6:05.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.1) (Watering)

runners.name: Dorney Lake
runners.comment: Unplaced last five 3yo starts but has possibilities if revived by a change of stable
runners.spotlight: Both wins for the Gosdens came at 6f (good/good to firm); unplaced last five 3yo starts but he ran in some warm races and returns for a new stable (having been sold for 18,000gns and gelded) off a career-low mark; possibilities if revived by a change of scenery.

runners.name: North View

prev_owners.owner: Dr John Wilson And William Prosser

runners.comment: Ended 2024 with improved efforts; still has untapped potential; major player for new yard
runners.spotlight: Cosy winner in a big field at Newbury last August, and again performed well when second of 12 at Kempton (also 7f) the following month on final start for Peter Chapple-Hyam; subsequently sold for 95,000gns and gelded; returns to the fray with untapped potential, and the way he travels suggests this drop back in distance will be in his favour; major player.

quotes.race: EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Band D) (EBF Restricted Race Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was such a good race at Ascot. Obviously the winner won the Acomb, and Ralph Beckett likes his horse a lot too. I ran North View over too far at Newmarket, that was my fault, so it was nice to see him win today. I wouldn't be opposed to dropping him back to five furlongs either because he has so much speed. He's the sort of horse we will go slowly with and see what the handicapper does with him before making any fancy entries but I promise you he's better than that - Peter Chapple-Hyam, trainer.

runners.name: Harry Did
runners.comment: Made all under Kaiya Fraser at Newcastle and ridden less positively next time; chance
runners.spotlight: Comes here fit from an AW campaign, posting a career best when making all under Kaiya Fraser at Newcastle (6f) in March; ridden less positively when only fifth of 12 at Kempton next time; just as effective on grass and may well bounce back.

quotes.race: Dennis Barnett 80th Birthday EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Harry Did is a nice big horse.  There was a lot of leg changing over the first 2f going downhill, but he finished off well.  He'd prefer a generous, level course, which might be why he got a bit lost on the undulations at Newmarket last time - Trevor Whelan, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Fletchers Flight
runners.comment: Improved to win here and at Leicester last term but those races were over 5f
runners.spotlight: Seemed suited by the drop to 5f when winning here (good to firm) and Leicester (soft) in second half of last season and had possibly gone over the top by his final start; may improve a bit further this term but his best form remains at the minimum trip; stablemate of Rhythmic Acclaim.

runners.name: Dashing Harry
runners.comment: Bit below par when fourth at Wolverhampton nine days ago; others have more potential
runners.spotlight: Looks exposed after 22 outings and he was a bit below par when fourth of eight at Wolverhampton nine days ago; others have more potential.

runners.name: World Of Darcy
runners.comment: Completed hat-trick last autumn; today's ground could be a bit quicker than ideal
runners.spotlight: In fine form last October, ridden up with the pace when rattling off a quick hat-trick over C&D and at Windsor and Brighton; still on a fair mark judged on the pick of his 2yo form but today's ground could be a bit quicker than ideal (very best efforts on softer than good).

quotes.race: Trustatrader Apply Today EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I took a bit of a gamble and ran World Of Darcy at Newmarket over seven furlongs because I felt that now's the time to decide what we're going to do with him. Luke [Morris, jockey] said drop him back to six and get him a bit of confidence because he's obviously had a few hard days at work and we picked this one. There's nothing wrong with him, but he's not very big. There's always going to be a doubt whether this horse trains on, but at the moment he eats well and works well. There's a winter campaign and I think that's what I'm aiming for. We've got a big entry at the weekend, but we'll look at that and decide what the ground does. We'll see how he recovers and then we'll make decisions - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: Racehorse Lotto National Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: World Of Darcy is a good solid horse, he'll be winning plenty of races. He'll probably go for the Windsor Castle - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: Northern Commercials - Used Stock For Quick Delivery EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: I was very impressed. World Of Darcy travelled really sweetly and I could have done with a lead for longer. Karl said whatever he did today that he would improve a lot for it - Sam James, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He was second to Elite Status, who's a very good horse, in the National Stakes and will definitely go for the Windsor Castle, barring accidents. He's tough and solid and the stiff five furlongs will play to his strengths. He'll go there with a chance. 14-06-23

runners.name: Rhythmic Acclaim
runners.comment: Probably needed reappearance; won on this card 12 months ago; in the mix again
runners.spotlight: Now back below her last winning mark; probably needed her Wolverhampton reappearance five weeks ago and she's better on turf than AW; won on this card on good to firm ground 12 months ago; in the mix again.

4:55.race_name: QuinnBet Daily Free Bet Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Alpine Trail
runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux, J Etienne

runners.spotlight: Ultimately impressive when making winning debut at Wolverhampton (9.4f) in February, needing to be cajoled along over 3f out but pulling 3l clear by the finish; well bred and open to plenty of improvement.

runners.name: Palazzo Blu
runners.comment: Overcame greenness to make winning start at Chelmsford in November; could be useful

runners.spotlight: By Dubawi; dam 1m2f winner (RPR 84), closely related to outstanding 1m2f-1m4f performer Enable, out of 1m2f Listed winning sister to 12.5f Group 2 winner; bred in the purple and receives 7lb from the two winners in the field; fascinating newcomer.

runners.name: Dancing With Drums
runners.comment: 200-1 and last of eight both starts; hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: 200-1 and last of eight both starts; hard to fancy.

runners.name: El Ghaawy

runners.spotlight: Closely related to three winners including the useful Song Of Life; raced freely and faded when 8l fourth of eight on debut at Wolverhampton (9.4f; 6-1) seven weeks ago; improvement required but certainly possible.

runners.name: Eupator
runners.comment: Similar form in novices last year; this trip should suit; retains untapped potential
runners.spotlight: Similar form in novices at Salisbury (1m, heavy) and Kempton (7f, AW) last autumn, rallying on second occasion; should stay at least 1m2f and retains untapped potential; has to be considered.

runners.name: Minhad
runners.comment: Newcomer; makes some appeal on pedigree so worth a market check
runners.spotlight: By Universal; dam 7f 2yo winner (RPR 82), closely related to 7f winner Queen's Course, out of Irish 6f 2yo Group 3 and Norwegian 1,000 Guineas winner; makes some appeal on pedigree so worth a market check.

5:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.1) (Watering)

runners.name: Show Biz Kid

runners.spotlight: Stablemate of Queen's Company; placed in a couple of Wolverhampton AW contests (8.5f/9.5f) since wearing blinkers; still a maiden but has each-way possibilities in the retained headgear.

runners.name: Kinetic
runners.comment: The new headgear may suit; took well to first-time visor at Kempton in February
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent on AW this year but the new headgear may suit back on turf; took well to first-time visor at Kempton in February (awarded the race; off this mark).

stable_tour.quote: She's done very well for Deva Racing. She was well bought, having won four on the Flat for us. We were going to sell her but decided to keep her and run over hurdles. She was quite green at Newbury first time then she was beaten again at Kempton. She may go to Plumpton on Sunday. 01-01-25

runners.name: Bobacious
runners.owner: The Trip To Syndicate And Partners
runners.comment: Two wins last term for Georgina Nicholls; sold for 17,000gns after final start
runners.spotlight: Consistent spell last term for Georgina Nicholls featured two wins; sold for 17,000gns after final start; market may be instructive on stable/seasonal debut.

runners.name: Always A Star
runners.comment: Form has substance; likely to be suited by this new trip on handicap debut; interesting

runners.name: Beach Point
runners.owner: John & Peter Seabrook And Tim Fisher
runners.comment: Scored over C&D last July; ended his 2024 campaign with creditable efforts on AW

quotes.race: Ron And Esther Leahy Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: I think the application of cheekpieces and the step up to ten furlongs has helped Beach Point. His brother improved for doing exactly the same and I'd been wanting to do it for the last couple of runs. I think he had his right conditions today and Callum gave him a lovely ride. We'll freshen him up now but I'd like to think he'd be a horse on the upgrade - William Knight, trainer.

runners.name: Universal Story
runners.comment: Showed promise in AW contests this winter; open to further progress now handicapping
runners.spotlight: Sea The Stars filly who showed promise in AW contests this winter, good third at Wolverhampton (9.5f) the final time; open to further progress now handicapping and is one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Queens Company
runners.comment: Scored on AW when last seen; has plenty of form, including three wins, at Yarmouth

runners.name: Eljaytee
runners.comment: Both wins in Class 6; now 5lb out of the weights back up in grade
runners.spotlight: Seasonal debutant; made a successful reappearance over C&D two years ago but has gained both wins in Class 6; now 5lb out of the weights back up in grade.

quotes.race: Download The Racecourse App Raceday Ready "Confined" Handicap (Horses Not Won Since 2023 Flat Turf)
quotes.quote: Eljaytee is a super-genuine horse. He can be a keen and Silvestre [de Sousa], who rode him last time, suggested taking the blinkers off and putting cheekpieces on and he relaxed so well. He stays well so the uphill finish here suits him and, as he likes soft ground, the rain came in time  - John Berry, trainer, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Anglo Saxson
runners.comment: Four-time winner over 7f/1m here and 3lb below his last winning mark; worth a second look

quotes.race: Quinnbet Second To The Favourite Handicap
quotes.quote: Anglo Saxson is a great horse to have in the yard and is a great work horse. He's done amazing since he came over from Ireland. He was sent off favourite again and we took the visor off him and it made the difference. We rode him differently and it worked - Patrick Owens, trainer.

runners.name: Windsor Pass
runners.comment: 1-32 and another placing may be her best hope
runners.spotlight: Just 1lb higher than when successful at Chelmsford (7f, AW) in January, but that her only success in 32 starts; another placing may be her best hope.

runners.name: Eight Mile
runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival on stable debut/reappearance last month; needs to leave that behind
runners.spotlight: Won over 6f here as a 3yo but does stay this far; failed to beat a rival on his stable debut/reappearance at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) last month, though, and needs to leave that effort behind; cheekpieces return.

stable_tour.quote: I own him with a friend and he's a great staple of the yard. He leads a lot of the two-year-olds up at home and we just run him when he looks in good form. Our apprentice Liam Wright and our amateur Lillie May get a lot of practice on him and he pays his way. He's picked up some wins along the way, and I think he'll win again for sure. 29-03-24

runners.name: Artificer
runners.comment: In good form on the AW lately; respected if continuing the progress back on grass
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 4yo who has run into form lately, beaten a neck at Chelmsford (1m, AW) in January and going one better over the same C&D the following month; 4lb higher, but respected if continuing the progress back on grass.

runners.name: Waistcoat
runners.comment: 0-7 but was sent off just 7-4 for his penultimate start; may have a bigger effort in him
runners.spotlight: 0-7 for three different stables; well beaten in both starts for this yard, but was sent off just 7-4 for the first of those which suggests there may be a bigger effort lurking somewhere.

runners.name: Rising Force
runners.comment: Third of 21 at Doncaster last Sunday; runs off the same mark and a player if backing it up
runners.spotlight: 2-30 with both wins coming on the AW, but he ran a big race when third of 21 in an amateur riders' event at Doncaster (1m, good; 25-1) last Sunday; races off the same mark and a player if backing it up.

runners.name: Oh So Audacious
runners.comment: Consistent last year; conditions should be ideal and another big effort not a surprise
runners.spotlight: Three-time turf winner who proved most consistent last year (3413222); may just be better for the run after seven months off, but conditions should be ideal and another big effort wouldn't be a surprise.

quotes.race: St Leger Form Study On attheraces.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Oh So Audacious isn't that quick but she tries very hard and I think if you get after her early enough she just keeps rolling - Hayley Turner, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Glastonbury
runners.comment: Sole win came over C&D (soft) in October; quicker ground poses a question
runners.spotlight: Sole win came in first-time cheekpieces over C&D (soft) in October; still unexposed for a 4yo and should be all the better for last month's Newcastle return (1m, AW), but quicker ground poses a question.

runners.name: Embarked
runners.comment: 14lb lower than when winning at Southwell last September, but 0-13 since and 0-21 on turf
runners.spotlight: 14lb lower than when winning at Southwell (7f, AW) last September, but 0-13 since and 0-21 on turf; stable also runs Maguire.

runners.name: Keen Interest

runners.spotlight: 3lb lower than winning at Newcastle (1m2f, AW) in November and was running well when last seen on turf last summer, including a win here (11.5f, good to firm); still capable over this shorter trip and shortlisted.

runners.name: Kranjcar

runners.name: Maguire
runners.comment: Little to get excited about in eight starts on the AW; looks up against it on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Little to get excited about in eight starts on the AW and looks up against it on turf debut.

runners.name: Moreginplease
runners.comment: 1-33 but placed in three of her five starts here last year; could outrun her odds
runners.spotlight: 1-33 but was placed in three of her five starts here (6f/7f) last year; does stay this far and could outrun her odds.

runners.name: Marmoga

runners.spotlight: Made it 1-19 when well beaten at Chelmsford (6f, AW) last month and he's unproven at 7f; however, he went close at Kempton (6f, AW) in February and is not discounted in a weak race in a change of headgear.

runners.spotlight: Has a modest 1-16 strike-rate and she hasn't been at her best on AW on her two runs this year; however, she's now 4lb lower than when a commanding winner over C&D (good to firm) last August and she'll be a major player if rediscovering some form.

runners.name: Laughing John
runners.comment: Displayed clear promise when making the frame on first two outings; looks the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Out of a fairly useful Flat/hurdle winner; displayed very clear promise when making the frame on first two starts, more recently when second of five at Hereford (2m, good) six weeks ago, and looks the one to beat here.

runners.name: Mad Maxios
runners.comment: Close second of three at Market Rasen but the odds-on winner was toying with him
runners.spotlight: Out of a sister to smart jumper Le Patriote; bettered low-key debut (behind Laughing John) when close second of three in tactical race at Market Rasen (2m, good; tongue-tie added) three weeks ago, but the odds-on winner appeared to be toying with him in the closing stages; needs to improve again.

runners.name: Uhtred Ragnarson
runners.comment: Made good start to hurdling career when third at Taunton last month; respected
runners.spotlight: Placed in the second of his three bumpers and made good start to hurdling career when third of nine at Taunton (2m, good) last month; probably needs to build on that performance today but has the potential.

2:15.race_name: DragonBet The Independent Bookmaker Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Olivers Travels
runners.comment: Dual winner last summer but absent since some below-par runs in the autumn
runners.spotlight: Won consecutive races at Worcester (2m7f, good) when cheekpieces were added last summer but had gone off the boil when last seen in the autumn and needs to have been refreshed by 133-day break.

runners.name: Awaythelad
runners.comment: Won with a bit to spare when upped to 3m at Southwell last month and commands respect here
runners.spotlight: Came good over fences at fifth attempt, when upped to 3m at Southwell (good to soft; second run in blinkers) last month; did that with a fair bit more in hand than winning margin might suggest and a subsequent 5lb rise is offset by Callum Pritchard's useful 5lb claim here; leading contender.

quotes.race: Grace And Dotty Fedora's And Feathers Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Better ground has done the trick and Awaythelad has skipped off of it. He idled a bit up the straight but he jumped really well - Ben Jones, jockey.

quotes.race: Luke Watson Memorial "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Fair play to Awaythelad he's won that well. I thought we bumped into a good progressive horse (Joker De Mai) at Lingfield last time and this looked a good opportunity. He should go on from this - Kielan Woods, jockey.

runners.name: Nothin To Ask
runners.comment: Has fitness to prove but ran well in defeat on latest outing in December
runners.spotlight: 2-11 over fences; no longer the force of old and has fitness to prove after 112-day absence but ran well in defeat behind progressive rival at Newcastle (2m7f, good to soft) on latest outing and was given another wind op (his second) during his break.

quotes.race: Inscapes Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Nothin To Ask impressed me more than I thought he would. I thought the fences would slow him down at home, but they've made him go quicker. They went hard in front, but Paddy gave him a lovely ride and took his time. He did it really well, but we'll be in no rush - he's had a race there and puts his heart and soul into his work at home. His mind will have had a race there too so he'll have three weeks or a month before we think about running him. he probably doesn't want deep, deep ground - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Thor De Cerisy
runners.breeder: O Varin,  Y Varin &  S Varin
runners.comment: Lurks on a good mark but all his best form was on soft or heavy ground
runners.spotlight: Only fifth of six in recent Newbury race won by The Boola Boss but was not beaten far and would almost certainly have been better suited by a stronger gallop; lurks on a good mark but all his best form was on soft or heavy ground, and he has never raced on anything quicker than good to soft.

quotes.race: dragonbet.co.uk New Online Bookmaker Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Thor De Cerisy just needs this heavy ground. Regardless of whether it's a hurdle or a chase, when he gets his ground just run him. He thrives off it and makes it feel like you're riding on good ground - Luca Morgan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He looked like he was going to win two runs ago at Uttoxeter, where he fell at the last as he was starting to go clear, and he put that back on the table when he won really well at Chepstow. He's going the right way. He was beaten only four lengths before that and he's definitely finishing his races better now. He seems to be jumping better and hopefully there's more to come. He likes heavy ground. 06-03-24

runners.name: The Boola Boss
runners.comment: Back in prime form when making all at Newbury last month; can give this a good shot too
runners.spotlight: Not always one to rely upon but was back in prime form when making all at Newbury (2m6f, good to soft) last month; 4lb higher here but good 5lb claimer Jamie Brace is enlisted; will be suited by the forecast good ground; no surprise if he gives this a good shot.

quotes.race: BetVictor A Run For Your Money At Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The keys to The Boola Boss are a flat track and good ground and, like Becky [Curtis, trainer] said, two [miles] six [furlongs] is probably his perfect trip. Three miles probably stretches him and two and a half [miles] is probably a bit too short so ideal conditions really - Sean Bowen, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports.

quotes.race: William Hill Extra Place Races Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The Boola Boss has been going really well at home and he's just come into himself. He did it nicely and I'm very pleased. He's quite versatile on ground but I'm not sure I'll keep him going now because he's a big horse and he might not want to be summer racing. He may go out on his break next week  - Rebecca Curtis, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We found he had a bit of a bad infection the last time he ran, so you can draw a line through that run. He's been declared to run at Doncaster on Thursday in a 2m4½f handicap chase. 10-02-25

1:40.race_name: On Course Values Online With DragonBet Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Salamanca Bay
runners.breeder: D Fenton, Elm Equine & Holling Equine
runners.comment: Out of form in recent months and needs help from the refitted tongue-tie today
runners.spotlight: Now 5lb lower than when making all in small-field chase at Ayr (2m, good) for Lucinda Russell 13 months ago but looked badly out of sorts on his three starts for Dan Skelton during the winter and was unable to justify good market support when well beaten on recent debut for latest new stable (breathing issue reported); needs refitted tongue-tie to make a big difference.

quotes.race: ThurlesRaces.ie Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Salamanca Bay had been a bit keen and I just decided to let him go today. He has a high cruising speed and he handles that ground well. He will improve jumping-wise when he gets a lead in maybe a good handicap - Mikey Fogarty, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's pretty headstrong but we've done his wind and he should be out in early December. He has some decent form to his name and looks like a two-miler at this stage. 12-11-24

runners.name: Lucky Lugger
runners.comment: Not yet proven on good ground but has been consistent over fences this season; respected
runners.spotlight: Consistent since switched to fences in the autumn and deserved his win at Uttoxeter (2m, soft) in February; needs to prove himself on today's forecast good ground but is suited by this C&D and features prominently in calculations.

stable_tour.quote: He ran a good race to be second at Chepstow at 25-1 on his seasonal reappearance and chasing debut, and then ran really well again to be second back there in another novice handicap chase last week. I think we bumped into a really good horse there. If you look at Ryan's Rocket's form, when he won a point-to-point, our Ihandaya finished second, so that showed the class of the horse. He's a very late maturer but it looks like he's finally getting there. I'm very hopeful for him. 28-11-24

runners.name: Jet Of Dreams
runners.comment: Three chase wins this season; ran well last month and is suited by good ground; a player
runners.spotlight: Three chase wins this season, the latest in fast-ground match race at Taunton (2m2f) in November; ran well again when second of three at Newcastle (2m, good) last month, after a break, and is likely to be on the premises here.

quotes.race: Royal Oak At Hillcommon Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was like a piece of work for Jet Of Dreams. He sometimes goes left anyway and especially when he's in front he's going to do it more so I just left him drift over that way. The things in front of me were the only things that were going to get me beat - James Bowen, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Boston Joe
runners.comment: Lacked fluency and was slightly disappointing last month but has 5-15 record over fences
runners.spotlight: 5-15 over fences (including two good-ground wins); lacked fluency and was slightly disappointing when returned to chasing at Bangor (2m1f, good) a fortnight ago but a subsequent 3lb drop is helpful and he can be very dangerous here if the first-time cheekpieces have any positive effect.

stable_tour.quote: He was second at Chepstow last time but he cut his leg quite badly and we've given him a bit of time to let that heal. He's ready to run now and goes to Ffos Las on Thursday. 10-02-25

runners.name: Dj Pete
runners.comment: Safely held on both stable starts, latterly over C&D on last month's chasing debut
runners.spotlight: Still lightly raced after only seven runs but has been safely held in two handicaps for new stable this year, more recently when third of five over C&D (good) on chasing debut three weeks ago; needs to up his game today.

runners.name: Jack Sparrow Grey
runners.breeder: S A R L Mm Stud
runners.comment: Well down the field on handicap hurdle debut but remains very unexposed; chase debut today
runners.spotlight: Well down the field when 33-1 for handicap hurdle debut in January (2m3f, good to soft) but remains very unexposed and is well worth a glance in the betting before this chasing debut.

2:50.race_name: DragonBet 8 Places In The National Mares' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Phillapa Sue
runners.comment: Ran quite well over C&D on soft ground in February but well beaten on good going since
runners.spotlight: Went close at Doncaster (3m, good to soft) in December and also ran well when fourth over C&D (soft) in February; current mark is workable but she was very disappointing on good ground last month and would appeal much more on a slower surface.

runners.name: Smugglers Haven
runners.comment: 2-3 since switched to handicaps and could have more improvement to come over this new trip
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer who launched handicap career with two good-ground wins in the autumn (2m3f/2m4f) and returned from break with creditable second at Plumpton (2m4f, good) last month; open to more improvement over this new trip and needs to be taken very seriously.

runners.name: Herewegohoney

prev_owners.owner: Middleham Park Racing & C And J Hobkirk

runners.comment: Badly out of form over hurdles and fences since returning from a layoff last summer
runners.spotlight: Badly out of form over hurdles and fences since returning from a layoff last summer; has conditions to suit here and is very well handicapped but was pulled up in her last two chases and needs this switch back to hurdling to rekindle her enthusiasm.

runners.name: Keppel Queen
runners.comment: Placed in all four handicap hurdles, the latest off today's mark over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles but placed in all four handicaps, most recently when clear third over C&D (good) under Benjamin Macey last month; obvious contender off same mark today.

runners.name: All Inn Hand
runners.comment: Showed promise in her qualifying races but struggled on last month's handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in two of her three qualifying races (2m6f/2m3f, good to soft) but struggled on last month's handicap debut at Exeter (2m7f, good) and is difficult to enthuse over after that performance; tongue-tie added.

3:32.race_name: DragonBet Real People Real Bookmakers Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Ninth Loch
runners.comment: First two stable runs were promising; didn't fire last time but still looks worth chancing
runners.spotlight: Irish bumper winner (good to yielding) who subsequently collected three hurdle wins in France (all on heavy); started off for Harry Derham with two promising runs this year, the latter a third of 14 at Taunton (2m, soft); needs to rebound from a lesser effort at Newbury (2m4f) last month but might still be worth chancing.

runners.name: Zambezi Fix
runners.comment: Won this in 2024; bumped into huge improver when second over C&D six weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner, including this race last year (good to soft); not really firing on all cylinders this season and might find today's ground a bit too lively but bumped into a huge improver when second over C&D (soft) six weeks ago and remains on a good mark.

runners.name: Estate Planning

prev_owners.owner: Mrs P K Cooper & Millie Cooper & Sean Cooper & Alice Cooper

runners.comment: Dead-heated for close third on recent handicap debut and is not yet fully exposed
runners.spotlight: Blotted copybook when refusing to race in February but placed on both subsequent appearances, more recently when dead-heating for close third on handicap debut at Ffos Las (2m, good) a fortnight ago; not yet fully exposed and helps to give Bernard Llewellyn a good hand in this race.

runners.name: Dartman
runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate II
runners.comment: Placed at big odds in a novice last summer but well beaten on handicap debut in January
runners.spotlight: Fair on the Flat for Brian Meehan a couple of years ago and belied 150-1 odds when placed in Uttoxeter novice hurdle (2m, soft) for this stable last summer; that is by far his best hurdling performance, though, and he was well beaten when switched to a handicap in January; 2lb wrong here.

1:10.race_name: DragonBet Born From The Betting Ring Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Timetoshine
runners.breeder: Haras De Saint Julien & Mme A Tamagni
runners.comment: Began hurdling career with two ready wins; appears to have been found a simple task here
runners.spotlight: Quite useful on the Flat in France before starting hurdling career with ready wins at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft) and Kempton (2m, good) for Nicky Henderson this year; appears to have been found a simple task here.

quotes.race: Advertise Your Business At Huntingdon Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Timetoshine was a very green on her first go over hurdles and got into the bottom of a few, but finished well off a strong pace. The members were worried about the market drift, but I just told them they would get more if they backed her. I don't know about future plans, but she probably wants more experience - Anthony Bromley, owners' representative.

runners.name: Cinq Douzaine
runners.comment: Absent since struggling on Flat debut in 2022
runners.spotlight: Has fairly good Flat pedigree but struggled to get competitive in 1m Brighton maiden for Mick Channon in 2022 and has not raced again since.

runners.name: Crazy About Her
runners.comment: Second on last year's bumper debut; both subsequent runs for this yard were underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in good-ground Worcester bumper for Olly Murphy last summer but both bumper runs for this stable in the autumn were underwhelming; had wind surgery in December; makes hurdle debut after five-month break.

runners.name: Jackie Diamond
runners.comment: Lowly rated Flat maiden who achieve very little when remote third on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Lowly rated Flat maiden who achieved very little when remote third on hurdle debut at Hereford (2m, soft) six weeks ago.

stable_tour.quote: She's had a wind operation and hopefully it may well have made the difference. She ran a nice race first time out and she'd always made a bit of a whistle so we decided to have her hobdayed. 21-09-23

4:38.race_name: DragonBet 'Remembering John Lovell' Novices' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Bells Of Ufford
runners.comment: Well beaten in a maiden last month but his first two hurdle runs were quite encouraging
runners.spotlight: Won good-ground point bumper last spring; well beaten in Taunton maiden hurdle on latest outing in February but his first two hurdle runs (2m/2m3f) were encouraging and he remains open to improvement in handicaps.

runners.name: Impecunious
runners.comment: Has found things tough in handicaps but, from a reduced mark, he's a big player here
runners.spotlight: Has found things tough in handicaps since returning from a break in the autumn but was placed in two good-ground novice events last spring (2m/2m1f) and, from a reduced mark, he's a big player in this modest race.

runners.name: Snitterfield
runners.comment: Showed nothing more than glimmers of promise in three 2m maiden/novice hurdles
runners.spotlight: Showed nothing more than glimmers of promise when a big-priced outsider for three 2m maiden/novice hurdles (good/good to soft) in February/March; up in trip for handicap debut; significant improvement required.

runners.name: Sonic Gold
runners.comment: Pulled up in first two handicaps, latterly when back on good ground at Hereford last month
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in first two handicaps, latterly when back on good ground at Hereford (2m3f) last month (bled from the nose); huge leap of faith required to support him here.

runners.name: Privilege
runners.comment: 0-8 over hurdles when trained in Ireland and pulled up all four British starts
runners.spotlight: 0-8 over hurdles when trained in Ireland and pulled up all four British starts, most recently on stable debut ten days ago; can't be recommended.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him off Jessica Harrington. He won his maiden on the Flat for her and showed good form in handicaps. He has jumped well since he joined us and will be ready to start off at Fairyhouse next week and hopefully on to Leopardstown over Christmas. H's owned by The Adders Partnership, who have been lucky with me, as they had Xsquared. Hopefully this lad can give them plenty of fun. 08-12-21

runners.name: Tillaway
runners.comment: Well beaten in both handicaps, the latter over C&D (good) last month
runners.spotlight: Still unexposed after only five hurdling starts but was well beaten in her first two handicaps, the latter over C&D (good) 16 days ago.

runners.name: Marcos Light
runners.comment: Showed very little in her three qualifying races last summer but worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Did not show a great deal in her three qualifying races last summer (2m-2m4f) and makes her handicap debut after a 229-day break but she has a lowly opening mark and is well worth a glance in the betting.

runners.name: Harvie Wallbanger
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late K W Bell
runners.comment: Struggled in novice/maiden hurdles in 2022-23 season; back from long absence today
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in good-ground course bumper in October 2022 but struggled to get competitive in four subsequent hurdle races that season (2m-2m3f); makes handicap debut after 742-day absence; considered only if lively in betting.

runners.name: Junior Des Mottes
runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Des Mottes
runners.comment: Has shown no promise over hurdles this season; has basement mark for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in two bumpers in 2023 but has shown no promise over hurdles this season (four runs; 2m-2m3f); has basement mark for this handicap debut but still needs to take a big step forward.

runners.name: Victor Haze
runners.comment: Improved form when second of five here (2m) last month; back up in trip today
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 8yo who bettered his low-key handicap debut when second of five here (2m, good) last month; that form isn't anything to go wild about but he could plausibly have more to offer over this longer trip.

4:00.race_name: Randox Grand National Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
4:00.going_detailed: National Course - GOOD TO SOFT; Mildmay Course - GOOD (GoingStick: Mildmay Chase 5.5, Mildmay Hurdle 5.3, Grand National course 5.3) (Watering)

runners.name: I Am Maximus
runners.comment: 8lb higher today and missed his final prep race but he was impressive in this last year
runners.spotlight: Far from a natural jumper but that matters a lot less in this race these days and the turbo has kicked in when he's moved into marathon territory; that resulted first in a last-gasp win in the 2023 Irish National and then a storming success in this race last year, both on soft; hugging the inner seemed to help somewhat with his jumping 12 months ago; 8lb higher this time and forced to miss his final prep race (with an infection) but he was mightily impressive in the closing stages last year.

quotes.race: Randox Grand National Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I could see all the time that Paul was happy with where he was, just looking for room, looking for daylight, and he eventually got it and set I Am Maximus alight. He made little of his mark, and that means he's going to be a Gold Cup horse. We don't know how good this horse is. Today he showed us that he's better than he has been, anyway. I think he was still just a little bit ahead of the handicapper after what he did in the Bobbyjo Chase and he proved it today. He's quirky, he's immature, but he's learning all the time - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote.ie Bobbyjo Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I don't know how good I Am Maximus is, but he's certainly improving with every run. I'd imagine he goes for the Grand National, he would look like a Gold Cup horse in time but I'd imagine Aintree is his objective - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Drinmore Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: That was a nice bonus on his last day as a novice. I Am Maximus won his maiden in nice circumstances and then to do that on his last day as a novice was good too! He is a total character but he looks a class horse now and not just a handicapper so we might have some different plans for him. We were hoping he might have a chance but it was more in hope, and the fact it was his last run as a novice made us give him his chance. He's clearly improved and showed he has that bit of class when he needs it. We were thinking of the Grand National but maybe we'll stick to Grade 1 races with him, we'll see - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Irish Grand National Chase (Extended Handicap Chase) (Grade A)
quotes.quote: I must complement Paul for the ride he gave I Am Maximus because if he were listening to me I'd have said pull him up after going a mile. He dug in and stayed very well. It's really special - JP McManus, owner.

quotes.race: Prodec Networks Maiden Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I Am Maximus will be a lovely horse and I wouldn't be surprised if we went two and a half miles at some stage. He's quickened up again at the end, but is a strong galloper who learned a lot at Exeter last time - he'd had just one run in his life before then. He was a different horse today and his jumping was deadly. He looks like he's got a very powerful gallop in him. He'll be a fantastic chaser next season and he's a Graded horse; there's no doubt about that - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Royal Gloucestershire Hussars Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I Am Maximus is lovely and will be very good, but we'll have to discuss plans re another bumper or hurdling - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's come back in from being at grass good and strong. In fact, he's probably even stronger than he was this time last year, which is a great sign. We'll try to give him the same sort of schedule as he had last season, taking in the Bobbyjo Chase at Fairyhouse as his last port of call before having a second crack at the Grand National. His connections are very keen to go back to Aintree and try to win it again. 25-11-24

He came to us in the autumn and, although he has yet to get his head in front, he has run well in top company, notably last time behind Mighty Potter. There are several options in the Ultima, Brown Advisory, Turners and Plate. 08-03-23

runners.name: Royale Pagaille
runners.comment: All wins on soft/heavy; class act over the extended 3m1f at Haydock but out of form lately
runners.spotlight: All wins on soft or heavy; he's been a class act at Haydock but did not show it in two visits there this year, including on his second attempt at a marathon trip, and his sixth in last month's Cheltenham Gold Cup was a remote one; some conspicuous negatives.

quotes.race: Boodles Cheltenham Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Royal Pagaille kept going, he was really enthusiastic, jumped well in the main. One or two mistakes, but kept going and he felt in a good place. Just outpaced - Charlie Deutsch, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfair Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Lancashire Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's unbelievable because Royale Pagaille was beaten wasn't he? He's had to do all the hard work and was being a bit careful at the obstacles, but he's not beaten until he's beaten. We've got options. He's been second in a King George and he would have been back here last year for a third Peter Marsh but it was abandoned. I know it's a handicap, but that's obviously an interesting option. It's quite clear that ground is key for him to be at his very best and you don't often get that after February and into March, but you never know - it might be different this year - Venetia Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Lancashire Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've come up against Bravemansgame before so I know how good he is. I was worried he would do us for toe but Royale Pagaille felt amazing. He was quite relaxed early and I was a bit worried he wasn't travelling. I pulled him out wide and he took hold of the bit and galloped. I wanted to make it a bit of a test because I knew I'd stay. I didn't want to get outsprinted. It felt like he was never stopping so it gave me confidence just to keep kicking and fair play to him - Charlie Deutsch, rider, speaking to Racing TV. I'm absolutely thrilled, over the moon. Charlie said for part of the first circuit he was quite laid back and wasn't really grabbing hold of the bridle but he said when he pulled him a bit wide down the back he grabbed hold of the bridle. He jumped very well. I was full of hope but you're never confident. The fact that our horses are running so well does give you a lot of hope. We've got to go for the King George, he was second last year obviously by default but at the same time Jerry Roberts who rides him all the time and travels with our horses every day has been telling that he's in better form this year than last year. I'm pretty sure where he'll end up. He's run in the last three Gold Cups but he hasn't had his ground. Who knows, this season he might - Venetia Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes King George VI Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a shame as it looked as though L'Homme Presse and Royale Pagaille were going to be second and third, but they've both run very well; I'm proud of both of them today. Paul's horse has won today but there'll be more races in which they meet and hopefully we'll come out on top when they do - Venetia Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Denman Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Royale Pagaille was staying on all the way to the line there. We absolutely have to go for the Gold Cup and we'll take our chance - Rich Ricci, owner.

quotes.race: Peter Marsh Handicap Chase (A Limited Handicap) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm really thrilled. Royale Pagaille had loads of weight and it was a tougher race than last year. They've gone a good gallop and he's had to find his way through. He wasn't travelling all that well, but his jumping held up. Charlie has given him a superb ride and he's had to battle all the way to the line. I made no secret he missed quite a lot of work since he was here (in the Betfair Chase) last time. It was like the days gone by when the Gold Cup horses used to run in the Peter Marsh and hopefully we'll have the ground to be able to take him back to Cheltenham in March - Venetia Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Lancashire Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm absolutely delighted wth Royale Pagaille, thrilled to bits. We definitely have to go to Kempton now. He has already won there and we'll go back for the King George - Venetia Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: WellChild Cheltenham Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Royale Pagaille has got an injury to a hind foot which is very, very painful. I've had a horse who has done it before and I think they fracture the hoof wall stepping on the take-off board, so it's a hoof injury and not a bone injury. He'll be fine - Venetia Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Peter Marsh Handicap Chase (A Limited Handicap) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: To be able to do that on this ground off 156 beating them 16 lengths is very impressive. That was a hell of a thrill. Royaille Pagaille has  jumped well and taken me all the way down the back straight. I got there sooner than I'd have liked but he was going so well. He was fabulous today and the world is his oyster. I'll leave the rest up to Venetia and Rich Ricci but it was a pleasure to be here to ride him today - Tom Scudamore, jockey.

quotes.race: Back And Lay On The Betfair Exchange Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a really smart performance. Royale Pagaille relaxed from the word go and jumped well in the main. We liked him at home last season, but he was disappointing at the business end of his races - Charlie Deutsch, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He fractured his shoulder when he fell at Cheltenham in January and that took a long time to come right. He's going well now and will probably go back to Haydock to defend his Betfair Chase crown. That was an exciting day last year and a lovely performance. He was lame just a few days before the King George, so couldn't run there, but we had him ready for the Peter Marsh in January until it was lost to the weather, which was a great shame because he loves it at Haydock. He hasn't been able to show quite the same level at Cheltenham, although he was starting to stay on again when he fell in the Cotswold. He's well at the moment. 23-10-24

runners.name: Nick Rockett
runners.comment: Never better but had good scrap last time with Intense Raffles, who's now 15lb better off
runners.spotlight: Capped his first season over fences with third to Minella Cocooner in bet365 Gold Cup at Sandown (extended 3m4f, good) last April and took his form to another level with two Grade 3 wins on testing ground in Ireland this year; the latest was in a good scrap with Intense Raffles, who's now a whopping 15lb better off; that helps to show that even more improvement is needed.

quotes.race: Follow @ToteRacing On Twitter Bobbyjo Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I thought it was a nice performance, beating an Irish National winner in the process, and it was a nice trial for Aintree. I'm very pleased with Nick Rockett. It was tough coming back from the Thyestes only four-and-a-bit weeks before this. That was tough and this should leave him spot on for Aintree. He'll probably take a little while to recover from that but he has the time. I was very impressed with how slick he jumped ? his jumping was excellent. We aimed him for the Irish National last year but it didn't work. He's a horse I think has the potential to run well around Aintree. Bobbyjo winners have been lucky around there - Willie Mullions, trainer.

quotes.race: Goffs Thyestes Handicap Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: We'll probably look forward to a National and we'll have a look at the Bobbyjo. That might be too soon but we'll see how Nick Rockett comes out of this - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: McInerney Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Nick Rockett was good. He improve a little bit from his first run, he obviously jumped very well. The first day was a competitive race and the form has been franked - David Casey, assistant trainer

stable_tour.quote: He jumps and stays. He was our Irish Grand National horse last season but it just didn't work out. I think he could go back there, or else to Aintree. We'll aim him at all those top staying handicaps, including maybe the Thyestes at Gowran, and hopefully he can win one of them along the way. 25-11-24

runners.name: Grangeclare West
runners.comment: Irish Gold Cup 2nd (3m, yielding) two runs ago but handicapper has taken that into account
runners.spotlight: Very weak in the betting when running moderately over 2m4f on heavy going five weeks ago, a sixth chase run he needed to qualify for this; second in the Irish Gold Cup (3m, yielding) one month earlier was a career best but the handicapper has been able to take that into account today, so this major step up in trip demands another new high.

quotes.race: Neville Hotels Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I didn't expect that - I was hoping Grangeclare West would run well but that was a top race. Paul was very worried about him pulling too hard and he had some job there. He'd want to be as fit as he is as he just pulled his arms out for the three miles. To do that in that ground and win like that going away, it was a huge performance. His jumping was excellent. He just came out of Paul's hands at the first fence and from then on he was just trying to settle him back. You can't keep jumping like that over three miles. He got him back jumping normally and then when he needed him over the last few fences, especially at the third-last, he was there. He's just a natural chaser. We were looking at it and asking ourselves is he a Brown Advisory horse? But we nominated Fact To File for that. The winner could go for the Brown Advisory and Fact To File might go to the Turners, but we'll see, it's a nice problem to have. We might come back here for the Dublin Racing Festival first - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Mongey Communications Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Grangeclare West has always promised and I would say chasing might just help him to fulfil his promise now, hopefully we can get a good run with him now. The two fences in the straight being taken out was no help to him. I was using his jumping to fill him up, so if I was going to get beat it was the long run-in which was going to do it but his class got him through - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I have to say Grangeclare West impressed me, considering he was so keen early on and jumped a bit big during the race. Then he settled and Paul got him together and balanced. Once he got down to gallop he impressed me. The obvious race for him would be the Lawlors of Naas Novice Hurdle (January 8). He surprised me in the manner he did it there. As I said to the owner before racing, we could run well here and finish fourth or fifth. It looked a good race - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We were kind of looking at the Grand National for him, but I spoke to the owners during the week and I said we're going to Cheltenham. Now the dust has settled I think we'll wait and see what weight he gets before deciding where to go next. 5-2-25

runners.name: Hewick
runners.comment: bet365 Gold Cup and King George winner; competitive mark and dry weather is in his favour
runners.spotlight: Big-race winner in Ireland, the USA and twice in Britain; stormed clear in the bet365 Gold Cup at Sandown (extended 3m4f, good) in April 2022 and came from the clouds to snatch a dramatic King George at Kempton (3m, good) in December 2023; gave a strong reminder of that quality in November this term and won well over hurdles three weeks ago; with a competitive mark and dry weather, a lot is swinging in his favour.

quotes.race: Jimmy Neville Memorial Hurdle
quotes.quote: Hewick was brilliant. He'll go for the National now and this was a lovely set-up for it. Every time I asked him he was there for me and he travelled great. Hopefully he'll go to Aintree with a great chance - Paddy Hanlon, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Racing TV Grande Course de Haies d'Auteuil (Hurdle) (Grade 1) (5yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Hewick jumped well, did everything and a better horse beat us. I know we're better over fences but that shows what I have, he's a great horse - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes King George VI Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Turning out of the back I said we will still be in the first three. It was some ride. I thought the game was up, but Hewick has such a heart. He is a small horse. Probably the race for him in the future is the Grand National, but now when you are here you have to go for a Gold Cup. I said he was getting one run (before the Gold Cup) and he was coming here for that. Cheltenham will suit this horse a lot better as it is a tougher three and a quarter miles there. There was a lot of the other horses that had problems, and we came here fresh and we had a great man on board and that was it - Shark Hanlon, trainer.  Put it this way - if it wasn't the King George I probably would have pulled up! I knew that he stays and stays and I just wasn't able to get going. There are only so many questions you can ask them and if they are not responding you can't ask. Shark said before I got on him he is  is the smallest horse here but he has got the biggest heart and that perfectly sums him up - Gavin Sheehan, speaking to ITV Racing.

quotes.race: bet365 Oaksey Chase (Grade 2) (For The Menorah Challenge Trophy) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I wanted to go for the Bet365, but with the fall Hewick got at Cheltenham I thought it was the right thing to do for the horse to give him a confidence boost. His season's only just starting because he's a summer horse. I just wanted him to get around safe and Rachael's ridden him beautifully, as she always does. I have something planned but I'm not going to say it yet. You'll see it in time, but I have a plan for him in six weeks' time and it won't be in England or Ireland. He'll also go back to America, but we might go somewhere else with him, have horse, will travel - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote Galway Plate (Handicap Chase) (Grade A)
quotes.quote: It's been a dream run with Hewick - this is unreal. We bought him for just 800euros.  Jordan gave him a super ride and knows the horse well. In the closing stages I was nearly afraid to look because the loose horses were doing harm. Everyone told me during the week he wasn't fast enough for this. At Sandown they were going a strong pace from the first furlong, and I knew they wouldn't be going that pace here. I knew he'd have the pace for this race. You need to be ridden prominently here because you stay out of trouble. I knew he'd stay all day. I told Jordan that if he was four lengths behind them at the dip he'd win by five [lengths] - John 'Shark' Hanlon, trainer

quotes.race: Vickers Independent Family Run Bookmaker Durham National Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hewick stays the trip and was very good. This opens up a lot of doors and he'll probably go on a break now as he's a good ground horse. Next year, there's a lot of Nationals for him and we'll be spending a lot of time over here. He's only a young horse at six and I think he'll keep improving - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

quotes.race: Devon Inn Hotel Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Hewick is very consistent and I was disappointed he didn't get into the Kerry National. I also had him entered in this race so we said we'd come here. He loves the trip, and the ground dried up which is a big help. He loves good ground  - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

quotes.race: Camida Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Hewick is a lovely horse and needs that fast ground. He's a summer horse and maybe we will go for a winners somewhere. He likes that trip and that ground.

stable_tour.quote: He's back in and did his first piece of work last week. There are a few different races we have in our mind for him, one coming up at Thurles, but his main aim is most definitely the Gold Cup. We can't wait to have another crack at it. We ran him here, there and everywhere last season, and he picked up a huge amount of prize-money, but we will be more selective this season. Jordan [Gainford] thought he was about to get his second wind in the Gold Cup when he came down. We're looking forward to getting back there again. 27-11-23

runners.name: Minella Indo
runners.comment: 2021 Cheltenham Gold Cup winner and third in 2024 Grand National; 1lb lower than last year
runners.spotlight: 2021 Cheltenham Gold Cup winner, second in it in 2022 and third in last year's Grand National; what a staying star he's been and the first of his two runs this season was creditable (latest was over hurdles) but, off just 1lb lower than 12 months ago, this veteran could again be on the premises without winning.

quotes.race: Randox Grand National Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Minella Indo was in against younger legs, but it was a brilliant run. I got a nice passage around, and had plenty of space where I wanted it. It was still a massive race to ride in - Rachael Blackmore, rider.

quotes.race: Glenfarclas Crystal Cup Cross Country Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Minella Indo ran super, really good, and with the schooling he'd done at home we were hoping that he'd put in a jumping performance like that. He took to those fences really well. He had a lot of weight to carry there. Henry and the Moloneys will decide what's next but I very much enjoyed riding him there - Rachael Blackmore, jockey.

quotes.race: Irish Daily Star - Best For Racing Coverage Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Minella Indo has given us so many great days and I'm delighted to see him start his season like that. His work was really good, but it was also good before the Gold Cup and it just didn't happen for him there. It was a messy start and it just didn't happen for him. He jumped from fence to fence today, his ears were pricked and Rachael said he really enjoyed it. We entered him in the north (Ladbrokes Champion Chase) but that's only a couple of weeks away, so we'll see. We can enjoy today and decide in the next couple of weeks. The Grand National is something we can discuss. Coming here after the Gold Cup run, we couldn't make any big plans but we're really encouraged now for the rest of the season - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Cheltenham Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: No excuses. Minella Indo has run his race, he jumped brilliantly and he travelled beautifully. I thought when I quickened off the bend down to the second-last they'd have to come and get me, but A Plus Tard is a year older and a year stronger and he probably saw the trip out a bit better - Robbie Power, rider.

quotes.race: WellChild Cheltenham Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was there very soon on Minella Indo but I didn't want to disappoint him. He carried me into it so I didn't want to be taking him back. I landed over the last and he pricked his ears and he was pulling up, but it wasn't out of tiredness. I heard Rachael coming and he took off again. It's unbelievable stuff - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

quotes.race: BetVictor Make Your Best Bet Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with that. He did everything good, it was a lovely race for him and I'm glad we've got it behind us now. You couldn't have asked him to do it any better. He jumped really well and did everything he had to do. I would imagine we'll aim towards the Savills Chase at Christmas, I think that will be our next one - Henry de Bromhead, trainer of Minella Indo

quotes.race: M.W. Hickey Memorial Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: He looked sharp for his first run. We got him in a bit earlier and maybe that made the difference. Coming away from the RSA you'd be hoping he'd turn into a Gold Cup horse but we'll see and we'll take it one race at time. It's very likely he'll go for the race at Navan now next month (the Grade 2, BetVictor Make Your Best Bet Chase. He seems to handle any ground and Rachael was delighted with him - trainer Henry de Bromhead.

quotes.race: RSA Insurance Novices' Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Minella Indo ran a cracker but was a bit slow at the last. Fair play to Barry Geraghty for nabbing us on the line. We're gutted to be beaten but delighted with the run. He's a rockstar of a horse and hopefully he will be back here in a few years and he could go again this season, perhaps in the 3m3f chase at Punchestown - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Eco Friendly Cups Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Minella Indo had to tough it out a little bit, which was good. He should improve again for that and I'm delighted to get that out of the way. He needed a test over 3m because he is so laid back at home. I think he will head straight for the RSA now - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Spa Novices' Hurdle)
quotes.quote: Minella Indo was disappointing at Limerick the first day over hurdles but he codded me completely. He's a chancer at home and I didn't know him well enough and hadn't got enough work into him. He then ran really well at Clonmel, we had to do all the donkey work that day and felt we'd take the chance in this if we got in as it would be a more strongly-run race. He's really tough and a dour stayer. - Henry De Bromhead, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's great, a Gold Cup winner in his prime. He's not at that level now but seemed to love it in the Grand National last season, when he finished third, and we'd love to have another crack at that. He ran a cracker at Punchestown last month and will go to Tramore in January for the Savills Chase. The cross-country race at Cheltenham is something we might look at but he'd have to carry a lot of weight now they've changed the conditions. 18-11-24

A real superstar who really comes alive at the Cheltenham Festival. His record is quite outstanding there as he won the Albert Bartlett in 2019, finished second in the RSA in 2020, won the Gold Cup in 2021 and ran another stormer last year to be second to A Plus Tard in his title defence. He's had one run this season and showed he's as good as ever when beating Stattler a neck at Tramore over 2m6f. He seems in mighty form at home and the aim has always been to try to win the Gold Cup for a second time. 01-03-23

runners.name: Appreciate It
runners.comment: Rarely seen over even 3m (has run respectably); 2m5f win has put him back up the weights
runners.spotlight: Rarely seen over even 3m, though has run respectably at it; back near his best when a strong finish over nearly 2m5f secured him a Grade 2 win by 6l at Thurles (good) in January on latest start, for his first success in two years, but that has put him back up the weights.

quotes.race: Horse & Jockey Hotel Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Appreciate It probably missed his prime when he got injured after winning the Supreme so it is great for him to win such a prestigious race as this today. I think he loved the ground and dropping back to a Grade 2 helped as well - Patrick Mullins, assistant trainer

quotes.race: WilllowWarm Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Paul said Appreciate It might have been a little bit flat after Cheltenham. He nearly got brought down as well but he said that didn't make a lot of difference - David Casey, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Rathmore Stud Irish EBF Novice Chase
quotes.quote: It was the same as the last day and you'd love to get a lead on Appreciate It as he's idle in front - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: Last Chance 20% Off Festival Tickets Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Appreciate It was having a look everywhere and not doing a lot. When Jack (Kennedy) did come alongside us, and got competitive, he was always in control I felt - Paul Townend, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: You'd have to think that was a Vautour-like performance, wouldn't you? The way he destroyed them up the hill was fantastic. Appreciate It was awesome. Paul (Townend) was exuding confidence the whole way down the hill. It was textbook stuff from Paul and the horse. In my head I had that he would probably be an Arkle horse. I never envisioned him as a Champion Hurdle horse. We'll go to Punchestown and leave that to next season. I always had chasing in mind - but then I always had chasing in mind for Faugheen. I think we might be back to the same argument. We'll have a word with the owner Michael Masterson, see what he'd like to do and have a word with everyone on my team. He could do either, I think - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Chanelle Pharma Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I'd like Appreciate It to jump better than he did today. He was a bit careless down the back - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Paddy Power Future Champions Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: He surprised me and impressed me. I was wondering if he was a two-and-a-half mile horse or a two-mile horse. I know he can easily do it over two and a half, but to come back to two miles and put in a performance like that in a Grade 1 was impressive. I'd say we'll go down the two-mile route now. He's not flashy like Ferny Hollow but he has a great cruising speed and covers a lot of ground which helps him to burn other horses off. He'll probably have another run here at the Dublin Racing Festival - Willie Mullins, trainer of Appreciate It

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I'm very happy with that. He picked up when I wanted him at the back of the last. He's deadly to jump, electric. He had a lot of it done before he came to us in terms of jumping. Over two miles today, you couldn't be happier. He'll have no problem going further - Paul Townend, rider of Appreciate It

quotes.race: Goffs Future Stars (C & G) I.N.H. Flat Race (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Appreciate it was very impressive. The way he put away a field of what looked the best bumper horses in Ireland did surprise me but Patrick had way more confidence in him than I had. He was keen on him all the time. I thought it was a very tough race. He looked like a Cheltenham type for me anyway - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Paddy Power Games "One For The Road" INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: That was a very good performance. Patrick said riding him at home that he'd come on a lot from his last run and you can see the evidence of that today. He showed a nice turn of foot albeit over two and a half miles. He did it the hard way making all and I liked the way he changed gear in the last two furlongs. He's a real chaser in the making but I'd imagine we might try and go down the Cheltenham bumper route - Willie Mullins, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's back on song and looks really well. He has an entry at Thurles on Thursday and could run in that Listed chase. He ran a big race in the Punchestown Gold Cup and wasn't beaten far. 25-11-24

He started his novice chase career very well, winning twice, but ran disappointingly last time out in the Irish Arkle when beaten by El Fabiolo. He ran flat but he's nine now and it looks as if he's not as fast as he was, so a step up in trip is what's needed. He's likely to go for the Turners as it's over an extra half-mile, which I hope will suit. Any give in the ground will help him. 08-03-23

runners.name: Minella Cocooner
runners.comment: Came late to win bet365 Gold Cup at Sandown (extended 3m4f, good; up 6lb today) last April
runners.spotlight: Third to Intense Raffles in the Irish National (3m5f, heavy) and delivered late to win the bet365 Gold Cup at Sandown (extended 3m4f, good; 6lb higher today) later last April; Grade 1 rivals proved far too hot for him this season and he failed to trouble Nick Rockett and Intense Raffles at Fairyhouse on latest outing, but he looks a far more interesting prospect for today's assignment and this could be when he wins again.

quotes.race: Jack Kiernans Celebrating 55 Years In Business Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Minella Cocooner jumped spectacular there and seemed a lot more settled than he was in his hurdling days. Paul was delighted with him - Patrick Mullins, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Spa Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Minella Cocooner ran a cracker. He was a little bit keen early and was beaten by the better horse on the day. The ground is drying out a bit - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Nathaniel Lacy & Partners Solicitors "50,000 Cheltenham Bonus For Stable Staff" Nov Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Minella Cocooner was very well ridden by Danny, he got some tremendous jumps from him and he got his breathers into him after his hurdles and paced it beautifully. I don't see any need to go up in trip - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Mervyn Gray Construction Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Miella Cocooner had the benefit of his Cork run and he's maturing the whole time. He's a real galloper and we will see the best of him when he jumps a fence - Paul Townend, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He did us proud last spring, finishing third in the Irish Grand National and then winning the bet365 Gold Cup at Sandown on the final day. He ran in a red-hot John Durkan on Sunday, but there will be other days for him this season when the company is not as competitive as that. 25-11-24

He's done little wrong in his three hurdles runs, which included victory in the Grade 1 Nathaniel Lacy & Soilicitors Novice Hurdle at Leopardstown. Danny gave him a terrific ride and I was very pleased with his jumping. He has options in the Ballymore and Albert Bartlett and just looking at how he races it might be that the latter would be tough for him. We will make up our minds nearer the time but looking at his style of running and racing then the Ballymore might the one for him. 09-03-22

runners.name: Conflated
runners.comment: Twice second in Grade 1 chases at this meeting; this season's results look pretty grim
runners.spotlight: Not proven beyond 3m2f; contested Grade 1s at this meeting for the last three years, twice finishing runner-up, and he was third in the 2023 Cheltenham Gold Cup; this season's results, contrastingly, look pretty grim but he did lead turning for home in a Cheltenham handicap last month (finished eighth) which showed that something is still smouldering.

quotes.race: Savills Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Conflated has run a big race from the front and it's a pity he came down at the last. He definitely didn't deserve that - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Cheltenham Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Conflated has run his heart out in what was a fantastic race and I am very proud of him. If he is in good form he could go to Punchestown next but he has had a proper race there - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Savills Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Paul (Townend) was going kind of steady on Kemboy and Conflated got a bit lit up going by the stands, so I let him go on and he'd probably be better off a stronger gallop but it was a good performance. I'm delighted and I don't know about plans, but he'd stay the Gold Cup trip; there are no issues with stamina - Jack Kennedy, rider.

quotes.race: Betway Bowl Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: There were no excuses. Conflated ran his race. He has to go left-handed so I'd say that would be him for this season. He'll come back for all these type of races next season - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Irish Gold Cup (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Conflated has a massive engine but he can be very hot and cold, and I was keen to try him in this race. We have the Gold Cup, the Ryanair and the Grand National as options for him - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Foxrock Handicap Chase (Grade B)
quotes.quote: That was nice. Conflated is good horse and was a Graded horse over hurdles but he lost his way a bit. I fancied him in the Kerry National but he unseated at the third fence. It's great to win a nice pot with him - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: BAR ONE RACING Directors Plate Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Conflated was entitled to win and it looked a good opportunity prior to Fairyhouse and Punchestown, he won well and jumped great - Denis Foster, trainer.

quotes.race: John Lynch Carpets Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Conflated is not a bad horse. He ran a few good races last year over the wrong trip. He was a fit horse today too. I don't know if he's a Grade 1 horse over fences but we'll see - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Kettles Country House Supporting Fingal Ravens GAA Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's a nice horse, very keen at home and a chaser in the making. He had a nice run at Cork last time when learning a lot - Gordon Elliott, trainer of Conflated

quotes.race: Next Meeting Holy Thursday Flat Race
quotes.quote: Conflated is very tricky but is starting to get the hang of things now and is starting to relax. He is not hanging now and has lots of ability. I'd say when he gets a hurdle in front of him he'll be better again - Declan Lavery, rider

stable_tour.quote: He's in loads of races but I'd say if the festival started tomorrow he would run in the Ultima. He's lost his way a bit this season and, at the age of 11, he isn't going to be getting any better, but he was bang there at the last in the Punchestown Gold Cup last season and that's less than a year ago. 19-2-25

runners.name: Stumptown
runners.comment: Seriously improved over 3m5f for Cheltenham cross-country wins on his last two outings
runners.spotlight: Cross-country chasing could hardly have gone better, which augurs well, as does his markedly improved form over 3m5f in the Cheltenham version on last two outings; spending the last third of it off the bridle at the Festival last month (with first-time cheekpieces; last season's blinkers now return) is a niggling worry, and slogging it out was a taxing as well as serious achievement, but he finished well on top and can race off the same mark today; on the shortlist.

quotes.race: Glenfarclas Cross Country Chase (A Limited Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was very concerned for a while to be honest, but Stumptown has ended up running out a good winner in the end. I don't think Keith thought he was at his best either, but we will take it anyway. I don't have an explanation [why he didn't travel] as well today, but we got away with it and he won. The cheekpieces just helped him at the finish, but he has thrived over these fences. Keith [Donoghue, jockey] is definitely worth a few pounds around here. He's an ultra professional and there is no stone unturned with him. He's in the Grand National and we will aim him at it, but it's coming soon enough. All being well, he will go there - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Glenfarclas Crystal Cup Cross Country Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stumptown loved it and it's a huge asset to have Keith [Donoghue, jockey] in these races because he's very good and gets a tune out of the horses. He's been around Punchestown a few times and he's very good at the banks, but it's a different discipline here with the hedges and we were hoping he'd take to it, and he took to it very well. We said we'd give the Punchestown Festival a go with him. We thought he'd hit his maximum in the handicap and we'd give this a go. It seems to have brought a new lease of life into him - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Colm Quinn BMW Risk Of Thunder Chase
quotes.quote: Stumptown has really taken to these obstacles and just seems to love it. He had been careful over normal fences and I wondered if he would have the heart for jumping these obstacles but he just loves it. He will probably go to Cheltenham next month for the cross-country there and work from there - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think the blinkers helped. Stumptown schooled in them a week ago and they really sharpened him up. He hasn't run badly this season - he's just jumped poorly. Keith said jumped really well and made ground in the air, which we haven't seen since March. We were gutted at Newbury and really fancied him, but he didn't become a bad horse overnight. We might come back here for the festival, but it might be too soon for the National for him. We'll see what Gavin says - Ger Teahon, part-owner.

quotes.race: Alanbrooke Handicap Chase (Challenger Staying Chase Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: The long game is hopefully next month and the Kim Muir, but we didn't think Stumptown was high enough so it was Gavin's idea to send him here, win and get a few pounds. He's only young so is still learning his craft - George Savage, part-owner.

quotes.race: www.thurlesraces.ie Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Stumptown is capable. I fancied him last day but he never jumped at all, and even given that he wasn't beaten that far. With the bit of better ground here he was able to jump well. Hopefully the handicapper isn't too hard on him - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: PricewaterhouseCoopers Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Stumptown was second in a point-to-point so we knew he'd stay well. He was a little green the whole way around, they went a good gallop and he stayed going well. He loved that soft ground and will stay further. Coming here if he finished fourth or fifth, I'd have been delighted. I don't know where we'll go now, maybe for a rated novice - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a Kim Muir runner-up but he's gone down the cross-country route more recently and has taken to the discipline well as he was very good when winning at Punchestown. He's going to go to Cheltenham on Friday for the cross-country race and hopefully he can get back there in March. 12-11-24

He's a Kim Muir runner-up but he's gone down the cross-country route more recently and has taken to the discipline well as he was very good when winning at Punchestown. He's going to go to Cheltenham on Friday for the cross-country race and hopefully he can get back there in March. 13-11-24

runners.name: Hitman
runners.breeder: Mme C Villaud Ameline & Mr Q Villaud
runners.comment: Only one win (2022) in the last four years; running creditably; has his first go beyond 3m
runners.spotlight: It's impossible to ignore that he's won only once (November 2022) in the last four years; minor honours include second in last three renewals of the Grade 2 Denman Chase at Newbury (2m7f) in February, which made it three creditable seconds from his three starts this term, but it would be bold to predict that this first go beyond 3m will take him back to the winner's enclosure.

quotes.race: Get Daily Rewards With Betfair Graduation Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hitman was a little bit keen and fresh at Aintree the other day and needed that run and we let him bowl along in front. He settled and galloped and jumped.
