For a six-year-old rated 160, we've been patient with him and he's run some really good races for a young horse and is just becoming the finished article now. He's got an entry for the King George and I'd say that's where we'll be heading. I might give him a couple of other entries, but I'd say the plan would be to go to the King George - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Jewson St Helens Old Roan Limited Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Hitman. I tried to keep him covered up and getting a lead and everything went right apart from our head wasn't in front. I'm very happy but frustrated at the same time - Harry Cobden, jockey.

quotes.race: Marsh Chase (Registered As The Melling Chase) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've always held Hitman in high regard, he's just been a big, weak horse. He's a work in progress. That was probably a career-best run. He's needed a bit of time. He'll definitely step up in trip next season which will suit him. He got beat by a very good horse today - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Novices' Chase (For The Jacky Upton Trophy) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hitman will go to Aintree now for the Manifesto Novices' Chase, although if it was testing he could drop back to two miles for the Maghull Novices' Chase; he won't go to Cheltenham, which I didn't want to do after a fall. He's still a big baby and the plan was a clear round today, which was beautiful. It's too soon for Cheltenham and that's perfect today so off to Aintree - Paul Nicholls, trainer

quotes.race: Planteur At Chapel Stud Henry VIII Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think the first and second are both very good horses. Hitman's inexperience may have caught him out down the back but I wouldn't be afraid to take the winner on again. I could also see our horse coming back here for the Scilly Isles - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: You have only to look at his record in recent seasons to see how hard he is to win with. It doesn't help that he's been troubled on and off with his breathing, and he had his fourth bout of surgery last winter. Despite his frustrating tally of one victory from 16 starts in the last three seasons, he's still capable of smart form and he came back at Aintree eight days ago to run another good race in the Old Roan. He suffered a bout of colic on the way home and spent the night in a veterinary hospital, but he's fine again now. I'll enter him in the Betfair Chase, although the trip would probably tax his stamina. Of course, he'd be up against it, but a horse like him will more than pay his way, picking up plenty of valuable place prize-money. 04-11-24

runners.name: Beauport
runners.comment: Going left-handed is a concern but there are lots of positives otherwise
runners.spotlight: Jumped and hung badly right in the Midlands National at Uttoxeter (4m2f, heavy) last March but nevertheless battled back to win, the clear highlight among seven chases going this way round; scoring by 31l at Ascot (3m5f, good; 12lb higher today) was a good way to start this season and he's run with credit over hurdles since; going left-handed is a concern but there are lots of positives otherwise.

quotes.race: 1st Class Logistics Berkshire National Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: His jumping was spectacular. Beauport has had a few physical problems but Nigel Twiston-Davies and his team have done brilliantly to get him into that kind of shape. He should be put up enough after that to sneak into the National so that must be a race we've got to think very hard about. We always thought he was a potential National horse and, after a Midlands and Berkshire National, we probably need to go to Liverpool at some stage. There won't be many British runners but I hope he can be one of them - Bryan Burrough, owner.

quotes.race: bet365 Midlands Grand National Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Beauport has run one bad race in his life and the owners have shown great loyalty to Jordan. He's such an honest horse and when he gets his conditions he's hard to get past. Bryan and Philippa [Burrough] always buy horses who are National types, so Aintree could be something to consider next season, but this is a big race in its own right and it's great to win it - Carl Llewellyn, stable representative.

quotes.race: Colin Parker Memorial Intermediate Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was nice to jump well first time over fences and to have a good experience. At the weights, Beauport was well-in on his ratings getting the weight from Millers Bank. He was entitled to win and I don't think he's surprised anyone. He might go to Newbury now at the end of November - there's a nice novice chase there - Carl Llewellyn, assistant to Nigel Twiston-Davies. ,

quotes.race: Optimum Pay Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Beauport is a lovely horse. Dropping him back in trip wasn't ideal but we made sure it was a good gallop and he kept going well. I ride him quite a bit at home and he's quite strong - he always runs off with me! It's lovely to ride him regularly and I can't thank his owners enough. Winners on these big days are what you need to get your name out there and I'm closing in on losing the claim - Jordan Nailor, jockey.

quotes.race: European Breeders' Fund Paddy Power 'National Hunt' Novices' Handicap Hurdle Final (Grade 3) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Beauport is my first winner here and my first Graded or Listed win too. The ground really helped him out. I was thinking to myself when I got to the front I was there too soon and I'd have been fuming with myself if he'd have got beaten. But all he does is stay and it was always going to be really hard work for anything coming from behind to get me on the ground - Jordan Nailor, jockey.

runners.name: Bravemansgame
runners.breeder: Dr Vet M Guiot & Dr Vet B Stoffel
runners.comment: Won the 2022 King George and second in 2023 Cheltenham Gold Cup but doubts have now set in
runners.spotlight: Won the 2022 King George and second in the 2023 Cheltenham Gold Cup (he's unraced beyond that 3m2f); a run of seconds late in 2023 was creditable but more substantial doubts have now set in and various equipment has been tried; to look on the bright side, he makes his first foray outside Grade 1 or 2 for over three years and his handicap mark has plummeted.

quotes.race: William Hill Bet10 Get10 On Racing Denman Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They sprinted a bit from two out and Bravemansgame was done by younger legs. He has run a really nice race. He went around with his ears pricked, loving it - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Charlie Hall Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bravemannsgame was a long way off his best, visually. The winner is rated 157 so officially we've run to 153 haven't we, which is a long way below his mark. I'll see what Paul says but we're going to go for a bit of headgear if I have my way - Harry Cobden, rider.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes King George VI Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Harry (Cobden) said he was getting a bit of a tow from the other horse (Shishkin) for as long as he could then the other horse had an unfortunate incident, and that interfered with him and that stopped him dead and cost him any chance then. Bravemansgame has run a good, solid race. It is a case of ifs and buts. He was staying on strongly again and picked up the crumbs. I've never doubted that he stays. He is better on better ground. We will get him fresh and well now and go to Cheltenham - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Lancashire Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bravemansgame was not good enough on the day, it's as simple as that. No excuses. He jumped well and travelled well. I thought he was going to win going to four out and he didn't quite pick up. We'll get him fresh for Kempton, that probably suits him better, it's an easier three miles. Daryl gave him a super ride, the other horse outstayed him. He's run a good race, Kempton's his track, it won't do him any harm to have a few runs. You can wrap them up too much in cotton wool. Sometimes they want a few races to harden them up a bit. He's run well and he'll run well at Kempton - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Charlie Hall Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Harry said fitness caught Bravemansgame out on the day. I'm pleased with him, he just got a bit tired in the ground and the other horse had had a run. This time last year you could get away with horses needing a run a little bit on better ground but on this ground you don't. He's done exactly as he did last year and he'll take a step forward, the King George will be a different ball game. He needed a bit of a blow and if it had been good ground like last year it wouldn't have happened. He just missed the last and was giving the winner 6lb and our targets are the King George and the Cheltenham Gold Cup - it hasn't made any difference to how he'll run in the King George at all. I don't like losing but he's run very well. He'll go straight to Kempton - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Cheltenham Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I hate coming second, you know me, but I can't be anything but proud of the horse. Bravemansgame ran a blinding race and we'll give it another go next year. We'll see about Aintree, he had a hard race. The only places he'll run are Punchestown and Aintree, but we'll play it by ear and see how he is. If he didn't run again this season it wouldn't be the end of the world, but he's only run once since Christmas so we could go to Aintree - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes King George VI Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a hell of a race. They went a good gallop and old Frodon gave them a good lead. Bravemansgame stayed on strong then and showed his strengths. He is just a maturing horse and we have trained him for today. We will go straight to Cheltenham now and we won't run him before the Gold Cup. Better ground he travels better on than he did today, but he dug deep and stayed on - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Charlie Hall Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That's what we wanted to see. We knew we had Bravemansgame fairly right. He hasn't been away for a gallop anywhere because I wanted to improve from now. We've got eight weeks to get him ready for the King George and he obviously won't run before then. Harry said that was the best feel he's ever given him. He felt he was in third gear all the way round, jumped fantastically well and galloped all the way to the line. Onwards and upwards - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Mildmay Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bravemansgame hasn't run his race. It was the end of a long season, I suppose. Harry said he was very keen going down and very keen in the first part of the race, he wouldn't switch off. If he'd have jumped the second-last upsides and got beaten I'd have thought 'fair enough' but Harry said he was beaten turning in. I haven't been hiding it, some of ours have been disappointing in the spring, some have run well and some haven't and that wasn't his true form. With a good summer out he'll be back next season - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Cheltenham Roarcast Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've left plenty to work on with Bravemansgame and didn't want to come here really fit and not improve for Cheltenham. We ran the likes of Kauto Star and Denman a bit short here and they came on. This fella hasn't run since Kempton and has been mad fresh. We haven't done much with him and we've left plenty to improve. I'm pleased with what he's done and we go into Cheltenham in good shape - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Kauto Star Novices' Chase (In Memory Of Nigel Clark) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bravemansgame has it all, doesn't he? I did think the ground might be on the slow side but those good horses keep on galloping. He is improving all the time and we haven't been too hard on him. I learned a few lessons about how to train him from last year - but last year he was half the horse he is now and I think he'll improve as he gets better physically. That was a mighty performance. If you wanted to get him winning King Georges when he's nine and ten you would want to be minding him and not overdoing him now. I know the guys would like to go to Cheltenham but my target was always next year's King George. If you want to get horses like Clan and Frodon to their best you need to give them time to mature. You don't want to leave races at home - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Double Daily Rewards With Betfair Graduation Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bravemansgame is improving physically and is obviously very good. He jumped fantastically well and has got so much scope that chasing was always going to be the big thing for him. He'll go for the Kauto Star next at Kempton on Boxing Day. It's the obvious race to go for. Three miles around Kempton will be absolutely brilliant for him - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet Challow Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bravemansgame has got it all hasn't he?. Next year he'll make a super chaser and he's not unlike Denman in his physique, size and how he does things - he's probably got a bit more boot than Denman - but it's just nice to be talking about him in the same breath as Denman. It'd be nice if he turned out as good as Denman, but he's every bit as good at this stage of his career as Denman was at the same stage. He'll go for the Ballymore but it's just if we give him another run before we'll see. I certainly wouldn't run him on Trials Day at Cheltenham, but we'll see if we can find somewhere that I'd call a soft race. He'll get three miles in time, but doesn't need to do that now - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Play Ladbrokes 5-A-Side On Football Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bravemansgame did that well and we thought we'd come here en route to the Challow. We were going to go straight there but I thought he came out of his last race so well we'd give him another run before a step into a Grade 1. Testing ground would make me slightly nervous for the Challow as he's a good-actioned horse who wants better ground. He'd get further in time, but we probably wouldn't do that this season and he'll make a hugely exciting chaser next term - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Kennford Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bravemansgame and the winner that day at Chepstow [Soaring Glory] will be quite nice horses. He is a big, progressive horse who's going to keep going forward and is a chaser in the making so we're thrilled with him. He'll be a super chaser in a year's time. He's a horse who could run in a Challow, I wouldn't be afraid. He's well capable of running in Graded races now so we'll see what there is - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: The King George is always a hot race but he loves it around Kempton and he hasn't run badly in his two races this season. The ground shouldn't be too bad for him as it's a dry forecast and we think he's in good shape for it. He's a former winner and he ran very well in the race last season, so hopefully he can do so again. 20-12-24

runners.name: Chantry House
runners.comment: Looked much more like his old self on penultimate start but not on latest
runners.spotlight: Very smart in his heyday; returned to chasing at Cheltenham (extended 3m1f, soft) on New Year's Day and looked much more like his old self, asserting late on in a five-runner handicap; however, he singularly failed to back that up in a Grade 2 over that same C&D over three weeks later.

quotes.race: Betfair Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's great when these old boys come back. It's been a long time but Chantry House is such a lovely horse. He's fooled us a little bit as we just let him do his own thing at home. I was trying to get him ready for the first hunter chases but I'm afraid I've probably blown that completely - that was the whole plan. There have been little glimmers but he looked like a young horse again there - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Cotswold Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Chantry House has got the job done and he's had a right good blow actually, Nico jumped off him as he was a bit tired. If you go right back, that's his first race since Aintree last year as he had the two-horse race at Sandown and then ran no race at Kempton (in the King George). It's the first time he's had to do something that wasn't straightforward for him. The cheekpieces were a bit of a response to Kempton. That was a tough race today and they went a good gallop, Santini always sets a good gallop and they had to work hard. It's lovely ground but it's quite dead and you can get tired. He's entitled to be tired there and we've got plenty of time so I think there's plenty of positives to take from that - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: John O'Leary Memorial Future Stars Intermediate Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'll have to talk to JP (McManus, owner) about it. The King George seems the natural thing to do at the moment. Chantry House has now proven he stays and his jumping was lovely. I know it may not have proved a lot but The Big Breakaway is a good horse on his day and Colin Tizzard's horses are running well at the moment - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Mildmay Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Nico was reasonably confident that Chantry House was creeping to the other horse but I felt very sorry for Kim because his horse had put up a very good exhibition and set a very strong gallop. The object of the exercise was to find out whether he was a three-mile horse and they've gone a good enough gallop there to prove that that is what he wants. Any horse that can come to Cheltenham and follow up here has got to be pretty good and he's got a great temperament, a lovely attitude to life. He's a very good horse - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Marsh Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (Registered as The Golden Miller) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We knew last year in the Supreme that Chantry House really wanted the extra half a mile, and, when he got it, it really looked like he needed another half, so you'd have to think he might be going over three miles sooner rather than later. He was about in top gear the whole way, but when he got there he did it well. He has quickened up well, so I think we'll be looking at three miles soon - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Bet At racingtv.com Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was happy with that. Chantry House put Cheltenham behind him there. The most important thing was to get him back on track after that and I think he's done that. He jumped well despite the ground, you couldn't really be asking for too many big jumps because you wouldn't last home but his jumping was very measured today - Nico de Boinville, jockey.

quotes.race: Ascot Racecourse Supports Safer Gambling Week Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Chantry House is having a really good blow. Nico said he took his first blow coming out of Swinley Bottom but ours are a lot like that at the moment. It's tiring ground and I was pleased with his jumping. He just wanted to be a little bit careful going down the hill but these are big fences for a novice but once he was asked to go he was quite relaxed and he took it in his stride up the hill. We certainly wouldn't be going down in trip, that's for sure. I'd say that today is just about right for now. You have to be really sure of your horse when you come here first time and it's not something I always like doing, but his schooling had been good and he was good. He won't need to do that again and he learnt a lot today. He could come back here for Christmas [for the Noel Novices' Chase].  - Nicky Henderson, trainer

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: It was a great run and Chantry House kept going really well, but the winner was really good. I missed the flight at the top of the hill but that didn't really make a difference - Barry Geraghty, jockey.

quotes.race: Set Your Own Odds On Betfair Exchange Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Chantry House is a smart horse and was very green when he won at Cheltenham. Barry said you could go either way at Cheltenham. We know he stays and he's got speed. You've got to stay in both races, so I think we'll have a look at them. I'd be surprised if he didn't want another half a mile, but Barry said he races very sweetly and is not aggressive in anyway, you just press the button and it works. You've got to be pleased with what he did. He's very straightforward and is a chaser in the making, only starting out in life. He's in the same mould as Shishkin and they've got futures whatever happens - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: British EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Chantry House is a very nice young horse who just needs the education. It was a bit of a messy race as they did not go much of a gallop and Barry has come back and said he was still a bit green. He is going to be very nice in time and hopefully he can do that again under a penalty and then we can take a view - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Northamptonshire Britains Best Surprise Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: Chantry House is a nice horse. We didn't run him at Kempton because it was too quick, while Newbury just dried out last week, but he doesn't want a bog - just safe ground, or really safe ground. He has to come on for that, but he's nice for the future and you'd dream he'd be a three-mile chaser. I don't know about plans - Barry Geraghty, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's coming along nicely and seems to be enjoying life at the moment. He didn't get round in his three chases after winning the Cotswold in 2022 and we switched back to hurdles last season, but we might look at chasing again. He behaves like a young horse and looks fabulous so I hope he can retain some of those past glories. 22-10-24

runners.name: Threeunderthrufive
runners.comment: Fourth in the 2023 Scottish National (4m); beaten a nose off today's mark last time
runners.spotlight: Fourth in the 2023 Scottish National (4m, good); commendable efforts most starts since and he went down by a nose off today's mark at Ascot (3m, good) last time; big odds but place possibilities.

quotes.race: Injured Jockeys Fund Ambassadors Programme Swinley Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Threeunderthrufive is not going to go to Cheltenham in three weeks and Max is quite keen on him running in the National. I've always had a reservation about his jumping but today it was as good as I've ever seen. He lost his way a bit last year and it never happened. I've tinkered with his wind a bit in the summer and he's ran three solid races this year and just got better and better - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Wigley Group Hampton Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Threeunderthrufive will have entries for the RSA and National Hunt Chase but I'd think we'll go for the former as he's not short of speed and his times compare favourably. He's jumped around Cheltenham and Adrian can ride him in that race - his record on him is phenomenal - Iain Turner, owners' racing manager.

quotes.race: bet365 December Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Threeunderthrufive is never going to be too flashy, but he gets the job done. He's got the experience and he'll have a break now and I'd say his next target might be the Reynoldstown or possibly the Lingfield race at the end of January in the million series - Ian Turner, owner's racing manager.

quotes.race: mallardjewellers.com Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a nice jumping and staying performance. Threeunderthrufive improved enormously for his first run at Chepstow, I thought we'd beat Kim's horse (Does He Know) just on the fact we needed it first time and we'd improved since Exeter. I was slightly nervous 12 days since Exeter was soon enough, but we wanted to try and support it. I just said to Max he'd be superb for it (National Hunt Chase) and something like Reynoldstown in the spring would suit and that could be the route back. I wouldn't be thinking the Brown Advisory as they'd go too quick for him. He's a real strong stayer, he jumps and gallops away and you can ride him handy. My head lad (Clifford Baker) said that horse would run well in a National one day, I hope he's right. He's a lovely staying horse - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Scottish Stayers Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Threeunderthrufive is a really progressive horse, who jumped nicely. The only question mark was the distance, but Adrian said he stayed really nicely. He would have preferred to get a lead a bit longer because when he gets to the front, he sometimes doesn't always do as much as he might. He probably won with a little bit in hand. There's a chance we could go to Aintree for the Grade 1 novice hurdle over three miles. Paul would like to go to Aintree with him, but we'll have to speak to Max. Paul thinks he's going to be a really smart chaser next season - Harry Derham, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Shukers Introductory Hurdle
quotes.quote: That was really good. It wasn't ideal because Threeunderthrufive's still a bit green after only one start over hurdles. But he's a thorough stayer and he's done it the hard way. Paul had the Winter Novices' Hurdle at Sandown pencilled in but it will all depend on how he comes out of this race. He's a real, good tough horse. Essentially he'll be a really smart chaser for the future - he's a lovely horse and one to really look forward to - Harry Derham, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Siobhan Winterbottom Supports Children With Cancer UK Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: Threeunderfive is a nice young horse for the future and we thought he'd improve for his run at Fontwell. It's attritional out there, but he's stuck to it well. There are no fancy plans but he'll have another run before we put him away. He doesn't really like that ground, but he's tough and improving and will make a nice novice hurdler over two and a half next season - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We've entered him in the Grand National, which is his main aim, and he's going to Ascot this month for the race he won last year, but I've put him in this as an option. He's run only once this season, finishing third at Ascot. 9-2-25

runners.name: Perceval Legallois

prev_owners.owner: Ms Kiva O'Brien & Mrs J M Walker

runners.comment: Won big 3m handicap from off the pace at Leopardstown (good to yielding) over Christmas
runners.spotlight: His three handicap wins have all been in large fields; two were over hurdles, including latest start, and he also worked his way from well off the pace to surge 7l clear in the valuable Paddy Power Chase at Leopardstown (good to yielding) over Christmas; looks sure to stay further than that extended 3m but this first attempt is over a lot further; not the most fluent jumper and needs to improve again but he comes here on a high.

quotes.race: Race And Stay At Leopardstown Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Perceval Legallois was very nimble over hurdles. I thought coming here he's a better chaser than he is a hurdler but he was good there. He's in the Grand National so we'll have to consider it - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Paddy Power Chase (Extended Handicap Chase) (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Perceval Legallois got me out of trouble! It didn't go to plan. I didn't want to be as far back as I was. They kicked on down the back straight and I was a good bit back, further than I wanted to be, but I weaved my way through and he winged the last. I thought coming down to the second-last I had a chance if he kept going the way he was going. I got a great kick out of that because the horse deserved it. He's been unlucky on his last few runs. I knew the ability was there but nothing went right on his last few runs - Mark Walsh, jockey.

quotes.race: P.J. Foley Memorial INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: That was great from Percival Legallois. We've liked him and I was fairly confident he'd handle conditions. Obviously we were very afraid of Willie's horse coming here but I'm not one bit surprised because he has shown us plenty at home - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been frustrating but hopefully he could still win a big one off this mark, although he needs things to fall his way. He's had plenty of hard luck along the way and has crept up in the handicap without winning. If the ground is on the better side it won't be a problem to him. 21-12-24

He's been a bit frustrating and the handicapper keeps pushing him up a little bit despite him not winning. He might just not be well handicapped anymore but hopefully he'll have a good chance in one of those staying handicap chases if things fall his way. 13-11-24

runners.name: Kandoo Kid
runners.comment: Won Coral Gold Cup at Newbury (upped to 3m2f, good to soft) in November; 7lb higher today
runners.spotlight: Negotiated these fences in dashing style when staying-on third in the 2m5f Topham (soft) last April and returned from wind surgery to win the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury (upped to 3m2f, good to soft) in November from Broadway Boy; 7lb higher today; had a run at Newbury five weeks ago and, although there are slightly mixed signals with that display and whether he will be suited by this distance, he looks set for a bold show.

quotes.race: Coral Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've aimed at this race all season and I wasn't going to be tempted to run Kandoo Kid. He's great fresh and galloped beautifully here the other day. I thought he'd stay and he got a great ride. We made a plan and have done plenty of work with him. I just thought he'd improved and that this was the ideal race. I didn't want to run him before and set him back. I think he'd be a great type for Aintree. He's been round there once before and was brilliant. He's got the National written all over him and that's what we'll train him for - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Stella Artois Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a good race and Kandoo Kid is obviously quite smart. He's probably got a bit more gear than he shows at home. He will get further but having won at two miles, there's no rush to go up in trip. He's very much a future chaser - Harry Derham, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was largely consistent in his first season over fences, despite winning just the once. He was probably a shade lucky to land a valuable pot at Newbury as the leader threw it away at the last. He continued to improve after that, putting up sound efforts in Grade 3 handicaps, and he jumped the Liverpool fences beautifully when third in the Topham. He was staying on strongly at the end of two-mile-five, so the plan is to take him back there in the spring for the Grand National. Before then his first big objective is the Coral Gold Cup, and we might take him to Newbury beforehand for their public gallops day in the middle of the month. He seems well suited by good or good to soft ground. 04-11-24

runners.name: Iroko

prev_owners.owner: Lord Daresbury, Ecurie Mme Jacques Cypres & E Clayeux

runners.comment: 2m7f-3m1f defeats among his best efforts and contained suggestions of stamina; promising
runners.spotlight: Noble Yeats three years ago showed a 7yo can still win the National; this one has spent most of his career at about 2m4f/2m5f and his three appearances over 2m7f-3m1f were defeats but they were among his best efforts (two were Grade 1 novice places here) and contained mouthwatering suggestions of stamina not yet called upon; it is today and there's almost no doubt he remains capable of better.

quotes.race: bet365 Premier Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was happy with Iroko. Jonjo thought the track was a little bit sharp for him in that grade. There were no excuses today, he was up against a good horse.  He's run well and he deserves to go for the National. I think the trip is what he wants, he seems always to be doing his best work at the end. He does normally travel a bit better in his races but they were probably going a bit quick - Oliver Greennall, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Exchange Graduation Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with that and for a first run everything went to plan, bar winning. Iroko jumped brilliantly, travelled really nicely and bar winning, I couldn't have been happier. We'll probably look at something like the Cotswold Chase and maybe once the National weights are out a handicap somewhere - Josh Guerriero, trainer.

quotes.race: Huyton Asphalt Franny Blennerhassett Memorial Mildmay Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: To get two runs out of him after his injury is unbelievable. Iroko just gallops and round here it's probably too sharp for him and we probably bumped into one. Jonjo said he got stuck down the inner and while he probably wouldn't have won, he didn't quite get a clear enough run up the home straight. He tries and stays and jumps so well. When he's flat out he still jumps really well. It was fairly tacky ground out there and he was tired. He could go to Punchestown and there are races like the Coral Gold Cup next season - Oliver Greenall, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Stan Mellor Memorial Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Iroko was pretty much foot perfect, bar a couple of small mistakes. He loved the ground and we thought he would like three miles more, but he has travelled like a dream there over two and a half miles. We will probably stick to two and a half for the time being. At Aintree he looked like he wanted a trip, but maybe he had a hard enough race at Cheltenham and he just ran a bit flat at Aintree. Maybe that wasn't his true reading. Whether you go for a smaller race then go up a level or go straight up a level next we will just have to see. On a tighter track like Kempton on better ground you could go three miles, but we will see how we go. The Kauto Star could be considered. If it is soft ground at Cheltenham he would probably stay at two and a half miles and if it was quick he would go over three miles - Oliver Greenall, joint trainer.

quotes.race: Winners Wear Cavani Sefton Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a very good run and Iroko is a lovely horse. Mark said if he had run over three miles before he might have been a bit more positive with him. It was his first time over three miles and you couldn''t have done that. He was staying all the way to the line and he will be an exciting chaser for next season. We would possibly go back to two and a half to start with over fences at somewhere like Wetherby - Oliver Greenall, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Martin Pipe Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was amazing. We always knew Iroko was nice but we just felt that maybe he might be tapped for toe around here. He held his position, came off the bridle early enough but jumped so well even when he was off the bridle. He's so easy, tough and honest. He shows nothing at home and he's not a good work horse but he's so straightforward. He doesn't take much work and he's a dream. He toughed it out, winged the last and it was great. Absolutely brilliant - Oliver Greenall, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Slingsby Gin Peak Cap & Pearls Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We've always liked Iroko. I was slightly concerned about the ground and he came off the bridle early enough but he battled on well. He's bound to come from that, he's still a big baby - Oliver Greenall, joint-trainer.

stable_tour.quote: The long-term plan is the Grand National as JP [McManus] is very keen to go. He's a Graded horse who's been placed in two Grade 1s and he looks a classy horse going back into handicap company. He's got the right profile for the National as he's a very good jumper who stays well. We'll work back from that but it's going to be tricky because he's had only three runs over fences and we want to get some experience into him without affecting his mark too much. We've been waiting for the ground with him and he'll go for the intermediate chase at Haydock on Saturday. After that, he might go to the Cotswold Chase before hopefully going to Aintree. He had a foot injury last season and did well considering he missed virtually all of the season. He could be better again this season with an uninterrupted prep. He's bigger and stronger and he's definitely getting better. 21-11-24

He's a very interesting horse by top French sire Cokoriko. He started out in France and has since been bought by JP McManus and sent to us, which is a huge feather in our cap. After a couple of high-profile starts for us last season, both of which were decent efforts, we opted to give him a long break before bringing him back at Wetherby last month. That was over 2m3½f and it was great to see him get his head in front off a mark of 121. He's a fine, big chasing type, but before then he can do well over hurdles. There's a conditionals' race at Ascot on December 16 that will be his next target but he won't have a very busy campaign, possibly two or three more runs, as he's still a youngster and we have nice plans for him further down the line. Hopefully we can justify Mr McManus's decision to send the horse to us, as everyone wants to train for owners of his ilk. 07-12-22

runners.name: Intense Raffles
runners.comment: Won 2024 Irish National (3m5f, heavy); fine 2nd latest; different ground is the question
runners.spotlight: Just a 7yo but he contested chases in France as early as March 2022; unbeaten last year in his first three Irish races, culminating in the Irish Grand National (3m5f, heavy) in which he was always prominent and overcame an uncharacteristic blunder four out; they'll go a lot faster today, while he's also on different ground (the big question) and switching to a left-handed chase, but he made an excellent return to fences just behind Nick Rockett at Fairyhouse six weeks ago and that makes him look one of the best handicapped contenders in this race.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Irish Grand National Chase (Extended Handicap Chase) (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: It's a massive race to win and that was a good performance. It's unbelievable really. I thought they didn't go quick and I was comfortable where I was, we were just pottering away. I gave the fourth-last a right belt and I thought that'd knock the stuffing out of Intense Raffles. He stuck out his head and galloped all the way to the line - J J Slevin, rider. I'm buzzing. That's every bit as much as a thrill [as 2012] for different reasons. He came here as second favourite and we had huge confidence in him. He ran just like we expected he would. It's a very satisfying feeling - Thomas Gibney, trainer.

quotes.race: Book Your Advanced Tickets Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: It's easy to get carried away in a three-runner race. Good Time Jonny is probably much better dropped out in a big field and Henry's mare hadn't been in great form. If we didn't win it we would have been very disappointed but, at the same time, we couldn't have been happier with the way Intense Raffles did it. We could have gone for the novice race tomorrow in Naas, but we decided to come here today to test out the distance. We wanted to see if he'd stay and today it looks like he'd get every bit of it, so there is a good chance he'll come back on Easter Monday (for the Irish National) - Thomas Gibney, trainer.

runners.name: Senior Chief
runners.comment: Lightly raced 8yo; Cheltenham win (3m1f, good) in October means he needs a second look
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 8yo; 10-1 when pulled up in the Irish National (3m5f, heavy) last April, in touch five out on his only go at a marathon trip; reappearance win at Cheltenham (3m1f, good) in October was a great deal more auspicious, staying on strongly; creditable sixth off this 9lb higher mark in Coral Gold Cup next time and had a hurdle race in February; needs a second look.

quotes.race: William Hill Committed To Top Prices Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Senior Chief always looked like there was a big one in him. He was disappointing in the National, we gave him a good break and I'm delighted. The plan was to win a big handicap, and we felt he was entitled to do that, and now we'll see. The English National has always been in my head for him but his run in the Irish threw me a little. He may be more a left-hander, I'm not sure - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Senior Chief has done little wrong. He has run into some good horses. It was tough ground out there. We'll look for a handicap now - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Senior Chief is a lovely horse. I like the way he ground it out there. He's still a baby and improving all the time. He qualifies for the Red Mills final at Punchestown and that's where we will probably go - Henry de Bromhead, trainer

quotes.race: John Ross Memorial Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Senior Chief is a horse we like a lot and he was good there. He still looked a bit green but he jumped really well. I think his main aim is the auction final back here at the festival - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I was delighted with him when he won on his return at Cheltenham. We've always hoped there's a big pot in him and we'll go now to the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury. I always thought he wanted nice ground and I think he's improved for it. 18-11-24

runners.name: Idas Boy
runners.comment: Ex-Noel Meade; probably in need of race on yard debut; this 11yo needs a big career best
runners.spotlight: 40-1 winner at Kilbeggan (3m1f, good to yielding; the furthest he's been) last July and ran respectably in the Galway Plate (his only race with today's tongue-tie) before leaving Noel Meade for 60,000gns last August; probably in need of the race over hurdles on debut for new yard five weeks ago, but this 11yo needs a big career best.

quotes.race: Ryans Cleaning Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Idas Boy was going to be a nice horse last year. He pulled something here a year ago and we were never able to get him back. He had been working well. He got a lovely ride. He's in the Paddy Power at Christmas but he might have top weight after that - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: It was a nice starting point for Idas Boy. He had schooled very well at home so we were confident. He did what was expected. We always knew that when he got a fence he'd improve, and he could go up in trip too. I'm sure there'll be plenty of options for him. He's going the right direction but probably wouldn't want it too testing - Bryan Cooper, rider

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Idas Boy was very good when he jumped good. He will pay his way going forward over a trip. He's a nice horse - Bryan Cooper, rider.

runners.name: Fil Dor
runners.comment: A notch or two below his best this season; also has a big stamina doubt
runners.spotlight: 2-14 score over fences and the second win came at 1-40 in a two-runner race; a notch or two below his best this season and his penultimate start (sole attempt over as far as 3m) was not promising for stamina.

quotes.race: Racing TV Black Friday Offer 14 Euros Per Month Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: It was very straightforward and fairly routine. It would have been a surprise if Fil Dor had been beaten as he was rated a lot higher than the other horse. He really showed some glimmers of his old form the last day in Clonmel, so hopefully it is onwards and upwards - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

quotes.race: Barberstown Castle Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Fil Dor jumped very well. He lost his confidence a bit last year. He had a good blow but he galloped all the way to the line. There will be plenty of fun to be had with him over 2m4f - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Red Mills Trial Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Fil Dor is a smart horse who had a little blip the last day over fences and it's great to see him come back and enjoy it - Jordan Gainford, rider.

quotes.race: Boardsmill Stud Irish EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Jack said it rode like a proper race. Fil Dor was foot-perfect apart from one down the back that he landed on top of it. You couldn't help but be happy with him and I'd imagine he'll go to Leopardstown at Christmas now (for the Grade 1 Racing Post Novice Chase) - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: Knight Frank Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Even walking around the parade ring Fil Dor is so relaxed. The Dublin Racing Festival would be the obvious place to go with him now and if not then straight to the Triumph - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Price Boost Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Davy (Russell} said Fil Dor was just so professional and was asleep the whole way. He gave him one dig and he did what he had to do. A bit softer ground would suit him better but it was a nice performance and he did it well. Lunar Power brought him a little left so he needed the good jump at the last. We will look at Leopardstown over Christmas but ground will be a thing so we will put him in Chepstow as well - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: Value Cabs 3yo Hurdle
quotes.quote: Fil Dor is a good horse. I love the way he did it, he was so relaxed through the race and he will go on any ground. He will probably go to Fairyhouse next month - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's not going to be an easy horse to place but he came back in looking a million dollars and we'll hopefully get his head back in front. He has the option of hurdles and fences. 28-10-24

runners.name: Broadway Boy
runners.comment: Good shout judged on 2nd to Kandoo Kid in the Coral Gold Cup but he's disappointed since
runners.spotlight: Started this season brightly, notably when second to Kandoo Kid in the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury (3m2f, good to soft); he'd have a good shout judged on that display and going beyond 3m2f made plenty of appeal even before that; however, he disappointed at Cheltenham on New Year's Day and ran badly there last month; cheekpieces (tried at this meeting last year, tailed off) return.

quotes.race: Coral Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was delighted, Broadway Boy ran a brilliant race. Sam [Twiston-Davies, jockey] said it was soft ground and that if the horse didn't make a mistake then we'd have probably won. He's run the race of his life and I'm very proud of what he's done - Willy Twiston-Davies, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: Favourite From The Sun Now Daily Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Broadway Boy's jumping was brilliant on the whole, but he made three mistakes down the back and if it wasn't for those he would have won quite easily. He is very tough and really good. After the last day this race came onto the agenda. We are always looking for big money and this race was worth a lot of money. You can go for a novice chase for half of the money so that is the idea of going for a race like this. He could go for either the National Hunt Chase or the Brown Advisory come the festival. We will just have to see what the opposition looks like before making those decisions - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: From The Horse's Mouth Podcast Novices' Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Broadway Boy was very impressive, and he beat our other horse by a long way and he is pretty good so it is happy days. That was a good run behind Flooring Porter the last day and he has obviously improved for it. There is no point rushing into anything at the moment and we will see how he comes out of this. There is always the three-mile race at Kempton (Kauto Star Novices' Chase on Boxing Day) which is a possibility, but we will see. As it stands I think his credentials (for the Brown Advisory Novices' Chase) are superb. It does look like he will stay all day, but I think we will stay at three miles for the moment as he seems to have a bit of speed, but let's see as he has plenty of time - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: Boylesports Best Odds Guaranteed On Racing Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Broadway Boy did it well. He finished second behind Authorised Speed last time and that horse has just won [at Sandown]. He ran on well and staying is definitely his game. Next season he'll be a good chaser - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It's all systems go for the Ultima, and he worked brilliantly last Tuesday. He's had a quiet time since his disappointing run on New Year's Day and he's had his knees medicated since. He could be a forgotten horse in that race. 17-2-25

runners.name: Coko Beach

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Patrick Joubert & Sc Ecurie Couderc

runners.comment: Below form this term; can't be fancied judged on his runs in last three Grand Nationals
runners.spotlight: Entered this race last year as one of the top weights and having been in career-best form, including at 3m2f over these fences; he duly came up with easily his closest finish here in three Grand Nationals but was beaten 33l even so; this season has continued well below form.

quotes.race: SBK P.P. Hogan Memorial Cross Country Chase
quotes.quote: Coko Beach loved it, he's a natural. I was excited when I saw him entered in it and when Gordon asked did I want to ride, I didn't need to be asked twice. He's probably been schooling over these for a year and has won a couple of good pots in the meantime. He was looking for the next fence the whole way, and I don't know who enjoyed it more, me or him! - Jack Kennedy, rider.

quotes.race: Boylesports Becher Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a massive run from Coko Beach. He was giving away a lot of weight to all the other runners. He doesn't mind that ground, it was just tough work with all that weight on him. He jumped for fun. He's a dream ride, he travels and he jumps - Danny Gilligan, jockey.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Troytown Handicap Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Jack Kennedy was half-thinking of riding Coko Beach, but I didn't really give him the choice because I wanted to claim off him. He's a great horse. He's a real character at home. I was happy with him coming into the race after his run in the Munster National. My eye was drawn to Watch House Cross, who I thought was travelling best, and then I thought Gavin's horse was going to do us from the last, but I'm delighted he got there. We might go back for another crack at the Thyestes in January - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Grand National Trial Handicap Chase (Grade B)
quotes.quote: Coko Beach jumped well, he didn't really do a stroke but he got a good jump at the last and we're delighted with him. There's nothing for him at Cheltenham so he might head straight for Aintree - Gordon Elliot, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Watch Racing Online For Free Ten Up Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Jack (Kennedy) said Coko Beach is better in a big field, with horses around him, where something can keep him travelling. I'd imagine we'll keep him at home and he might go for the Irish National. I was standing out on the track and I wasn't sure whether he would have won or not. Jack said he thought he would have. He said he needed the jump to win it and he got it - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Goffs Thyestes Handicap Chase (Grade A)
quotes.quote: Coko Beach jumped and travelled unbelievably well and I couldn't believe how I was going three out. The blinkers made a massive difference to him too - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Where The Nation Plays Hurdle
quotes.quote: Coko Beach will come on a good bit for this. They went very quick in front and just set it up for him. He looks a nice horse for the season - Gordon Elliott, trainer

stable_tour.quote: It was a shame what happened in the Velka Pardubicka as he looked to be cantering when he got rid of Keith [Donoghue]. It's hard to believe he's only nine as he seems to have been around for a lifetime. He's been some servant. 28-10-24

runners.name: Stay Away Fay
runners.comment: Career has taken a spectacular wrong turn but there was a slight hint of better last time
runners.spotlight: Won Grade 1 novice hurdle at the 2023 Cheltenham Festival (3m, soft) and made a promising start to chasing career last season, when he continued to look all about stamina; his career has taken a spectacular wrong turn since but there was a slight hint last time of getting back on track.

quotes.race: Betfair Esher Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stay Away Fay digs deep and stays and gallops. He is a proper horse. I knew he would stay and gallop all the way to the line. It is a hard in front as he doesn't do a whole heap in front. In those better races when you have loads of company and they go a true gallop, it helps him. No one was going to takes us on so we were left in front and we had to do the donkey work and you are a sitting duck, but one thing he does is gallop all the way to the line and he stays on strong. He is a good horse.   I'm definitely not going for the National Hunt Chase and if he runs anywhere it will be the Brown Advisory at the festival. We might look at something like the Reynoldstown at Ascot, but there are no real plans. He will not go to Kempton (for the Kauto Star) that is for sure as he will have a little break now - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway 'Future Stars' Silver Bowl Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stay Away Fay stays, he jumps and he gallops. He is classy and that is what you want. I'm thrilled with that. I was a bit worried all week as I thought he looked big and round and that he would improve for a run. You almost expect too much from these horses and you have got to have them ready to do that, but also have them ready to improve. There is lots to come from him - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Winners Wear Cavani Sefton Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was only Stay Away Fay's fourth run over hurdles so he has got a bit more experience today and he will have a lovely holiday now and then go chasing. He will be an awesome chaser. We had thought about staying over hurdles with him but he probably lacks a little bit of class for that. I'm not saying that we won't start him over hurdles next season at somewhere like Wetherby but that is for us to discuss - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Spa Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stay Away Fay is a very smart young horse. He's going to improve for a summer. I knew he'd win turning in because he's a very strong stayer. He wasn't going to stop - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Get Closer To The Action Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've been patient as Stay Away Fay has been big and weak. He hadn't shown a lot at home, but his point-to-point form was fine and he's a nice horse. He'll improve a bit and he stays really strongly. I think Hermes Allen will go for the Challow, but Harry Skelton [who rode the second] said that was the best novice hurdle he's ridden in all season. We'll find a nice race for him and we're only just learning about him - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I'm glad we got him back at the Chris Giles dispersal sale. He looked like developing into a leading novice chaser last season, but he scoped dirty after disappointing at the festival and by the time we tried him over a trip in the Scottish National he was clearly struggling with his breathing. So he's had a summer breathing operation that has left him a bit behind the others in terms of fitness. I was hoping we might have him ready for the Coral Gold Cup, but we've have a few little issues with him and Newbury will come too soon, so I doubt we'll see him this side of Christmas. I'm in no rush. The handicapper dropped him 6lb at the end of last season - I'm still not convinced he's on a good mark - and as the new owners are keen to go for the Grand National, we'll work backwards from Aintree. We might start back over hurdles. 04-11-24

runners.name: Meetingofthewaters
runners.comment: Disputed the lead over the final fence in this race 2024, only to be beaten 16l in seventh
runners.spotlight: Big improver sent chasing by his new yard last season and he then disputed the lead over the final fence in this race, only to end up 16l behind in seventh; needs to see it out a lot better and, after he faded well out of contention on all three starts this term, he nevertheless returns to Aintree with a 1lb higher mark than last year.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Chase (Extended Handicap Chase) (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I travelled into the race nicely and going down to the last I wasn't sure how much Meetingofthewaters had left and in fairness I was probably all out on him at the finish but in a staying chase like that you just keep going as hard as you can. I don't know if he as much value for the distance so hopefully they won't be too hard on him. You'd like to think he could make up into a National horse in time, he's not the biggest but the National has changed in recent years and it looks like he'd fit the profile now - Danny Mullins, jockey, talking to Racing TV

stable_tour.quote: Crossing the Melling Road he was going as well as anything in the Grand National. I'd imagine he might go down the Grand National route again, but maybe he might be more of a Topham horse over shorter. He loves jumping and loves Aintree, but you'd have to wonder whether he fully got home in the National. Maybe different tactics might make a difference, we'll see. 25-11-24

runners.name: Monbeg Genius
runners.comment: 13l fourth in the Welsh National; dictated pace for a Uttoxeter win (3m, soft) in February
runners.spotlight: Familiar contender in major handicaps who was better than ever when dictating the pace for a Uttoxeter win (3m, soft) in February with second-time cheekpieces; however, he's back up 5lb as a result and while his 13l fourth in the Welsh National (near 3m7f, soft) was respectable, today's task may also prove a bit too demanding.

quotes.race: Lisa Mitten Turns 60 Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Nick Scholfield gave Monbeg Genius a lovely ride and it's great to see him get the job done. The National weights are out Tuesday, so we'll see what happens there, but hopefully he'll get a run. He's good with cut in the ground but ran a nice race at Newbury last season. We've been waiting for this day with him as the form at Cheltenham worked out well. It's great to see him get his head in front - AJ O'Neill, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They were going so fast over the first couple Monbeg Genius didn't get into a rhythm until halfway down the back. He'll be better with a bit slower ground but he ran a blinder. He's in the Welsh National and will hopefully be in the Grand National too. He'll have a go at all of those and let's hope we have a bit of luck in one of them - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

quotes.race: Ultima Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Monbeg Genius ran a cracker and I could not be more pleased with him, except of course, if he had won. He could now go for the Scottish National next month at Ayr but that will be ground dependent as he has to have soft ground. If it was on the quick side at Ayr he would not run and we would put him away for this season with a tilt at the Aintree Grand National next spring at the forefront of our minds - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran very well to be third on ground that was a little bit too quick for him in the Coral Gold Cup. He then got a foot abscess and wasn't able to make the Welsh National or the Classic Chase, which would have been his proper target. The track was a bit sharp at Kelso and then he struck into himself in the Ultima at Cheltenham. He's in good form again now and has been schooling really well. He'll start either at Bangor next Wednesday over three miles or at Cheltenham on Sunday week over three miles three. The Welsh National and Classic Chase will be his targets again and hopefully we can get him up a bit in the weights to have a crack at the Grand National. I don't think he's lost any of his ability; things just haven't gone for him. 06-11-24

runners.name: Vanillier
runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Haras Des Marais
runners.comment: Finished strongly when 2nd in this in 2023 and 3rd in Cheltenham cross-country last month
runners.spotlight: Strong-finishing second off this mark in the 2023 Grand National (good to soft) but faded badly from turning for home on his second crack at it; blinkers have brought him back to his best in banks/cross-country races on his last two outings; latest was at Cheltenham last month when nearly taking the wrong course early on did not help, he was outpaced when the race warmed up and then finished strongly; that reminder of the 2023 National puts him back into each-way calculations.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes P.P. Hogan Memorial Cross Country Chase
quotes.quote: Vanillier has really sharpened up of late. The blinkers helped. He really enjoyed that. He's entered in the National and he has the option of the Cross Country at Cheltenham - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Randox Grand National Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was really nice. I probably found myself too far back, but Vanillier is a really strong stayer and he stayed on all the way to the line - Sean Flanagan, jockey.

quotes.race: Liam & Valerie Brennan Florida Pearl Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: On the whole Vanillier jumped very well. I would have liked it if something had joined him earlier in the race just to force a bit more pace into it, but he's just a dour stayer. I walked the track beforehand and it's nice, safe ground. Hopefully he'll be okay in the morning. He's a big, lazy type of horse who wants to get his toe in. There's the two staying novice chases at Leopardstown and Limerick this Christmas. He'll get an entry for both and, ground depending, a decision will be made closer to the time. He's a big horse and we want to mind him in terms of the ground - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered as The Spa Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I watched the race with Jonathan (Moore, injured regular rider) and he said the last day he couldn't even get him to line up at Leopardstown and here he had his ears pricked and he bounced out the gate. It's tough for Johnny, but the good thing is he'll be back on these horses and they're young horses so hopefully they have a bright future. Vanillier is a proper staying chaser in the making, to what level he can go I'm not sure but he's a lovely big horse - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's a three mile chaser for next season. I didn't think he'd be able to win a maiden hurdle up until recently but he's improved a lot. He's entitled to step up in grade after that - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He won the Albert Bartlett at the Cheltenham Festival for us in 2021 and has been aimed at the Grand National for the last two seasons, finishing second in 2023 and 14th last season. I wouldn't rule out going back to the Grand National again but in the meantime he has an entry in the cross-country race at Cheltenham on Friday and we're going to give that a shot. Hopefully that will spark him up. 12-11-24
He has an entry in the cross-country at Cheltenham on Friday and we're going to give that a shot. Hopefully that will spark him up. I wouldn't rule out going back to the Grand National. 13-11-24

runners.name: Horantzau Dairy

prev_owners.owner: Scea De La Vallee De L'Orne

runners.comment: 2nd in Kerry and Munster Nationals but they are over just 3m; left W Mullins for 50,000gns
runners.spotlight: Second in the Kerry and Munster Nationals but they are over just 3m; beaten 20l in the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury (3m2f; the furthest he's been) next time and similar in two more big handicaps since, making his recent form figures 999; first run since leaving Willie Mullins for 50,000gns one month ago.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: If you're not in you can't win. I'm delighted with Horantzau D'Airy and he'll continue chasing until the summer - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Punchestown's Fittest Club Sunday June 11th Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Horantzau D'airy had the experience and he handled the nicer ground. He's a fine, big horse and he will jump a fence - Paul Townend, rider.

runners.name: Hyland
runners.comment: Stayed 3m well when 2nd at Kempton in a Grade 1 novice and a major handicap; inexperienced
runners.spotlight: Best away from soft ground; saw the 3m out well on last two starts when second at Kempton in a Grade 1 novice and a major handicap; reverting to a left-handed track here may help his jumping; however, he switched from hurdling only last June and, notwithstanding his three small-field wins, six runs over fences is a slight record for a would-be Grand National winner.

quotes.race: Mucking Brilliant Paddy Power Novices' Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The one thing Hyland has always done is jump. From when we first put him over the nursery hurdles, he was unbelievable. That seemed his strength and I'm not sure how good we thought he was. Even at this time last year, I'd have been surprised to see him in a race like this but his jumping is just exceptional and he loves this ground ? he has to have it. He stays, he gallops and he jumps and he was very brave doing that out on his own today. He had his ears pricked all the way and loved it - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Enjoy A Free Digital Racecard At raceday-ready.com Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Hyland was going to really enjoy his chasing. He's a three-miler really, so we were probably going quicker than he wanted, but he has the scope to do it. You couldn't have faulted him - Nico De Boinville, rider, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Pertemps Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were going to jump fences, but I suspect we will put that on hold. Hyland was very good at Warwick, but this is a different kettle of fish and I thought he wanted top of the ground. He stays and jump, and once you have qualified for the Pertemps you might as well go for it - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been remarkably good all along and keeps growing up the whole time, and he's been improving, which is what we like. He stays and must have good ground, but he's earned his ticket to a race like this. It's a big step up again, but it's good ground so we've got to have a go. He's earned the right to be there. 23-12-24

runners.name: Celebre Dallen
runners.comment: Close fourth in Topham here (2m5f, soft) last April; has twice won well over about 3m/3m1f
runners.spotlight: Completed on all three attempts over these fences, easily best of those efforts when close fourth in last season's Topham (2m5f, soft); has twice won well over about 3m/3m1f, including in November on sole start this term, but today's trip is a leap in the dark and this 13yo has easily his highest mark.

quotes.race: Jewson Vieux Lion Rouge Veterans' Handicap Chase (Leg 8 Of The Veterans' Chase Series)
quotes.quote: It was easier than I thought it was going to be. Celebre D'Allen gave me a beautiful ride round. It was his first run of the season since running in the Topham, so the aim was to just get him jumping and he has seen it out beautifully - Elizabeth Gale, jockey.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Warwick Castle Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Celebre D'Allen did it well and stayed on strongly in the straight. He's progressing nicely and hopefully will run in the Plate at the festival. We thought if he didn't run today he probably wasn't going to get in, but he will now - Philip Hobbs, trainer.

quotes.race: Windham Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Celebre D'Allen handles the ground and clearly likes Haydock. Turning into the home straight, one click and he picked up - Tom O'Brien, jockey.

quotes.race: Chillblast Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: His last run in France was on quicker ground but a lot of his form before that came on heavy. Celebre D'Allen has got ability - Tom O'Brien, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He looked really good when winning the veterans' race at Aintree last month, that was a great run. He's entered in the Becher Chase and I think we'll aim him at that next. He ran very well in the Topham over the National fences in the spring when the ground was a little fast. I thought he jumped the fences really well and was running on strongly at the end over a trip too short. He needs very soft ground to be at his best and the way things are with the weather suggests everything should be spot on for the Becher. He's rated 140 so I don't know if he'd get in a National but if he was to win the Becher then he'd possibly be rated another 10lb higher and might get in. We'll see. Otherwise the Veterans' Final at Sandown could be an option. 23-11-23

He's done well at Aintree, over the National fences, finishing fourth in the Topham in April and was also fourth in last year's Becher Chase. He wants very soft ground and is entered in the Grand Sefton on November 9. After that all things are possible, but we don't have anything set in stone at the moment. 30-10-24

runners.name: Three Card Brag
runners.comment: Only six chases; placed behind talented rivals and shapes as if he has strength in stamina
runners.spotlight: Can throw in a blunder and, although chase career began in 2023, he's had only six races in this sphere, winning a beginners chase at Navan (3m, soft) this January; however, he's played second or third fiddle to some very talented rivals and left the impression that he has strength in stamina.

quotes.race: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Three Card Brag ran well in his own right. He needed that run to qualify for the Grand National - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Three Card Brag has had a few niggly problems, and just a few things didn't work out for him. I imagine we will probably head straight for the English National with him now - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Easter Festival 8-10 April Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Three Card Brag is a nice horse and stays at it well. It wasn't ideal having to make it because he is lazy but the further they went the better he was - Ian Amond, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Three Card Brag looked good. He jumped well apart from one but what impressed me most was the way he went on to the line. I think there is plenty of improvement in him - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's still a maiden over fences, would you believe, so we'll start him in a beginners' chase and hopefully he should be able to make use of the experience he gained over fences last season. He could be one for a big staying handicap chase later in the season and could be a National horse at some stage. He stays very well. 28-10-24

runners.name: Twig
runners.comment: 2nd at the Cheltenham Festival (3m1f, heavy) last March under his usual rider Beau Morgan
runners.spotlight: Always-prominent runner-up at the Cheltenham Festival (3m1f, heavy; 3lb higher today) last March under his usual rider Beau Morgan; seems to have been campaigned with the National in mind this term (three hurdle races, then brief headway in a chase) and while obvious positives in recent races are hard to find, at his best he looks sure to stay beyond 3m2f.

quotes.race: Ultima Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This morning we were debating even running Twig, he wants better ground. But we thought we could go here and prep him for Aintree and he's run like that. I'm absolutely delighted - Beau Morgan, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: bet365 Summer Cup Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: When I originally trained Twig for his previous owners, who bred him, he just wasn't physically ready. I didn't think he was going to be a racehorse and that's why I sent him off into the point-to-point field, and he's just improved and improved - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The BetVictor App "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Twig is very consistent at a decent level and is possibly a better chaser than he is a hurdler, but we're trying to give Beau some good experience on a nice horse. The horse is going the right way and we might chuck him in something better towards the end of the season; he's a flat track, better-ground type - Ben Pauling, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It was a brilliant return over hurdles at Wetherby and lovely to see him jump so efficiently. He's going for the Grand National this season and will qualify over fences once the weights are out because he's got the perfect handicap mark. We'll look at either the staying handicap hurdle at Haydock on Saturday or the Long Distance Hurdle at Newbury next. This weather is helping him as he's a proper good-ground horse, which makes his second in last season's Ultima on heavy ground all the more extraordinary. He's certainly not done with and probably still going the right way. 21-11-24

He joined us earlier this autumn and his three runs have been very encouraging. He finished second to Found On at Worcester first time out for us. We then went to Warwick this month where he got his head in front in a 3m novice handicap chase. He reverted to hurdles at Cheltenham on Friday and ran well to finish second to Shearer in a novice (well clear of the third). He would not want the ground too soft and I would anticipate a small break over the Christmas/New Year period. He will be an interesting runner when he returns in early spring. 26-10-22

runners.name: Duffle Coat
runners.comment: Keeping on in a 6l fourth when brought down two out in the 3m6f NH Chase at Cheltenham
runners.spotlight: Best away from soft ground; runner-up with big late gains in the 2m6f Galway Plate last July; sole chase win (13 attempts) was the Mayo National at Ballinrobe last May which is not much beyond 2m7f, but he was running a big race, keeping on in a 6l fourth, when brought down two out in the 3m6f NH Chase at Cheltenham last month; could belie huge odds.

quotes.race: McHale Mayo National Handicap Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Duffle Coat has finished second a lot lately, so it's great for him to win a big pot. I've been reeled in on him before when I've sent him for home, so I waited as long as I could and the better ground helped him to see it out well this time - Sam Ewing, jockey.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Registered As The Prestbury Juvenile Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was flat to the boards the whole way. To be fair Duffle Coat is really tenacious and a little terrier. From the top of the hill I gave him a little squeeze and he picked up underneath me. I wasn't overly concerned as I thought we had gone quick on genuine soft ground. His stamina is his forte - Robbie Power, jockey.

quotes.race: gowranpark.ie 3YO Hurdle
quotes.quote: Jack said it turned into a bit of a sprint and it didn't suit him. A faster gallop would have suited him. He won well at the line and he keeps winning so that's all that matters. There's a winners' of two at Down Royal and Punchestown and there's a Listed race at Wetherby as well - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: Sanctuary Synthetics 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Duffle Coat had never been on grass and it's the first time he has worked properly. He was good. He has to be smart because he had nothing done. Keith said he'll improve stones - Gordon Elliott, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He was just touched off in the Galway Plate and won the Mayo National before that. He revels in those big-field handicap chasers. 28-10-24

3:05.going_detailed: National Course - GOOD TO SOFT; Mildmay Course - GOOD (GoingStick: Mildmay Chase 5.5, Mildmay Hurdle 5.3, Grand National course 5.3) (Watering)

runners.name: Altobelli

prev_owners.owner: Charles C Walker And Jonny Craib

runners.comment: Two from two since wearing cheekpieces but has something to prove upped in trip/class
runners.spotlight: Successful in a couple of useful handicaps at Ascot (2m3f, good) since wearing cheekpieces; open to further progress in the headgear but appears to have a stiff task on these terms and the trip is an unknown.

quotes.race: Betfair Exchange Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a shame they don't have a festival here in four weeks. Altobelli is on an upward curve and hopefully he can keep climbing now. I imagine we'll enter him in the Coral Cup and another step up in trip would be a plus if anything - Harry Fry, trainer.

quotes.race: Brown Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're delighted to see Altobelli progress from his first start over hurdles, we've done a lot of work with his schooling and there's definitely improvement in that department. Ordinarily we would've liked to have kept him for Exeter later in the week but they're good, good to firm and it's the challenges we're facing with the conditions as he's a big horse who needs some cut in the ground - Harry Fry, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We were delighted with his bumper win at Exeter last season and he's schooled so well that we'll go straight over hurdles in the next few weeks. We've been waiting for softer ground and will start off over two miles. He's one of our leading novice hurdle prospects. 11-11-22

He improved from his first run over hurdles to win by a wide margin at Carlisle but on reflection I think that left its mark as he ran no race when we pitched him in the Grade 1 at Aintree. We can forget that run and we've got a second-season hurdler who's still unexposed. I'd like to give him experience in a handicap, possibly at Ascot's first fixture in November, with a view of aiming him for the £150,000 Betfair Exchange Trophy there just before Christmas. I'd like to think he'll progress. 04-10-23

runners.name: Buddy One
runners.owner: E Lynch & T C Quinn & John J Mcgrath
runners.comment: Second in this contest 12 months ago but has limitations, being 0-7 at Grade 1 level
runners.spotlight: Ran creditably in this contest 12 months ago (finished second) and the latest edition of the Stayers' Hurdle (also good to soft; finished fifth); however, appears set for another supporting role, with Grade 1 record now 0-7.

quotes.race: Guinness Chase
