quotes.quote: Buddy One jumped great, he was clever and shortened when he had to. Where we go from here, I don't know, but obviously our main aim is to try to get back to Cheltenham. He'll definitely face stiffer opposition through the winter, but that was a lovely experience for him - Paul John Gilligan, trainer.

quotes.race: JRL Group Liverpool Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It would have been nice to win it but we're happy. Buddy One is a fantastic horse. Is he going to win a Grade 1 over hurdles? He hasn't yet but he's on the premises the whole time. He's entered at Punchestown but I'd imagine that's it. He won at Cheltenham in November and he has been boxing in the main arena since and has been boxing with credit - Paul Gilligan, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Stayers' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was an absolutely super run. If the ground was just a touch better it would have suited Buddy One better, but I'm not complaining. I won't go to Punchestown, but I think he might go to Aintree as he ran very well there last year. I will talk to his owners to see what we do - Paul Gilligan, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Games Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I didn't think Buddy One would be beaten today, his Galway run last time was really good. He was winning this race today off top-weight, he has gone out of handicaps now. Depending how he comes out of today he'll go for the Hatton's Grace - you meet Willie [Mullins] and Gordon [Elliott] wherever you go, but this is so special - Paul Gilligan, trainer.

quotes.race: W.B. Gavin & Co. Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Buddy One deserved to win that. He's been consistent always, he has carried a big weight and won as he liked. We would hope to kick on now to Cheltenham in November. He is going the right way - Paul Gilligan, trainer

runners.name: Dashel Drasher
runners.owner: Mrs B Tully And R Lock
runners.comment: Not the force of old; soundly beaten in this race for the last two years; opposed
runners.spotlight: Smart hurdler/chaser in his prime; soundly beaten in this race for the last two years, however, and three defeats over fences this season confirm that he's not the force of old; this veteran can be opposed.

quotes.race: Howden Long Walk Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dashel Drasher ran above our expectations as he didn't get his ground. We were beaten six lengths and Paisley Park carried 6lb at Newbury so it's roughly the same. I was thrilled with him, he ran a blinder. We've got a few options but if the ground was looking right for the Cleeve and he was in good form we'd probably look at that - Jeremy Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Long Distance Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a very special moment for us. We were beginning to wonder if Dashel Drasher had the same sparkle as he'd been beaten so many times, albeit narrowly, last season. To come here and battle that out with dear old Paisley Park, who is a brilliant horse, was fitting. Whichever horse had won, it would have been a great story. He's still full of beans at home, but had to do it on the racecourse - Jeremy Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: Dahlbury Stallions At Chapel Stud Cleeve Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dashel Drasher has run a brilliant race and we were just outsprinted up the hill. I didn't think they went terribly quick early on and it didn't seem to play to Paisley Park's strengths. We bumped into one that is obviously a lot better than we gave credit for before the race. We beat the horse we thought we had to beat in Paisley Park but unfortunately we just bumped into another one. I think we will come here for the Stayers' Hurdle and have a lovely day out. If we can tweak a few things at home maybe we can get a little bit of improvement. I wouldn't rule out going back over fences but the Ascot Chase is looking so competitive now let's get him fresh and come back here. Let's hope it tips it down with rain - Jeremy Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: careers@dornangroup.com Relkeel Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dashel Drasher always runs his race and he's been beaten by a really classy mare with an allowance who has won at the Festival. I'm very happy with him and we have plenty of options, be it two and a half to three miles and fences or hurdles. The Stayers' Hurdle is definitely one of those options - Rex Dingle, jockey.

quotes.race: Boylesports Best Odds Guaranteed Day Before Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It looked slow-motion stuff, but it's very difficult when you've got to front-run and when the favourite was out, it became more tactical. In fairness to Dashel Drasher, he battled back and was very brave. He doesn't always win on his first run so that was good. The plan was always to go to the Chanelle Pharma 1965 Chase at Ascot but that's only in a fortnight's time so we'll see how he comes out of the race. Ultimately, we'll look to go back there in February (for the Ascot Chase) - Jeremy Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: Bank A Winner With MansionBet Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's difficult to find races for Dashel Drasher. We thought we'd freshen him up over hurdles and he likes Newbury and the ground came for him - it's perfect ground for him. We were very close to running him in the King George. If we'd had a crystal ball and could see that rain coming we'd probably have run, and - seeing how the race turned out - he might have run all right. We could look at the Silviniaco Conti Chase at Kempton next and then the Ascot Chase again - Patrick Tully, owners' representative.

quotes.race: Betfair Ascot Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dashel Drasher is unbeaten here but it didn't look likely going to the last. I don't know why he likes Ascot because he seems to hang left but it just seems to suit his racing style. If you saw him at home you wouldn't believe he was this class. It's just lovely when horses do okay at home but aren't blowing your socks off, and when they come to the races they bring out a bit more - Jeremy Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: Injured Jockeys Fund Graduation Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That's the best I've seen Dashel Drasher jump. He came on for the race the other day and while we were wrong at the ratings, I think he jumped the best of the three of them and he's difficult to peg back. I wanted to stick to small-runner fields to get experience and it paid off, although I wasn't expecting it to. We'll see what the handicapper does. I haven't got any firm targets - Jeremy Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: Citipost Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Dashel Drasher has not looked back since winning at Chepstow in January as I think he likes to stride on and is a relentless galloper. He will now be put away for the summer and then go novice chasing in the autumn - Jeremy Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: Be Wiser Insurance Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: I'd have loved to have gone to Aintree with Dashel Drasher, two-miles-four, but on his last performance, as good as it was, his jumping was a bit sketchy. We thought we'd go lower key and his jumping was loads better. I think Aintree will be too quick now and he'd want easier ground, so that might be his last race this season. The timing of Punchestown would be perfect, but I'd have to look what races they've got and the ground would have to be right. He'd go chasing in the autumn and with another year on his back he'd be an exciting prospect. When we held him up earlier in the season, we broke his stride and he probably hasn't got a turn of foot. He doesn't have to lead, but if he can get into a rhythm that does seem to play to his strengths. He'd see 3m out eventually but there's no rush and he clearly has the speed for 2m4f at the moment - Jeremy Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: Thames Materials Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: They've been running well and Dashel Drasher has a good engine in him and a hell of a good stride. Since we've let him bowl along the results have been much better. I thought we were second but he's just very babyish out in front. It's nice to get a winner here - Jeremy Scott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been consistent all season but to win he's going to need everything to go in his favour. He copes with testing conditions better than most and would definitely like it on the wetter side to be seen at his best. He was second last season when things fell right for him and he's certainly not regressed on what we've seen this season. 20-02-24

runners.name: Gwennie May Boy
runners.comment: Record includes emphatic wins on this card last year and a Grade 2 on latest start
runners.spotlight: Record of 4-7 for current stable includes emphatic wins in the 3m handicap hurdle on this card last year and the Rendlesham (Grade 2) at Haydock on latest outing, both on good to soft ground; could well have further progress in him; respected back at Aintree.

quotes.race: WKD Rendlesham Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gwennie May Boy won at 80-1 on his debut at Bangor and has been fantastic ever since.There was talk of sticking to last year's plan of Uttoxeter and then Aintree, but we might have to start thinking about Cheltenham - Nick Clarke, owner's son.

quotes.race: William Hill Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I genuinely thought West Balboa would win and I'm astounded by the improvement in this horse. Gwennie May Boy is only six years old and I've not had him all that long, and it's remarkable how much he has improved - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Bangor-On-Dee Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Gwennie May Boy travelled nicely and did it well in the end. He hasn't got much respect for his hurdles but he gets from A to B - Fergus Gillard, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He won three races last season, including two big ones at Uttoxeter and Aintree. A fast-run race is what he wants, and he just hasn't had that this season. The faster they go the better, and he'll probably run in the Rendlesham before the festival. 10-2-25

runners.name: Hiddenvalley Lake
runners.comment: Creditable third in this contest 12 months ago; flopped badly in lower grade last time
runners.spotlight: Ran well in this contest 12 months ago (good to soft; finished third) and the Long Walk at Ascot in December (close second); each-way shout on those efforts but needs to rebound, having flopped badly at Gowran Park when back down in grade last time.

quotes.race: William Hill Boyne Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Hiddenvalley Lake loves heavy ground and Darragh  (O'Keefe, jockey) said the further he went the better he jumped. When they stepped on the pace he jumped better up the straight. We knew he'd stay well over that trip and that ground probably suited him. It's great to get that and we'll see where we go next. He stays three miles and we'll have a look at all the big festivals coming up and see what the options are. He's a fresh horse, he's only had two runs and that's his first completed run this season - Robbie Power, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: Singletons Supervalu Stayers Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I thought Hiddenvalley Lake was struggling turning in and then he picked up really well - I'd say he quickened after the second-last. He could run at Clonmel in February, in the race which Monalee won for us, and Minella Indo finished second to Allaho - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Hiddenvalley Lake is a lovely horse and had been working well. He was green and he stays well; he is a horse we will keep finding out about - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran very well at Ascot in the Long Walk when just chinned by Crambo. I think he came back too soon at Gowran in the Galmoy and our form was a bit out, so it may be a combination of both. He was in great form beforehand, so it was obviously disappointing. He's been doing well since though and is in good form. 7-2-25

He's a lovely young horse who made a flying start to his hurdling career with wins at Naas and Cork before Christmas. His latest start in the Grade 3 Mercedes-Benz Novice Hurdle was another fine effort when he was collared late on by stablemate Monty's Star on ground that was softer than ideal for him. I was very happy with that effort and the plan is to go for the Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle. 01-03-23

runners.name: Home By The Lee
runners.comment: Successful in two Graded races this term; hampered and unseated rider in Stayers' Hurdle
runners.spotlight: Failed to show his form in this race two years ago; otherwise a smart stayer and he beat Bob Olinger in Graded races in November/December (both on yielding), prior to having no luck (hampered by faller and unseated rider mid-race) in the Stayers' Hurdle; capable of being involved.

quotes.race: Savills Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I'd say that was close to a career-best from him. He's been around for a number of years now and will go back to Cheltenham for the Stayers' with an each-way chance - Joseph O'Brien, trainer of Home By The Lee

quotes.race: Railway Bar Lismullen Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Home By The Lee was a bit better off at the weights this year. He went through the race well and jumped well, Danny was impressed with him. He'll go to Leopardstown now and then to Cheltenham, his programme really plots itself - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Stayers' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: JJ [Slevin] gave Home By The Lee a lovely ride and he galloped on well to the line. I was very proud of his performance. We won't make any plans yet as to what we will do next, but I'm delighted with the performance - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Jack de Bromhead Christmas Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I'd say Home By The Lee will probably go straight to Cheltenham now for the Stayers. He likes getting into a nice rhythm and wasn't beaten a million miles in it last year. He looks a better horse this year - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Railway Bar Lismullen Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Home By The Lee was a bit wild when he was younger, he went chasing and he didn't take to it. But he's a very decent horse on his day. Staying will be his job. He is lazy but this track suited him and I told JJ if he was on their tails turning in he wouldn't be far away - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer

quotes.race: Paddy Power "From The Horse's Mouth" Podcast Novice Handicap Chase (Grade B)
quotes.quote: Home By The Lee is a horse that can be very excitable, but JJ managed to get him switched off today and did a lovely job. He jumps and stays and who knows what he'll be in time - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power From The Horses Mouth Podcast EBF Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: He's a hardy horse. It was a big ask having had just one run over fences to step in to Grade 3 company He jumped fairly well but got under one or two. He stays very well and is a lovely horse going forward - JJ Slevin, rider of Home By The Lee

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: It was a good, tough performance and he's done quite well for his first day over fences. He's a young, hardy horse. I felt he'd went to sleep on me jumping the third last and thought we were in trouble, but once I got stuck into him he took off. He galloped out to the line well. He could be a nice stayer going forward - JJ Slevin, rider of Home By The Lee

quotes.race: Happy New Year From All At Fairyhouse Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's done nothing wrong all the way along and ran a lovely race last time at Naas, which he's come forward from. JJ [Slevin] said he jumped the third last very well and got to the front sooner than he wanted and was waiting a little bit then. At the back of the last he caught a hold of him and he galloped out to the line well. A confined novice could be an option for him, or some kind of Graded race, but we'll take baby steps with him. He's a staying horse for the future and has only just turned five - Joseph O'Brien, trainer of Home By The Lee

stable_tour.quote: He had a great season and he really came into his own as a stayer. We were very pleased with his reappearance in the Lismullen under a penalty. He will go to the Christmas Hurdle at Leopardstown, which looks the obvious next step for him. He ran a great race in the Stayers' Hurdle at Cheltenham last season and if Leopardstown goes well then hopefully we can get him back there. 27-11-23

He knocked on the door a couple of times last season but this term he has really got his act together winning back-to-back races at Navan and Leopardstown. I had him in grand order for the Stayers' Hurdle last month, but he made a very bad mistake on the first circuit which put paid to his chances, and the fact he was still less than four lengths behind the winner is a testament to his battling qualities. He goes for the 3m hurdle on Saturday at Aintree and I'm very happy with how he is right now. 12-04-23

runners.name: Kitzbuhel

prev_owners.owner: Mme M Juhen-Cypres, D S De Beauregard & Mme T De Beauregard

runners.comment: Two from two since joining Willie Mullins; interesting, assuming he stays the new trip
runners.spotlight: Seems versatile as regards ground; ex-French 5yo who is 2-2 since joining Willie Mullins, both wins over 2m, latest in Grade 3 event at Gowran Park; promising sort who is a very interesting contender, assuming he stays this markedly longer distance.

quotes.race: Red Mills Trial Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I love the way Kitzbuhel jumped, he'd have no trouble going over fences. I loved the way he stayed on when it looked like the race was over when he was taken on by Sir Gerhard and he had to find again to take on the challenge of Break My Soul. It's the sign of a real good horse that he was able to pick up a second time. I'm probably looking at Liverpool more so than Cheltenham. With the timing of the race and the two and a half miles for the Liverpool Hurdle, Aintree would be a big possibility. I think he'd love to step up in trip and I'd have no problem going three miles - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Members Club 2025 Hurdle
quotes.quote: He was very professional. I think Kitzbuhel will stay further, he surprised me the way he quickened into the straight - Paul Townend, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Monmiral
runners.breeder: S A R L Carion Emm
runners.owner: Sir A Ferguson G Mason J Hales & L Hales
runners.comment: Creditable second in Grade 2 contests the last twice but this is harder
runners.spotlight: Creditable fifth to Gwennie May Boy on this card last year, having won the Pertemps Final (3m, soft) the time before; creditable second in Grade 2 contests the last twice but this is harder; well beaten in this race in 2023.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Final Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Monmiral has loads of ability. We have been trying to make a chaser out of a hurdler, but he didn't like it. I thought I would qualify him at Chepstow two weeks ago, and he actually needed the run that day as he hadn't really finished a race for a long time. Freddie [Gingell] rode him the other day and said that he thought he might have won at two out but he blew up. He said to try him in blinkers and I listened to what he said. Whether they have made a difference I don't know, but he has obviously come back to himself a little bit. I said to Harry, 'Give him plenty of daylight as he doesn't need to be boxed in', and he gave him a beautiful ride. The horse has always wanted a trip. He has had small problems which hasn't helped us, but he has been a real head-scratcher. It is great for his owners and the whole of my team to get a winner here - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Highflyer Bloodstock Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're thrilled with that, Monmiral had a nice clear round and jumped well. He'll improve for that and we'll probably head off to Sandown next for the Henry VIII Novices' Chase. It's a different day and a different track, so I'd say he'll come on a lot for that on his next run. He came in a bit later and I was a bit concerned with how he might jump today but Harry (Cobden) was thrilled with his jumping - he said he'd come on tonnes for the run so I'm thrilled. The winner was really good and is favourite for the Arkle on the back of it, but we've a long way to go between now and then. He's a very smart horse without a shadow of a doubt and will be very hard to beat but we were always going to come here and then go to Sandown and I'd suspect we still will. Hopefully the ground will be a bit more testing there, but I was very pleased - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Doom Bar Anniversary 4-Y-O Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Monmiral is a proper Grade 1 horse and the best juvenile I've sat on. I'd rather see him jump a fence (next season). He travels well and jumps great. He's probably beaten the best English juvenile; he's top class - Harry Cobden, rider. He's just kept on improving and getting stronger as the season has gone on and today I thought was the best he's looked. It's just hard for the novice chasers at five (years old) these days. They don't get much weight allowance in the spring and taking on the older horses in the spring is quite hard. If he had another year over hurdles it wouldn't do him any harm and then he could go novice chasing five into six. It might be nice to start him in something like the Fighting Fifth on a galloping track and then we'd know where we were going. It's something to think about over the summer - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Summit Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Monmiral is a lovely type and I like him a lot. He probably got there a bit too soon because he was travelling and winging hurdles and he'll be better with a lead for longer. He was just looking around in front [at the second last] and then I got after him and he winged the last - Sean Bowen, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He gave us all a great day when winning the Pertemps last season and has two options next month ? I'll make a decision closer to the time. He's consistent and would have to carry a big weight in the Pertemps or we step him back up to Grade 1 level. I'm not saying he'd win the Stayers' if he lines up in that, but he could run into a place. 9-2-25

runners.name: Sounds Russian
runners.comment: Has shown best form over fences; bottom of this pack on hurdles figures
runners.spotlight: Has shown his best form over fences, notwithstanding a Listed win in this sphere; well behind Gwennie May Boy at Haydock on sole start this season and is bottom of this pack on hurdles figures; enough to prove.

quotes.race: British EBF Gold Castle 'National Hunt' Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Brian [Hughes, jockey] had it planned before he ever sat on Sounds Russian today. He'll be chasing and go for the Charlie Hall, then he's off to the Betfair Chase, and then Cheltenham, but we'll see where we end up - Ruth Jefferson, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Cotswold Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've probably learnt a bit from that. Sounds Russian is still in the Gold Cup and I really wanted to see him do something like that today. He's entitled to have a go in the Gold Cup, obviously Protektorat and Noble Yeats were a long way ahead of us in the betting for that and we were about 125-1, so we won't be that tomorrow morning. I suppose he's a horse who could do what he did today and run well in a Gold Cup but whether he's got the class to win I'm not sure ? I think he'd need a lot of things to fall right. I think he's a solid horse who always runs his race but might just find a Gold Cup horse a bit better than him - Ruth Jefferson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was off a long time, so when he went to Haydock in February we thought he would need the run, but it was the only day he could run with the ground. It brought him on a bit, and Perth did the world of good for him mentally and he got over his fall there - it was great to see him win. He's just had a little setback but the aim is to be out around January. Plans are very fluid at the moment but there's plenty of options for him in the spring. 25-11-24

He made his return to the track in the Rendlesham Hurdle on Saturday. He was sound on Sunday morning, but probably didn't travel or jump as well as I expected which may may have been down to the tacky ground. He'll come on for the run, but we don't have any plans yet in terms of where to go next. He didn't cost a lot so he has done fantastically well considering, finishing second in the Cotswold Chase last season behind Ahoy Senor, and then taking us to the Gold Cup where he was brought down at the 17th when running a great race, suffering a knee injury in the process. He took a while to get to the track - he didn't make his debut until he was six - and hopefully we can manage him now given the injury he suffered. He had 12 chips of bone removed from his knee, and had to have all his cartilage and ligaments tightened up, so he might not run as much any more, but if he can run to the same level that'll do. We'll leave him over hurdles now and see how he does. It's possible we might look at Aintree for either of the three-mile handicaps or the Grade 1 in the spring, but we'll see. 21-02-24

runners.name: Strong Leader
runners.comment: Best to forgive last two efforts; registered a clearcut win in this race 12 months ago
runners.spotlight: Ran as if something was amiss in the Long Walk (subsequently had wind surgery) and latest effort confirms that Cheltenham isn't his ideal track; promising stayer otherwise since upped to 3m and registered a clearcut success in this race 12 months ago (good to soft); shortlisted.

quotes.race: Coral Long Distance Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was Strong Leader's first start of the season and I had him as fit as I could get him. We're obviously mindful of the rest of the season, so I left a bit to work with. He's not a flashy horse, he doesn't do anything over-exuberantly, but overall he jumped well. He improved throughout the whole of last season and I'd like to think he'll do the same this term. He's as good a staying three-mile hurdler as we've got on this side of the water by the looks of things, and hopefully he can keep progressing. We'll head for the Long Walk and then potentially look at the Cleeve Hurdle and see if we go for a Stayers' or wait for Aintree. Sometimes in life you've got to have a go. If we go for a Stayers' he'll have to run in a Cleeve and go very close to winning - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: JRL Group Liverpool Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This is my best day as a trainer. This lad is a home bred and they're just ten minutes down the road from me. I'm adamant Strong Leader doesn't like Cheltenham, he doesn't go up and down hills well enough. I was ballsy enough to leave it alone and save him for this day. He got into a rhythm and jumped and travelled well. He's a very good horse on his day - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Boylesports Best Odds Guaranteed Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: It was a smart performance under a penalty. Jumping hasn't come naturally at all and Strong Leader was a lot more professional (than on hurdling debut) and jumped well on the whole, with probably still plenty to brush up on. He's a horse we've always liked. He definitely wouldn't want very heavy ground - Olly Murphy, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a fantastic season, winning the Liverpool Hurdle, and is unexposed at three miles. I'd imagine he'll start off at Wetherby with the Long Walk Hurdle as his main target for the first half of the season. It remains to be seen whether we'll go for the Stayers' as he's so effective on flat tracks like Aintree, but otherwise his season largely maps itself out. 24-10-24

We were disappointed with his run in the Welsh Champion Hurdle but he'll step up in trip now. He has a big staying pedigree and has never worked like a two-miler - he has shocked me every time he has gone to the races, including when finishing runner-up in a Grade 1 last season. We'll put a line through Ffos Las as he has come out of the race fine and I still have plenty of faith in him. 01-11-23

runners.name: Teahupoo
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras Du Hoguenet Et Al
runners.comment: Far from discredited when bidding for a second Stayers' Hurdle win; again top on ratings
runners.spotlight: Leading stayer whose success in the 2024 Stayers' Hurdle (soft) was the middle leg of a Grade 1 hat-trick; beaten favourite back at Cheltenham (good to soft) last month when bidding to defend his crown but far from discredited in finishing a clear second; again top on ratings.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Stayers' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: No excuse, really. Maybe if the ground was a shade slower it would have taken the sting out of the other lad a little bit, but no excuse. I was probably left [in front] a little bit early, but Teahupoo is a genuine horse who would gallop away in front there. I sort of knew Rachael was going fairly well - well, I knew there was something beside be, I didn't know exactly what it was. Bob Olinger is a horse with loads of ability and he's just put it all together today - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Champion Stayers Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Jack [Kennedy, jockey] said he was very happy with Teahupoo the whole way. Paul [Townend, on Asterion Forlonge] had him in a pocket for the first half of the race and he just said he had to get out of it. He's a great horse, we're very lucky to have him. I'd imagine we'd keep him to hurdles as he looks pretty strong in that division at the moment - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Stayers' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This was always the plan with Teahupoo. He runs well fresh and so we came straight here. I was a bit anxious at the top of the hill when he missed the second-last, and then he probably got there a bit soon as he [Kennedy] had to give him a squeeze, but I had loads of confidence in Jack as he's a world-class jockey and you don't need to tell him what to do - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Hatton's Grace Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: We are going to do things a bit different this year and the plan is to go straight for the Stayers' Hurdle now - Gordon Elliott, trainer of Teahupoo

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Champion Stayers Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Teahupoo had the ground as quick as he wanted it and Darragh O'Keeffe said he was just flat out the whole way - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: John Mulhern Galmoy Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Teahupoo was good and he is going the right way. The trip is the key to him and it seems to suit him well. Hopefully drying ground won't be a problem to him and he will go straight to Cheltenham - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Hatton's Grace Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Teahupoo was very good last year on soft ground and we ran him on good ground a couple of times which was probably a mistake but we are still learning about the horse - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Champion Hurdle Challenge Trophy (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Teahupoo was just flat out on the ground the whole way - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Red Mills Trial Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Teahupoo hated the ground but he was able to pick up on the better ground in the straight, Robbie said that he sprinted in the straight. I thought it was a good performance. We said we would come here today and see where we were and we will definitely go for the Champion Hurdle now. He's a very deceiving horse, he doesn't do much at home and is very laid back, but I would say he is not a bad horse - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Fishery Lane Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Teahupoo was very good. I felt I had Autumn Evening covered when he fell and he did it well. He's a lovely horse. I reluctantly had to go forward early on, but he wasn't really going that hard in front. When Rachael went on I was much happier and he picked them up well and stayed galloping. He jumped brilliant. I hadn't ridden him in a race before but I think he's a horse that has improved - Jack Kennedy, rider.

quotes.race: Norman Colfer Winning Fair Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Teahupoo put up a good performance and he's improving all the time. He's in everything at Cheltenham but I wouldn't be surprised if we came back here at Easter for the Grade 2 instead - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: ITM Virtual Stallion Trail Hurdle
quotes.quote: Teahuptoo is a nice horse. We had a lot of luck on our side today. He's more of a stayer than a 2-miler in time and I loved the way he ran from the last to the line - Gordon Elliott, trainer

stable_tour.quote: I thought his Punchestown performance last year after Cheltenham was as good as any. We decided to stick to the same plan this season and go Fairyhouse-Cheltenham-Punchestown again. He won the Hatton's Grace last season, but I would argue he put up a better performance in defeat against Lossiemouth this season. A lot of people seem to think he needs soft ground, but I don't think it's that important to him. It was quick enough when he won at Punchestown. He looks great and it's a case of so far, so good with him. He worked after racing at Navan recently and Danny [Gilligan] was very happy with him afterwards.  19-2-25

runners.name: The Wallpark
runners.comment: Made the frame in the Long Walk and Stayers' Hurdle since upped to Grade 1 level
runners.spotlight: Completed a four-timer, mostly in handicaps, last July-October; has made the frame in the Long Walk and Stayers' Hurdle (both on good to soft) since upped to Grade 1 level; finished 8l behind stablemate Teahupoo last time but remains comparatively unexposed at 3m and may rate higher still; in the mix.

quotes.race: Deacy Gilligan Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Wallpark keeps winning. We will probably go to Cheltenham in October for a Pertemps Qualifier. He has his own way of doing it but he has an engine. If they went faster it would have suited him better - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: BoyleSports Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: The Wallpark is a very tough horse and he is becoming a real fun horse. I think the ground suited him well. He's a young horse on the way up. I think he'll go further and he could be a horse that we will try and qualify for the Pertemps Final at Cheltenham next year - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Seamus Mulvaney Bookmaker Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Wallpark did it well. I would say he wants further, he was good and tough out there today - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's in the Pertemps Final and the Stayers' Hurdle and no decision has been made yet on where he will go. He's come a long way in a short space of time. He's won seven of his last 11 races and has just kept on improving. Wherever he shows up he's going to be dangerous, as we know the hill really suits him. 19-2-25

runners.name: Jetara
runners.comment: Sole attempt over 3m resulted in Grade 2 mares' win; this is a stiffer assignment
runners.spotlight: Ran respectably in the 2m4f Mares' Hurdle at Cheltenham last time, while shaping as if this step back up in distance will suit; 1-1 over 3m (good to soft; Doncaster Grade 2 mares' win on penultimate start) but this is a stiffer assignment.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Yorkshire Rose Mares' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jetara was second to Ballyburn at Punchestown and she had rock-solid form last season. We thought we were going to go to all heights this season, she won a Listed race and she won on the Flat but then she was disappointing at Navan - she was in season after that - and the ground was a bit quick for her at Leopardstown. The step up to three miles and the cheekpieces really helped. Onwards to Cheltenham, she's in the mares' hurdle and the three-miler - Kate Harrington, trainer's daughter.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Cailin Alainn Mares Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Jetara switched off then stuck out her head and did what she had to do, and jumped fluently throughout. It's grand to see her settling like that and hopefully she'll come on for it - Donagh Meyler, rider.

quotes.race: BeattheBank.ie Irish EBF Mares Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Jetara jumped and settled, and Jack said he couldn't believe how much she picked up. He thought he had got there plenty soon enough and, when he asked her, she picked up well. We're delighted with her. She'll be better on better ground as the whole family want better ground. She's the only one of them who is happy on that soft ground. She'll probably come back here for the two-mile-six novice hurdle at the Dublin Racing Festival. We might as well go as she's still a novice. She jumps very slick and they will have to give her 7lb - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Epic Value Mares Novice Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Jetara was good. She had the experience from last year and umnlile most of the family she goes on that heavy ground. She is hardy now and a lot stronger - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing TV Black Friday Offer - Join For Just 12 Euros PM For An Entire Year Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Jetara relaxed well today. At Down Royal she was like a lunatic. I schooled her over hurdles at the Curragh the other day and it just took the edge off her. She will go the mares route over 2m4f - Jessica Harrington, trainer

quotes.race: Coolmore N.H. Sires In Swoop Irish EBF Mares INH Flat Race (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: It's some family and you can't beat breeding. Jetara is tough and we kind of got it wrong in Gowran where she stayed on really well and we didn't make enough use of her. I was worried about the ground as most of the family like good ground but she's by Walk In The Park and she seems to cope very well with it - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

5:00.race_name: Rosconn Group Maghull Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
5:00.going_detailed: National Course - GOOD TO SOFT; Mildmay Course - GOOD (GoingStick: Mildmay Chase 5.5, Mildmay Hurdle 5.3, Grand National course 5.3) (Watering)

runners.name: Brookie
runners.comment: Won off a low weight in Doncaster handicap last time; much stiffer task on these terms
runners.spotlight: Record of 4-9 (hurdles/fences) for current yard, most recently scoring off a low weight in Class 2 handicap chase at Doncaster (2m, good); useful but faces a much stiffer assignment on these terms; would be receiving weight from all of his opponents if this were a handicap.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Brookie hasn't run badly all season and has been freshened up after taking on Sir Gino at Kempton last time. I knew conditions would suit and it's worked out perfectly - Ben Godfrey, rider.

quotes.race: Boodles Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Brookie had three goes over fences in Ireland so we thought jumping around here would be okay. He was safe and sound and there should be another day - Sam Twiston-Davies, rider.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Brookie is a nice horse and he's had plenty of experience. Hopefully, he'll make a nice chaser. He jumps very well - Tony Martin, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He made a fantastic start to the season to win at Kempton - he jumped really nicely and it was a valuable pot to win. I don't know what his Gold Cup will be and he won't be chucked in anywhere, but he's a nice horse for races over two miles on good ground. He's a half-brother to Captain Guinness and hopefully he can be competitive in some valuable races. 14-11-24

He's new to us from Tony Martin. The owners are based in the Isle of Wight and wanted to have him closer so they could see him more. He won well at Fontwell on his first start for us last week. We'll have a crack at a decent race now, possibly the £60,000 2m handicap hurdle at Ascot on November 4. We'll also keep chasing in mind and we could make that switch this season. He's most effective on good ground. 12-10-23

runners.name: Kalif Du Berlais
runners.breeder: S A R L Haras Du Berlais
runners.comment: Form figures of 111311 in completed starts at about 2m; interesting back down in distance
runners.spotlight: Seems versatile as regards ground; non-stayer over a testing 2m4f in the Scilly Isles at Sandown last time; has form figures of 111311 in completed starts at about 2m, the third-place finish in Grade 1 juvenile hurdle at this meeting last year; has proved ahead of his mark in two novice handicap chase wins, markedly so at Cheltenham on second occasion; interesting back down in trip, with a resumption of progress plausible.

quotes.race: Sonic The Hedgehog 3 In Cinemas Now Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Kalif Du Berlais is some horse. He's filling his frame and doing everything well. It's brilliant when a horse jumps like that and I love the way he's improving. He's only five and there's more to come. He's taken a step forward since Newbury and has enough experience to go anywhere now. There's plenty of good races in the spring, whether here or at Aintree, and he'll get two and a half miles without a shadow of a doubt. He'll have all the entries, including the Arkle, and next season should be even better as he can run in all those proper races - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Racing Club Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (For The Fulke Walwyn Trophy) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Kalif Du Berlais had that horrific fall last time and it's amazed me how he got over that. We've done a lot of schooling and now I can back off him a bit. He will get two and a half, but as a four-year-old I don't see any point going too far up in trip at the moment. He does gallop and he jumped brilliantly today. He was a bit unlucky the other day and he was a bit fresh. He's a big scopey horse and it happens - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys nhstallions.co.uk Graduation Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We thought Kalif Du Berlais would win, but he took a very heavy fall. Thankfully he's A1, passed the vet and is on his way home. The ups and downs of racing are incredible - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Adonis Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Kalif Du Berlais won't go to Cheltenham as he's had a hard race today. If we run him again this season it will be Aintree. He's won three from three and it wouldn't worry me if he didn't run again. If he comes out of this well and we're happy with him, he could go to Aintree. He might have to go chasing next season. He's absolutely a smart prospect - one of the nicest we've had for a long time to go chasing - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Play Coral 'Racing-Super-Series' For Free Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: John (Hales, trainer) wants to win a Gold Cup one day and that's why Kalif Du Berlais was bought. Everyone knew about the horse but no-one seemed to be able to buy him but thankfully John did. He's a beautiful horse for the future and very much a chaser. He's never looked back from the minute he walked into the yard and he's gorgeous. We need to look after him and we will. He's not a Triumph horse. I've run Clan Des Obeaux and Frodon in the Triumph. They always finish in the middle of the pack and end up superstar chasers, so I don't see the point of running him in a Triumph. All options are open but I don't see him as a Triumph horse - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'll run at Cheltenham on New Year's Day and we're looking forward to it. I'm not sure what else we'll run there quite yet but he could be joined by Hitman in the Betfair Exchange Handicap Chase. 20-12-24

runners.name: Leau Du Sud
runners.breeder: E A R L Du Moulin
runners.owner: G Mason, J Hales, L Hales, P Hogarth, Sir A Ferguson

prev_owners.owner: Sir A Ferguson G Mason J Hales & L Hales

runners.comment: The sole Grade 1 winner in this field; ran well in the Arkle most recently; major player
runners.spotlight: Acts on any ground; useful handicap hurdler and an even better novice chaser, producing form figures of 11114 in this sphere; the only Grade 1 winner in this field, having beaten Touch Me Not in the Henry VIII at Sandown (1m7f, soft) in December, and most recently ran well in a thrilling Arkle where he wilted towards the finish having hit the front a tad sooner than Harry Skelton had planned (left in lead two out); major contender, provided he takes well to first-time cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Unibet Kingmaker Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: L'Eau Du Sud's jumping was really good and it was an important race, even more so with Harry wearing John's colours. He's a really good two-miler; he's got the speed and he can jump at that pace. Him and Rubaud went really quick. He was superior from the back of three out to the last and probably got a bit lonely late on. That will put him spot on for next month. He has more experience than Sir Gino and Majborough, and experience counts for a lot, but ability supersedes experience the majority of the time. I don't think L'Eau Du Sud is lacking in ability though. He's a very good horse, been a great novice this season and we go there full of hope. We're not going there expecting to win, but we're going there hoping to win. It will be as good an Arkle as there has been for years - Dan Skelton, trainer

quotes.race: Betfair Henry VIII Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It will be the Kingmaker or the Game Spirit [next], and I'm not afraid of either, so I'll talk to the owners. If Harry had to be at Newbury to ride Protektorat in the Denman Chase and Be Aware in the Betfair Hurdle, then I'd have no problem running L'Eau Du Sud in the Game Spirit. We'd go into it likely finishing second to Jonbon, but it would be a great run en route to the Arkle. In an ideal world he goes to Warwick, but we'll see. I think he just got quite stuck in the ground, and the biggest lesson I learned there is he's better on that slightly better ground, especially over fences. He's quite an exuberant jumper, and late on it was a bit hard work getting out of it. He was untidy at the last two, but the good ones find a way. He's never been in that position before, where he's actually had to fight. That was the only question coming into it - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Arkle Challenge Trophy Trial Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (Reg' As The November) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think with a horse like L'Eau Du Sud you are entitled to get excited. He has done it around the track and has got the form in the book. Yes, there will be shorter-priced horses [for the Arkle] who achieved more over hurdles but they have yet to prove their suitability. We've got one tick in the box now and he'll go to Sandown now and hopefully cement his place as the best two-mile novice in Britain, although I know Nicky [Henderson] and Paul [Nicholls] might have something to say about that - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: The Arkle looks a hot race, despite the absence of Sir Gino, but I've no intention of swerving it. He might not have Grade 1-winning novice hurdle form like Majborough, but he's a very good chaser and I think he's a player. I thought he won in spite of the soft ground in the Henry VIII Novices' Chase, which was a good performance, and I was chuffed to bits with his win on Saturday at Warwick. He probably got lonely and a bit tired going to the last, but when he heard Rubaud coming he picked up again at the line. He's versatile and has won over fences at Cheltenham, which is a positive thing to have in your locker. 10-2-25

runners.name: Special Cadeau
runners.breeder: M H Sly, Dr T Davies & Mrs P Sly

prev_owners.owner: Michael H Sly Dr T Davies Mrs Pam Sly

runners.comment: Took well to fences at Thurles two months ago; may have more to offer in this sphere
runners.spotlight: Flat bred but took well to fences at Thurles (2m, good) two months ago, belying his 66-1 odds and finally adding to debut success in a bumper; upped sharply in grade for second chase attempt but may have more to offer in this sphere and is fresher than some of his rivals.

quotes.race: Horse & Jockey Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Special Cadeau is a fine big horse, he got a bit low at the last but I love what he did from the last. We were hopeful fences would improve him and he definitely did today. The nice ground was key - Darragh O'Keeffe, rider

stable_tour.quote: A nice bumper type out of a 1,000 Guineas winner. He won a bumper on his only start in the UK last November. He's doing everything right at home and could run in November or December. 07-11-22

runners.name: Touch Me Not
runners.comment: Normally consistent and has Grade 1 form but folded tamely in the Arkle most recently
runners.spotlight: Grade 2 winner at Punchestown in November (2m, soft) then ran creditably in two Grade 1 contests, including at Sandown behind L'Eau du Sud; normally consistent but folded tamely and came home tailed-off last of five in the Arkle most recently; difficult to support on the back of that effort.

quotes.race: Betfair Henry VIII Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Touch Me Not was travelling away and that one mistake [at the sixth] knocked the stuffing out of him. It knocked his confidence a small bit but he still ran a cracker. He was a little bit low at the second-last but over the last he was good. He's a young horse who is still learning and hopefully there's more big days ahead - Jordan Gainford, rider.

quotes.race: BetVictor Craddockstown Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: We got Touch Me Not from the point-to-point field. He actually fell in his point-to-point, believe it or not. I was worried about the ground, but it was a good performance and he came on plenty from last time. He was very keen as a young horse and didn't show me anything. He was well down the pecking order, but he's come a long way in six months. He might not be easy to place at Christmas. The two-mile race at Leopardstown is not there anymore and I don't think the Grade 1 at Limerick would suit. We'll get him home and see - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a brilliant jumper when in full flow and we'll let him roll in the Arkle. He ran very well against Majborough the other day and, while it's hard to see him turning around that form, it wouldn't be the biggest shock in the world if he were placed. He's a different horse over fences compared to hurdles.  19-2-25

runners.name: Only By Night
runners.comment: Progressive mare; excellent second in the Arkle and appears to have a Grade 1 prize in her
runners.spotlight: Seems versatile as regards ground; progressive mare whose record of 3-4 since switched to chasing features wins in Cork Grade 2 and Exeter Listed event, both against her own sex; belied her 25-1 odds with an excellent second in a dramatic Arkle at Cheltenham most recently, edging ahead and looking the likely winner on the run-in only to be collared by the fast-finishing winner close home; appears to have a Grade 1 prize in her.

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Arkle Challenge Trophy Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Only By Night ran a great race and I'm really happy with her. I don't have an idea what we'll do with her next; this was the plan - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Agatha Christie Mares' Novices' Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The dream still goes on. The Mares' Chase might be for Only By Night at Cheltenham. The big question with her, which we still haven't answered, is whether she'll do two and a half miles. She's entered in the Arkle as well, and if the ground was heavy then we'd be more tempted to look at that. It's still up in the air and it's a nice problem, but the Arkle is so strong with the likes of Sir Gino and Majborough. You have to accept we have a nice horse, though, and we couldn't be more delighted - Colin Russell, part owner.

quotes.race: Coolmore N.H. Sires Order Of St George Irish EBF Mares Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Only By Night is a very big mare and jumps very well. There should be a lot more to come. The mares novice chase at Thurles in January would look a logical next step on the way to the mares novice at Cheltenham - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Tipperary Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Only By Night is very good to jump although I thought we were in bother going along the side, but she found plenty for pressure. I'm delighted with her. We won't lose the run of ourselves but it was a good performance and she will go further too - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Care At Home Services Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Only By Night is a nice mare. She had won a Listed bumper and we would have hoped she could come here and do that. She jumped well and has a lovely way of going. She was a bit keen first time for Derek O'Connor, but she improved on that at Navan and today she was very straightforward. She has become so in her work at home too. She has grown up. We would hope that she could end up in the mares' novice at Cheltenham - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Coolmore N.H. Sires Hurricane Lane Irish EBF Mares INH Flat Race (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Only By Night is a lovely mare. She really went through that ground but I would say she will go through any ground. She will stay in bumpers and is very straightforward - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's a nice mare who showed plenty in her bumpers and had a couple of good runs over hurdles last season, finishing off with a third at Punchestown. She's going chasing and is a point-to-point winner who jumps well. She's ready to start off as soon as we get some soft ground. She's a fine, big mare and we think she'll improve for a fence. 12-11-24

She's a nice mare who showed plenty in her bumpers and had a couple of good runs over hurdles last season. She's going chasing and is a point-to-point winner who jumps well. She's ready to start off as soon as we get some soft ground. She's a fine, big mare and we think she'll improve for a fence. 13-11-24

2:30.race_name: William Hill Handicap Chase (Registered As The Freebooter Handicap Chase) (Premier Handicap) (GBB)
2:30.going_detailed: National Course - GOOD TO SOFT; Mildmay Course - GOOD (GoingStick: Mildmay Chase 5.5, Mildmay Hurdle 5.3, Grand National course 5.3) (Watering)

runners.name: Sam Brown
runners.owner: The Exors Of T C Frost
runners.comment: 13yo who has a lofty mark, but won last time and has a good record in this race; respected
runners.spotlight: 13yo who has never won off a mark this high; however, he won a veterans' handicap by 3l at Newbury last month and has a good record in this race, winning it easily in 2022 and 2l runner-up last year (both good to soft); has won on good going; he's just 2lb higher than 12 months ago; respected.

quotes.race: BetVictor Super Boost Has Arrived Veterans' Handicap Chase (Leg 2 Of The Stayers' Veterans' Series)
quotes.quote: You can see all the way Sam Brown was trying to lug in and if you let him do that then he'd sulk his way round a little bit. It was good for Chad to take him as wide as possible down the back because it's straight and he gave him that room. I thought it was going to be a fair tussle - Anthony Honeyball, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Handicap Chase (Registered As The Freebooter Handicap Chase) (Premier Handicap) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Sam Brown has had an amazing season. It is just tough as he is 12 now, and he is running off 154, but quite rightly so. He has run an absolute blinder. In a race like this you are going to hit a proper flat spot against younger legs. In the veterans' race last time out he was able to hold his own all the way through the race. We jumped out to be handy, but we knew we were going to be slotting back, and I'm surprised he stayed in it for so long. When we dropped out it was a case of Freddie (Gingell) not panicking, and he didn't. We were too far back turning in to have any hope, but he sensed he was on the way home and away he went. He is in the bet365 Gold Cup, and that is two weeks from today, so he could probably do that as he saves a bit, but that is as long as he is 100 per cent at home - Anthony Honeyball, trainer.

quotes.race: Home-Start Bracknell Forest Veterans' Handicap Chase (Leg 4 of The Stayers' Veterans' Chase Series)
quotes.quote: It was a bit of a tricky decision because there's a 100,000GBP veterans' race next weekend at Haydock but I think the key today was that Sam Brown could dictate and it's probably done his confidence the world of good - Anthony Honeyball, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Veterans' Handicap Chase (2023 Veterans' Chase Series Final)
quotes.quote: We've been quite lucky as Sam Brown had a little issue and we were going to struggle to get him to Sandown, so it panned out perfectly. We thought we had him in great order and his jumping kept him in it. He's a fantastic horse to train - Anthony Honeyball, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Handicap Chase (Grade 3) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I suppose it is riding genuine good to soft and that was just soft enough. We did have Sam Brown in the Grand National but we did bottle it a bit. We had a lot of picking up to do after the Haydock Park run which was a bit of a car crash really and it probably came too soon after the Peter Marsh. To have him and go and win today, what a bonus. He was going to run in the Topham but that was going to be too high a tempo so I'm happy with that decision. We will have a look at it (Grand National) for sure but he has won that off a decent mark so it will be tough for him, but we thought he would win a pot somewhere and he has - Anthony Honeyball, trainer.

quotes.race: Patrick Coyne Memorial Altcar Novices' Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: I thought Sam Brown was in trouble turning in. He'd made mistakes, I was thinking I'd run him too quick and I thought the best he could do was keep on for third. But then his stamina came into it, he was a very good bumper horse and he has lots of stamina - he really gallops and soft ground is key. He's got a good brain and that was a proper race and that will do him good. He'll be entered in the RSA Chase but he'd probably need soft ground, otherwise he;d be tilting at windmills, and he'll be entered in the National Hunt Chase as well. If he doesn't get his ground at Cheltenham there is the Grade 1 race at Aintree and Punchestown - Anthony Honeyball, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow At The Races On Twitter Novices' Chase
quotes.quote: Sam Brown's bumper form was very good and novice hurdle form solid, he's just had various problems. He had no experience coming here but he loves that ground and jumped brilliant. He hasn't run since 2017 and we just want to see a bit more of him. He was always in second gear and could have gone around there for eight miles - Aidan Coleman, rider.

quotes.race: Derek Hunnisett Memorial Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sam Brown is a really nice horse and his bumper form was up there with last season's best. On that he should really have been odds on getting the weight - Aidan Coleman, rider.

quotes.race: Moore Of Devizes Ltd Supporting Greatwood Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: On pedigree Sam Brown would want better ground but the key is he's a stayer. On good to soft he might have got done for toe. The last furlong made my mind up not to go to Aintree. He'll go hurdling in the autumn but will make some chaser one day. He could be our best young horse - Anthony Honeyball, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a lovely season, winning the veterans' final before running a screamer at the Grand National meeting. His comeback in the Charlie Hall was good, as good as any first time out for a while, and he's qualified for the veterans' final again having won at Ascot in March. That will be his target but we can look to go somewhere else beforehand, possibly the Coral Gold Cup. 14-11-24

He went missing a little bit last season. We went to the Grand National and he fell at the Chair but then at Punchestown, when he was under the radar, he ran a blinder and fell two out when he was in front. We'll never know if he would have won but he would have been bang there. He's rated too high for veterans' races and if the season goes right we won't end in those races. We'll look to prepare him for the Charlie Hall and then we could be heading towards the Fleur de Lys Chase at Lingfield's Winter Million again. He was ante-post favourite for that last season before it was abandoned. On his day he'll be competitive in those Grade 2-type races. 12-10-23

runners.name: Imperial Saint
runners.comment: Stamina to prove now up in trip but 3-3 here; could play leading role if seeing it out
runners.spotlight: Stamina to prove on first rules run beyond an extended 2m4f but he won a 3m point in May 2023 and he's 3-3 at Aintree, with all those wins coming in handicap chases during this novice campaign (2m/2m4f, good/good to soft); could play a leading role now back here, provided he sees out the trip.

quotes.race: William Hill Betting Done Properly Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Imperial Saint definitely seems to enjoy it round here and it was the obvious race for him. We knew he'd get further and he's bounced back. We were a little bit disappointed at Newbury but maybe two miles round there was a bit too sharp for him. He's jumped, travelled and done it really well. He's going to go up in the handicap again and it's not going to be easy for him, but it's lovely to have a horse of his quality for our syndicate - Richard Johnson, syndicate manager.

quotes.race: Jason Salleh Memorial Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I didn't see what happened to the other horse, but I felt I was just getting back on top coming to the last. I was very comfortable the whole way and Imperial Saint jumped really well. He's had the point-to-point experience and he's a forward-going type, so we used that experience. He stays really well - Micheal Nolan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice horse for the Richard Johnson syndicate who won his last point-to-point very well. We've been happy with him at home and we'd be looking forward to running him very soon. He'll go novice hurdling. 23-11-23

He did well for us over hurdles last season, winning twice, at Ludlow and Ffos Llas, and finished in the first three in all of his five runs.  We were over the moon with his win at Aintree on Sunday in his first run over fences when he jumped very well throughout. He's owned by the Richard Johnson Racing Club and he gave his owners a great day. We think he'll get further in time but we'll stick with 2m with him at the moment and try and find another race for him in a couple of weeks' time. He's one we're looking forward to. 30-10-24

runners.name: Shakem Uparry
runners.comment: Won off this mark at 2024 Cheltenham Festival (2m4f); doubts about trip and current form
runners.spotlight: Runs off the same mark as for his Cheltenham Festival win last year (2m4f, soft) and he was a creditable fourth of 15 in this race in 2023 (good to soft); however, he was outstayed on that occasion and this 11yo has finished down the field on both outings this year.

quotes.race: TrustATrader Plate Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I campaigned him Shakem Up'Arry very badly in the early part of his career and put him against horses like Shishkin, so he's deserved his big day and that's that. It was a change of tactics as I told Ben [Jones] to go for it early as he always comes there travelling, looking like the winner, but doesn't always go through with it. So I said, 'If you turn for home going well, put some distance between yourself and then see if you can hang on.' It's great for Ben and it's great for the team - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power New Year's Day Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It is the first time Shakem Up'Arry has ever found off the bridle to be honest. I slightly felt that are we coming back to waters that have been swum before and are we going to get the same result. I don't think he travelled as well today as he normally does. He was really keen in the Coral Gold Cup and today he was behind the bridle. Maybe that is the key to just get him to switch off. I'd say the ground and everything else has played right for him today. We did his wind over the summer and I would say that has helped a little bit. He slightly idled in front, but not too badly, and he had it under control at that point. He will come straight back here in March at the Festival for the Plate that he ran in last season. He could go in the Ultima if the ground was quick and he will probably have an entry in both races - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Magners Plate Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Shakem 'Up Arry has run at Cheltenham twice and both times have seen him flatten out in the last 200 yards or so. He just does not seem to get home at this trip at this course - Ben Pauling, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He came out of the race at Warwick well but it hasn't been the easiest of seasons after his fall in the veterans' chase at Cheltenham in December. He has options in the Ultima or a return to the Plate, but if we had to wait for Aintree and run in the Topham or the Grand National we could. 17-2-25

A smart handicap chaser who runs in the well-known colours of Harry Redknapp. Last term he was an easy winner at Haydock before being placed in his subsequent three runs, all decent efforts. He goes well fresh as in each of the last two seasons he has won his first completed start, and he seems in grand order prior to this season's starting point -  the Paddy Power Gold Cup at Cheltenham. He loves soft ground, so I will be quite happy to see the heavens open before then. He is still on a nice mark and has proved he is best fresh, and I hope he is a big player at Cheltenham next month. 26-10-22

runners.name: Myretown
runners.comment: Easily made all in the Ultima and this exciting 8yo could take a 15lb rise in his stride
runners.spotlight: Bounced back from a heavy fall at Windsor to make all easily at Kelso (2m7f, soft) and confirmed that promise when doing likewise in the Ultima at the Cheltenham Festival (3m1f, good to soft); unraced on good ground; hit with 15lb rise since last time but this exciting 8yo could take it in his stride.

quotes.race: Ultima Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We knew that if Myretown jumped round, he was phenomenally well-handicapped; I just didn't know if he was going to be man enough, and it's very exciting that he is. He's a novice horse, his jumping has been a bit hit and miss, he turned upside down at Windsor, but since then we ran him at Kelso and he's got his confidence back. He's a bit different to Corach Rambler - he jumps so exuberantly. Corach is just a different sort of horse, but this is a phenomenal horse - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: Every Horse, Every Race, At timeform.com Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Myretown was much more grown up today and that opens options up for us. I'd like to keep Derek [Fox] on him so we wouldn't go for the Kim Muir or anything and we'll look at a novice chase at Uttoxeter after Cheltenham - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I really like him; he reminds me of a smaller Ahoy Senor. He's headstrong but jumps well and I can't wait for him to go chasing. He's had some leg trouble before and we won't run him unless it's good to soft or softer. 30-10-24

runners.name: Le Milos
runners.comment: Snapped losing sequence at Warwick in February but this 10yo was only 6th at Newbury since
runners.spotlight: Won the big Newbury handicap in November 2022 (3m2f, good) and snapped a losing sequence when exploiting his reduced mark in veterans' chase at Warwick (2m4f, soft) two months ago; remains well treated on peak form but this 10yo was only sixth at Newbury (2m4f, soft) latest; needs a much bigger run today.

quotes.race: Unibet Middle Distance Series Veterans' Handicap Chase (Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: This track really suited him and the fences in quick succession down the back straight meant Le Milos could fill up. He's such a nice horse so it's great to see him back winning - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Premier Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Le Milos just got tired halfway up the run-in. I knew how much he was going to improve for today. The National is where he's going. He jumped very well bar one at the top of the hill on the final circuit and he was always going to get tired at some point - unfortunately it was in the last ten strides - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: There was definitely some apprehension over the ground. Bangor was very soft but I felt he'd really stepped forward. I'm glad they put the water on last night and that probably helped Le Milos from the back of the last, I thought Remastered had got us and I'm actually surprised he hasn't because we were out there to be gunned down for a while. He was so brave for Harry at the last. If he'd put one more stride in we were beat and you have another winner - Dan Skelton, trainer.  He was magic. He was good for me as he was on the limit the whole way and I knew he would stay galloping. It's a big team effort. We're led by Dan and we're all so lucky in that position to work for him. The horse responded really well - he's really tough and he kept galloping until the line - Harry Skelton, jockey, speaking to ITV racing.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Masters Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Le Milos has got speed and sharpness but he's very gritty as well. I think that will probably have been his Gold Cup - Alan Johns, jockey.

quotes.race: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I was going to enter Le Milos in the Welsh National, but thought we might not get in, so sat quiet, but he definitely looks that type of horse. It looks like he'll stay a lot further and he loves the ground. He's been progressive and is not an old horse. That was a career-best today and you could see him in an Eider Chase, where you might not need as much class as the Welsh National. He's still young and unexposed - Tim Vaughan, trainer.

quotes.race: Get Switched On With Matchbook Juvenile Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Last time we ran Le Milos handy at Exeter and he was keen for the first mile and a quarter. We dropped him in today with a hood on. He's almost fallen asleep at the back and was behind the bridle the whole way. He was tough as they come up the straight - Alan John, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He ran nicely on his first race of the season at Cheltenham last month but we probably thought he was fitter than he actually was and I'd say he blew up that day. He'll go to Haydock on Betfair Chase day for a three-mile handicap chase [November 23] and I still think he can win good races. Obviously he's not hitting the form he did when he won the Coral Gold Cup, but they can never take that away from him, he was brilliant that day, and I still think there's plenty left in the tank. He's a pleasure to have and I think he can win another nice pot. 12-11-24

runners.name: Richmond Lake

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Hemmings

runners.comment: Pulled up at Cheltenham Festival but has a useful record here; e-w claims back at Aintree
runners.spotlight: Pulled up at the Cheltenham Festival but he made a bad mistake and that may not be his track; running well in defeat previously at up to 3m1f and he has a useful record here; each-way claims now back at Aintree.

quotes.race: Boylesports Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was pain-free for Richmond Lake until the last and we've got away with it, but he's turning into a good little horse. He's learning to race and relaxed a bit and this was the plan. His entry at Cheltenham next week was just in case, so you can forget that - Donald McCain, trainer.

quotes.race: Save Our Sport Sign The Petition Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: We thought Richmond Lake might need the race. He goes for a 2m4f chase at Aintree on Boxing Day - Michael Meagher, owners representative.

quotes.race: Hillhouse Quarry Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It wasn't happening great early because we went very quick and Richmond Lake was finding the ground quite tight but I just held him together and he eventually came good. He's been a grand horse, he rarely runs a bad race. It was a good spot by Donald to run him, he's still a novice and hopefully he can improve into a nice horse next season - Brian Hughes, jockey.

quotes.race: Bob "Few Scoops" Kerslake's 70th Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That is just him [jumping left]. Richmond Lake does go that way, but he is a talented horse. He's got an engine and it'll be Aintree for the Red Rum or Ayr for him - Donald McCain, trainer.

quotes.race: Book Corporate Hospitality At Wetherby Racecourse Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Richmond Lake did enough wrong there but he got better and it was a good performance by a horse that's only had one run over fences against horses that have got lots of experience - Brian Hughes, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: A talented horse who has a big day in him. We were delighted with his comeback in the Grand Sefton. He took to the place well again, and the three horses in front of him were all getting more than a stone from him. He was probably just a couple of bits of work short as well. He'll have an entry in the Becher and the two-and-a-half-mile handicap chase, which he won last year, on the same card. Around two miles five is his optimum, but I think we'll stretch him out at some point. The Grand National is definitely an option, if he managed to get the rating to get in. He would never have gone in an old National, but it's a different race now. 12-11-24

He runs in the colours of Trevor Hemmings and he is typical of the sort that he liked in that he is a proper chaser in the making. He is a funny horse to weigh up as he shows us nothing at home. I remember on the first day over hurdles at Bangor he really surprised us with an easy win. His first run over fences was disappointing at Carlisle in November but it was the wrong way round and he was overracing and basically it was a car crash. Next time out I ran him in a novice handicap chase at Wetherby and he did the job very professionally. He has gone up 6lb for that, which was fair, and he goes to Newcastle, again over 2m, in the next couple of weeks where I expect him to go very well again. 09-02-23

runners.name: Peaky Boy
runners.comment: Disappointing on stable debut at Ascot but this lightly raced 7yo was promising previously
runners.spotlight: 2-2 over hurdles and won on chase debut for Nicky Henderson at Cheltenham (2m4f, good) in November; good third in hot handicap there (3m1f, good to soft) next time; his jumping lacked fluency when he tailed off in the Grade 2 Reynoldstown at Ascot (3m, good) on stable debut in February, but this lightly raced 7yo retains potential and is not written off.

quotes.race: mallardjewellers.com Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Peaky Boy might just still be a big baby. He was ridden down on the paint, covering him up and not seeing a lot of his fences but his jumping was superb. I'm surprised he didn't travel a bit more comfortably but Nico said it was fine. I think there's an awful lot of improvement in this horse, I don't think we've seen half of him yet. He could be a good horse. I'm sure he'll get three [miles] but I don't think he needs to yet - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Citipost Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Peaky Boy is a nice horse who has a future over fences. His first run here took a bit out of him and he is a bit like that. He'll strengthen up and toughen up but will be lovely to go chasing with next season - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Favourite From The Sun Now Daily Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: When we started with Peaky Boy he needed his wind tending to, but he's lovely and very laidback. Michael Scudamore went up to Scotland, so Olly (Harris, owner) kindly sent him to us. It looked like he handled the ground and I'm sure he's going to stay well. He'll stay at two and half miles for the time being and you'd like another run before we go for anything deeper. He's a horse with a big future, especially over fences - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's another exciting prospect. He's won his last three, including both runs over hurdles at Cheltenham last season. The first of those was on heavy ground on New Year's Day and the second on good ground in April, so I don't think conditions will be an issue. I think we can go to war with him this season with considerable optimism. 22-10-24

He won his only start in points at Borris House last March. He enjoyed a nice summer break and I gave him his rules debut in a bumper at Bangor last month when he ran a lovely race to be second of nine over 2m½f. We bumped into a very smart one on that occasion (Realisation) and had he not been there we would all be very excited as he would have been a nine-and-a-half-length winner. We will stick to bumpers this season as he is still only four and has lots of filling out to do and is not the biggest. This lovely young horse does everything we ask at home and he has a bright future judged on his pointing and bumper form. 21-11-22

runners.name: Happygolucky
runners.comment: Very lightly raced since winning this in 2021; encouraging run at Cheltenham last month
runners.spotlight: 11yo who has raced just five times since winning this in 2021 (good to soft) for Kim Bailey; however, he was a creditable fourth of 24 behind the easy winner in the Ultima at Cheltenham (3m1f, good to soft) last month on his second start for this stable and he could be involved.

quotes.race: Betway Handicap Chase (Grade 3) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It would be nice if Happygolucky could come back this time next year - an hour later. He could progress. He jumps so well and he's a professional little racehorse. He seems to stay. He wouldn't be the biggest but he's a very athletic individual. That was a great performance today. He's a novice and the way he jumps and the way he handles himself is extraordinary - Kim Bailey, trainer.

quotes.race: International Decorative Surfaces Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm very pleased he jumped really well, Happygolucky is a proper trainer's horse as he's not overly big and is an athletic individual. He got there far too soon and got lonely in front. It's soft ground out there and looks very holding. We'd certainly like to be back here in March, but in what race I don't know. He'll stay as long as he wants but like a lot of things it'll depend on the ground. The RSA has a lot of very good horses around and we're not quite in that league yet. He's happier left-handed so we've got some nice options for him - Kim Bailey, trainer.
