stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely horse who has come back in a good place. He just got a bit jarred up after his race at Aintree in April 2021 and his owners have been patient, as we could have easily had him back in training last season but decided to give him the full time. We took him out of the Paddy Power because of the ground and where we go will be ground-related. He's got a handicap mark he needs to be using rather than losing. He could possibly go for the Rehearsal Chase and he's got the entry in the Coral Gold Cup, but we want rain and lots of it. 21-11-22

A lovely horse who won on his hurdling debut at Stratford last season and followed up with two thirds in Graded company but his best effort was in the Martin Pipe at Cheltenham when making the frame in fourth place. He returned to Stratford last month for his chasing bow and won very nicely over 2m5f. I think he has potential to do well over the larger obstacles and was just run out of it by the useful Getaway Trump at Fakenhma this week. He has taken to fences well and is very professional in his races. 18-11-20

runners.name: Cruz Control
runners.comment: Won this last year; a return to form is needed back from a break but he's not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Arrived in good form when making all in this last year (good to soft); soundly beaten (hurdles) and pulled up (fences) on his two starts towards the end of last year and he returns from a break with something to prove, but he's just 3lb higher than 12 months ago and is not ruled out.

quotes.race: William Hill Handicap Chase (Registered As The Freebooter Handicap Chase) (Premier Handicap) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Cruz Control missed the ditch in the home straight the second time but otherwise he jumped pretty economically, fast and effectively. It was a good performance. He was unlucky to lose at Doncaster and he got chinned at Newcastle on another occasion but otherwise he's not done a lot wrong this season. He appears to be slow but he's such a big, long-striding horse he's covering ground - he's taking one stride to other horses' two. I've been reluctant to step him up to three miles because although he's seven he's still a frame. We've given him time to mature and I think he'll just get better and better, hopefully - Tom Lacey, trainer.

quotes.race: Sportvision Stadia & Event Branding Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Cruz Control jumped much better compared to how he jumped at Ascot, where he was just running into fences. We did a load of schooling with him at home over some poles and he's tucking his front end up so much better. He's a horse that's still to do some maturing - he's got such a big frame and has been such a hollow horse - and hopefully he can go on from here. If he can jump with accuracy he could go up in trip - Tom Lacey, trainer, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Cruz Control is a fine horse. Two-and-a-half miles around Cheltenham just didn't suit him and he jumped okay today, but I got a free lead. It's a cliche but we'll see the best of him over a fence - Stan Sheppard, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's a big, tall, angular type who has done nothing wrong, winning his bumper and scoring twice over hurdles. However, he's always been a real chaser in the making and got off the mark on his third attempt over fences at Newcastle, where I was much happier with his jumping following plenty of schooling. He followed that up with a good second at Doncaster on Saturday and the result might have been different had he been a little bit quicker over the last few fences. He'll get better in time, is constantly filling his frame and seems to handle most ground. I think he's progressive. 20-12-23

runners.name: Doctor Ken
runners.comment: Returned from an absence with promising second in November; very much of interest
runners.spotlight: Two wins (2m4f/2m7f, good to soft) in the 2022-23 season from first three chase starts and he returned from a long absence with a clear second at Kempton (2m4f, good to soft) in November 2024; that form reads well, he has a good record when fresh and this step up in trip could be in his favour; won on good ground over hurdles; this unexposed 9yo is very much of interest.

quotes.race: Boylesports Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Doctor Ken jumped very well on the whole. He's a gorgeous big horse who is hopefully going to improve. A lot of mine have needed a run this season and I was waiting for him to take a blow, which he didn't. He was tough and is one to look forward to - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Ascot Shop "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Doctor Ken is probably more a horse for next year. In terms of raw ability I'd say he wouldn't be far away from the best of them (his novice hurdlers) but probably mentally and physically he's going to be better next year whereas I might have a few others who are a bit sharper than him - Olly Murphy, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He missed last season but has some good form in the book over fences and could be a lovely horse for staying handicap chases. 24-10-24

He had a good season last season, winning two chases, and is going to be a good staying chaser. I'm not sure where he'll start out just yet, but hopefully he's one to keep on the right side of. 01-11-23

runners.name: Weveallbeencaught
runners.owner: Jimmy & Susie Wenman, Edward & Jane James
runners.comment: Ran well when 13l fourth in the Kim Muir last month and he might not be far away
runners.spotlight: Won at Doncaster (3m, good) in January on first run back with this yard and bounced back from a lesser performance there when 13l fourth of 23 in the Kim Muir at Cheltenham (3m2f, good to soft) last month in a first-time visor (retained); might not be far away.

quotes.race: Ballymore Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was the plan to keep it simple with Weveallbeencaught and go from the front. He doesn't do too much, he's idle and had his ears pricked after the last. He's one for the future and a chaser - you only have to look at the size of him. He's a big, powerful animal and surely hurdles aren't what he's made for. He's very exciting. He'll be better over 3m and he'll come back for the Ballymore or Albert Bartlett in March, most likely the Albert Bartlett as we don't want to take on Hermes Allen - we're not stupid! He's one of the priciest horses we've bought but he's worth way more than they paid for him - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: Visit Irish Store Sales With ITM Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've got a good one, long term. We'll go and win another bumper with Weveallbeencaught and then put him away hurdling next season. I think a quiet bumper. The owners will be keen to do something fancy, but I've got to calm them down. A horse his size isn't going to win an Aintree bumper and he's a three-mile chaser. We bought him as a Gold Cup horse and that's what we're going for. He's very similar to Imperial Commander. That's big talk, but that's the idea we've got - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He might be going to the sales on Friday, but he'll be entered in the National Hunt Chase and the Kim Muir. His main target if he doesn't sell would be the Grimthorpe. 17-2-25

runners.name: Heltenham
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late N W Lake

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late N W Lake

runners.comment: Won off 2lb higher last March but over 2m4f; below par this season, including at 3m
runners.spotlight: Has dropped to a mark 2lb lower than when winning at Newbury (2m4f, good to soft) last March; however, he's been below par this season and was pulled up at Kempton in February on his first crack at 3m; plenty to prove.

quotes.race: Get Best Odds Guaranteed At BetVictor Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Heltenham won over hurdles at the start of the season and maybe had a hard race, but he definitely had a hard race at Aintree after that on bad ground. Before Kempton in February, his coat massively changed and I knew he hadn't been right. He's come into form and is pretty effective round here and we'll look at all sorts of races. Maybe Sandown and the Oaksey Chase will suit him at the end of the season, a big galloping track. If a Bravemansgame turns up in that, he isn't in his league, but there's a race at Perth for him and options at Ayr and he's in the Topham too - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Dransfields CIU Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Heltenham was back over hurdles and it was a bit different for him. His jumping has never been his forte, back over hurdles he was knocking them but he's gone and done the job and that's the main thing - Tristan Durrell, jockey.

quotes.race: Run For Your Money At BetVictor Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Heltenham is improving all the time and hopefully keeps improving. Chasing has helped him but time more than anything. I could see him one day coming here for a Coral Gold Cup, but that might be in 2024 rather than the autumn. More immediately, he could go to Sandown on the last day of the season for a novice handicap chase, but it would have to keep raining. He wants really slow ground, it's very important to him - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: The ground hasn't been soft enough for him yet this season but we're aiming to go to Newbury with him for a two-and-a-half-mile handicap chase at Newbury on November 29. We thought he was going the right way last term and he won a £100,000 Grade 3 handicap at Newbury in the spring - more of the same will be on the agenda. 12-11-24

runners.name: Docpickedme
runners.comment: 9yo who has been better than ever in good handicaps at Doncaster the last twice; chance
runners.spotlight: 9yo who has been inconsistent over the years but he's been better than ever the last twice, going very close at Doncaster (3m, good to soft) in December before winning another competitive handicap there (3m, good) in January, albeit having a battle on his hands before being left clear at the final fence; that latest form still reads well and a 4lb rise isn't harsh; chance.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Great Yorkshire Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Docpickedme is not a National horse, he doesn't stay beyond three miles, this is his trip. He was so well, he was bursting out of his skin. That's why I'm here! It was unlucky for the faller but he would have battled - Richard Hobson, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The ground was probably softer than Docpickedme wants and the trip on the easy side, he gets three miles and that probably won it for him as he outstayed them - Lee Edwards, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's a point winner who came with a reputation from Ireland and will want soft ground. He jumps very well and seems to have speed, so might start in a bumper before hurdling. 09-11-20

runners.name: Frero Banbou
runners.comment: Won in November when upped to an extended 2m7f but hasn't shone the last twice
runners.spotlight: 10yo who won when upped to an extended 2m7f at Newcastle (good) in November and ran well when 10l second at Kempton (3m, good to soft) next time; however, below par at Doncaster (3m, good) subsequently and pulled up at Cheltenham (3m1f, good to soft) last month; needs to get back on track.

quotes.race: BetMGM Rehearsal Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Frero Banbou has got a bit of a scope to him as he ran over the Grand National fences the last day but liked being back over the normal ones. He's a brilliant jumper and pretty versatile as he's run on everything before - Ned Fox, jockey.

quotes.race: racehorselotto.com Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was Charlie's idea after riding Frero Banbou last year to take his time a little bit more with him. The lack of pace wasn't a problem. At the last, it was heart in mouth stuff. They were meeting it wrong and it was either ask him up long and pray or take a pull and don't win the race - Venetia Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Frero Banbou did that nicely first time after a wind op but I'm not sure how good the race was. He jumps very well and styed on well up the hill - Venetia Williams, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been running well without winning. He wasn't beaten far in the Grand Sefton last season and could go back there next month. He hasn't won since the start of 2022 and it would just be nice to get his head back in front. We might try him over three miles at some point. 23-10-24

runners.name: Erne River
runners.comment: Best run for a while when fourth at Doncaster latest but he needs to build on that today
runners.spotlight: 10yo who ran his best race for a while when fourth at his favourite course Doncaster (3m2f, good) last month, despite coming under early pressure; however, he needs to build on that performance if he's to threaten today.

quotes.race: Download The Racing AppHandicap Chase
quotes.quote: Erne River obviously likes Doncaster. He lost his way a bit but Nick Kent has his horses in good form - Charlie Hammond, rider.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We knew Erne River was a very good horse and his two wins last season were a bonus as I didn't think he'd be quick enough for hurdle races. He oozes chasing and I was really pleased with that - Nick Kent, trainer.

runners.name: Charlie Uberalles
runners.comment: Won at Doncaster in December but pulled up at Kempton since and out of the handicap today
runners.spotlight: Won a competitive handicap at Doncaster (3m, good to soft) in December and that form was subsequently franked by the neck runner-up Docpickedme; however, he's 7lb higher this afternoon from out of the handicap and he was pulled up at Kempton (3m, good to soft) last time.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Charlie Uberalles has run twice here previously and ran well both times. He was third last year in the Great Yorkshire Chase, so the weight, ground and jockey was right. He'll go back for that race here in January - we've got the date in already. If the ground was wrong we wouldn't go but if it stays on the good side, we'll go - George Critchley, owner

1:55.going_detailed: National Course - GOOD TO SOFT; Mildmay Course - GOOD (GoingStick: Mildmay Chase 5.5, Mildmay Hurdle 5.3, Grand National course 5.3) (Watering)

runners.name: Castle Carrock
runners.comment: Useful Sandown win on debut and respectable third in Grade 2 since; highly tried this time
runners.spotlight: Moved to Alan King after Ayr bumper win and he found the most on hurdle debut at Sandown (2m, soft) against a rival who showed up well at the Cheltenham Festival next time; just a respectable effort in Grade 2 at Kelso (2m2f, good to soft) last month suggests he's highly tried here.

quotes.race: Anne Boleyn "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I knew coming to the last I had a bit left and I would have liked to have winged it, but Castle Carrock picked up well from the back of it. He's always jumped well. He might improve as the season goes on. He won on good ground up at Ayr, so it was nice to get today's win under his belt - Tom Cannon, rider.

runners.name: Fingle Bridge
runners.comment: Missed two years; progressive winner of all 3 hurdle starts since (soft and good to soft)
runners.spotlight: Missed two years of career but the wait was worth it as he's won all three hurdle starts this winter, at up to about 2m2f (on soft and good to soft) and getting the better of Regent's Stroll in a Listed race at Exeter in February; should stay this sharp 2m4f but another step forward is needed.

quotes.race: trustatrader.com Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Fingle Bridge is a horse that has got lots of ability, but I think he will be better suited to Aintree and we will look at one of the good races up there. I'd say we might try and get another run into him before then just to give him that bit more experience, but I'm chuffed to bits with what he has done today - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Watch Unibet Racing Post Postcast Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Fingle Bridge is not an easy horse to train - you can see how hard he hits the ground. He's a big boy and if he stays sound, he's got a bright future. I wanted to go for a Listed race at Exeter on February 9. He went badly left at Uttoxeter and I wanted to go right-handed with him to make sure it wasn't a problem, hence why he came here. It fitted in timing wise as well. He wants proper soft ground. He won't be running on good ground and won't be going anywhere near Cheltenham either - Olly Murphy, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely young horse who made a pleasing debut at Uttoxeter in October when second in a 2m bumper. He has done well since then and I had hoped to run in a Listed bumper at Ascot last week but the frost put paid to those plans. I think the horse who beat him on his debut could be very smart as I really rate my fellow, who is a gorgeous prospect. He'll have one or two more runs and then we'll put him away with a view to novice hurdling next term. 22-12-22

runners.name: Funiculi Funicula
runners.comment: Wide-margin winner of yard debut (2m1f, soft); 80-1, never sighted in the Supreme since
runners.spotlight: Returning from an absence when he made a successful yard debut at Clonmel (2m1f, soft) in January where he had a workout despite finishing well clear (main rival fell at the last); 80-1 and never sighted in the Supreme at Cheltenham since but he remains with potential.

stable_tour.quote: He came recommended from France and had some nice form over there. He's a nice type to go novice hurdling with. 25-11-24

runners.name: Good And Clever
runners.comment: Close 3rd in bumper at this meeting last year; third in two Grade 1 hurdles; more needed
runners.spotlight: Close third to Horaces Pearl in the Grade 2 bumper here last April; no match for Regent's Stroll on hurdle debut at Newbury and although he's been a creditable third in two Grade 1s since, on this track and at Leopardstown, he has his work cut out here and the drying ground spells danger.

stable_tour.quote: He came out of the Dublin Racing Festival really well and I'm very happy with him. We were going to go to Kelso last Saturday but they had no rain. He's in two races this week, one at Fontwell on Thursday and one at Exeter on Friday, just to see if the ground is soft. I might well just give him a spin round for a confidence boost. If not, we'll wait for Aintree. 05-03-25

runners.name: Honesty Policy
runners.breeder: H Fowler, A Frost & C Longsdon
runners.comment: Progressive winner of last two races; up in class but open to improvement at new trip
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on hurdle debut at Naas (2m, heavy) and that slog left no mark when he found plenty to win at Navan (1m7f) and in a 2m Leopardstown novice (yielding), doing well in the latter to reel in a useful bumper winner, despite needing to be switched; up in class but he's progressive and open to improvement over the new trip; yard has won the last three runnings.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Novice Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: I suppose we were all sweating coming down the home straight because Honesty Policy was stuck in a bit of a pocket for a while, but he got himself out of trouble and has actually won snug enough at the winning post. The softer the ground the better for him. It's lovely to get that win on the board and I'm sure Gordon will be aiming for the Final at the Punchestown Festival - Lisa O'Neill, stable representative of Gordon Elliot.

quotes.race: Navan Ford & Opel Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Honesty Policy is a nice horse. The further he goes the better. He's going in the right direction and he should make a nice chaser - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's not long with us and ran well in a point for Pat Doyle. We'll see where we stand with him in a couple of weeks, but I'd imagine he will start off in a bumper in a few weeks' time. 28-10-24

runners.name: Horaces Pearl
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Logis, J Ince Et Al
runners.comment: Won all five starts, including the bumper at this meeting in 2024; very promising hurdler
runners.spotlight: Has won all five starts, including the Grade 2 bumper at this meeting (good to soft) last year; has made an excellent transition to hurdles, jumping confidently when not turning a hair at Newbury (2m4f, soft) on latest start; looks more than ready for a go in Graded company as a hurdler.

quotes.race: Watch Weekend Winners Powered By BetVictor "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were worried about the rain this week, but once it started drying up I thought Horaces Pearl would have a chance - Matt Burford, joint-owner.

quotes.race: Bet Builder Boosts At Rhino.Bet Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with that and Horaces Pearl did it very well.There's no plans going forward because he's four from four, but there's always a long time between drinks. Everyone at home does a good job with him and when he turns up he's obviously got a big engine. Connor [Brace] gave him a lovely ride. He's done a lot of schooling at home, but he'd never run in a point-to-point and it was lovely to see him get better as the race went on. I think he'll stay further in time and he should be better in a better race. His jumping should improve - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys nhstallions.co.uk Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought with the ground being softer Horaces Pearl would go well as he won his two bumpers on soft ground. His Wincanton bumpers were good, and the way he did it from the back. He can probably step up to two and a half miles, whereas I think Tripoli Flyer will be fine over two miles. They have both schooled brilliantly - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Join The Harry Fry Racing Syndicate Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 2 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Horaces Pearl is a nice horse and he missed Cheltenham last month as he was not quite 100 per cent right. I said to Matt [Burford, co-owner] don't worry about Cheltenham, come back to Wincanton on Badger Beer day where he won before. We'll go to the Listed race at Ascot then go hurdling - Sally Randell, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Kappa Jy Pyke
runners.comment: Left clear for Punchestown win; tough task at Cheltenham since; may be similar story again
runners.spotlight: Turned over on hurdle debut but he took a healthy step forward when left clear by his main rival's late fall at Punchestown (2m1f, soft) in January; found the Turners at Cheltenham too tough since and so might this.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Acca Freeze Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was a nice performance. Kappa Jy Pyke built on Cork well in every sense, jumping-wise and the freshness was gone out of him with the benefit of that run. I thought he quickened up smartly down the straight. I was actually quite taken with him - Paul Townend, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: I'm keen to bring him over to Cheltenham. He's in the Supreme and the Turners. I'd say it will probably be the Turners, but we'll see. 5-2-25

runners.name: Koktail Divin
runners.comment: Suited by 2m4f and a convincing winner at Leopardstown latest; one of the better ones
runners.spotlight: Low-key effort over 2m on second hurdle start but he'd previously prevented a useful one from having it all his own way over this trip at Leopardstown after Christmas and the return to 2m4f there (also on yielding) paid off handsomely last month; one of the better ones.

quotes.race: Leopardstown Members Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Delighted with that. Koktail Divin had a lovely run at Christmas, I probably messed up and we were probably under the weather in January when I dropped back in trip but it was lovely to see him do that today.  We'll aim him at Aintree now - Henry de Bromhead, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Miami Magic
runners.comment: Useful effort in Grade 1 here on Boxing Day; needs more for the new trip
runners.spotlight: Romped through first two hurdle outings over 2m at Fakenham (good) and Kempton (good to soft) and he had enough firepower to bustle up a smart one in Grade 1 here (2m1f, soft) on Boxing Day; a subsequent defeat at Kempton suggests improvement will be needed for the new trip.

quotes.race: EBF Stallions "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I don't think I've had one as good as Miami Magic before. He literally does everything in a hack canter at home. I don't know how high he can fly but we'll have to look at the programme book a bit more now I would think. He won a point-to-point over two and half mile but shows a lot of speed. I'd had a sneaky look at the Formby (Grade 1 at Aintree on Boxing Day) before today as he's smart and we'll have to go somewhere quite nice after this - Stuart Edmunds, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Moon Phases
runners.comment: Modest bumper form and his second at Ayr on hurdle debut leaves him with it all to prove
runners.spotlight: Beat only one home in a Perth bumper and his second in an Ayr maiden hurdle in March leaves him with it all to prove in this company.

runners.name: Regents Stroll
runners.comment: Needs more than for two wins in relatively minor races but may do better for being hooded
runners.spotlight: Not the easiest to settle and although 2-4 in this sphere he was turned over by Fingle Bridge in an Exeter Listed race (2m, good to soft) in February before finding a soft option at Wincanton; now hooded; this is a tall order.

quotes.race: Salisbury Hospice Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Regent's Stroll has behaved a bit better today and he's learning. He jumped very well. People expect too much just because he cost plenty of money. There's loads of horses making that money and more privately. We're quite keen to go to Aintree but Harry wondered whether the occasion would just get to him a little bit. In his bumpers last year, he never picked the bridle up, he was chilled and a completely different beast to deal with. I think that's a little bit of the Walk In The Park in him. He's not unlike Clan Des Obeaux. Clan novice hurdling was not easy, keen and stupid. Eventually, when he did relax and he stayed, he won a load of races  - Paul Nicholls, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: trustatrader.com Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: He won't go now [to Cheltenham]. We'll just go and find a two-and-a-half-mile novice hurdle in the spring before going chasing with Regent's Stroll - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Challow Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I know full well Regent's Stroll is a very smart horse but he didn't run his race and he has to learn to relax. We have to get some experience into him in a lower grade so he learns how to race - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Play Coral "Racing-Super-Series" For Free "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Regent's Stroll has a lot of pace and I'd say he'll stay too. It's a long way off making any plans with him. I need to get some experience into him, but ultimately he'll make a lovely chaser one day. I was going to run him in the Challow, but we'll see what happens as he's not short of speed. He's got loads of scope and he's a big unit - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Goffs UK Spring Sale Bumper (An Open National Hunt Flat Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've always thought Regent's Stroll was very smart, but we were nervous about having to give most of them a stone. He's obviously very good and you couldn't be more impressed with that. He was doing his best work at the end and that would be it for the season - what more does he need to do? Who knows what the future holds, but I'd say he's the best bumper horse we have and if he hadn't been qualified for this race, he may have gone for a championship bumper at Cheltenham or Aintree - Charlie Davies, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'll run in the Challow as long as the ground isn't heavy. He won nicely at Newbury on his hurdling debut. I would have liked to have got two runs into him before going for this but we just haven't been able to. The Challow looks like it's going to be a hot race but we think he's well up to it. 20-12-24

runners.name: Lulamba
runners.comment: Wore down the favourite in the Triumph only to get nailed close home; redemption awaits
runners.spotlight: Headed the Triumph Hurdle betting before making a good all-round impression on British debut at Ascot (1m7f, good); he again raced freely, without overdoing it, when always prominent at Cheltenham (2m1f, good to soft) but there was plenty in reserve when he finally wore down the favourite, only to get nailed close home by a smart one off the Flat; redemption awaits.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: As Nico [De Boinville, jockey] said, the winner has come so late that Lulamba couldn't see him and therefore couldn't respond to him. We are only a baby, and that is only the third run of his life. He will have learnt an awful lot today. He was just a little untidy on the way around. He has had the fight that everyone expected and he fought his way back out of that. He is going to be lovely and you can see by the size of him he is not for this season. He has got a great temperament and a great attitude. He will have learnt more today than in all of his life I would say - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: BetMGM Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought we were facing a complete brick wall there when you think we were trying to give 10lb to some very high-class horses. It looked an impossible task and I was prepared to get beat today because of the hype, but we've got to eat humble pie a bit because the hype appeared to be correct. You don't want these horses hyped up before they run because you're just putting pressure on yourself and everybody therefore wants to knock you down. I read things about Lulamba doing a piece of work with Jonbon and leaving him standing still, but it just shows what happens with these hyped horses as that never happened. Nico just said he was very classy, very good. He jumps, travels, he has pace, he's just a very straightforward, very good horse - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a strong favourite for the Triumph on the strength of one run in France and one in England, but he did look very good at Ascot, very polished and extremely uncomplicated. He seems straightforward, schools well, doesn't pull and doesn't need to be pushed, and he's won on heavy ground and good ground. I'm sure something will happen to prove me wrong, but my gut feeling after Ascot was not to run again beforehand, so we go there full of hope. Punting-wise, I haven't had a bet at Cheltenham for about 30 years and I'm not about to start, but with him at 7-4 and Palladium at 16-1, I'd have to say they aren't that far apart in ability ? quite probably one's too short and one's too long. 16-2-25

1:20.race_name: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
1:20.going_detailed: National Course - GOOD TO SOFT; Mildmay Course - GOOD (GoingStick: Mildmay Chase 5.5, Mildmay Hurdle 5.3, Grand National course 5.3) (Watering)

runners.name: Maximilian
runners.comment: A top novice hurdler in 2022-23 but off until pulled up at Chepstow in February
runners.spotlight: One of the top staying novice hurdlers of the 2022-23 season, including second in C&D Grade 1, but not seen again until pulled up in a Chepstow handicap hurdle six weeks ago; can only be watched after that.

quotes.race: Winners Wear Cavani Sefton Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I wouldn't change anything. Maximilian has run a great race. That will be it for the season and we'll concentrate on next year now. He's a very exciting horse; second in a Grade One, and on another day? He's given the winner seven pounds, and it was a good try - Donald McCain, trainer.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett River Don Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I nearly walked away because Maximilian wasn't going but he just saves plenty for himself. We went down to Sandown, the ground was like glue and he hated it. He had a bit of blood in his nose but I think that was because he was hating the ground and not going. But he was still third in a Grade 2 and we've always had a lot of faith in him. But he's never going to do anything flash. I'm not a massive Cheltenham fan. Aintree is our muckheap and he's had a hard enough race today so I'd think that would be first choice. Donald McCain, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a very smart horse who looks every inch a chaser. He's coming back after missing the whole of last season with a knock. It was a bang rather than a strain and we went very carefully with him. The season before he won a Grade 2 novice hurdle and was second in a Grade 1, and I thought he was the best horse in that race at Aintree. He's back cantering away, but he's a little behind as we've gone quietly with him. He'll go novice chasing, hopefully starting back around Christmas. He's very good, so it's exciting for his many owners. 12-11-24

I have always thought he was well above average and he has done nothing to dampen my enthusiasm in his six career starts, with five wins. I was disappointed with his third at Sandown in the Grade 2 Winter Novices' Hurdle in December but he had his excuses as the ground was horrible. We raised him in trip last time at Doncaster for the Grade 2 River Don Novices' Hurdle and he got back on the winning trail in a race that looked pretty smart. He cruised up, but as ever as soon as he got a length up he thought to himself “that's enough”. But that is his way - he will never win by far, but so long as he keeps winning that does not matter. Before Doncaster I spoke to his owners and the consensus was that we would give Cheltenham a miss and head to Aintree. I am looking long term and I think Cheltenham is not going to help in that department. Of course we could change our minds nearer the time, but I am minded to head to Aintree at this stage. 09-02-23

runners.name: Jeriko Du Reponet
runners.comment: Good placed efforts around 3m last twice, latterly second in Pertemps Final at Cheltenham
runners.spotlight: First six rules starts were over 2m but he proved suited by the step up to around 3m the last twice, third to the reopposing Catch Him Derry at Exeter before finishing a place in front of that rival when second to stablemate Doddiethegreat in the Pertemps Final at Cheltenham (good to soft) in first-time cheekpieces (retained); a 5lb rise shouldn't prevent another prominent showing.

quotes.race: Boodles Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jeriko Du Reponet is a very good horse and I really believed he'd canter round today and we'd be talking about coming back here the Henry VIII but I don't think we'll do that for the time being. We've got to go away and regroup. We can always get surprised and fooled, and I'm afraid the horse has done that to us today in every sense. He's 100 per cent and pulled up completely sound. I just think it's a bizarre chapter of circumstances that have contributed to this. I'm sorry, but no one is going to be more disappointed than our team. We've got to correct it and we will - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: SBK Supreme Trial Rossington Main Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The race wasn't run to suit Jeriko Du Reponet. We went too slow and it turned into a sprint. He didn't jump great early - they were going too slow. He was a bit sloppy. I think that's because he thought he was just going for a school round. But when we picked it up into the straight he was electric over the last three - Mark Walsh, jockey.

quotes.race: Coral Committed To Safer Gambling 'Introductory' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jeriko Du Reponet is obviously very smart. We don't know what he's beat, but he's done it as good as he can. I wouldn't like to say about his trip but today he felt speedy enough and he was fine on that ground - James Bowen, jockey.

quotes.race: Coral Get Closer To The Action "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We all know that wasn't the greatest novice hurdle run at Newbury, but Jeriko Du Reponet is the most beautiful horse - he's stunning. His attitude to life is very good and he's a lovely, lovely horse and I'm very lucky to have him - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has enormous potential. He won his sole point-to-point in Ireland before joining us last season and showing his talent - he won his first three races before being pulled up at Cheltenham. He really is the most gorgeous big five-year-old and I think he'll almost certainly go novice chasing this season where maybe over a bit further than two miles he could and should be top-class. 22-10-24

runners.name: Rushmount
runners.comment: Going right way, scoring readily at Thurles last month; probably more to come from him
runners.spotlight: Going the right way, building on his eyecatching fourth in 3m Listed handicap at Dublin Racing Festival with a ready success over 2m6f at Thurles (good) last month; a really smart handicap performance will be needed from this mark but there's probably more to come from him.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Money Back On Every Race At Cheltenham Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rushmount travelled very easy. When I opened him up at the top of the straight he duly obliged. He ran a cracker at Leopardstown and Jonathan minds them and gets the best out of them - Brian Hayes, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Act Of Authority
runners.comment: Consistent type who goes well for Lewis Saunders; second at Cheltenham Festival latest
runners.spotlight: Succesful twice around 2m4f (good to soft/good) under Lewis Saunders in November and has run with credit in defeat since, notably with his second of 24 to Wodhooh in the Martin Pipe at Cheltenham (extended 2m4f, good to soft) 22 days ago; raised 5lb but he did come over 4l clear of the third; tackles 3m for the first time under rules now; respected.

quotes.race: Peak Cap & Pearls Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was never in any doubt for Act Of Authority. He could possibly have a break now and then step up in grade - Colin Asquith, owner's representative.

quotes.race: Trustatrader Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Act Of Authoirty is a classy little horse. He's a bit of a wimp and when the two closed in on me in the straight, I thought, 'We're done here' but he showed an extra gear and I think he's way better than what he's off [ratings wise]. We've always thought he was a nice prospect but has just taken time to get to where he is. He showed an amazing turn of foot up that hill - Lewis Saunders, jockey.

quotes.race: Bowel Cancer Screening Programme Saves Lives Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Act Of Authority is not the biggest and I don't think he'll be seen at his best on winter ground. He's a horse for the autumn and the spring so we'll look at a sexier target for him. Aintree may come a bit too soon but we could look at Ayr or the Cheltenham April meeting. He didn't turn up last time, he was beaten early on. He's a funny horse, he has a kink in him. It's hard with two penalties so that was a good performance - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Paul & Janet Mizen Wedding Anniversary Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Act Of Authority didn't run badly at Cheltenham where I still don't think he ran his race. I hate riding horses like that, but his best performances have been when ridden positively. We'll have a go at a nice handicap and probably go up in trip - Olly Murphy, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's had some good runs this season, winning twice in quick succession in the autumn, and we'd be hopeful the trip and track would suit him well in the Martin Pipe. 19-2-25

He came up against some nice horses last season and got off to a good start over hurdles at Bangor but was found out in Graded company at Cheltenham last week. He's never worked the house down at home and saves his best for the track. I don't think he'll improve loads for a fence, but he's one to look forward to. 01-11-23

runners.name: Kamsinas
runners.comment: Looked suited to 3m when second at Doncaster latest; unexposed as a stayer
runners.spotlight: Started this second season hurdling with a win here (2m4f, good) and creditable fourth at Haydock (2m3f, soft); bounced back quickly from a lesser run at Ascot in January when second to Patriotik (placed in strong Uttoxeter handicap since) at Doncaster on his first attempt at 3m under rules; the first-time tongue-tie he wore at Doncaster is retained; unexposed as a stayer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We'll probably go the same route as Crambo last year and go to Haydock now. We stepped Kamsinas up in trip all last year and he danced every dance and turned up nearly every day. He's a lovely horse, who's so straightforward, and has amazing will to win - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet More Extra Place Races Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Kamsinas is a personal favourite, a little pocket rocket, and if you could take out what he has and put into other horses you'd be happy. He has a will to win. We told Jack to drop in and hunt around and he went to sleep, and toughed it out well, although I was a bit worried when Dan Skelton's horse came upsides. He's tough and was like a handicapper against novices. He's won a Grade 2 and the ground was bottomless in the Grade 1 at Aintree, while things were too quick for him in the Betfair Hurdle. Today was logical to step up in trip and we'll try to find a race for him, maybe at one of the festivals, before we go chasing next season - Dave Crosse, owners' representative.

quotes.race: Betfair Racing Podcasts Newton Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Kamsinas had been working well and I thought he was very unlucky at Cheltenham, he got blocked coming down the hill and he ran on very well. What I loved about it was even though he'd had a fair old bang and a rough ride he threw himself over the last. He's got a great will to win. He loves being a racehorse. We'll sit down and decide where we're best going. It's a long road to Cheltenham in March and there will be plenty of races before then, hopefully - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Lowes Garage Home Of £30 MOT's EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That race did fall apart a bit. I rode Kamsinas at Kelso on good ground and even though he won I didn't get the same feel as I got from him there. He's exciting - Paddy Brennan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: We really love him. His form was franked in the Greatwood when Lookaway, who he finished second to at Cheltenham last month, ran really well to finish runner-up. I think he was a bit unlucky that day as his run got blocked but he put things right at Haydock on Saturday. I love the way he hit the line. He doesn't work like a two-miler at home but he was quick round there and travelled very well. It was a competitive race and I was very impressed with him. I suppose the obvious place to go now would be the Tolworth at Aintree on Boxing Day. 27-11-23

A rock star of a horse, I've never seen a horse with a will to win like him. He won three times last year as a novice hurdler, including a Grade 2 at Haydock. After that he went for the Grade 1 Formby Novices' Hurdle at Aintree, where he ran respectably but didn't go on the ground. He got stage fright in the Betfair Hurdle, which told us he needed to go up in trip, and then he won a novice with a double penalty at Kempton. He's off a mark of 131 and he'll go to Aintree on Sunday and then step up in trip in the valuable staying handicap hurdle at Haydock on Betfair Chase day. He's going down the same route as his trainer Fergal O'Brien did with Crambo last season. He could jump fences at some point, but Haydock is the target and we'll see from there. 24-10-24

runners.name: Whatcouldhavebeen
runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner; shaped as if return to 3m will suit when fifth of 16 over 2m4f latest
runners.spotlight: Four wins divided between Flat and hurdles; well held in January on return from a break but more like it when fifth of 16 over 2m4f at Fairyhouse (soft) six weeks ago, shaping as if this return to 3m will suit.

runners.name: Dartan
runners.comment: 2nd over fences last August but well held in hurdle/Flat race since; off for 188 days
runners.spotlight: Eight-time winner, latest in a Bellewstown handicap hurdle in summer 2023; returned from a break to finish second on Galway chase debut last August but well held in handicaps over hurdles and on the Flat subsequently; first outing for six months; others arrive with much more obvious claims.

quotes.race: DMG Media Irish EBF Handicap
quotes.quote: Dartan had some good form last year, but had a bit of a setback so we let him off for the rest of the summer. I had faith in him and knew he was good enough to win. I told Declan to make plenty of use of him and he gave him a great ride. He stays well and he is a nice horse - Matt Smith, trainer.

quotes.race: SP Or Better Guaranteed With Tote Handicap
quotes.quote: Declan (McDonogh, rider) said this was as short as you would want to be going with Dartan. He was only getting going in the last 100 yards and Declan liked him. He has a great attitude, just switches off and relaxes. He can be a bit slowly away so probably two miles would suit him and he can just take his time. Declan thinks he would be good enough for some of those better staying handicaps - Matthew Smith, trainer.

runners.name: Barry Lyndon
runners.comment: Better than ever with 2m4f win latest and shapes as if he'll prove effective around 3m
runners.spotlight: Better than ever with tongue-tie added to his regular cheekpieces (combination retained) when proving too strong for his 15 rivals at Fairyhouse (2m4f, soft) six weeks ago; his other wins came on good/good to yielding so a return to drier ground won't be an issue; below-par fifth on his only attempt around 3m but he shapes as if he'll prove fully effective over this trip.

quotes.race: Punchestown's Fittest Club Sunday June 11th Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Barry Lyndon is a lovely horse. He loved that ground but his jumping let him down. He hit the line strong and if his jumping gets better he can improve - Conor Maxwell, rider.

runners.name: Bo Zenith
runners.comment: Never going when Imperial Cup favourite and now up markedly in trip with cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Went close in Grade 1 juvenile hurdle at this meeting for Gary Moore two years ago; returned from a long absence with a couple of encouraging handicap efforts (2m1f/2m3f) in December/January but never going when favourite for Imperial Cup at Sandown last month; on the back of that he steps up markedly in trip and is also fitted with the cheekpieces which have worked well on a few of the yard's runners recently, notably the Pertemps Final one-two; no shock were he to bounce back with a bang.

quotes.race: Jewson Anniversary 4-Y-O Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought we had it but Bo Zenith's head was up on the line unfortunately. I'm gutted but he has still run a blinder. He is a proper horse and he will be a really good two and a half-mile chaser. We always knew we were going to have to kick turning in as he has got a bit more of a staying pedigree and Zenta had a bit more speed than us - Olly Harris, owner.

quotes.race: Betfred Victor Ludorum Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a very nice performance from Bo Zenith. I think they drew a line through his run at Sandown and said he'd come on for it and they were proved right. It's only his third go, he was a little bit green at stages and he'll come on a bundle mentally. The further he went, the better he seemed to go - Tom Cannon, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He was a short-head second for Gary Moore in the Grade 1 juvenile hurdle at Aintree in 2023 before missing last season and has come here to continue his career. He's undoubtedly a very exciting prospect as long as he can stay in one piece. He's a very impressive gelding who will no doubt make a chaser in time, but I think we'll stay over hurdles and see how far we can go as he's still a young horse. 22-10-24

runners.name: Bill Joyce
runners.comment: 2m4f Grade 2 novice winner; up in trip for handicap debut with tongue-tie added
runners.spotlight: Won well at Carlisle and Sandown (Grade 2 on soft) in first two starts over hurdles and creditable third in the Grade 1 Challow at Newbury and a Grade 2 at Cheltenham (both extended 2m4f); steps up to 3m for the first time under rules for handicap debut; a tongue-tie is another first.

quotes.race: Betfair Winter Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bill Joyce is a chaser in the making, so anything he does now is just a bonus. We'll enjoy today and just think about what comes next later - AJ O'Neill, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Antonia Reid Memorial Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bill Joyce is a lovely, big horse and we always definitely thought he'd go well for an obstacle. He was probably not really a bumper horse, but he was strong enough to be able to compete last season. We're delighted with the way he started and hopefully he'll continue that way - A J O'Neill, joint-trainer.

stable_tour.quote: The Champion Bumper was probably a step too far, but he won his two earlier bumpers and the form of those is stacking up quite well. He likes soft ground, jumps well and made the perfect start over hurdles at Carlisle on Sunday. There is a three-mile Grade 2 at Cheltenham's December meeting that Shanagh Bob won after one run last season, but we'll just wait and see. He's classy and I hope he can step up to that grade at some stage during the season. He'll get three miles no problem and will be a proper chaser next season. 06-11-24

runners.name: Push The Button
runners.comment: Stayed on for creditable sixth in Martin Pipe, shaping as if return to 3m will suit
runners.spotlight: His record of late is a bit mixed but he stayed on from the rear for a creditable sixth (Act Of Authority second) of 24 in the Martin Pipe at Cheltenham (extended 2m4f), shaping as if this return to 3m will suit.

quotes.race: Olly Murphy Racing Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: To see your homebred win is just fantastic. I've bred some nice horses from his dam Tara Rose, but Push The Button is by far the best. He just keeps improving and has achieved plenty for a four-year-old - Jimmy Wenman, owner-breeder.

stable_tour.quote: He was a bit disappointing at Exeter recently after a great run at Windsor. We probably ran him too soon, but two and a half miles on the New track for the Martin Pipe will suit him well. 17-2-25

runners.name: Timmy Tuesday
runners.owner: David Barnard & Nick Courtney & Cillian Moran
runners.comment: Has won both handicap starts around 2m4f and trying 3m should suit; interesting runner
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-2 in handicaps when comfortably on top over 2m4f at Down Royal (good), travelling strongly and drawing clear after the last despite hanging left (did same at Exeter the time before); the return to a left-handed track should suit, as should the step up to 3m; very interesting contender.

stable_tour.quote: He shaped with real promise the first day for us at Cork, but ran out next time at Punchestown. He's definitely got ability in there and hopefully we can get it out of him. 28-10-24

runners.name: Building Bridges
runners.comment: In good form last summer/autumn on Flat and over hurdles and has won when fresh before
runners.spotlight: Struck on the Flat at Bellewstown (1m4f) last summer and went in again over hurdles at Perth (3m) in September; another creditable effort when third on the Flat at Thurles in October (all good ground); first outing for six months but he's won after a similar break before.

quotes.race: Randox Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Building Bridges was going well at home. He's never went from the front for us, we always thought he was too keen. Today we said we'd give it a rattle and it worked a treat - Oran McGill, jockey.

runners.name: Park Of Kings
runners.comment: In good form in competitive events around 2m4f; shapes as if should be as effective at 3m
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-18 over hurdles, the most recent win in October; ended 2024 with good seconds in 2m4f Listed handicaps at Naas and Leopardstown (both good to yielding) and another creditable effort when fifth of 24 in the Martin Pipe at Cheltenham, rallying having been outpaced; didn't seem to quite stay 3m on his only attempt but that was on soft ground at Leopardstown and he should see it out better under these conditions; likely to be in the mix.

quotes.race: Golf Societies @ Gowran Park Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Park Of Kings jumped well and won well enough. He's only six and we'll look for something similar. I wouldn't like the ground to deteriorate too much. He wears a tongue-tie for a reason - Paul Nolan, trainer.

runners.name: Dinons
runners.breeder: S C E A De Maulepaire
runners.comment: In good form in first half of the season but returns from six months off in a hot race
runners.spotlight: Pulled up over fences last summer but has form figures of 112 in 2m7f handicap hurdles since returning from a long absence; only nosed out off 2lb lower last time but it was back in October and this is a tough race in which to return from six months off.

quotes.race: Geary's Garage Ltd John Deere Main Dealers Rated Chase
quotes.quote: It was a great pot to win. I was toying with the idea of running him in the Munster National, he had a nice weight in it, but I was concerned about the ground. We couldn't leave this race behind us. He might go to Cheltenham in two week's time, he won there last year, and we'll give him a break afterwards to bring him back for those handicap chases next year - Gordon Elliott, trainer of Dinons

quotes.race: Barrow Novice Chase
quotes.quote: He's a good horse and he knows how to win. He doesn't ever do anything fancy but he keeps on winning. He's a nice horse to have. Davy said he probably should have let him stride on but Victoria Bay probably isn't a bad mare of Colin Bowe's either but all he can do is win. We could even step him up to three miles and that could even suit him better - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: BetVictor Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Dinons is a big horse and was always going to be better over a fence. He was brilliant and you couldn't fault him - Jack Kennedy, rider.

quotes.race: Randox Health Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Dinons is a big, honest galloping horse. He is a chaser in the making. I wouldn't be surprised to see him back over here again for a Graded three-mile race. He gallops and stays and if his jumping gets slicker he could be a very nice horse. He has won five races this summer and don't owe us too much - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Edinburgh Gin 2018 Leading Horsemen Awards Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Dinons did it well again and will go for a staying novice race at Cheltenham next month - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: He has improved for a jump compared to his bumper form and Gordon will find plenty more races for him to win -  Davy Russell, rider

quotes.race: Paul Byron Shoes Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He was unlucky last time when he looked to have it in the bag and fell. He won't have too much more this year and I'd imagine we'll try to find a little hurdle race for him somewhere and he'll go chasing next year. He's a staying type, a big good looking horse who'll need plenty of time. I'd say he'd go on any sort of ground - Gordon Elliott, trainer of Dinons

runners.name: Nurse Susan
runners.comment: Off for 14 months prior to well held in the Martin Pipe and Harry Skelton looks elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 8yo mare who won her first two handicap hurdles in the mud last winter; off 14 months, prominent for a long way in the Martin Pipe at Cheltenham, suggesting she retains her ability; entitled to come on for the run but Harry Skelton prefers Catch Him Derry; wears first-time cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Watch Racing TV Now Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We thought a lot of Nurse Susan at home but you just never know going to the track for the first time. She's something a bit special, hopefully. She's a proper National Hunt mare, who's only four, and whatever she does this year will be a bonus - Harry Skelton, rider.

stable_tour.quote: She's had a couple of setbacks along the way, which has been frustrating, but she's a high-class mare. I don't think I'm going to have time to get a run into her before, but I'll be doing lots and lots with her at home and it might be that we end up running in the Mares' Hurdle. 10-2-25

runners.name: Double Powerful
runners.comment: Progressive, winning six on spin before good placed efforts last twice; respected up at 3m
runners.spotlight: Very progressive hurdler who won six in a row between March and November and has advanced his RPRs in defeat when placing over 2m5f at Ascot and Kempton this winter; this strong traveller is a must for the shortlist now stepping up to 3m for the first time under rules.

quotes.race: Lycetts Insurance Brokers Conditional Jockeys Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hdl Series Qual')
quotes.quote: Double Powerful is a one-dimensional kind of horse and you have to ride him like that. When you ask him, he comes alive so quickly and is one of those horses you always think has got there too soon. He stuck his head down today and it was a good performance - Dylan Johnston, rider.

runners.name: Jipcot
runners.comment: Never involved in Coral Cup but in good form prior to that, including at 3m
runners.spotlight: Had wind surgery before winning in fine style at Newbury (extended 2m4f, good to soft) in December, with creditable in-frame efforts over 3m at Windsor and Haydock on his next two starts; never involved in the Coral Cup over 2m5f at Cheltenham but this hold-up performer has claims now he's returning to 3m.

quotes.race: Coral Racing Club Join For Free Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Kielan has given Jipcot a lovely ride. He got him settled and was jumping lovely, so it's great to see it work out for everyone. The Megsons have been very patient with the horse and hopefully he can keep improving. He has plenty of quirks, so I don't think we'll ever stop learning about him, as he definitely has ideas of his own - AJ O'Neill, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Richard Howard Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Jipcot is a bit of a hothead to train and it's quite obvious the way to ride him is with a tongue-tie and a hood. He'll have an entry now for next weekend in the Imperial Cup. I think he'll actually be good for coming out again quickly. I always wanted to run him in the Imperial Cup but he wouldn't have got in off his handicap mark [of 117]. With a 7lb penalty he will and this was our last chance - Ben Pauling, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He looked like he needed it on his first run for us at Ffos Las and should strip fitter next time. He was third in the Imperial Cup last season and there's a race for him back at Sandown on Sunday. On soft ground I think there should be a nice handicap hurdle in him. 06-11-24

runners.name: Catch Him Derry
runners.comment: Excellent third in Pertemps at Cheltenham and top yard has won this three times since 2019
runners.spotlight: Gained a fourth handicap hurdle success when roaring back to form with a clearcut win at Exeter (2m7f, good to soft; Jeriko Du Reponet third) in February; backed that up with a fine third (Jeriko Du Reponet second) of 24 to Doddiethegreat in the Pertemps Final at Cheltenham (3m, good to soft), faring best of those held up; yard seeking a fourth win in this since 2019.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Final Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Going to the last for a moment I thought we were going to get there, but Catch Him Derry has run so well and taken his owners on a phenomenal journey. If you look back where he started off, which was 96, he has come a long way. He looked very good at Ayr on okay ground and today was a career best on okay ground. While he is effective on slower ground you can't say he didn't act on it today as he has run unbelievably well - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Pertemps Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Catch Him Derry just needed it at Cheltenham last time, which is unusual for one of ours, but we've done a lot of work with him since and he's improved. Hopefully we can get into the race at Cheltenham - Harry Skelton, jockey.

quotes.race: Celebrating David Freeman's 35 Years Service Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Major Fortune and Catch Him Derry [his two winners]. They won a few races each last year. I thought they'd both need the run today and this was the first chance I've had to run them on some slower ground because it's been flooded down here the last few meetings. They were both very much suited by the ground, but hopefully they can continue to improve. It's early season form on a testing surface so I'm not sure what we'll do with them next, but they're going the right way - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Get Home Safe With Thistle Cabs Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The pair of them pulled clear last time and it was obviously good form. Catch Him Derry has come an awful long way. He was a bit of a wayward baby but he hasn't half made up for it. He'll have a holiday and he'll stay hurdling next season, he'll still get in a 0-120 and we'll go quietly - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He got the hang of things last year on soft ground and made a very pleasing comeback at Newton Abbot, although you wouldn't know quite what the form's worth. He's progressive for sure, loves a staying trip and could go to Haydock for a £100,000 handicap hurdle on November 23. 12-11-24

runners.name: Deep Cave

prev_owners.owner: C B Woods & Mr N Doolin

runners.comment: Fourth to Titan Discovery at Windsor (3m) in January but a lesser run at Sandown since
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish and ex-French; best effort for new yard when fourth of 12 to Titan Discovery at Windsor (3m, soft) in January but he needs to shrug off a lesser run at Sandown since.

quotes.race: Savills Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Deep Cave is a lovely horse who we always liked. Rachael gave him a super ride. In fairness to Ciaran Murphy, he recommended him to us after winning his point-to-point. Davy Russell felt he went a bit soon the last day so we said we'd take our time here. We'll look to the spring and see what's there - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A nice young horse that I like. He's been doing things nicely at home and we'll find him a suitable maiden hurdle over the next few weeks. 14-11-22

Having been a good second of 22 on his debut at Punchestown, he opened his account at Leopardstown over Christmas and that form has been franked since. We raised his sights last time for a Grade 1 at the Dublin Racing Festival and he ran another promising race. He's likely to be saved for Punchestown. 01-03-23

runners.name: Shanagh Bob
runners.comment: Well behind Jeriko Du Reponet and Catch Him Derry in the Pertemps Final; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Good effort in first-time cheekpieces when second in Huntingdon handicap hurdle (3m1f, soft) in January but two lesser efforts have followed, latterly when well behind in the Pertemps Final.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle (Registered As The Bristol Novices' Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This is the road to the Albert Bartlett, but there is a long way to go before that. I thought this was a crazy step, but it has worked, and Shanagh Bob will now have to stay in this company from here on in. If he can make the Albert Bartlett that would be lovely. You'd hope we would have all bases covered (in the novice hurdle division). We are lucky that they are a good bunch - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Bookedit Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with that, as it's not ideal conditions for Shanagh Bob being around a sharp track. I could never get him rolling until after the last. He's a big horse for a track such as this and he only got going when I gave him a flick after the last. He was going places when we hit the line and a stiffer track and longer trip may be his thing going forward - Sean Bowen, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He's a pretty laid-back fella who doesn't quite open his eyes up. He jumps beautifully at home, but he needs to be a bit sharper than he was at Uttoxeter. 23-12-24

runners.name: Navajo Indy
runners.breeder: Natton House Thoroughbreds & Mr G Bishop
runners.owner: M Baker, K Ibberson And H Pearman

prev_owners.owner: C & M Baker, K Ibberson, H Pearman

runners.comment: Off bridle early when in frame in strong 2m races last twice, so much longer trip may suit
runners.spotlight: Won the Gerry Feilden at Newbury (2m, good to soft) in November; creditable in-frame efforts have followed in strong 2m handicaps at Windsor and Newbury but he was off the bridle a fair way out on both occasions, making him an interesting candidate for this major step up in trip; cheekpieces removed.

quotes.race: Coral Racing Club Intermediate Handicap Hurdle (Reg' As The Gerry Feilden) (Premier Handicap) (GBB)
quotes.quote: We had the window to run Navajo Indy at Bangor, and it's been like that all season. You have to take the opportunity, but we'll see what the handicapper does. I think the horse mentally has come up so much. I was thrilled with his demeanour. He was so professional and very relaxed - Tom Symonds, trainer.

5:35.race_name: Weatherbys nhstallions.co.uk Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
5:35.going_detailed: National Course - GOOD TO SOFT; Mildmay Course - GOOD (GoingStick: Mildmay Chase 5.5, Mildmay Hurdle 5.3, Grand National course 5.3) (Watering)

runners.name: Blofeld
runners.comment: Won by over 7l at Ayr but beat only four rivals and the ground was heavy
runners.spotlight: Out of a half-sister to Irish National winner Commanche Court; could do no more than win by over 7l on his debut at Ayr but beat only four rivals and the ground was heavy; may lack the gears for a test of this nature.

stable_tour.quote: He's always been a standout among John Wade's young horses. He's a half-brother to the Listed bumper winner Lilting Verse and we've protected him a bit - he's a big horse and we've brought him along steadily. But he's nice and shows plenty. He's got a lovely stride and a great way of going about him and he'll go for a bumper. 16-10-24

runners.name: Camberwell
runners.comment: The form of his Carlisle win isn't flashy and this looks a big ask
runners.spotlight: Only fifth in his one point start; Irish raider who was sent to Carlisle for his rules debut (soft; 8-1) and responded well for pressure to win going away; however, that form isn't flashy and this looks a big ask.

runners.name: Crackerjacque
runners.comment: Heavy-ground Sandown winner; this race offers a different examination altogether
runners.spotlight: From the family of the stable's smart staying chaser Sam Brown and this 5yo kept on best to win on heavy ground at Sandown two months ago (form has been franked); has a bright future but this race offers a different examination altogether.

runners.name: Destination Dubai
runners.comment: Has posted RPRs that suggest he could hold his own at this higher level
runners.spotlight: Strong at the finish to win at Hereford (good to soft) and Warwick (good), latterly in a first-time tongue-tie on stable debut; scopey 6yo who should progress further and has posted RPRs that suggest he could hold his own at this higher level.

runners.name: Edward Sexton
runners.comment: Won well at Fontwell last time but wouldn't be an obvious one to follow up in this company
runners.spotlight: Ridden by David Dunsdon in all his races and a shade of odds-on when comfortably accounting for his four rivals at Fontwell the final time (1m5f, good); he wouldn't be an obvious one to follow up in this company.

runners.name: El Cairos
runners.comment: His fifth at Cheltenham sets the standard and he could easily have finished closer
runners.spotlight: Recruited for 200,000euros after winning an Irish maiden point (3m, yielding) last April; won easily at Newbury (good) and held his own in the Champion Bumper at Cheltenham, finishing a 5l fifth but unlucky not to be closer (met with late interference); that form sets the standard and, seemingly not short of speed, this track should suit him well.

quotes.race: British Horse Society Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: El Cairos was impressive and he's a nice horse. He's always shown that at home, but the proof is in the pudding here today and it was a rare turn of foot - Gary Moore, trainer.

runners.name: Fountains Blenhein
runners.comment: Made all at Fontwell (won by 6l) but this will be a very different ball game
runners.spotlight: Fourth in a point bumper; showed the right attitude when making all for a 6l success at Fontwell (good to soft) but this is a very different ball game and he'll improve for longer trips further down the line.

runners.name: Gaelic Pride
runners.comment: This represents a huge rise in class after beating average opposition at Fontwell
runners.spotlight: His form in Irish points was no great shakes but he fetched £50,000 after winning at the fourth attempt; this represents a huge rise in class from beating average opposition at Fontwell (soft).

stable_tour.quote: He was bought recently and looks fairly good value now off Denis Murphy, who we've had great success from in the past. I've loved him since he came here. He had four runs in points, but there were reasons he wasn't beaten that far. He's just been a joy to train. He's very easy and works well without being flashy. I thought he'd go very well at Fontwell when he won. He went round nicely and he's going to have a very bright future. We'll probably give him one more bumper run before the end of the season and then we'll go hurdling next season. 05-03-25

runners.name: Green Splendour
runners.comment: Needs to improve on his fifth at Leopardstown but possibly still a work in progress
runners.spotlight: Stable last won this in 2016; won a traditionally warm bumper at Leopardstown over Christmas (yielding) and did his best work late in the day when beaten just over 3l in a Grade 2 there in February (soft; just behind Koktail Brut); the second and third horses last time didn't disgrace the form at Cheltenham, finishing seventh and eighth respectively (El Cairos was fifth); needs to find more, clearly, but that's feasible.

runners.name: Kilwaughter
runners.comment: Bought for £120,000 after winning an Irish bumper; stable's bumper horses are going well
runners.spotlight: Pulled clear with a subsequent winner at Down Royal in December (2m1f, good to yielding; 12-1) and changed hands for £120,000 the following month; could be interesting for a yard that's had a fine season with its bumper horses (5-10) and there have been once-raced winners of this race.

runners.name: Koktail Brut
runners.comment: Solid fourth in a Grade 2 at Leopardstown and has a nice bit of experience behind him
runners.spotlight: Limitations seemingly exposed since impressing at Fairyhouse in early December and he had no excuses when fourth in a Grade 2 at Leopardstown as he was favourably positioned throughout; lines of form from that race give him a bit to find with El Cairos but he's respected.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "Bet Builder On Self Service Betting Terminals" (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: I'd say Koktail Brut is a nice horse. We thought we had a few nice ones at home and that was a good performance. He's a bit faster than his half-brother Gevrey and shows a bit of class. I'd imagine we'll look for a Graded bumper - Gordon Elliott, trainer

stable_tour.quote: A wide-margin point winner who is a half-brother to plenty of nice horses, including Gevrey. He moves well and he'll be ready to start off in a bumper soon. 28-10-24

runners.name: Le Labo
runners.comment: Won on good ground at Thurles and now a rare British bumper runner for Joseph O'Brien
runners.spotlight: Out of unraced half-sister to Champion Hurdle winner Binocular; overcame his inexperience to win going away at Thurles (good) and, while improvement is necessary for this, he will be his trainer's first bumper runner in Britain for five years; respected.

runners.name: Mossy Fen Road
runners.comment: Impressed in both his wins; in good hands and impossible to gauge how smart he might be
runners.spotlight: Well bred; odds-on when making most to win his Irish point (heavy) and again strong in the market when emerging from off the pace to collect stylishly in a Wetherby bumper (soft); in good hands and it's impossible to gauge how smart he might be.

runners.name: Quaviste
runners.comment: Huntingdon winner with a lot to find on the figures but he's promising
runners.spotlight: 90,000euros 3yo; justified market confidence by only a neck at Huntingdon (good to soft; 2-1) but was good value for his narrow winning margin having been settled out the back, and the runner-up won easily next time; has a lot to find on the figures but he's promising.

runners.name: Scope To Improve
runners.comment: Impressed in a point and again when strong through the line to collect at Naas
runners.spotlight: Impressive point winner who hit the line strongly when the clearcut winner of a Naas bumper in December (good to yielding), posting a smart RPR in the process; the last two winners of this race were returning from over 100 days off the track; interesting.

runners.name: Storming George
runners.comment: Didn't beat a lot at Doncaster but won well; connections won this in 2022 with Lookaway
runners.spotlight: 25-1 at Doncaster but well on top in the closing stages despite a troubled run; the placed horses have since done little for the form but he's clearly useful and connections won this three years ago with Lookaway.

runners.name: Swingin Safari

prev_owners.owner: Mrs T Hyde & Mrs T P Hyde & Mrs Paul Shanahan

runners.comment: Limitations were seemingly exposed here in December (Listed) and he needs to step up
runners.spotlight: Hardly impressive in a four-runner race at Wincanton in November (good) and duly came up short in a Listed event here the following month, though in fairness he wasn't the only one left trailing behind a very smart winner; looks vulnerable unless he can raise his game.

stable_tour.quote: He was bought at the sales in Ireland in May, having finished second on his only start in a well-contested Ballinrobe bumper. The plan is to give him another run in a bumper for experience some time this month, as he's only four, and then go novice hurdling. He looks a decent prospect. 04-11-24

runners.name: Frontier Prince
runners.comment: Will need to be seen in a different light if he's to follow up his Kempton win on soft
runners.spotlight: Stable won this last year with a sharp improver and this gelding will need to be seen in a different light if he's to follow up his Kempton win on soft ground (produced an ordinary RPR); furthermore, this is a tough test for 4yos with plenty having come up short in the last decade.

runners.name: Our Boy Stan
runners.breeder: N J Henderson And Mrs S A Aston
runners.comment: Workmanlike Kempton winner; looks more of a galloper than a quickener
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to dual Imperial Cup winner Go Dante; second in a Cheltenham Listed race on his debut and readily went one better at Kempton; looks more of a galloper than a quickener and his age group doesn't have a good record in this race.

runners.name: Unjeu Royal
runners.comment: It wasn't a strong field that he beat in workmanlike fashion at Southwell
runners.spotlight: It wasn't a strong field that he beat in workmanlike fashion at Southwell (good to soft); can win more races but this is unlikely to be one of them.

2:40.race_name: Val And Kath Bollado Memorial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
2:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.4) (Watering)

runners.name: Genois
runners.comment: Won at Wetherby in November on second stable start but form has gone the wrong way since
runners.spotlight: Won at Wetherby (extended 2m3f, good) in November on second stable start and now 2lb lower; however, form has gone the wrong way since and he's been pulled up/tailed off the last twice; a major turnaround is required.

quotes.race: Each Way Extra At bet365 Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Genois had plenty of form and a good first run for Jonjo. He stepped up on that and it was a nice prize to win. He's so straightforward, you can do anything you want on him - Sean Bowen, jockey.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Livestream UK & Irish Racing On The App Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Genois is a nice horse. The nicer ground today suited him. He'll get further and we might end up going to Punchestown with him, but he's a real chaser down the line - Enda Bolger, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: For a £40,000 race it was probably a weak affair that he won at Wetherby on Friday, but he did it nicely and I'd imagine something like the Sir Peter O'Sullevan Memorial Handicap Chase at Newbury would suit him quite nicely. If he kept improving he might be a grand horse for the Topham in in the spring. 06-11-24

runners.name: Special Rate
runners.comment: Close 2nd of 4 to Cerendipity over 2m7f here latest; should be fine now back down in trip
runners.spotlight: Won seven times over hurdles/fences last season, including on good ground, and he returned to form with a close second of four to Cerendipity here (2m7f, good to soft) three weeks ago; he should be fine now back down in trip and could be bang there once more.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Independent Family Owned Bookmaker Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Special Rate jumped brilliant. I let him run to the front down the back, I thought he'll stay anyway and he's kept galloping - Ross Chapman, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Choosethenews
runners.comment: Won this last year; failed to stay 4m1f in the Eider last time; could play a leading role
runners.spotlight: Won this last year (heavy) and good second here (2m7f, soft) in January; also effective on good ground; failed to stay 4m1f in the Eider here in February and could play a leading role now back down in distance.

runners.name: Flic Ou Voyou
runners.comment: Won two in a row in the autumn and soft ground may not have suited in December last time
