runners.spotlight: 11yo who won over C&D (good) in October and followed up at Carlisle (2m4f, good to soft) in November; tailed off at Carlisle in December but the soft ground may not have suited; not ruled out now back from a break.

quotes.race: JenningsBet Bracknell Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Flic Ou Voyou can go to Ayr for something at the Scottish National meeting in April as he needs fast ground - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: John Ayres Memorial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Flic Ou Voyou's jumping let him down a couple of times last season, we did a lot of work on it. He loves that ground, looked fresh and well. He had a nice weight and I thought he'd win today, he had everything in his favour. It's a nice prize to win with him - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: EBF Stallions "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Flic Ou Voyou has now won three and that was just an exercise canter for him. We'll try and find a better race for him now. I'm not sure where yet - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet 3 Uniboosts A Day Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Flic Ou Voyou was a big, backward horse last year, but just needed time. He's going to run at Newton Abbot on Sunday and I was going to run once and then go chasing, but if he's improving he might just win a nice novice hurdle - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: For a big horse he wasn't the most fluent of jumpers last season, but we have done a lot of work in that department this autumn and it paid off as he came out and jumped nicely to win at Chepstow. I fancied him strongly as everything was in his favour; he wants 2m4f on decent ground. Rarely runs two races alike and was below that form at Wetherby three days ago; the fences there were slightly stiffer than at Chepstow and he got caught out by one. Is ideally suited by a small field and provided I place him right he should win again. 31-10-22

runners.name: Cerendipity
runners.comment: Won here three weeks ago; key player if handling the ground (unproven on good going)
runners.spotlight: Two wins last season (1m7f/2m4f) and, following wind surgery, he was back on the scoresheet in a small field here three weeks ago (2m7f, good to soft; Special Rate a close second); just 1lb higher today and he's a key player if handling the ground (unproven on good going).

runners.name: Immortal Fame
runners.comment: Completed hat-trick in February; could return to winning ways now going back left-handed
runners.spotlight: Completed a 2m4f, left-handed hat-trick (good/good to soft) at Stratford in February and again ran well when third at right-handed Leicester (2m6f, good to soft) last month, when he jumped to the left; no surprise if he returns to winning ways now reverting to a left-handed track.

quotes.race: Grace And Dotty Fedora's And Feathers Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm absolutely thrilled to bits with that. Immortal Fame went so well throughout, had his ears pricked the whole way round and just thoroughly enjoyed himself. I've always been a bit worried about his jumping, but we've done a lot of schooling with him and it looks like the penny is starting to drop. We'll see what the handicapper does to us now but I think he can progress - Deborah Cole, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He did very well last term in novice hurdles, winning three times and finishing up on a fair mark of 105. I gave him a pipe-opener at Chepstow last month when he finished third and went up 1lb. We started him off over fences at Doncaster on Saturday in a novice handicap chase company, and he made a good start to finish second. 30-11-22

runners.name: Five Dollar Fine
runners.comment: Won at Carlisle in October but below best since and pulled up at Carlisle last time
runners.spotlight: He's just 1lb higher than when winning at Carlisle (2m, good to soft) in October and he has form at up to 3m; however, below his best on his last three starts and was pulled up at Carlisle a fortnight ago.

3:25.race_name: Download The At The Races App Handicap Hurdle
3:25.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.4) (Watering)

runners.name: Anyharminasking
runners.comment: On losing run of 13 but 10lb lower than when third at Cheltenham in October; interesting
runners.spotlight: On a losing run of 13; has found little on his last three starts but he's in a weaker race than usual and 10lb lower than when third at Cheltenham (2m4f, good) in the autumn; carries risks but could be dangerous.

stable_tour.quote: He's always threatened to win a nice race but just hasn't quite done it yet. He ran very respectably on his comeback at Cheltenham and we might head to Haydock on Betfair Chase day for a 2m3f handicap hurdle next. There's a chance he'll go over fences at some point this season but, while the ground is good, there are races over hurdles for him between two miles and a two and a half. 06-11-24

runners.name: Baron De Midleton
runners.comment: Old-timer; second at Kelso when last seen in September; vulnerable to younger legs
runners.spotlight: Old-timer who ran well under a positive ride when second of eight at Kelso (2m5f, good) in September; has run well when fresh but still could be vulnerable to younger legs.

quotes.race: Vertem - Very Different Stockbrokers Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Sean Quinlan rode Baron de Midleton last time when he finished second to a nice horse of Nicky Henderson's and he said if he could breathe he'd have beaten him. So we had his wind done and he's a different horse. They went fast and it's hard work on that ground but he stays and he jumps well - Brian Ellison, trainer.

quotes.race: Eileen Peacock Memorial Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I thought Baron De Midleton would win and I backed him. He needed the race first time out over hurdles then he didn't stay the trip at Sedgefield last time. The blinkers made the difference today. He's in at Sedgefield next Friday and we'll see how he is - Brian Ellison.

quotes.race: bet365 Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I'm over the moon with that. Baron de Midleton ran really well at Newcastle and Phil was going on holiday so I thought I'd run him again beforehand. He'd had a long time off with little, niggly things and he's taken time to fill his frame. Phil has been very patient. The last flight sealed it. He'll go over fences in time and he'll be a very nice chaser - Brian Ellison, trainer.

runners.name: Turn And Finish
runners.comment: Came up short in Fred Winter at Cheltenham but must be considered in these calmer waters
runners.spotlight: Came up short in the Fred Winter at Cheltenham (wore cheekpieces and tongue-strap) last month but had previously been second in a big field at Cork (final outing for Joseph O'Brien) and landed the odds at Catterick; relatively lightly raced and must be considered in these calmer waters.

quotes.race: Raceday Ready Juvenile Maiden Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Juvenile Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: It was a messy, unsatisfactory race and Turn And Finish was well short of maximum fitness. He came over from Joseph [O'Brien, trainer] and we gave him a break when he got here. We just wanted to give him a race to help with our preparations for the Fred Winter. That's nowhere near his best and he'll be much better in a strongly run race coming off the pace. His Irish form also suggests that. It's job done, though, and all roads lead to the Cheltenham Festival. He'll be a much, much better horse in the middle of March. He jumps well and travels strongly and looks a hurdling type, and for most of that race he was looking around and thinking what was going on. I think 24 runners going flat out in front of him will be much better - Harry Derham, trainer.

runners.name: Thank You Blue
runners.comment: Revitalised by return to hurdles, winning at Southwell and Kempton; may complete hat-trick
runners.spotlight: Has a poor completion record over fences this season but has been revitalised by a return to hurdling of late, winning at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft) and Kempton (2m, good), well handled by Lewis Stones each time; escapes a penalty for Tuesday's success and could complete a hat-trick.

quotes.race: JTC Pizzalicious Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Thank You Blue jumped really well. He'll probably be better over a little bit further, I was just forcing him for the last half a mile. He was good over the last two and galloped to the line - Sean Quinlan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: We managed to get this lovely big rangy horse out for one run last term in a Wincanton bumper, where he ran a smashing race in what looked like a very hot contest. That was over 1m7f, but he has plenty of stamina and we will try and get another bumper into him next, although he is still around six or seven weeks off his return. I look on him as a medium-term project as you will not really see him at his best until he is seven or eight years old. 09-11-22

runners.name: Cuban Cigar
runners.comment: Disappointing since the autumn, reluctant to race and never dangerous last time; risky
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on second at Perth (2m, good) in September but disappointing since, reluctant to race and never dangerous last time; risky.

quotes.race: bet365 Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Cuban Cigar is a cracking little horse. We bought him privately and the aim was the Go North Final at Musselburgh but he could go to Cheltenham for the Triumph Hurdle now. He was very well trained with Richard Hannon and I was very pleased with him today - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

1:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.4) (Watering)

runners.name: Maximum Offers
runners.owner: L H & A Snowden & Lady Keswick

prev_owners.owner: L H & A Snowden & Late Sir Chips Keswick

runners.comment: Irish point 2nd; off the mark on 2nd hurdles start last time; 2m4f will suit; sound chance
runners.spotlight: Second in an Irish point in November 2023; off the mark on second hurdles start when winning by a short head at Huntingdon last time (2m, good; first two clear); this longer trip should suit; obvious contender.

quotes.race: Visit Huntingdon For Your Next Conference Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Maximum Offers is a six-year-old but he's still weak and will get better with age and also get further - Gavin Sheehan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: Second on his debut in a four'-year-'old point-'to-'point at Quakerstown and received a rating of 93, which is incredibly high. He looks another exciting recruit. 06-11-24

runners.name: Small Town Kid
runners.comment: 2m hurdle winner here in November; not so good since; addition of a tongue-tie might help
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m maiden hurdle here in November (good; third has won since); pulled up when tried over 2m6f next time; subsequently had a wind op then well-beaten third here last time (2m1f, good); should fare better with a tongue-tie tried.

runners.name: Auchinlek
runners.comment: Well beaten on all three starts so far and others have stronger claims
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on all three starts so far and others have stronger claims.

stable_tour.quote: He's been very big and backward and doesn't show you much at home. Greenness just caught up with him on his debut at Ayr and he'll go over hurdles now, with a race at Newcastle pencilled in at the end of the month. It's hard to say at this stage how far he can go, but there were encouraging signs at Ayr that might not have been obvious to the naked eye. He's been quite nervy and it was great to get him on the racecourse. He's the first horse we've trained for Kenny Alexander, which is great, and he's a 3m chaser in the making. 22-01-25

runners.name: Little Roger
runners.comment: Fourth in a bumper here on debut; not so good since, last twice over hurdles; best watche
runners.spotlight: Best effort when fourth in a bumper here on debut in December (2m1f, good to soft); hasn't fared as well since, including on both starts over hurdles; probably a longer-term prospect.

runners.name: Mr Griffiths
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Saubouas
runners.comment: 68,000euros 3yo; 7l-seventh in bumper only run so far; should improve
runners.spotlight: French-bred; 68,000euros 3yo; 7l-seventh of 12 in a Warwick bumper in December on only outing so far (2m, good to soft; 12-1); plenty to find, but improvement likely.

runners.name: Moveonbuy
runners.comment: Modest form in bumpers and best watched on hurdles debut.
runners.spotlight: Modest form in bumpers and best watched on hurdles debut.

runners.name: Saxon Star
runners.comment: Some promise in bumpers and in five races on the Flat (AW); more needed on hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: Signs of promise in three bumpers and in five runs at up to 2m on the Flat (AW; cheekpieces tried last time); more needed to take this on hurdles debut.

stable_tour.quote: She was a bit unlucky to finish third in a bumper at Musselburgh last month on her first start and then the race probably came too quick for her when she went to Kempton two weeks ago. We might give her another run in a bumper, but she's going to have a Flat campaign in the summer. She's a nice filly. 03-04-24

4:30.race_name: Sky Sports Racing Virgin 535 Handicap Chase
4:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.4) (Watering)

runners.name: Jac Jumper
runners.breeder: Mrs Laurence Grandchamp Des Raux Et Al
runners.comment: Runner-up four times this season, including at Doncaster five weeks ago; in the mix again
runners.spotlight: Ex-French 6yo who is 0-10 in Britain but has been runner-up over fences on four of his last six starts; headed late on at Doncaster (2m3f, good) five weeks ago after being 4l clear jumping the last; in the mix again.

runners.name: Six One Nine
runners.comment: Won this race 12 months ago; below form since but there have been excuses; interesting
runners.spotlight: Had a productive 2023-24 campaign, winning three times on this course including this event; unplaced all five outings since but has had excuses, seeming not to stay 2m7f on latest; back to a more suitable trip today and has had wind surgery; interesting off 3lb lower mark than 12 months ago.

runners.name: Ribeye
runners.comment: Disappointing last time but is respected on Musselburgh win and Catterick second
runners.spotlight: Disappointing at Carlisle last time but comes into the reckoning on his win at Musselburgh (2m7f, good to soft) in December and his second at Catterick (3m1f, good) in January; unlikely to be far away.

runners.name: Top Of The Bay
runners.comment: Encouraging start for this stable when second over C&D; obvious candidate off 2lb higher
runners.spotlight: 0-9 under rules but he made an encouraging start for this stable when second of seven over C&D (good; 11-1) last month; the winner has since followed up; obvious candidate off just 2lb higher.

runners.name: Pure Surf

prev_owners.owner: Mrs C Brown & Exors Of M Wares

runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner; hasn't shown the same form over fences, soundly beaten last time
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner; hasn't shown the same form over fences and she was soundly beaten when last seen at Sedgefield two months ago.

12:55.race_name: quinnbet.com Conditional Jockeys' Training Series Mares' Handicap Hurdle (Part of the REI)
12:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.4) (Watering)

runners.name: Maura Jeanne
runners.comment: Both wins this season, latest at Ayr in February; fine on good ground; a possible
runners.spotlight: Both wins have been this season, latest at Ayr in February (3m, soft) when scoring by 7l; not so good over 3m3f last time (faded late on); has run well on good ground and not without a chance back down in trip.

runners.name: Blame Rose
runners.comment: Two wins on soft/heavy last spring; interesting back up in trip on first run since wind op
runners.spotlight: Won twice on soft/heavy ground last spring, over 2m1f at Carlisle (by 15l) and 2m4f at Hexham; not so good last time but stable going much better now; interesting back up in trip on first run since wind surgery.

runners.name: Flighttothestars
runners.owner: M White M Beesley S Horsfall
runners.comment: Has shown promise on occasions but recent form is poor and others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Has run the occasional good race but recent form is poor (well beaten at Southwell nine days ago) and others appeal more.

runners.name: Ballyhiho
runners.comment: Runner-up in a 3m point; modest form hurdling; can do better up in trip on h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in an Irish point last May (3m, good to yielding); only modest form in novice/maiden hurdles, all at around 2m; can do better now up in trip on her handicap debut.

runners.name: Somebodys Fortune
runners.owner: Mr And Mrs T P Winnell
runners.comment: Won over 3m2f at Kelso last May; not so good after; back after a break with a bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in a 3m2f Kelso handicap last May when visored for the first time (good to soft); well below that form next three starts (second was over fences); returns after 159-day break with a bit to prove.

quotes.race: Five Star Taxis Mares' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Somebody's Fortune was disappointing a couple of times but we didn't understand her and probably ran her at the wrong track. She'll probably jump a fence one day and I think her point-to-point form has worked out good enough. She's tough and she jumps well enough - Peter Scudamore, trainer's partner and assistant, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Heather Honey
runners.comment: Best run when 4th on h'cap debut latest; may improve again over this longer trip
runners.spotlight: Maiden; best jumps run when fourth on handicap debut at Southwell last time (2m4f, good to soft); may improve again over this longer trip; a possible.

runners.name: Noble Affair
runners.comment: 1-18 over hurdles; headgear tried; longer trip a concern
runners.spotlight: Exposed 9yo; only win in 18 tries over hurdles was at Hexham in April 2023 (2m4f, soft); well beaten only previous run at this sort of trip; cheekpieces tried; plenty to prove.

runners.name: Joanna Im Fine
runners.comment: 3m Ayr winner in 2023; fair second last June; best watched after 300-day break
runners.spotlight: Won a 3m handicap at Ayr in February 2023 (good to soft); fair second at Perth in June when last seen out (3m, good to firm); probably best watched after a break.

runners.name: Lady Hamilton

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mr A Lister

runners.comment: 0-23; fair fifth at Hexham in November; not so good either side of that; best watched
runners.spotlight: 23-race maiden; fair fifth at Hexham in November but well beaten either side of that; best watched on return from a break.

2:05.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.4) (Watering)

runners.name: Saligo Bay

prev_owners.owner: Ballylinch Stud, P Inglett & N Jones

runners.comment: Dual hurdles winner for the Moores; not so good for new yard; on fair mark; down in grade
runners.spotlight: Won twice on the Flat and twice over hurdles (both at Plumpton, second a seller) for the Moores; taken time to hit top form for new yard (beaten a long way over 2m5f here last time); on a fair mark and quite interesting down in grade.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: This is a better track for Saligo Bay than Chester and he deserved a win, although he wants a bit of dig in the ground. He'd stay further, but I think we'll stay at a mile and a half and hopefully he'll improve and win another, while I think he's the type who would do well hurdling - Roger Charlton, trainer.

runners.name: Big Storm Brewing
runners.comment: Only modest form in a bumper/four runs over hurdles; may do better on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in a Perth bumper last May (2m, good to soft); only modest efforts over hurdles, last three over 2m; may fare better back up in trip on handicap debut.

runners.name: Regal And Royal
runners.owner: P And Mrs G A Clarke
runners.comment: Two wins over 2m3f in May/June last year; sound run on comeback a fortnight ago; chance
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 2m3f on good ground at Bangor last May/June; sound reappearance run when second to in-form rival over same C&D two weeks ago; should go well again.

runners.name: Marty Mcfly
runners.comment: Won 2m novice h'cap last June; weighted to beat Regal And Royal, but not sure to do so
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m Perth novice handicap off this mark last June (good); hasn't fared as well since, although fair sixth at Carlisle last time (2m1f, good); weighted to beat Regal And Royal (who is 13lb worse off for beating him 4.75l) on Bangor form last May, but hasn't progressed as well as him.

stable_tour.quote: We were really disappointed with him at Ayr the other day and maybe it was the desperate ground. We haven't had him that long and are just finding out about him. He'll make a nice novice chaser next season. 22-01-25

runners.name: Knacker Trapper
runners.comment: In decent form last year but well below his best on last two starts and plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: In decent form last year (won over 2m4f at Southwell in May and placed twice in the autumn) but well below par on both starts this year (pulled up behind Luminaries here last time); plenty to prove at present.

runners.name: Luminaries
runners.comment: Improved for cheekpieces, winning last two races, both over C&D; stiffer task; contender
runners.spotlight: Progressive sort who has won over C&D on his two starts since cheekpieces went on, last time (good to soft) scoring by a cosy 6l; now 9lb higher but still makes plenty of appeal.

quotes.race: Michael Knox Memorial Equine Products Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Luminaries had a big ulcer and it's just taken a bit of time to get him back, but we've always thought he's a horse who's capable of running a big race - Ewan Whillans, trainer.

runners.name: Time Was
runners.comment: Sound run back over hurdles when second over 2m4f at Southwell last time; each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Two runs over fences in February (good second on first occasion) and sound run back over hurdles when runner-up in a mares' novice at Southwell last time (2m4f, good to soft); each-way chance.

runners.name: Shes A Rocca
runners.owner: Mrs I C Sellars And Miss D C Sellars

prev_owners.owner: Mrs I C Sellars & Major Philip Arkwright

runners.comment: Last win was in October 2023; mixed form since, best run when 2nd here; place chance
runners.spotlight: Last of her three wins over hurdles came at Southwell in October 2023 (2m4f, good); mixed form since, best run when second over 2m1f here in December (good to soft); pulled up at Carlisle next time (reportedly unsuited by undulating track); should fare better.

runners.name: Leader Wing
runners.comment: Bumper winner last May; best hurdles run when second over C&D latest; each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Sedgefield bumper winner for Tom Weston last May (2m, good); taken time to find his form over hurdles, best run when second to subsequent winner Luminaries (who is now 12lb worse off) over C&D last time; each-way chance.

runners.name: Ballydangan
runners.comment: 0-20; well beaten for Dan Skelton earlier this season; best watched on stable debut
runners.spotlight: 20-race maiden; well beaten in five races for Dan Skelton earlier this season; watching brief advised on debut for new connections.

5:05.race_name: Acorn Catering Equipment Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 2 Elimination) (GBB Race)
5:05.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.4) (Watering)

runners.name: Coffee Boy
runners.comment: From leading northern yard with 16% strike-rate in bumpers; interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: 28,000euros 3yo; half-brother to French 2m1f-2m6f hurdle/chase winner No Risk For You; dam French maiden Flat/jumps, half-sister to French 2m6f Grade 1 chase winner Top Of The Sky; from leading northern yard with 16% strike-rate in bumpers; wears hood; interesting newcomer.

runners.name: Escortkheops
runners.comment: In frame in three Irish points, including on good ground; cannot be dismissed
runners.spotlight: Made the frame on all his completed outings in Irish points, including on good ground; new stable has had two bumper winners (from 35 attempts) in last five seasons; has plenty of experience and cannot be dismissed.

runners.name: I Am Simba
runners.comment: 21,000gns yearling; has a useful Flat pedigree and in-form yard wins its share of bumpers
runners.spotlight: 21,000gns yearling; Roaring Lion half-brother to five winners including Captain Chorus (Norwegian 7f-1m6f including Listed; RPR 108), Seaside Song (Norwegian/Swedish 1m Listed; 95) and Tavener (5f-7f; 86); dam 1m4f winner (79), closely related to 1m2f Group 1 winner; has a useful Flat pedigree, and in-form yard wins its share of bumpers; has had wind surgery.

runners.name: Littletown Lad
runners.comment: Well beaten at Ayr in January; needs to improve markedly for these less testing conditions
runners.spotlight: Third in a point bumper, then well beaten on rules debut at Ayr (soft; 20-1) in January; needs to improve markedly for today's less testing conditions and the fitting of a hood.

runners.name: Milan Park
runners.comment: Fifth twice in good-ground bumpers; now tongue-tied; needs to raise his game significantly
runners.spotlight: Fifth twice in good-ground bumpers, with wind surgery and a long absence in between; now tongue-tied; needs to raise his game significantly.

runners.name: Walk On Son
runners.comment: Tailed off in two events of this type, tongue-tied on latest start; needs a transformation
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in two events of this type, with a tongue-strap added on latest start; needs a transformation.

runners.name: Japetus
runners.comment: Quickened well to score here three weeks ago; penalised but holds leading claims
runners.spotlight: Has a useful Juddmonte Flat pedigree; built on debut promise when winning five-runner race over C&D (good to soft; evens) three weeks ago with more in hand than the margin suggests (quickened well); more rivals to contend with here and has a penalty, but still holds leading claims.

runners.name: Brooklynese
runners.comment: Last of seven on rules debut at Doncaster three weeks ago; much more needed
runners.spotlight: Some promise in point bumpers over the winter but was last of seven on rules debut at Doncaster (good; 20-1) three weeks ago; much more needed in a first-time hood.

runners.name: Its Miss Marple
runners.comment: By Pether's Moon; dam 1m4f winner; others appeal more on paper
runners.spotlight: By Pether's Moon; dam 1m4f winner (RPR 64), sister to 2m hurdle winners Arctic Reach and Gin And Tonic; others appeal more on paper.

runners.name: Ben Reid
runners.owner: Clova Farms And P D Niven
runners.comment: Bred along similar lines to a recent winning bumper debutant from this yard; interesting
runners.spotlight: Bred along similar lines to his stable's recent winning bumper debutant On To The Rouge, out of an unraced half-sister to bumper winner Simply Rouge and from the family of smart dual-purpose performer Clever Cookie; commands plenty of respect, especially if strong in the market.

runners.name: Freddie Steady Go
runners.comment: Out of a 2m hurdle winner; stable just 4% in bumpers in last five seasons
runners.spotlight: By high-class middle-distance stayer Frontiersman, out of 2m hurdle winner; stable just 4% in bumpers in last five seasons.

runners.name: Queen Marcia
runners.comment: Nathaniel half-sister to two winners; yard's record in bumpers (0-32) is off-putting
runners.spotlight: Nathaniel half-sister to winners Majestic Ace (German 7.5f) and Gerolamo Cardano (2m/2m4f hurdle); dam maiden (stayed 1m4f; RPR 71), half-sister to 10.5f Group 3 winner Goncharova; yard's record in bumpers (0-32 last five seasons) is off-putting.

7:45.race_name: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Fillies' Handicap

runners.name: Powdering
runners.comment: Thriving this year, landing a gamble back at 6f last month; should go well once again
runners.spotlight: 2-3 this year, both wins at Southwell with the latest a well-backed success when dropping back to 6f; effective at this track and she can remain competitive against her own sex.

runners.name: Orchid
runners.comment: Easy 6f win at Kempton when last seen 6 months ago; tongue tied for her return/h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Below par on soft turf on her second start (blew the start) but that run was sandwiched by two good Kempton runs, notably an easy 6f win when last seen 192 days ago; unexposed and one to note for market confidence with a tongue-tie fitted on her handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: She was a good second behind a very well bred Shadwell filly for Saeed bin Suroor on her debut at Kempton and has some fancy entries. We'll try to win her maiden first and then she could be one for something like the Goffs Million. 11-09-24

runners.name: Griselda
runners.comment: Completed a hat-trick last July; good 3rd at Doncaster in September; AW debut
runners.spotlight: Made a nonsense of her opening handicap mark of 60, winning 6f events at Pontefract, Lingfield and Thirsk last July; unplaced in three of her next four starts but the exception was a fine third at Doncaster's St Leger meeting; career-best required to win off this mark on her reappearance/AW debut.

stable_tour.quote: She's tall, imposing and covers a lot of ground, she looks a really smart prospect for the yard. It's hard to know quite when she'll get started but she's showing us enough at home to suggest she'll be able to run over six furlongs. 29-03-24

runners.name: Raneenn
runners.comment: Won twice over 6f as a 2yo; only sixth in Listed company the last twice; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Won twice in maiden/novice company (6f) in the second half of 2024 before coming up short in a York Listed event last October (6f, soft); too keen upped to 7f for her reappearance (again in Listed company); mark left unchanged but returning to this trip can help.

runners.name: Wheres Clare
runners.comment: Two wins, one here, for C Johnston as a 2yo; sold 12,000gns last October; betting useful
runners.spotlight: Two front-running wins as a 2yo when trained by Charlie Johnston (including here over 5f); sold for 12,000gns after a couple of lesser effots last September; well drawn for a prominent racer and interesting to see how she goes in the betting on her first run for Kevin Ryan.

runners.name: Neytiri Te Tskaha
runners.comment: 5f turf win for K Burke last summer; promising 3rd here on stable debut in Feb; unexposed
runners.spotlight: Made all in a 5f fillies' novice at Thirsk on her third and final start for Karl Burke last August; shaped well over 5f here on her stable debut seven weeks ago, keeping on steadily and suggesting this trip would suit better; not fully exposed.

runners.name: Ziggys Ariel
runners.owner: Middleham Park X, Simon Wood & A Haynes

prev_owners.owner: Middleham Park Racing X And A Haynes

runners.comment: C&D win in November; solid run at Southwell after a break; could yet rate higher
runners.spotlight: Sprung a 22-1 surprise over C&D in November and she's only 1lb higher today; may have needed last month's return to action but still ran creditably and could yet rate higher.

runners.name: Scattering Light
runners.comment: Cosy C&D win last month but she will need more to make a winning handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the fourth attempt when keeping on well to land a C&D fillies' maiden three weeks ago; the second and fourth from that race were put in their place on Monday and she'll need more now handicapping.

runners.name: Handle With Care
runners.comment: 6lb rise for recent Lingfield win could leave her vulnerable at this level
runners.spotlight: Improving with experience, getting off the mark at the fifth attempt (second handicap) when well on top at Lingfield 12 days ago; up 6lb against stronger opposition.

6:45.race_name: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap

runners.name: Seraphim Angel
runners.breeder: Mrs Mary Taylor And James F Taylor
runners.comment: Two wins as a 2yo; conditions should be fine but not sure she's ahead of her mark
runners.spotlight: Showed her effectiveness around a sharp left-hand turn when winning the Lily Agnes at Chester 11 months ago; added a Windsor novice to her tally last September and she wasn't disgraced in an all-aged Dundalk Group 3 when last seen 162 days ago; not sure she's well handicapped but came to hand early last year.

quotes.race: CAA Stellar Lily Agnes EBF Conditions Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Seraphim Angel went to Newmarket and didn't know what to do when she came off the bridle, but she had clearly learned a lot today. She's got lots of speed and I'd suggest she'd go to York for the Marygate - Tom Dascombe, trainer.

runners.name: Megaphone
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Adrian Mcalpine
runners.comment: 2-2 for G Boughey this year, including C&D; gelded since latest; still unexposed; solid
runners.spotlight: Promise amid greenness in one 2yo run for Roger Varian; made all at Kempton on his stable debut in January (6f) and defied a penalty over C&D eight weeks ago (Desert Champion back in third and 7lb worse off today); gelded since; open to further progress and looks solid.

runners.name: Desert Champion
runners.comment: Twice finished behind Megaphone prior to impressive h'cap success latest (1st time visor)
runners.spotlight: Finished behind Megaphone at Kempton (6f) and over C&D before taking a big step forward when visored for his handicap debut at Chelmsford four weeks ago (5f), making all for a comfortable success; may do better still in the headgear but Megaphone should have his measure on these terms.

runners.name: Invincible Crown
runners.owner: Grange Park Racing Viii & Mrs R Carr
runners.comment: C&D win for R Hughes in October; satisfactory stable debut last month; needs personal best
runners.spotlight: Impressed over C&D on final run for Richard Hughes; satisfactory stable debut when midfield at Southwell 17 days ago; more required today.

runners.name: Ay Gee Ell
runners.comment: Finished with a flourish when splitting Megaphone & Desert Champion in Feb; new tongue-tie
runners.spotlight: Palpably green when splitting Megaphone and Desert Champion over C&D in February and his finishing effort was eyecatching; failed to back it up over 6f here last month but he's of interest now handicapping in a tongue-tie.

runners.name: Rubys Profit
runners.comment: 1-1 on AW; ended 2024 with a good 3rd at Newmarket; well drawn for a prominent racer
runners.spotlight: Made all to win a 5f fillies' maiden at Kempton on debut last May; came up short in Listed/Group 3 races on her next three starts; ended 2024 with a front-running third in a Newmarket sales race (6f, good to soft); well drawn for her reappearance and not discounted.

7:15.race_name: Weekly £5 Free Bet With BetUK Acca Club Selling Handicap

runners.name: Boasty
runners.comment: C&D win last March off 8lb higher; not at best this year but drops in class today
runners.spotlight: Five-time AW winner, the latest over C&D 13 months ago off an 8lb higher mark; not at his best this winter but this represents a drop in class and he's one to consider.

stable_tour.quote: He has been a consistent type who is always in the firing line but only has two wins to show for his efforts. He joined me in March this year and after finishing second first time out he won nicely at Chelmsford by three lengths. That saw him raised 8lb which has been hard for him, but he has since run a second and two thirds. He never runs a bad race, but there is no doubt he is better on the all-weather. Looking at his runs this term he has not enjoyed too much luck with draws. We will keep him going over the winter months, particularly at Lingfield and Chelmsford where he enjoys the bends. There is more to come. 29-08-22

runners.name: Claxton Bay
runners.comment: Chance on this year's best but he still has to prove his stamina over this far
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer; just missed out at Lingfield (1m) in January and he didn't run badly at Kempton two weeks later; not so good tried in a visor last time and the headgear is absent here; still to prove himself at further than 8.6f.

runners.name: Susiesparkle
runners.owner: J Fyffe, A Edmondson & L Mcgurty

prev_owners.owner: J Fyffe, A Edmondson & L McGurty

runners.comment: Good 1m2f runs at Newcastle the last twice; should remain competitive at this level
runners.spotlight: Had wind surgery in December and showed the benefit when winning a 1m2f handicap at Newcastle in February (second run back); similar form when third back at Newcastle last month; should remain competitive.

runners.name: Curtiz
runners.comment: Good 2nd off this mark at Chelmsford last month; unplaced in three runs at Wolverhampton
runners.spotlight: Six-time winner who showed his wellbeing with a good second off this mark at Chelmsford four weeks ago (1m2f); form claims on that run but he has finished out of the frame in three course runs.

stable_tour.quote: A fun handicapper. He was beaten only a short head at Windsor last time. He has won before but that might have been his chance - hopefully not. 06-06-24

runners.name: Forever Proud
runners.comment: Four wins over shorter this winter; placed over 8.6f on Tuesday; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Four wins over shorter this winter, two of them coming here (8.6f) and all for Hector Crouch; third over 8.6f here on Tuesday; unlikely to be too far away.

quotes.race: Unibet More Extra Place Races Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Forever Proud doesn't do an awful lot when she hits the front but if something rallied I always thought she'd go again. It was a very different scenario tonight, she's been running over an extended mile at Wolverhampton - that suits her very well - and I had slight reservations about 7f round here, but she's in such a good vein of form at the moment and all credit to James [Owen, trainer] and the team, they'e got her spot on - Hector Crouch, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She's been very busy. She won at Chelmsford on December 19, then was second at Wolverhampton a couple of days later and then we ran her again at Wolverhampton on December 27 before the handicapper put her up and she won again. She's always shown her best form at Lingfield and it took me a while to work out how to train her really, but we've tweaked a few things and got to the bottom of that. We're looking forward to getting her back to Lingfield in January and I think her form will step up again when she gets back there. 01-01-25

runners.name: City Escape
runners.comment: Two C&D wins this year and she's run well in defeat the last twice; now 3lb higher
runners.spotlight: Two C&D wins this year and she has run well in defeat the last twice, unsuited by the steady pace three weeks ago; new mark has now kicked in but she shouldn't be underestimated.

runners.name: Whiteley Way
runners.breeder: Mrs S Bunney & Mr P Taplin
runners.comment: Two good Flat runs for this yard, 2nd over C&D when last seen in February; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Two good Flat runs for her new yard, more recently finishing second over C&D in February (tongue tied for the first time); runs off the same mark and she holds each-way claims.

runners.name: Back From Dubai
runners.comment: Running well here this year, winning over C&D in January; should make a bold bid
runners.spotlight: Easy C&D win in January and filled third spot behind City Escape back here in February; late headway over 8.6f here last time and another to consider back up in distance.

quotes.race: Spreadex Sports Injury Time Loser Insurance Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Back From Dubai broke well and I just let him use his stride and he's toughed it out to the line - Jordan Williams, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Headshot

prev_owners.owner: J Palmer-Brown, M Daniels And Partner

runners.comment: Classified win here in January worked out well but he hasn't kicked on himself
runners.spotlight: It looked a weak classified event that he won here (8.6f) in January but the form has worked out surprisingly well (second, third and fifth have won since); he hasn't kicked on himself, however, and others appeal more.

runners.name: Danehill Star
runners.comment: Two wins this year (for today's rider); not at best last time; new headgear today
runners.spotlight: Two wins this year, over 1m2f at Lingfield (cheekpieces first time) and 1m at Newcastle (classified); overraced over 1m2f at Lingfield last time and connections now turn to a visor.

5:45.race_name: Weekly Free Bets With BetMGM Extra Handicap (Div I)

runners.name: Packetofbiscuits
runners.comment: Eight-race maiden; runner-up the last twice but creeping up the weights and drawn widest
runners.spotlight: 0-8 but has finished second on three occasions, including twice at Kempton last month; creeping back up the weights though and he has the widest stall to negotiate this time.

runners.name: Florida Dawn
runners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Al Maktoum
runners.comment: Gifted easy lead when winning on 2nd start (7f, Tapeta); makes h'cap debut at fair level
runners.spotlight: Gifted the softest of leads when winning a four-runner novice at Newcastle (7f) on her second start; couldn't cope with a penalty back there last time; makes her handicap debut at a realistic level and well drawn so not ruled out.

runners.name: Standput
runners.comment: C&D winner on handicap debut in January; close fourth next time but below par ten days ago
runners.spotlight: Improved effort when winning a C&D handicap in January off 2lb lower; drawn wide when disappointing at Kempton ten days ago; better than that but a career-best is required.

runners.name: Tolerance
runners.comment: Promising return from break (after wind op) last month; up in trip; looks on a handy mark
runners.spotlight: Five runs over sprint trips, showing his best form when a closing fourth at Newcastle last month (6f; first run after a wind op/tongue tied); finished his race off well from a poor position there and it was his first outing for eight months too; stamina not assured but looks on a handy mark.

runners.name: Blue Empress
runners.comment: Six-race maiden but often placed, including C&D latest; tricky draw and other pace on show
runners.spotlight: 0-6 but placed in three of those starts, including over C&D two weeks ago when sporting cheekpieces for the first time; not the only pace influence in today's field but stall 10 complicates matters.

runners.name: Blue Seeker
runners.comment: Looked good over C&D on Boxing Day but that hasn't been a springboard to better things
runners.spotlight: Impressive over C&D on Boxing Day on his nursery debut; no progress since and comes here with something to prove.

runners.name: Easily Convinced
runners.comment: Chelmsford maiden winner (7f) in January; only sixth in two handicaps since; new headgear
runners.spotlight: Hasn't looked straightforward in his four starts, hanging left when winning a Chelmsford maiden and again when sixth on handicap debut in February; no better for cheekpieces at Kempton last month and now tried in blinkers.

runners.name: Epicurian Lad
runners.comment: Absent since finishing 3rd in Thirsk nursery last July; should stay 7f; gelded; unexposed
runners.spotlight: Absent since finishing third in a useful 6f nursery at Thirsk last July; gelded during his absence and appeals as the type to do well this year; encouragement for 7f on pedigree.

runners.name: Rock Diva
runners.comment: Only fifth in two handicap runs this year; cheekpieces need to turn things around
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden; finished fifth at big odds in both handicap runs this year (7f and 1m); creeping down the weights but cheekpieces need to have a positive effect.

runners.name: Glitter Code
runners.comment: Ended 2024 with a 6f third at Newcastle; that form not working out; headgear absent today
runners.spotlight: Ran as well as he ever has when third of nine in a 6f nursery at Newcastle when last seen in November; that race hasn't thrown up a subsequent winner though and others holds more pressing claims; visor absent this time.

runners.name: Risk
runners.comment: Ability & quirks in equal measure; 3rd last week despite proving almost unsteerable 1f out
runners.spotlight: Little doubt he has the ability to win races off this mark but he's shown a dark side to his character too, most recently hanging badly left over 1f out when looming as a big threat at Lingfield last week; carries considerable risk but today's rider knows him well and things might click at some point.

5:15.race_name: BetMGM: It's Showtime Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Penfolds Grange
runners.comment: Won narrowly over C&D in November, but form not worked out; vulnerable under penalty
runners.spotlight: Built on his promising third of ten on his Kempton debut (7f, Polytrack) in October when scoring by a head over this C&D the following month; the form of that race hasn't worked out, though, and although being proven under the conditions must count for something he looks vulnerable under his penalty.

runners.name: Arboreous
runners.comment: Stable has a good record with 3yo newcomers; interesting, especially if market positive
runners.spotlight: 45,000euros yearling; 60,000euros breeze-up 2yo; closely related to winners Mia Man (French 1m2f; RPR 91), Jungle Pulse (French 9.5f AW; 84) and Running The Game (1m3f AW; 83); dam French 6f winner, half-sister to useful 1m4f winner Ice Pyramid; stable 15-82 (18%) with 3yo newcomers in past five seasons; interesting, especially if market positive.

runners.name: Special Ghaiyyath
runners.comment: In the frame in three of his four starts, but may be vulnerable to an improver
runners.spotlight: In the frame in three of his four starts, as when third of nine in a similar contest on his reappearance over C&D a fortnight ago after having attempted to make all in a steadily run race; each-way claims again but may be vulnerable to an improver.

runners.name: Belgravian
runners.comment: Disappointing favourite on September's Bath debut; gelded since; market interesting
runners.spotlight: Sent off 15-8 favourite for his Bath debut (1m, good) last September, but ran green and never figured (has been gelded since); bred to be much better than that and interesting to see how much confidence there is behind him on his return.

runners.name: Mythical Isle
runners.comment: Stable not known for winning newcomers
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to 7.3f-1m1f winner The Parent (2yo/Bahrain; RPR 96); dam 7f-1m1f winner (including US turf Grade 1; 108), out of 1m winning daughter of unraced half-sister to French 1m2f Group 1 winner Nadia; stable not known for winning newcomers.

runners.name: Rose Warrior
runners.comment: Stable can ready a newcomer and worth monitoring in the market
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to winners Sweet Promise (9.4f AW/1m2f turf; RPR 101), Evening Story (1m-12.4f including AW; 82) and Monsieur Melee (1m4f; 79); dam 7f 2yo winner (86), out of 1m4f Group 3 winner; stable can ready a newcomer and worth monitoring in the market.

runners.name: Wine Dark Sea
runners.comment: Second on his Yarmouth debut last September; gelded since; this stiffer test should suit
runners.spotlight: Sent off 16-1 but showed plenty of promise when second of 11 on his Yarmouth debut (1m, good to firm) last September; gelded since; this slightly stiffer test should suit him on breeding and high on the list.

runners.name: Iwantmytimewithyou
runners.comment: Stable 0-38 with 3yo newcomers in past five seasons; looks one for further in due course
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam 1m5f-2m winner (RPR 75), half-sister to US 1m/8.5f winner Money Trend, out of maiden half-sister to 1m2f Listed winner Dabtiya, is granddaughter of half-sister to French Derby winner Darshaan; stable 0-38 with 3yo newcomers in past five seasons and he looks one for further in due course.

runners.name: Quebella
runners.comment: Bred to appreciate further, but stable can get them ready first time; worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Sister to 1m AW winner Star Studied (RPR 89); dam 1m-1m4f winner (including 2yo; 84), half-sister to winners Maybe Today (1m2f-1m4f) and Qool (German/Italian 7f-1m3f including 2yo), out of Italian 1m2f Group 1 winner; bred to appreciate a bit further, but stable can get them ready first time so worth a market check.

4:45.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Be An Angel
runners.comment: Best effort was her first and she's not progressed; had no excuses in latest novice
runners.spotlight: Best effort was probably her first when beaten a neck at Leicester (6f, heavy); hammered by the same horse here on Boxing Day (5f) and had no excuses.

runners.name: Galaxy Zoo
runners.comment: Claims on her debut effort here and she's now with Ralph Beckett
runners.spotlight: First run for former yard (over 6f here) was better than the second but should be good enough to win a race of this nature and she's now with Ralph Beckett.

runners.name: Genius Mistake
runners.comment: Runner-up in two of her races but probably needs to improve on those pieces of form
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two of her races but probably needs to improve on those pieces of form to win this; soft ground a feasible excuse on final run.

runners.name: New Charter
runners.comment: Like others in here, she has shown winning potential but isn't progressing
runners.spotlight: Has a similar profile to some of these in that she showed some initial promise but isn't progressing; drops to 5f for the first time.

runners.name: Peregrine Falcon
runners.comment: Failed to progress from a promising start in Ireland; now with a new yard
runners.spotlight: Won a Naas barrier trial and ran in last year's Albany after finishing third in a 6f maiden; signed off for Emmet Mullins with a modest handicap run (tongue tied) and now kicks off for new yard with questions to answer.

runners.name: Pouting
runners.breeder: Razza Del Sole Societa Agricola Srl
runners.comment: Beaten six times but has shown enough to be competitive at this level
runners.spotlight: Beaten six times but has shown enough to be competitive at this level, including last time in a 5f nursery.

runners.name: Queenofdestruction
runners.comment: Hood tried last time now removed; previous form here would see her thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Expensive to follow (0-6) but was twice bang there (including here) before perhaps failing to take to a hood last time at Southwell; unlikely to be far away.

runners.name: Sunshine Soul
runners.comment: Has some of the best form on offer but now 0-6 and was poor last time
runners.spotlight: Has some of the best form on offer but now 0-6 and has to bounce back from a poor run at Lingfield (5f nursery; first-time tongue-tie); ability respected but essentially disappointing.

runners.name: Thecoffeepoddotco
runners.comment: Career started okay but her form has tailed off and she's now 0-7
runners.spotlight: Career started okay but her form has tailed off and she's now 0-7; returns from a break with questions to answer.

runners.name: Courageous Gold
runners.comment: Improved fourth on handicap debut here when never ideally positioned
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced and never ideally positioned in a steadily run race over C&D (handicap debut) two weeks ago, finishing a never-dangerous fourth; looks to have races in him.

runners.name: Bella Bluesky
runners.comment: Four-time winner but has beaten only three rivals in as many races since last May
runners.spotlight: Back-to-back classified wins in February of last year but has beaten only three rivals in as many races since last May.

quotes.race: Try Racing TV For Free Now Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a good performance and Bella Bluesky is still very novicey, she's very slow at her jumps but there's a bit of ability in there. She's got a brilliant attitude, she's very tough - Craig Nichol, jockey.

runners.name: Black Smoke
runners.comment: Not sure what happened back here 24 days ago but has form claims
runners.spotlight: Third in a division of this last year and won over C&D this February; not sure what happened back here 24 days ago but has form claims.

runners.name: Alioski
runners.breeder: Saleh Al Homaizi & Imad Al Sagar
runners.comment: First run after wind surgery when finishing well for second at Southwell
runners.spotlight: Had wind surgery after a poor run over hurdles and then went down narrowly in a 1m4f handicap at Southwell; did well to get so close that day after missing the break; stays this far.

runners.name: Tarjamah
runners.comment: Won here as a 2yo but has regressed badly and was tailed off at Southwell in February
runners.spotlight: Won here as a 2yo but has regressed badly and was tailed off at Southwell in February (stable debut).

runners.name: Zooks
runners.comment: Off the mark at Chelmsford and then wasn't beaten far off this mark 24 days ago
runners.spotlight: Made it 20th-time lucky when scoring under Billy Loughnane at Chelmsford (1m5f, Polytrack) and wasn't beaten far here last month off this mark; likely contender.

runners.name: Two Plus Two
runners.comment: Did well to be second over 1m4f here on Tuesday after challenging wide; thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Only 1-22 but that win came over C&D this January and he did well to be second over 1m4f here on Tuesday after challenging wide; thereabouts.

runners.name: Fine Print
runners.comment: 0-18 but has placed form on turf/AW and didn't run too badly the last time
runners.spotlight: Placed form in 1m4f/1m5f handicaps (including on the Dundalk AW) and didn't run badly there last time; 0-18 now but not without hope.

runners.name: Ocean Ridge
runners.comment: Has only won a classified race and has been thoroughly unconvincing this year
runners.spotlight: 1m4f classified winner here 13 months ago, his only success in 19 starts; thoroughly unconvincing this year.

6:15.race_name: Weekly Free Bets With BetMGM Extra Handicap (Div II)

runners.name: Last Shamardal
runners.comment: Two 6f runs at Newcastle, overcoming inexperience to win 5 weeks ago; 7f a plus; wide draw
runners.spotlight: Promise amid inexperience at Newcastle on his debut in February; still looked green when winning a 6f maiden back at Newcastle five weeks ago; comfortably on top at the finish and brings potential now stepping up to 7f for his handicap debut; lower draw would have been preferred, though.

runners.name: Arabian Cobra
runners.comment: 11-race maiden; good run in blinkers last month but vulnerable to less-exposed rivals
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden; solid effort in blinkers at Southwell five weeks ago and likely to give his running but could prove vulnerable to less-exposed rivals.

runners.name: Moby Quick
runners.comment: Both course runs have been promising; more to come now handicapping at a realistic level
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 with a close third over C&D; similar form when second at Newcastle on last month's return to action; not fully exposed and his rider Liam Wright takes off a handy 5lb.

runners.name: Sabrimento
runners.comment: Runner-up twice for new yard this year; not at very best latest; cheekpieces back today
runners.spotlight: 5f win at Bath when trained by Brian Meehan; runner-up twice for new yard this year and conditions shouldn't be an issue; cheekpieces the headgear of choice today.

runners.name: Amor Cordis
runners.comment: Gelded prior to this reappearance and now gets accessories; widest stall to contend with
runners.spotlight: No great progress in four 2yo runs; gelded prior to his return from six months off; has accessories fitted but the widest stall is troublesome.

runners.name: Invincible Melody
runners.comment: Runner-up in both handicaps this year; conditions fine and still has more to come; solid
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in both handicaps, over C&D in February and at Kempton last month; sneaking up the weights but could still have his best days in front of him.

runners.name: Penelope Valentine
runners.comment: Won easily at Kempton in February but in a weak race; up 8lb in a higher grade; opposable
runners.spotlight: Placed in her first three handicap runs before running out the easy winner of a modest affair at Kempton in February (7f); an 8lb rise against stronger opposition may find her out.

runners.name: Sherlock
runners.comment: Not at best at Newcastle when last seen but first two handicap runs were encouraging
runners.spotlight: Not at his best at Newcastle when last seen but his first two handicap runs were encouraging; still has some potential and the betting should guide.

runners.name: Optimatum
runners.comment: Signs of ability as a 2yo and a potential improver now handicapping on his 3yo return
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in three 2yo runs but there was promise on debut and again at Newcastle when last seen; gelded since; potential improver now handicapping.

runners.name: Yehudi
runners.comment: Promising 3rd over C&D when last seen; can win races this year but absent for five months
runners.spotlight: Promising third over C&D in October when last seen; could rate higher this year but may need this return to action.

runners.name: Bad Habits
runners.comment: 2nd over C&D on final run for G Boughey; well beaten in four runs for this yard; risky
runners.spotlight: Second over C&D on final start for George Boughey in January; poor form in four runs for new stable, the latest at Newcastle last week; risky.

prev_owners.owner: David Ingordo, Talla Racing Et Al

runners.name: Fort Payne

prev_owners.owner: Alain Jathiere, Mme Philippe Demercastel & Nicolas Caullery

runners.comment: Won Group 3 Burj Nahaar on Super Saturday but more to do in this company
runners.spotlight: Dual Group 3 turf winner who faced the kickback and stepped up a fair way on form of dirt debut when winning last month's Group 3 Burj Nahaar under today's rider, his task simplified by the below-par showing of a couple of the market leaders; more to do in this company.

quotes.race: Ras Al Khor Sponsored By Emirates Airline (Group 3) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I was pushed wide and saw too much daylight at Abu Dhabi last time. Today Fort Payne was in top form, they did a great job with him - Adrie de Vries, jockey.

runners.name: Kazu Petrin
runners.comment: 4-16 on dirt in Japan but yet to win at Group level; below best last time and opposable
runners.spotlight: 4-16 on dirt in Japan, though none of those wins have been at Group level; below best in Listed event last time and best watched from wide draw on UAE debut.

runners.name: King Gold
runners.comment: Fine effort to win the Group 3 Firebreak in January; didn't improve for 1m2f latest
runners.spotlight: Much improved on dirt - and a performance that matched the pick of his turf form - when beating last year's Dubai World Cup winner Laurel River (below form) in C&D Group 3 in January; didn't stay 1m2f last time but may do better back at 1m.

quotes.race: Firebreak Stakes Presented By Longines (Group 3 (Dirt)
quotes.quote: We will go for the Godolphin Mile with King Gold now and maybe run on Super Saturday too - Marine Henry, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Arc Prix Maurice de Gheest (Group 1) (3yo+) (Straight Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: King Gold had a few issues when he was younger but I think spending the winter in Dubai really helped him mentally, and something has really clicked. His work has never been better than in the last few weeks. Live I thought he'd won but on the replay, I thought we were second. Then they said the number eight and it's just crazy - Nicolas Caullery, trainer.

runners.name: Little Vic
runners.comment: Dual US Grade 3 dirt winner, including on most recent start; wide draw is the worry
runners.spotlight: Notched second US Grade 3 dirt win when scoring over this trip at Gulfstream in January; John Velazquez takes over this time but he'll do well to overcome the widest draw.

runners.name: Mendelssohn Bay
runners.comment: Respectable effort from wide draw in Burj Nahaar; may appreciate the return to further
runners.spotlight: Last year's UAE 2,000 Guineas winner who ran respectably from wide draw when third to Fort Payne in the Burj Nahaar over C&D; better drawn here but may well appreciate the return to further.

quotes.race: Dubai Islands (Conditions) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Mendelssohn Bay flew the gates. He's a talented horse but he's not straightforward - he's not a fan of kickback but he doesn't want to lead. I had to give Killer Collect weight and he'd had a run. It's not easy to produce a horse late on the dirt, but hopefully he'll improve a bit from tonight. He's still very immature, but he's got talent and I'm sure Bhupat will get it out of him - Pat Cosgrave, jockey.

quotes.race: UAE 2000 Guineas Presented by Longines (Group 3) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: The further we go the better for Mendelssohn Bay. He's a bit immature mentally, he's still learning, but when I asked him to quicken at the 300 he put the race to bed quickly - Pat Cosgrave, jockey.

quotes.race: Palm West Beach Presented by Nakheel (Maiden) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Mendelssohn Bay is the only thoroughbred I know who can do a 360 degree turn in full canter! He's far from straightforward, but he's only a baby. He's had a good experience there and he has plenty of talent. He'll be a lovely horse going two turns - Tadhg O'Shea, jockey.

quotes.race: Al Maktoum Mile Sponsored By Emaar (Group 2) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Meshtri came out of the Dubai Creek Mile really well. He was stronger at home, felt fresh, and we were very confident coming into the race. There were a couple of talking horses, but we wouldn't have swapped our lad. He's comfortable at a mile but his pedigree suggests he could get further - Ben Coen, jockey.

quotes.race: Dubai Creek Mile Sponsored By Nakheel (Listed Race) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: My lad was a bit fresh last time, but today with the blinkers on I was able to break well and take a pull around the bend. When Tadhg's horse [Walk Of Stars] came to me he kept on finding more. Meshtri has mentally got a lot stronger this season. I think he's good and comfortable at the mile - Ben Coen, jockey.

quotes.race: Arabian Adventures (Maiden) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: It was a good win today over a testing mile and Michael had him spot on. Meshtri travelled really well and gave me a winning feeling - James Orman, jockey.

runners.name: Mufasa

prev_owners.owner: Stud Los Leones & Stud Vendaval Inc

runners.comment: Prolific winner; beat subsequent Pegasus winner when last seen; player on UAE/yard debut
runners.spotlight: Prolific winner in Chile; only defeat in last four US starts came in last year's Breeders' Cup Mile (drawn 12); beat a below-par White Abarrio (since won the Pegasus) and Little Vic in Grade 3 over 7f on final start in December; could have been better drawn but interesting to see how he's acclimatised on this UAE/yard debut.

runners.name: No Lunch
runners.comment: 3-3 on AW in France this year but, while capable of better, has plenty to prove on dirt
runners.spotlight: Turf winner and Lockinge entry who is 3-3 on AW in France this year (last two for this trainer); however, this surface is something entirely different to synthetics and will do well to extend the winning run, especially from wide draw.

runners.name: Oasis Boy
runners.owner: Sheikh Mohammed Bin Khalifa Al Maktoum
runners.comment: Grade 2 winner in South America; back to form in Burj Nahaar but plenty more needed
runners.spotlight: Grade 2 winner in Argentina who returned to form when second to Fort Payne in the Burj Nahaar over C&D; booking of Christophe Soumillon takes the eye but work to do in this much stronger event.

quotes.race: Nad Al Sheba Gardens (Conditions) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: I was delighted tonight. I thought the draw [8] was a bad draw, but it was a good draw and neither me nor the horse really wanted to let Adrie [de Vries, on Strobe] out. Oasis Boy could have easily laid down in the straight but he switched leads and then finished strong. He held his line very well. He's a tough horse - Pat Dobbs, jockey.

runners.name: Peptide Nile
runners.comment: Grade 1 dirt winner in Japan who is down in class following two runs at the highest level
runners.spotlight: Grade 1 dirt winner in Japan who has run well on each of last two outings at the highest level, most recently when fourth to the progressive Costa Nova over this trip in February; he's a player on these terms.

runners.name: Qareeb
runners.comment: Good dirt strike-rate but he'll have to raise his game if he's to figure in this company
runners.spotlight: Good strike-rate on dirt in UAE and bagged first Group success at Jebel Ali on penultimate start (over 1m); below best in a Group 2 over 1m2f last time and work to do in this company.

quotes.race: Defender 90 (Handicap) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Qareeb only ran last week and before that it was ten days prior. His form is better on dirt but the way the grass track is riding, after the rain, he was able to get his toe in. He's very honest and he tries very hard. He went down to the start very well and looked fantastic. He's a credit to the team at Musabbeh's - Richard Mullen, jockey.

runners.name: Raging Torrent
runners.owner: Zhang Yuesheng And Great Friends Stables

prev_owners.owner: Great Friends Stables LLC & Mark Davis
Great Friends Stables LLC & Mark Davis

runners.comment: Best effort to win US 7f Grade 1 in December; still to prove he's as good over 1m, though
runners.spotlight: From a stable that has won this twice, including last year, and he's a progressive sort with a good strike-rate on dirt in the US; best effort to win the 7f Malibu (under Dettori) when last seen in December; big chance on the figures but still to prove he's as good at 1m.

runners.name: Sadaaty
runners.comment: Multiple dirt winner at Jebel Ali but will have to raise game to win on these terms
runners.spotlight: All four wins have been on dirt at Jebel Ali and is closely matched with Qareeb on Jebel Ali Mile (Group 3) form from February; best effort to win conditions event last time but good deal more needed in this company from wide draw; eyeshield fitted.

quotes.race: Al Sufouh Stakes Sponsored by Shadwell (Handicap) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Sadaaty surpassed expectations in his first run because he was a horse we didn't get to the races last year. He'd been off the track for a very long time. Horses generally need that first run and he ran well and had fitness under his belt. It was a great run today and he seems to like this track. We may stretch him out to a mile - Michael Costa, trainer.

runners.name: Steal Sunshine
runners.owner: Michael Iavarone, Jules Iavarone Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Michael Iavarone, Jules Iavarone & Carrie L Brogden
Carrie L Brogden, Michael Iavarone & Jules Iavarone
Carrie L Brogden & Little Red Feather Racing

runners.comment: Grade 2 dirt winner who has lost ground at the start so low draw may be a hindrance
runners.spotlight: Grade 2 US dirt winner who matched pick of form (squeezed at the start) when runner-up over this trip at Gulfstream last time; has lost ground at the start so low draw could quickly become an unfavourable one in field of this size, though.

runners.name: Sword Point
runners.comment: 2-2 on dirt in Hong Kong but faces a much stiffer test on this UAE debut
runners.spotlight: Smart performer who is 2-2 on dirt in Hong Kong; however, dirt form there nowhere near as strong as its turf counterpart and he'll likely struggle on this UAE debut.

3:20.race_name: Al Quoz Sprint Sponsored By Azizi Developments (Group 1) (Turf)

runners.name: Audience
runners.comment: Goes well fresh, ground fine and, although a slight doubt with the trip, has claims
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who has a fine record fresh; best effort to beat subsequent triple Group 1 winner Charyn in last year's Lockinge; handles soft but below best when last seen dropped to 6f in the Champions Sprint; the pick of the weights and chance will increase if he's left alone in front.

quotes.race: Sky Bet City Of York Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Audience got upset in the stalls and he struck the front of the stalls a couple of times when the other one reared up. Rab said he wasn't himself after that, he wouldn't let down at all - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: HKJC World Pool Lennox Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Audience has always had the talent but Rab knows him well. He was kept in training as a lead horse to Inspiral, as he was in the Lockinge. He's improving with age so there's hope for us all yet. He's matured a lot mentally. It wasn't a fluke in the Lockinge. The mile was too stiff at Ascot. Rab really knows him. He rides him most mornings - and then he takes him home. We'll go to the City of York without a penalty. We've put him in the Foret - last year's ground would have been perfect. He wouldn't want traditionally Parisian ground. He could well be a Breeders' Cup Mile horse as well - Thady Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Al Shaqab Lockinge Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Last year Audience wasn't giving himself a chance, we were running him over sprint trips to start. He was a little bit of a thug. He'd run some great races over seven furlongs last year, really staying on towards the end, and even towards the backend this was always going to be the starting point. We didn't think he'd be good enough to beat Inspiral but he's always threatened to win a big one. It's his first run over a mile and last year he never would have got a mile, he was too like a bull in a china shop. He's come back at the winner a couple of times last year, good horses like Kinross, he's had good horses around him. If he can improve over a mile - which he clearly has - there's some nice races to win with him - Rab Havlin, jockey, speaking on ITV racing.

quotes.race: Cavani Menswear Fashion Face-Off Frenzy Criterion Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: It is all down to Leah (Mapston) who looks after Audience and rides him every day. He was not right in the spring but he has come right now. I think the hood helps him a lot. Rab (Havlin) went up that ground this morning and it is completely fresh, virgin ground and that was a little bit of knowing your track. He is in races like the Lennox but he enjoyed the straight track here and seven furlongs is very much his trip - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Danon Mckinley
runners.comment: All wins in Japan have been over 7f and he needs to raise game to win back over 6f
runners.spotlight: All wins in Japan have been over 7f, including a Grade 2 in October; creditable effort in February after a short break but he'll have to raise his game if he's to win returned to sprinting.

runners.name: Howdeepisyourlove
runners.comment: Running well against top-class Ka Ying Rising in Hong Kong; big chance in this company
runners.spotlight: Hong Kong-based; has had the misfortune to bump into Ka Ying Rising (world's top-rated sprinter) on six of last seven starts but has performed with credit and won the only start in that period in which he didn't compete against that rival; no problem with the drop back to sprinting and he'll likely give a good account on UAE debut.

runners.name: Isivunguvungu
runners.comment: Grade 1 winner in South Africa who has run creditably for this yard in US; place claims
runners.spotlight: Grade 1 winner over this trip in South Africa (made most) and has run to a similar level in three runs for this yard in the US; should be suited by the return to 6f and he has place claims on UAE debut.

runners.name: Marbaan
runners.comment: Has won two minor Group events over 7f of late but more to do up in grade and down in trip
runners.spotlight: Smart performer for Charlie Fellowes; broke losing run and bagged first UAE win over 7f here in January (Group 2) and followed up over same C&D last time; more needed back in trip and back up in grade, though.

quotes.race: Ras Al Khor Sponsored By Azizi (Group 3) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Marbaan is a super horse and his last win was very impressive, but you could say this was even more so. He travelled around there so well and all I needed was a bit of space, which I knew I'd get, and he picked up really well. Michael [Costa, trainer] has found the key to him which is to keep him as relaxed as possible, as he can be a bit hot headed. Hopefully he can keep this form for World Cup night, if that's where connections decide to go, I don't know what the plan is - Ray Dawson, jockey.

quotes.race: Al Fahidi Fort Presented By Longines (Group 2) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Marbaan has done so well since his run at Abu Dhabi. He's not the greatest trackworker at home but I think we've found his niche distance now. The instructions were to keep him smooth and everything went perfectly - Michael Costa, trainer.

quotes.race: World Pool Lennox Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: We've been beaten by two proper Group 1 horses. I think Jamie felt had the ground been just a bit quicker, we might have been able to get a little bit closer to them. But Marbaan has run a cracker. To be fair he had one bad run at Ascot, where the whole race was just a disaster and I've always felt he is one of those horses who is better ridden with a little bit of confidence, a little bit of patience, whereas at Ascot, we were too aggressive on him. This is well and truly back on track and we are delighted with that run - Charlie Fellowes, trainer.

quotes.race: Japan Racing Association Vintage Stakes (Group 2) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: I genuinely haven't thought about future options but Marbaan is in the National Stakes, which could be very tempting, and I put him in the Champagne Stakes this morning - Charlie Fellowes, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Marbaan is a really good looking, straightforward horse. He got into a good rhythm and he was happy doing his own work and he stretched clear when asked to go. Whether we step him up to seven furlongs in the Superlative Stakes at Newmarket or wait until Goodwood (Vintage Stakes) - we will decide with the owner's racing manager. He will get a mile by the end of the year. I think he is a Group class horse. He is only going to improve as the year goes on - Charlie Fellowes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Again, regular readers may recall I was enthusiastic about this colt after his debut when third at Newbury. I thought he would turn out to be our best juvenile and it was nice to be proved right as he had a great season, including victory in the Group 2 Vintage Stakes at Glorious Goodwood for Sheikh Ahmed. He wintered well and I was happy enough with his reappearance at Ascot last month in the 6f Commonwealth Cup Trial behind Cold Case. He just got slightly tapped for toe when they quickened but stayed on well top the line. I will give him another crack at sprinting, although I thought he looked more of a 7f horse to me. That next race will be at Salisbury this weekend in the Cathedral Stakes. That will tell me whether I train him for the 6f Commonwealth Cup or the 7f Jersey Stakes at Royal Ascot. Looking further down the line this gorgeous looker could be going for races in France, including the Prix Jean Prat or Maurice de Gheest. 28-05-23

runners.name: Quinault
runners.comment: Better than ever last year with three Listed wins but below that level on last three runs
runners.spotlight: Better than ever last year with three Listed wins in Britain but below that level on last three starts, including in Qatar last time; will have to raise his game if he's to win this.

quotes.race: Starman At Tally Ho Stud Garrowby Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We thought Quinault wouldn't like this ground but he just wants to win - he definitely tries. He's a special horse for a yard the size of ours, especially as he came a long way in such a short space of time last year. He had a little wobble earlier this year and was a little bit ill after we gave him the flu jab, but he's bang in form now. He's such a special horse. There's a chance he improves again next year and I still think he might be better over seven furlongs, so we've got to explore that avenue as well. He'll have a little bit of a break now as he's done his bit for the summer, but we could travel with him. He's a gelding so we'll go where the best prize-money is that he can win. There isn't much point in running him in Group races just for the sake of it - Stuart Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Jenningsbet Hopeful Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I don't think Quinault was in love with the ground but he just tries very hard - Stuart Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Liverpool Airport Faster, Easier, Friendlier Queensferry Stakes (Listed)
quotes.quote: I'd love Quinault to go seven furlongs round a bend somewhere if I could find the right race for him - I think that would be ideal. We wouldn't be against travelling him later in the year. We might go abroad somewhere, some of the tighter tracks, maybe in America, somewhere like that might suit him - Stuart Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: What a special horse Quinault has been for everybody this year. He didn't run a bad race the last day but he's back on song today - it's a special day. He's got one way of running in that you let him stride on in front, and he's so genuine he keeps finding for you - Luke Catton, jockey.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: We had Sendintank who won ten handicaps in a season, including four in a week twice, but that was at a much lower level than this - this is very different. Quinault is a very tough horse and he's got loads of talent as well. Luke Catton has done a fantastic job settling him and it's such a shame he cannot do the weight. The horse was just a runaway when he arrived, he would just bolt. We trained him on a treadmill for the first two months so he never left the yard, before we slowly started to introduce him to the Heath, so there's a lot of work gone into what you're seeing today. He's always had the talent, it's just been a case of letting the horse know it and letting him use it - he's always been fast, that wasn't the problem! He's bred to get further so as long as we can keep him settled in his races that's a route we'll look to go with him - Stuart Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Oakmere Homes Supporting Macmillan Sprint Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: This was the biggest occasion Quinault has been to and he got a little bit warm in the preliminaries but he settled nicely in the race and Connor gave him a lovely ride, just managing to get him there on the line. We put him in at Ascot just in case something happened that forced our hand, but my gut feeling is probably not to run. I think he'll get a bit further and I've put him in the Bunbury Cup so that's a possibility - Stuart Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Aspall Suffolk Draught Cyder Handicap
quotes.quote: It was unfortunate Luke Catton couldn't ride Quinault today as he couldn't do the weight.
