Luke has done a brilliant job settling him at home as he was a tearaway when he came but that is why Godolphin put him in the sale in the first place. He will probably go to York now for the valuable three-year-old six-furlong handicap as long as he comes out of this fine - Stuart Williams, trainer.

runners.name: Regional
runners.breeder: Razza Del Sole Societa Agricola Srl (Gb)
runners.comment: Group 1 winner in 2023 who showed he was at least as good last year; interesting in UAE
runners.spotlight: Had Believing back in third when bagging the Group 1 over 6f at Haydock in 2023 and, although campaign restricted to three runs last year, showed he retains all his ability was second in the King Charles III at Royal Ascot; off since July but goes well fresh and, although not guaranteed his own way in front, is a player on UAE debut.

quotes.race: King Charles III Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Another half-a-furlong and we might have got there but that's horseracing. We can be nothing but proud of Regional. I would imagine we will try and aim towards something like the July Cup now - Ed Bethell, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Sprint Cup Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: It was a massive performance. It looked smooth and Regional was one of the last to come off the bridle. In the Nunthorpe, he was rushed off his feet but he was so much more comfortable at this trip and I'm over the moon for everyone. The owners might want to go to America but I'll see how the horse is first and then we'll make a decision - Ed Bethell, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Achilles Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Fast ground and flat tracks are his big things and we'll try and keep Regional to that now. I'd imagine we'll look at the Nunthorpe in August as it looks a logical target. We'll chat about what we do in the interim - there's the City Walls with a penalty or the King George at Goodwood. He wasn't the same horse last season as he is this year, he's just thrived and is enjoying his races - Ed Bethell, trainer.

quotes.race: Lindum York Handicap
quotes.quote: I wasn't expecting to make the running, but Regional is a decent horse and always has been. He came third in a Stewards' Cup and was unlucky in other handicaps, so I'm delighted for him. He ran off 100 in the Stewards' Cup and I think that's his mark in handicaps, which might make life difficult, but there's the City Walls back here now he's shown he's electric. I didn't think he was and he's shown me he's quick enough - Ed Bethell, trainer.

quotes.race: The Tin Man Handicap
quotes.quote: We thought we'd have to pay 30,000 and we paid 3,500gns and I'm not sure why. Regional's work had been good at home before and we were hopeful but I was a little unsure whether he'd strip fit enough for today. He's got a nice future, that's for sure, I'm looking forward to him - Ed Bethell, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: Regional travelled well and was very professional - Tony Hamilton, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's exciting. I was delighted with him in Ireland, the stiff 6f at the Curragh probably isn't his bag, so he'll go for the King Charles and I hope he'll run well over the stiff 5f at Ascot. He's come out of the race well and he's got a chance, but it's only a chance. It's going to be a tough gig. 10-06-24

Last year he was knocking on the door without winning, so I thought by dropping him back to 5f we'd see him running on at the end and it would do him good. I chose the Lindum York Handicap as the starting point and he led from start to finish to beat Korker. His best runs have been when he's made the running, but he can fluff his lines at the start and you don't have time to repair the damage over 5f. He's up to a career-high mark of 105 now and ideally I'd like to go for the Achilles Stakes at Haydock, followed by the City Walls Stakes at Chester, and if all goes well have a crack at the Nunthorpe. That comes at a time when some of those stepping up in grade can run huge races. 01-06-23

runners.name: Win Carnelian
runners.comment: Running respectably over this trip of late but faces a tough task on these terms
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner at a lesser level in Japan and, although he's been running respectably over this trip at Grade 3 level on last two starts (handicap last time), he faces a tough task on these terms.

runners.name: Believing
runners.owner: Mrs Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith & Resolute

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Derrick Smith & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: Yet to win at the highest level but a reliable sort who should give a good account
runners.spotlight: Yet to win at the highest level but she's a reliable yardstick who posted three solid efforts in Group 1 company in second half of last term; no problem with the return to 6f and should run well on seasonal/UAE debut.

quotes.race: Coolmore Wootton Bassett Nunthorpe Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted. As we discussed before, Believing probably was on the wrong side. She just gets a bit outpaced at that crucial point. Nothing really took her into the race properly. It was a lovely ride from Ryan Moore and she was getting there with each stride. She'll head to the Flying Five, that's been the plan for a long time and I'm very proud of her. She's dancing every dance and I hope she'll pop up at some point - George Boughey, trainer.

quotes.race: King George Qatar Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Believing is showing her tenacity every time. I was a little worried after a couple of furlongs she was out of her ground on the fastest five you run at this grade. She's still learning to sprint at this distance. She's carried a penalty, didn't have the easiest of runs and all options are open for her. Ryan Moore was pretty insistent she went to the Nunthorpe but the Flying Five has always been the plan and there's enough time for her to do both, but she'll govern that. She takes her races well and is still upwardly mobile - George Boughey, trainer.

quotes.race: Barberstown Castle Sapphire Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Believing is a very straightforward filly and was probably entitled to win this - Ryan Moore, rider.

quotes.race: Betfred Passionate About Sport Achilles Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: That was very impressive. There was a strong headwind today and the favourite was running into the teeth of it, but we weren't sat that far behind. Believing will definitely run in the 5f race [at Ascot] and it wouldn't be the biggest surprise in the world if she also ran on the Saturday over six as well [Queen Elizabeth II Jubilee Stakes]. She's a very easy filly to train so if she's ok after Tuesday's race she could then run on the Saturday - George Boughey, trainer.

quotes.race: EBF Stallions Highfield Farm Flying Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Believing was dropping in grade here but was given a very good ride and is a talented filly. Craig Witheford and his team have done a super job with her because she was a bit of a nightmare in the stalls for a while. She's a Group 3 winner when things go right but she'd rear up and it's pretty hard to come back from that in a sprint. She's progressive and I think straight tracks are what she wants. It was nice to get her back on track and we'll step her back up in grade now. She has an entry in the Sprint at Ascot on Champions Day and that's her main target - George Boughey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's such a consistent filly and we think she's a Group 1 winner in waiting, but she's running out of time a bit to do it this season. She goes to the Flying Five, which looks like it could end up being almost a match between her and Bradsell, and we're very happy with her. She won't go to the Champions Sprint as the ground will be too soft over that stiff six furlongs at Ascot. I've always thought the Breeders' Cup Turf Sprint could suit her. Her chance there would be very draw-dependent, but it's an open division. 11-09-24

Won back-to-back races in the spring, including the Group 3 Prix Texanita at Chantilly. She returned there this month but reared up in the stalls several times and eventually missed the break by five lengths. I need to get her stalls sorted out before we go again. She is in the Commonwealth Cup next week, a race in which fillies have a fine record, but I would not go unless she is absolutely right after recent travels. I will decide on whether she goes to the royal meeting much closer to the time. 14-06-23

runners.name: Puro Magic
runners.comment: Triple winner over this trip last year but out of sorts since last success; tough task
runners.spotlight: Triple winner over this trip in Japan last year (twice in Grade 3 events) but below best since last win and she's up against it on this UAE debut.

runners.name: West Acre
runners.comment: Broke 5f track record here on penultimate start; workmanlike last time; more to do
runners.spotlight: Progressive sort who broke the 5f track record in fine style in Group 2 here in January; more workmanlike when following up in Group 3 over same C&D last time but may appreciate the return to 6f and, although this is much tougher, she can do better.

quotes.race: Nad Al Sheba Turf Sprint Sponsored By Emirates Skycargo (Group 3) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It was certainly harder work [than the last race]. Ponntos got into his normal groove and was slightly away from us which maybe suited him but not us; it would have been nice to have direct aim at him. West Acre got away well and got into a nice position. He dug deep, was gritty and galloped out well after the line. I fancy he could be even better over the six furlongs of the Al Quoz Sprint - Callum Shepherd, jockey.

quotes.race: Blue Point Sprint Presented By Longines (Group 2) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It was a track record and an extraordinary performance. West Acre is a lightly raced horse and we thought he'd come on for his last run. I wanted to come back to five because he's all speed. He's got a huge engine and hopefully we can keep him safe and sound and more forward with the rest of the season out here. The obvious programme would be to go for the Nad Al Sheba on Super Saturday and the Al Quoz on World Cup night - George Scott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a very sharp and professional two-year-old and he showed up very well in a racecourse gallop at Chelmsford. If he makes a good start to his career he could go to the Lily Agnes at Chester in May, hopefully on his way to Royal Ascot, and he's a nice prospect. 29-03-24

runners.name: Admire Daytona
runners.comment: Best effort when fourth in Japanese Listed event last time; should appreciate this trip
runners.spotlight: Maiden winner at the fourth attempt but showed improved form when fourth in Japanese Listed event over 1m last time; closely matched with Don In The Mood and should go well over this longer trip on UAE debut.

runners.name: Don In The Mood
runners.comment: Dual 1m1f dirt winner in Japan; respectable effort over 1m latest; claims back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Dual 1m1f dirt winner in Japan and finished ahead of Admire Daytona in Listed event dropped to 1m last time; should be suited by the return to this trip and he has reasonable claims.

runners.name: Dragon
runners.comment: 1m1f winner; behind two of these last time but may well do better back up in trip
runners.spotlight: 1m1f dirt maiden winner in Japan but behind both Don In The Mood and Admire Daytona in Listed event over 1m at Tokyo last time; likely he'll do better back up in distance on this UAE debut.

runners.name: Flood Zone

prev_owners.owner: Big Frank Stable, Enrico Ascione Et Al

runners.comment: Progressive sort who should stay this trip and has leading claims on this UAE debut
runners.spotlight: Progressive sort; wide-margin 6.5f dirt maiden winner in January and he stepped up again on yard debut when winning Grade 3 over 1m at Aqueduct; he'll likely stay this trip and trainer reports he's shipped over well; leading claims on UAE debut.

runners.name: Galactic Star
runners.owner: Blue Blood Racing Syndicate - Kamlesh Mahtani & Dhruv Sahni
runners.comment: Improved to beat Heart Of Honor over C&D in February; more to do here
runners.spotlight: Showed improved form to beat Heart Of Honor in the Listed Al Bastakiya over C&D in February but, while he's open to improvement, he's got much more to do in this company.

quotes.race: Al Bastakiya Presented By DP World (Listed Race) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: I always knew they liked Galactic Star a lot. He's got his quirks but he's full of ability and talent. There were question marks over the trip but Bhupat said ride him as if he gets it. It helps if they're going two turns because they come back to you a bit easier going into that first turn and horses can just relax a little bit more than they do over a mile - Richard Mullen, jockey.

runners.name: Heart Of Honor
runners.comment: Better than bare form of last two starts but he'll have to improve if he's to win this
runners.spotlight: Imposing sort who doesn't do himself any favours with his lack of early pace but first-time blinkers could help on that score; bit better than the bare form suggests on each of last two starts but, while trainer knows what it takes to win this race, this 3yo will have to raise his game to win.

quotes.race: UAE 2000 Guineas Presented By Longines (Group 3) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: It had a mile and a quarter written all over it. There was a lot of traffic and Heart Of Honor doesn't have the gate speed of some of the others. Clearly, he's long in stamina. We've got four weeks until the Al Bastakiya and that's where we'll go. The extra couple of furlongs looks like being the key - Jamie Osborne, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Maritime City (DMC) (Conditions) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Heart Of Honor had a few quicker horses around him this time and they came across him and he got a bit of kickback. He didn't learn much last time as we were three or four wide and he didn't face any kickback. He still had a good old look when he hit the front, so I think there's a bit more in the tank. We mustn't forget that he was giving away 5lb too, probably to a good horse, so it was a tough performance - Adrie de Vries, jockey.

quotes.race: Arabian Radio Network (Conditions) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Jim and Claire came here last year with Many A Star, who wasn't good enough, and this year we wanted to do things differently so thankfully they backed me in buying dirt horses. It was also my brief to give Claire a winner two days before her birthday, and it's not often a plan comes off! - Jamie Osborne, trainer.

runners.name: Rafid
runners.comment: Listed placed in US and off the mark at Jebel Ali last time but has plenty to find
runners.spotlight: Listed placed in the US but, although off the mark at Jebel Ali last time, he'll have to raise his game by some way if he's to make an impact.

runners.name: Shin Forever
runners.comment: Ran best race in the Saudi Derby last time and worth a try over this trip; claims
runners.spotlight: Only one win from seven starts but he ran at least as well as he ever has when second to progressive UAE 2,000 Guineas winner Golden Vekoma in the Saudi Derby (1m) last time; up in trip but claims if stamina holds out.

runners.name: Queen Azteca
runners.comment: Good strike-rate on dirt but unimpressive here last time and more to do in this company
runners.spotlight: 3-4 on dirt but unimpressive when winning the UAE Oaks last time and she faces a different calibre of rival today.

quotes.race: UAE Oaks Presented By DP World (Group 3) (Fillies) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: It was a bit more stressful than I thought it would be! I didn't think Arigatou [Gozaimasu] would be the one to step up, after last time, but both fillies ran great races. From 50 metres out, I thought Queen Azteca had a good shot at it when Arigatou stopped a little, so maybe it looked easier than it was. It's a big racing scene here and we come from little Norway, so to pull it off is a huge achievement. I think all of Scandinavia was cheering us on today - Niels Petersen, trainer.

quotes.race: Cocoa Beach Stakes (Sponsored By Land Rover) (Conditions Race) (Fillies) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: I was very lonely when everyone went for the spot I wanted, but I decided to leave Queen Azteca there as I knew I had a horse for distance and she would get there. She has so much class and she will improve even more for more distance - Carlos Lopez, jockey.

4:40.race_name: Dubai Golden Shaheen Sponsored By Nakheel (Group 1) (Dirt)

runners.name: Colour Up
runners.comment: Smart but held by Tuz and makes no appeal in this company
runners.spotlight: Smart sprinter but finished behind Tuz the last six times he's run against him and he makes no appeal in this company.

quotes.race: Dubai Golden Shaheen Sponsored by Nakheel (Group 1) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: I had to use up a bit of petrol from the draw and Colour Up stopped very quickly for some reason - it's not like him. I'd say he's not right - Pat Dobbs, jockey.

quotes.race: Al Garhoud Sprint Presented by Azizi (Second Leg of The Emirates Sprint Series) (Listed Race) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Colour Up is a real nice horse. A lot of our horses have been coming up a little bit short and he was getting tired at the end but hopefully he'll move up from here - Doug Watson, trainer.

quotes.race: Defender 90 (Handicap) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Colour Up relaxed a lot better tonight and when I gave him a squeeze halfway around the bend he lit up and quickened like a really good horse. He doesn't want to be running that often so the Jebel Ali Sprint could be the plan if he's OK - Pat Dobbs, jockey.

runners.name: Drews Gold
runners.comment: Won first four starts in the US and is Grade 1 placed, but behind Tuz both UAE starts
runners.spotlight: Won first four starts in the US and placed in Grade 1 (2023); hasn't had much racing since and has twice finished behind Tuz in the UAE; it's hard to see those placings reversed.

runners.name: Eastern World
runners.comment: Beat Tuz in 2023 but behind that rival four times since; tough task
runners.spotlight: He was the last horse to beat Tuz over C&D, that win coming in late 2023, but he's finished behind that rival four times since and he'll likely struggle again.

quotes.race: Betway Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: The ground was quick enough for Eastern World him and a step up in trip to a mile and a quarter will see further improvement. - Charlie Appleby, trainer

runners.name: Kurojishi Joe
runners.comment: Multiple dirt winner in Japan; no improvement back at 7f last time; tough task
runners.spotlight: Multiple dirt winner in Japan but not at his best back over 7f last time and he'll likely struggle on these terms.

runners.name: Nakatomi
runners.owner: Mrs Fitriani Hay And Qatar Racing Llc

prev_owners.owner: Qatar Racing LLC & Mrs Fitri Hay
Mrs Fitriani Hay And Qatar Racing Llc
Qatar Racing LLC & Mrs Fitri Hay
Marc Detampel, Qatar Racing & Bottle Rocket Stable
Marc Detampel, Qatar Racing & Tim O Banker

runners.comment: Grade 1 handicap winner on dirt last summer but behind Straight No Chaser in BC Sprint
runners.spotlight: Grade 1 handicap winner over this trip on dirt at Saratoga last summer but below that level when sixth in the Breeders' Cup Sprint behind Straight No Chaser; only third behind Tuz in this last year and needs a return to best.

quotes.race: Dubai Golden Shaheen Sponsored by Nakheel (Group 1) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: The horse drawn nine took all my chance away when he crossed me after 50 metres and it cost me any chance of winning the race. Nakatomi has done really well to get to where we got - Jamie Spencer, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won his only start like a good horse. I had him carded for a race at home last month as I wasn't sure he'd like grass, but having tried him it has become apparent he loves it. He's also proved effective on firm or soft ground, which I don't think would be the case for most of his rivals. Oisin Murphy sat on him on Sunday morning when he worked fine with Lucci, although the other horse was well on top at the end. 08-06-21

runners.name: Remake
runners.comment: Capable sprinter but held by Tuz and by Straight No Chaser on form in the last year
runners.spotlight: Won last year's Dirt Sprint in Saudi Arabia and a valuable event in South Korea in September; however, held by Tuz on form of this race a year ago and well beaten behind Straight No Chaser the last twice, so plenty to prove.

quotes.race: Dubai Golden Shaheen Sponsored by Nakheel (Group 1) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Remake got pinched at the start and he got knocked over when he started to accelerate into the home stretch. Running abroad is hard. It was all over at the start. He showed his turn of foot though it was the worst time to get knocked down - Koichi Shintani, trainer.

runners.name: Royal Commando
runners.comment: Has won both starts this season, following a long absence, but tough task at the weights
runners.spotlight: Listed winner in Britain and at Jebel Ali on most recent outing; however, needs a huge step forward if he's to figure on these terms.

quotes.race: Unibet Cammidge Trophy Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Charlie Hills and the team have freshened Royal Commando up. He seems a happy horse at the moment. He hit a flat spot from the four to the three but he came good for me two furlongs out - Kieran Shoemark, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He was a good winner of the Cammidge Trophy on his reappearance this spring and we'd intended going to Ireland after that, but the weather put paid to those plans. So he goes straight to Royal Ascot for the Diamond Jubilee and I think he's a serious each-way player. He ran a good race in the Commonwealth Cup 12 months ago and is in very good form at home. I'm looking for a big show from him.. - 10-06-21

runners.name: Straight No Chaser
runners.comment: One of the best dirt sprinters around and he makes plenty of appeal on UAE debut
runners.spotlight: Powerful individual who has won six of his nine dirt starts, including the Breeders' Cup Sprint in November and Riyadh Dirt Sprint in February; makes UAE debut and takes on the local legend Tuz but likely to give another good account.

quotes.race: Riyadh Dirt Sprint presented by Saudi National Bank (Group 2) (3yo+) (Outer Track) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Straight No Chaser broke really well and I was actually, after Jasper Krone came up on the outside, going to see if I could get him back a little bit and tried to grab him. He started to fight me, so I just said, 'OK, I'll leave him alone' and then he relaxed a little better. He broke so sharp and I was trying to get loose reins. Then he was looking for the bit and I didn't want to touch him. I just wanted him to relax. All of a sudden [Jasper Krone] took back a little bit and my horse engaged and I said, 'Let's go'. Turning for home he was moving really well and then passing the sixteenth pole he idled a little bit and started looking around and I said, 'Oh no, no idling here' and he finished up well - John Velazquez, jockey.

quotes.race: Cygames Breeders' Cup Sprint (Grade 1) (3yo+) (Main Track) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: I wanted to break well and get a good position. Dan told me not to worry about getting the lead, so I just let Straight No Chaser get into a good rhythm and let him do his own thing. I knew we were going fast, so I didn't want to move too soon. I squeezed him a little at the three-eighths, but then by the three-sixteenths I knew I was gonna get it - John Velazquez, jockey.

runners.name: Super Chow
runners.comment: Prolific winner in the US but will need a clear personal best if he's to win this
runners.spotlight: Prolific winner in the US but yet to score above Grade 3 level and, although he comes here at the top of his game, he'll need a clear career-best effort if he's to do so this time.

runners.name: Tuz
runners.comment: Outstanding UAE dirt sprinter; should run well but has a tough rival in Straight No Chaser
runners.spotlight: The outstanding dirt sprinter in the UAE, he won this by a wide margin last year and has won all four C&D starts this season; sure to go well, though faces a different calibre of rival in Straight No Chaser.

quotes.race: Mahab Al Shimaal Sponsored By emirates.com (Group 3) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Tuz is a streetfighter, he just keeps coming back - he's like Muhammad Ali! He's made history by becoming the first horse to win all the big dirt sprints. There will be some good sprinters here for the Dubai Golden Shaheen, but we have home turf - Bhupat Seemar, trainer.

quotes.race: Al Shindagha Sprint Presented By Longines (Group 3) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Tuz is a machine around here. He's playing games with the opposition at the moment. He's a jockey's dream, a push button, and just a phenomenal racehorse. He had his ears pricked and if something had come to him, he's have pulled out more - Tadhg O'Shea, jockey.

quotes.race: Dubawi Stakes Sponsored By Binghatti Developers (Group 3) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Tuz is a special horse, a great horse for the barn. It's a great privilege to be able to steer him around for my 800th winner. I remember winning my 700th in this very same race on Switzerland. I had one slightly anxious moment going to the start when he saw something and slammed on his brakes but thankfully I stayed on - Tadhg O'Shea, jockey.

quotes.race: Al Garhoud Sprint Sponsored By Phil Advertising (Listed Race) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: He's very, very good and he got there [to the front] easily. He's awesome out of the gates - you just lie up his neck and let him at it. The difference between Tuz and other horses is that he lands running. He's a ball of muscle and a ball of fire - Tadhg O'Shea, jockey. In my opinion he's one of the fastest horses in the world. He beat some of the fastest horses from Japan and America in the Golden Shaheen. He had to do what he did today, but then there's always a worry because he's a big horse, a seven-year-old, and he was drawn seven. He set some very fast fractions, and you can see from the horses who finished around him that the early horses didn't finish in the money and they came from the back to finish second and third. We'll probably run next in January [G3 Dubawi Stakes] and then Super Saturday [G3 Mahab Al Shimaal] and then the World Cup [G1 Dubai Golden Shaheen] - Bhupat Seemar, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Golden Shaheen Sponsored by Nakheel (Group 1) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Tuz is very fast. We had a great gate number but we were getting pressured a long way out. He had to be good and tough. There wasn't much room to manoeuvre down on the inside, but I had a good, willing partner. He's a big horse. When he straightened up, he went through the eye of a needle. I was a length down off Cristian [Demuro] on the home turn. I gave [Tuz] a squeeze and the response was immediate. He's a high-class horse and when he gets a rail to shoot at, he's very, very, very good - Tadhg O'Shea, jockey.

quotes.race: Dubawi Stakes (Group 3) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: When Tuz is good, he's very good. He carried a penalty at Sharjah and he's a big horse, so he needed the run. He had a bad habit before of not changing his lead but he's over all that now. The best thing about him is that he has so much early speed. He'll give his roommate Switzerland something to think about in the coming weeks! - Tadhg O'Shea, jockey.

quotes.race: Al Shindagha Sprint Presented by Emaar (Group 3) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Tuz has got speed to burn. I told Jose to use the draw to his advantage and that is the only way to do it with him. He's a really nice horse. It might be Super Saturday and the Golden Shaheen, but we'll have to see where Switzerland goes - Bhupat Seemar, trainer.

runners.name: American Stage
runners.comment: Won all three 6f starts in Japan; first defeat at the trip when behind Tuz on UAE debut
runners.spotlight: Won all three 6f starts in Japan and his only defeat over that trip came over C&D on UAE debut behind Tuz; better berthed this time and Oisin Murphy up, so no surprise were he to step up again.

runners.name: Dark Saffron
runners.comment: Best effort to win conditions event over C&D last time but a good deal more is needed
runners.spotlight: Progressive sort who turned in best effort when winning a C&D conditions event by a wide margin back on dirt last time; considerably more needed, especially from widest draw.

quotes.race: Longines Spirit Zulu Time (Conditions) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Dark Saffron gave me a very good feel and he's done nothing wrong this season. He won here and then we switched to the turf where he's been beaten by some good sprinters. It was a good option to switch back to the dirt and that was more like a piece of work to him. There were some pretty decent horses in behind, too. He's got all summer to fill into his frame, so hopefully he'll be a proper sprinter next season - Connor Beasley, jockey. We have Sir Harmony and Dark Saffron, so that's why we moved Dark Saffron to the turf. If an invitation [for the Dubai Golden Shaheen] arrives we will probably go for it - Ahmad bin Harmash, trainer.

quotes.race: Como Residences (Maiden) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Credit must go to Saif Al Balushi as he rides Dark Saffron every day at home. He's been telling the boss how much he'd improved since Jebel Ali. He's not the easiest horse to ride in the mornings so well done to Saif as he puts up with a lot. He could be smart horse going forward - Connor Beasley, jockey.

5:15.race_name: Dubai Turf Sponsored By DP World (Group 1) (Turf)

runners.name: Facteur Cheval

prev_owners.owner: Team Valor International LLC & Gary Barber
Team Valor International LLC & Gary Barber
Team Valor International LLC & Gary Barber

runners.comment: Hasn't really taken to dirt and, although he won this in 2024, this is a stronger renewal
runners.spotlight: First success at the top level when taking this last year and he matched that form later in the year in the Sussex Stakes and the QEII; below that level this year in two runs on dirt; return to this surface is ideal but this is a stronger renewal than the 2024 one.

quotes.race: Queen Elizabeth II Stakes (Sponsored By Qipco) (Group 1) (British Champions Mile)
quotes.quote: When he challenged Charyn they went head to head but Charyn is the best miler and it's like a victory to finish second again. It's hard to win a Group 1 here in Britain but one day we will. Facteur Cheval got a little squeezed in but it wouldn't have changed anything, we were beaten by a better horse. We'll run in the Golden Eagle in Australia on November 2 - Jerome Reynier, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Queen Anne Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: The pace in the first 800 metres was too intense and then Big Rock gave way quite early and Facteur Cheval got left on his own to make the best of his way home, which was not easy. Watching the race back, even if Maxime had gone across to join the others he would have been on the wing without cover. The ground in Dubai was fast but with a better covering of grass, and here it was too firm for him with less of a cushion. He also lost his off-fore shoe - Maxime wasn't sure where - so he got unbalanced and was never comfortable. It's a race to forget - Jerome Reynier, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Turf Sponsored by DP World (Group 1) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Facteur Cheval is a great champion. We didn't know how he would handle the faster ground because he's more used to racing on soft and heavy surfaces, but you can see how well he did. He gave me a really great turn of foot and really wanted to fight to the line. I didn't want to go too early because he's been running over 1600 metres and was stepping up in trip slightly, for all that I think he'll stay 2000 metres - Maxime Guyon, jockey.

quotes.race: Qatar Sussex Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: It's like a victory today, we really thought he was going to beat Paddington but he had the stand rail, and we were in the middle of the track. Facteur Cheval was stuck in the middle of the traffic, but he's run a great race. He was third in a Group 1 the other day, second today in a very nice Group 1 and I hope that next time we will be able to win at that level. He keeps improving mentally and physically, so probably the best is yet to come. Fingers crossed he will be coming back in good shape and we can aim for the Queen Elizabeth at the end of the year with him. There are two options beforehand - the Moulin de Longchamp or the Woodbine Mile in Canada. Maybe, we will wait until he is a five-year-old for an international campaign - Jerome Reynier, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: The form of the Dubai Turf is amazing. The second, Namur, ran a cracker in the Yasuda Kinen, the fourth, Measured Time, won in America and even the horse who finished seventh, Calif, won La Coupe at Longchamp. We had a good draw and got a nice trip but Maxime [Guyon] rode an amazing race. Last year he had to face champions like Paddington and Big Rock and it was his first year travelling. Now he's more mature physically and mentally and he's ready to run even better. When you go to the track with him there's not a single doubt he will give his best. He's just an amazing athlete. 13-06-24

runners.name: Ghostwriter
runners.comment: Unbeaten as 2yo; posted best efforts in 2024 over 1m2f on a sound surface; each-way shot
runners.spotlight: Unbeaten as juvenile and kept to Group 1 company last year, posting his best efforts over 1m2f on a sound surface in the International at York and Irish Champion; preparation has reportedly gone well and there may be more to come from him this year; no surprise to see him run well at a price.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix du Jockey Club (Group 1) (3yo Colts & Fillies) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Ghostwriter had a great trip round and I'm really happy with how he travelled through the race. He probably just didn't find that change of gear that he has on quicker ground. I'm really pleased he's put up a positive performance and he's still a nice horse in the making - Clive Cox, trainer.

quotes.race: Juddmonte Royal Lodge Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Ghostwriter is improving with every run and that was a big step to take. His dam won over a mile and a half and it's possible he will get that trip, too. He's always been a nice horse, but had a frame to fill as well. This cements what we thought. What next? We'll discuss it with Jeff Smith (owner) but I'd probably be thinking of next year. We've had a couple of foal entries for the Derby before but this is the first potential live chance who we could be thinking about going that way with - Clive Cox, trainer.

quotes.race: RoR horses For Courses British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ghostwriter is in the Royal Lodge and that'd be our plan. He's shown an ability to handle Newmarket, albeit on the July course, and we just love him. It's great to be having that dream and Plan A. We were really impressed with him first up. He's coped with his penalty well today and I loved the way he stretched away there. He's clearly going to get the mile well and he's progressed mentally, and physically he's getting better all the time - Clive Cox, trainer.

runners.name: Goemon
runners.comment: In fine form in Bahrain this year and ran well in Saudi but considerably more is required
runners.spotlight: Improved performer in Bahrain this season, winning four of last five starts; good effort at Riyadh on penultimate start but that form leaves him a long way short of what is required to win this.

quotes.race: Bet UK's Acca Club £5 Free Bet Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This would be Goeman's minimum trip as he's probably a mile and a half horse. I'll have to speak to the owner  - Kevin Philippart de Foy, trainer.

runners.name: Holloway Boy
runners.owner: N White, S White, T White & E Burke
runners.comment: Not a regular winner and, although he's a reliable yardstick, he faces a tough task
runners.spotlight: Not a regular winner but he is a consistent sort, beaten without any obvious excuses behind Nations Pride in the Singspiel over C&D on Super Saturday; tough task.

quotes.race: Best Odds On The Betfair Exchange Superior Mile Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Holloway Boy is a very talented horse - he always has been - but he just saves a little bit for himself, as you saw there in the last furlong when he was just pulling up a little bit. He'll handle any ground and will run right the way through. I wouldn't mind traveling with him abroad, maybe to Dubai or Saudi, as he's the type of horse who could go anywhere - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: Clipper Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Holloway Boy ran his usual game race but was carrying plenty of weight. The Balmoral at Ascot at the end of the season would be perfect race for him - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Golden Mile (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Holloway Boy has run a great race again. I just said to the owners he's strung three races in a row now in big handicaps. It's so hard and he was giving 18lb to the winner, who was a much higher-rated horse a year or so ago, and we've also given about a stone away to the second. He travelled beautifully through the race, possibly we got there 100 yards too soon but I don't think so. We were just beaten by better-handicapped horses on the day. It would probably be wise to look for a Listed event or a Group 3 now - he's that type of class. The draw didn't help us either. We're disappointed to get beaten but he's run very well - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Stakes (Registered As The Somerville Tattersall Stakes) (Group 3) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: We're delighted with that as Holloway Boy missed eight to ten days with a dirty scope when he missed that Champagne Stakes. Danny Tudhope said he would be suited by a mile so we could look at the Vertem Futurity Trophy or beyond that the Breeders' Cup - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: Japan Racing Association Vintage Stakes (Group 2) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Holloway Bay has pulled a front right-fore shoe off, which hasn't helped, but the winner just had a bit more turn of foot. Danny says he feels like a top-class horse and he's got a great cruising speed, although probably just lacks that kick at an important stage. He's run a great race and the Champagne Stakes is the obvious target, and Doncaster should suit him better than here - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: Chesham Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Unbelievable. The truth is we were going to go to Musselburgh for the Sunday Series but Holloway Boy pulled a little muscle so we didn't go then the owner rang me up. He said he was supposed to have a box but was let down and wanted to get some tickets. I entered the horse and thought 'I'm not going to run him' but I thought sod it, we'll run him, give him a nice day out. It was superb by Danny, we were always going to ride him that way. He rides this track fantastically. We thought he was a nice horse but I didn't quite think he was that good. He's only had a quiet blow, he hasn't had a hard race - Karl Burke, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been running some great races carrying big weights in handicaps. I spoke with his owner [Nick White] and we were keen to drop him into Listed or Group 3 level so he runs at Haydock on Saturday off level weights. He's in fantastic form and looks amazing so hopefully he can be competitive in what looks a strong race. There's a Listed race at Sandown in another fortnight that could be good for him. He's in a lot of big handicaps too so all options are open. 11-09-24

He raised a few eyebrows last year when making a winning debut in the Chesham Stakes at Royal Ascot. I won't say I wasn't pleasantly surprised, but I would not have run him in the race if I did not think he was smart. He subsequently ran big races in Group company without getting his head in front again. On his final run in the Futurity Stakes people labelled him as a lairy horse, but I think he is more of a lazy colt. I think the combination of being in front too soon and wearing a visor first time resulted in his odd run. His preparations for the 2,000 Guineas have not gone smoothly but we are getting there now, and his work last week was very pleasing. He's another who could go under the radar and although Auguste Rodin looks seriously smart, there are few others that frighten me. 07-05-23

runners.name: Maljoom
runners.comment: Hasn't really fulfilled early promise and needs to raise his game to win this
runners.spotlight: Looked a fine prospect when winning first three starts and when looking unlucky in the 2022 St James's Palace; however, he has matched that Royal Ascot form only once since and wasn't at his best on AW on reappearance after a five-month break; this trip on turf should suit better but he needs to raise game.

quotes.race: Qatar Sussex Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: That was huge. Maljoom gave away ground out the gates, but he's always done that and it's been his running style, we just thought with the blinkers on he might not do it today. He's run brilliantly, he's just gone down to a Guineas winner. He's still on his comeback trail, he's not all the way there yet. Even though he's three years into his career he's a horse we can continue to look forward to, which is amazing - Tom Marquand, rider.

quotes.race: Queen Anne Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Maljoom ran massive and bounced back to that solid Group 1 form. He's not had much racing and was a little bit rusty but that's the best he's looked for a long time - Tom Marquand, jockey.

runners.name: Meisho Tabaru
runners.comment: 4-9 in Japan, including a Grade 2 win; however, well beaten last twice and up against it
runners.spotlight: Has won four of nine starts in Japan, including a Grade 2 over 1m3f in September; soundly beaten both runs since, though, and will surely struggle on these terms.

runners.name: Nations Pride
runners.comment: Multiple Group/Grade 1 winner and comes here in decent heart; more needed
runners.spotlight: Four-time Group/Grade 1 winner and bounced back from two disappointing efforts when beating Holloway Boy in the Singspiel in first-time cheekpieces; will have to raise his game if he's to better his third behind Lord North in this race two years ago.

quotes.race: Singspiel Stakes Sponsored By Emirates Airline (Group 2) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We came here confident Nations Pride was back to where he needed to be to win this after two disappointing runs. However, we had valid excuses for those runs; he's only ever run right-handed twice - around Bahrain - and he's been beaten twice. On his last start at Gulfstream he had a torrid shipping, it took a long time to get there and conditions didn't really suit when he did arrive. We've done well to freshen him up and get him back here and we might look towards World Cup night and the Dubai Turf. He deserves to be in that line up, though if Romantic Warrior turns up we'll just be going round for place money! - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: Arlington Million Stakes (Grade 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Nations Pride is a very good horse. He's very uncomplicated and does exactly what you like. He's a pleasure to ride. He has taken so well to North American racing. A mile and a quarter is probably his best trip, although he can stretch out to an easy mile and a half. We will see what Charlie and the team does with him next - William Buick, rider.

quotes.race: Canadian International Stakes (Grade 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: James [Doyle] knows his fractions. If there was one person I wouldn't have been quite so comfortable with it was him on the front end, he's dangerous out there. Turning in, I thought he'd got us. To be fair to William, he had confidence in the horse. We'll stick with plan A, we won't go to the Breeders' Cup as we don't think Nations Pride stretches out that mile and a half, so we'll take him to Bahrain for the Bahrain International Trophy and then contemplate if Hong Kong might suit him - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: Grosser Dallmayr-Preis - Bayerisches Zuchtrennen (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Nations Pride is a very good horse. He hadn't run for a while, but this race was a good opportunity for him. He's a specialist at this trip and the German Derby winner is a good horse who received a lot of weight from us. We had to be really good to beat him and he really was - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Dubai Turf sponsored by DP World (Group 1) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Nations Pride has run a solid kind of race having had to work harder from that draw and it probably cost us second. We wouldn't have beaten the winner but hopefully he's going to have a nice summer internationally ahead of him over the ten furlongs - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Millennium Stakes (Group 3) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Immediately, you'd say have a crack at the Dubai Turf, as they'll go a good gallop over the 1800 metres there. But we'll see how the cards fall - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: Caesars Jockey Club Derby Invitational Stakes (Grade 3) (3yo) (Inner Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Nations Pride has got that turn of foot. Since his first run here, he's really grown and filled out that frame of his. He's done fantastic since he's been here. It's nice to see. Frankie gave him an absolute peach of a ride. He travelled around and picked up just how you would like. It was fairly straightforward for a race like this - Chris Connett, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Caesars Saratoga Derby Invitational Stakes (Grade 1) (3yo) (Mellon Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We'll step Nations Pride up to the mile and a half of the Jockey Club Derby Invitational, that would probably be the most realistic aim now. If we're lucky enough that he can get the job done there it's a 'win and you're in' race for the Breeders' Cup, so it gives us the option - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: Best Odds On The Betfair Exchange Newmarket Stakes (Listed Race) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: After that Nations Pride stacks up to those that we have already entered in the Derby quite well. I don't know what his plans are and although he isn't in the Derby he has put himself in the mix there amongst the horses we have entered in the Derby. You would have to be very impressed with that. I liked him as a two-year-old and he did well in Dubai when he won. He has been pleasing us at home so I was hoping he would do something like that. A step up in trip should be fine as I think he will stay - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Jumeirah Derby Presented By Al Tayer Motors (Conditions) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We know Nations Pride stays well so this looked the right race for him and he has done it in pleasing style. He was pretty fresh so it was pleasing and we will probably take him back to England and look at a Derby trial - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

runners.name: Romantic Warrior
runners.comment: Top class on turf; posted an incredible effort on dirt debut last time; the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Top-class middle-distance performer and has captured Group/Grade 1 events in Australia, Japan and Dubai to go with the seven top-level wins in Hong Kong; turned in an incredible performance to mix it with World Cup favourite Forever Young on dirt debut in the Saudi Cup, where he even looked a shade unlucky; had a hard race but has had over a month to recover and he'll be hard to beat if he's anywhere near his best.

quotes.race: Saudi Cup (Group 1) (4yo+) (Outer Track) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: The winner is very good and didn't beat us by very much. It was Romantic Warrior's first run on the dirt and we were beaten only by Forever Young, and he is a very tough dirt horse. We were beaten a neck. What can you do? I tried something like this for the first time with Romantic Warrior and hopefully some other trainers and owners will [follow me]. We did the best we could. We hope to win every time, but racing is racing. He tried his best. It was a really good race and most of the people enjoyed the races. He'll go back to Meydan for the Dubai Turf - Danny Shum, trainer.

quotes.race: Jebel Hatta Presented By Longines (Group 1) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I'm extremely satisfied, I just loved the way Romantic Warrior did it. He was very fresh, jumped fast and travelled well. As I turned for home I could see the leader so far in front, but he was picking up beautifully and he did the rest. He adapts to anything, you can put him on a saucepan and he'll run well. Any pace, any distance will suit him. The Saudi Cup is unknown territory for him with a different surface, but one thing I do know is that he'll try his best. Whether he can win, I'm not too sure but I wouldn't swap him for anything - James McDonald, jockey.

quotes.race: Longines Hong Kong Cup (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: The Japanese [horses] put it to him but with no luck. He's the best, forget the rest, he's the best. Romantic Warrior has been flying and anyone could ride him because he's that easy - but I'm the lucky one. He's the horse of a lifetime - James McDonald, rider. He's the best, but I have to take another bigger challenge to go to Dubai and Saudi Arabia, just because I haven't been to Dubai for 25 years. At that time, I was assistant trainer for Mr Ivan Allan, I had a new experience. I will make sure the team that go there are in the best form. The owner Mr Peter Lau said it's a once in a life chance to take the challenge in Saudi Arabia for the top prize-money in the world. We are experimenting with dirt but I've tried him in an all-weather trial with a pacifier and he was quite good - Danny Shum, trainer.

quotes.race: FWD QEII Cup (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I can't believe this Romantic Warrior. It brings a tear to my eye how good he is. He was beaten at the three-furlong pole, but he just finds a way. There were ten riders dead set against us ? we had no favours at all ? so to pull out a run like that was incredible. There wasn't one part of the race I was happy with, and he still picked up - James McDonald, rider.

quotes.race: Longines Hong Kong Cup (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I'm so proud of Romantic Warrior. He's the best, one of the toughest I've ever ridden. He's so easy to ride and has a heart as big as a lion. To travel from Australia to here, this is his best win - James McDonald, rider.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Cox Plate (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: This means so much. I can't believe it, I thought I got beat. The camera didn't follow me and I can't say what I said ? I can't believe we won the Cox Plate - James McDonald speaking Racing.com

quotes.race: Longines Hong Kong Cup (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I didn't think Romantic Warrior would win like that but the quality of this horse is amazing. His turn of foot is incredible. He has everything a good horse should have and he has it in spades. This is the race here in Hong Kong I want to win - James McDonald, jockey, speaking to HKJC.

runners.name: Soul Rush
runners.comment: Grade 1 winner in Japan in November; has run well both starts since and has prospects
runners.spotlight: Notched first win at the highest level when winning over 1m at Kyoto in November (holds Brede Weg) and not far off that level when second to subsequent Group 1 scorer Voyage Bubble in the Hong Kong Mile the following month; creditable run over this trip last month and he's a player.

runners.name: Brede Weg
runners.comment: Grade 1 winner; held by Soul Rush on 1m form in November but this trip should suit better
runners.spotlight: Unexposed sort who has won half of her eight starts, including a Grade 1 over 1m3f in 2023; bit to find with Soul Rush on Tokyo form over 1m in November but she'll appreciate the return to this trip and is probably capable of better.

runners.name: Liberty Island
runners.comment: Grade 1 winner from 1m-1m4f and fine second to Romantic Warrior in Hong Kong last time
runners.spotlight: Multiple Grade 1 winner from 1m-1m4f and finished third to Rebel's Romance in last year's Sheema Classic; not far off her best when chasing home Romantic Warrior over 1m2f in Hong Kong Cup in December when last seen and she'll likely go well if there's enough of a gallop to chase.

quotes.race: Shuka Sho (Grade 1) (3yo Fillies) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I'm really impressed. I didn't make a plan in advance; I thought I'd make a plan after seeing how Liberty Island broke from the stalls, and she ran really well. It went smoothly. By winning the fillies' Triple Crown she is able to leave her name in Japanese racing history - Yuga Kawada, rider.

runners.name: Calif
runners.comment: Group 1 winner in Germany last year but behind Shin Emperor last time; trip is a worry
runners.spotlight: Notched first Group 1 win in Germany (1m2f, soft) last summer and ran well behind Shin Emperor in the Neom Turf Cup in Saudi Arabia last time; will need better to reverse placings over a trip he's yet to tackle, though.

quotes.race: Howden Neom Turf Cup (Group 2) (4yo+) (Inner Track) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Calif ran very well. Probably the slower pace affected him, but he was beaten by a Group 1 horse. Obviously he took the shortest route along the rail with a slow pace and it took time to get out and get going. Once he did, he finished the race well. The Sheema Classic is next - Fawzi Nass, trainer,

runners.name: Durezza
runners.comment: Not much racing since sole Grade 1 win in 2023; back to best in November; place claims
runners.spotlight: Grade 1 winner over 1m7f in Japan in October 2023; has run only four times since but showed he retains all his ability when dead-heating for second (with Shin Emperor) behind previous Grade 1 scorer Do Deuce over this trip in muddling Japan Cup when last seen; place claims with Christophe Soumillon up.

runners.name: Giavellotto
runners.owner: Scuderia La Tesa Limited & Vaibhav Shah

prev_owners.owner: Scuderia La Tesa Limited & Vaibhav Shah

runners.comment: Improved last year and off the mark at the highest level in Hong Kong; may do better
runners.spotlight: Improved performer last year, culminating with a first Group 1 success in the Hong Kong Vase, showing much more in the way of speed than previously; this demands another step forward but he's the type physically who could progress again this year; interesting.

quotes.race: Longines Hong Kong Vase (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It was all very comfortable until I got to the turn and I had to wait. When I got some racing room Giavellotto was explosive. I was really able to enjoy the last furlong which is a really difficult thing to do in a top-level Group 1. Marco thought a mile and a half was fine and I think as he's getting older, he's getting a bit sharper and faster - Oisin Murphy, rider.

quotes.race: Princess Of Wales's Stakes (Sponsored By The Kingdom Of Bahrain) (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Giavellotto is in the form of his life and is a much stronger horse this year. We weren't too worried about dropping back to a mile and a half, especially on a stiff course. He travelled so well into the race and Oisin said it was only a matter of having to press the button and the horse picked up straight away and ran strongly to the line. We know he stays well and the ground has dried out enough to be on the easy side of good. I don't think he wants it too soft but is versatile at the same time - he has also won on really fast ground. He is a big horse and very strong so the weight was not an issue. I thought it was a good performance and he showed he is definitely at his best this year. The Irish St Leger has always been the plan and I think today was a stepping stone towards that as long as the ground doesn't go too soft - heavy ground would be a concern and it can happen in September at the Curragh. I'm looking forward to it - Marco Botti, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Yorkshire Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Giavellotto loves the track and has always shown his best form at York. He acts on fast ground and we've been lucky to avoid the rain. We've tried two miles several times and I'm not saying he doesn't stay as he ran well in Saudi, but it does stretch him a little bit and I think the Gold Cup trip [2m4f] is too far for him. I know the Irish St Leger is not until September and sometimes the ground gets softer, but it's a race we considered last year and didn't go and I would say that could be the target - Marco Botti, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Yorkshire Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Giavellotto came here in very good order and we thought he would run a big race. We've always thought he is a proper stayer. The Gold Cup wouldn't be the race for him as he needs a galloping track. He stays two miles without a doubt so we'll sit down with the owner and map out a plan. The Melbourne Cup might be on the agenda - Marco Botti, trainer.

quotes.race: Cazoo St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: We're very pleased with Giavelletto, he ran a big race. He stays well and I wish we had a clear run. There's a Listed race at Ascot but we'll probably keep him for next year - Marco Botti, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He made the headlines on his debut when winning at odds of 100-1 at Kempton the week before Christmas from a useful Godolphin horse. There were three fancied runners in the betting and ours was pushed out to those ridiculous odds and a I know a few of the lads who ride him had small each-way wagers on him. I even had £5 each-way myself as I thought the odds were so generous. Although we never expect him to win first time out, I was expecting a good run. He backed that up at Newcastle over 1m2f next time out and earned a mark of 88. Last month at Sandown on his turf debut I was disappointed that he finished fourth, and yet the second and third each won next time out so possibly it was a hot handicap. He was quite immature as he kept changing his legs and just did not know which leg to put in front. Don't lose faith in him as he is a nice type and a mark of 88 is not harsh. 25-05-22

runners.name: Rebels Romance
runners.comment: High-class middle-distance performer with fine strike-rate; bids to win it for second year
runners.spotlight: High-class middle-distance performer with a tremendous strike-rate and he bids to win this for the second year in succession; didn't have to be at his best to win in Qatar last time after a break of over three months and has leading claims back in Dubai.

quotes.race: H H The Amir Trophy (Group 3) (4yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance is a horse of a lifetime. He's a seven-year-old now and it's a great training performance by Charlie [Appleby] and the team to have him in this condition. He retains all his enthusiasm, wears his heart on his sleeve and always turns up. From a jockey's point of view, he's pretty bombproof. I always think he makes his own luck and he doesn't have to make the running; he can sit off the pace. He wasn't in love with the track today but he's still won as he's a class horse. Hopefully, that's another launchpad to Dubai and the Sheema Classic - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Longines Breeders' Cup Turf (Grade 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance is an incredible horse. He's such a joy to ride and a beautiful horse who has been expertly managed by Charlie Appleby and the team. He's an international superstar. We agreed to give him a positive ride but we managed to get a breather in. He kicked from the turn and, when the competition came, he went again - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Mehl-Mulhens-Stiftung - 62nd Preis von Europa (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance is winning the race for a second time and he's a real international superstar. Today he showed what a tough horse he is and whenever we come to Germany we respect the local horses as it's never easy. The pace was pretty slow today and he's a horse who gets into a comfort zone. He's a high-class horse and he knows how to win - he always finds a way. He's a great horse - William Buick, rider.

quotes.race: Standard Chartered Champions & Chater Cup (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance has done it really well. You always respect the local horses in Hong Kong, and he had to travel over here too, so the team have done a great job with him. I thought he looked magnificent beforehand, he always does. The race went the way I hoped it would and it suited him, that sort of even gallop the whole way that kept building up. He's become a very uncomplicated horse and he's a real international superstar - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Longines Dubai Sheema Classic (Group 1) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance showed in Qatar what a versatile horse he is. His best form has usually been when he's held up but in Qatar I tried something new. I was keen today to adopt a similar tactic and I got a lovely slipstream from the leader - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: H H The Amir Trophy (Group 3) (4yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I managed to get things my own way and Rebel's Romance enjoyed it. When he got to the front he wasn't going to get caught. He was very good and really showed up. He's a Breeders' Cup winner and went through that season almost unbeaten. He looked great beforehand and the concern we had was his draw in ten, but Charlie was keen to go forward and he got to the front easily and relaxed - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Longines Dubai Sheema Classic (Group 1) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I just didn't have any luck from the gate. Rebel's Romance is still a very good horse - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Longines Breeders' Cup Turf (Grade 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance has turned himself round to be fair - probably telling me to switch him to the turf. Saying that, I watched him training on the dirt two days ago and said to the team I wish I was running him on the dirt - he loved it. He's a lovely big horse and time has helped him. He's another son of Dubawi and what more can I say about him as a stallion? - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: 60th Preis von Europa - prasentiert von DZ Privatbank (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance was nice and relaxed. He showed in Hoppegarten last time that he has a turn of foot and it's a long straight here. He's a better horse on faster ground but he did it well - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Westminster 132nd Grosser Preis von Berlin (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance has a nice progressive profile and we've probably been running him on the wrong surface for so many years! Now we've switched him to turf he's three from three and he seems to be enjoying it - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: L'Ormarins Queen's Plate Glorious Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: William (Buick) was delighted with Rebel's Romance. He said he was a classy professional in the race and has seen it out well. It could have ideally done with being a little bit faster for him, but he said that once he got rolling he has picked up and done it nicely. That's only his second run on turf. He won the UAE Derby and we sort of went down that route this year thinking that might be his way forward. It didn't quite work out, so Charlie brought him back to the turf last time at Newmarket and it seems to have gone well. I spoke to Charlie (Appleby) and he said that (today) was the target, he has seen that out well so there is the possibility of stepping up to 1m6f - Alex Merriam, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: House Of Cavani Menswear Fred Archer Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance trains on turf at home and he has been here before and had a spin on this track and went well. I don't think anyone was really that worried about him running on turf as the ground is nice and fast and it suited him. It was a real nice good staying performance - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: UAE Derby Sponsored By Emirates NBD (Group 2) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: I was a little bit worried I was getting there a little early; a little too quick, but that was some performance. Rebel's Romance has really come on and he's a big horse, but he's still a shell. He really knows how to use his power now - William Buick, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He could finish only eighth on his first run at the carnival but will come forward for that, having been off the track for 300 days. It may not have been the strongest company, but races like that on the dirt are rough and ready and they were hardened horses he came up against, so it was always a bit of a concern that he lacked that kind of experience. He's still learning on the job and there are positives to take out of the run, so we'll look to the Listed Curlin Stakes for his next start. 26-01-22

runners.name: Calandagan
runners.breeder: Haras De Son Altesse L'Aga Khan Scea
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Aga Khan
runners.comment: High-class middle-distance performer who won't mind the return to 1m4f or to quick ground
runners.spotlight: Made up into a high-class middle-distance performer last year, his best effort when second to City Of Troy in the International at York (an effort that could be upgraded given their respective track positions); ran well in the Champion Stakes when last seen, has no problem with 1m4f or quick ground and seems sure to run well.

quotes.race: Qipco Champion Stakes (British Champions Middle Distance) (Group 1)
quotes.quote: I thought the race was over when Calandagan took the lead and to be fair I didn't see the winner coming. He ran a great race and well done to the winning connections. He was slow away and he [Stephane Pasquier] tried to put him in the race then he travelled nicely. He had his chance to win but the winner beat us on the line - Francis Graffard, trainer, speaking to ITV.

quotes.race: Juddmonte International Stakes (British Champions Series) (Group 1)
quotes.quote: It was a fantastic run, but the odds were right. The stride Calandagan showed in the straight was fantastic to watch. I shouted as we thought we were coming to get him, but he could only keep pushing a champion in City Of Troy. I'm very proud of the horse. We didn't have any Group 1 form before and there were lots of question marks, but the way he accelerated was fantastic. He can come back to Ascot in the Champion Stakes, but we'll discuss it. He gave a lot of heart on the track today - Francis Graffard, trainer.

quotes.race: King Edward VII Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Everything was easy. Calandagan can be a naughty boy sometimes, and we have to ask him gently. Today he wanted to do everything - when he's like this, he is a fantastic horse. I didn't do anything, I just asked him to do it by himself - Stephane Pasquier, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: His form has worked out quite well but it will obviously be a different proposition at Ascot. He's a proper horse who has done everything very easily this year, while he's indifferent to the ground. He's very easy actioned and covers a lot of ground so I don't think the mile and a half will be a problem. 13-06-24

runners.name: Danon Decile
runners.comment: Japanese Derby winner who has a good strike-rate; can do better, but needs to
runners.spotlight: Has won half of eight starts, including Grade 1 Japanese Derby over this trip at Tokyo last May and best effort since in Grade 2 in January; likely he's capable of better, but will need to be if he's to win this.

runners.name: Deira Mile
runners.comment: St Leger fourth last year but below best in Saudi Arabia on reappearance and tough task
runners.spotlight: Turned in best effort last year when fourth to Jan Brueghel in the St Leger (first-time blinkers) but ran as though the race was needed in Saudi Arabia six weeks ago after break of over five months; back in trip but needs to improve a fair bit.

quotes.race: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Deira Mile has run a good race and he probably could have done with a stronger gallop. I was quite conscious I didn't want him seeing loads of daylight first time with blinkers on over this trip. The race wasn't really run to suit us. He travelled into it and stayed well but they dictated the pace from the front and were quickening off it. That made it hard for those held up. The owner's quite keen to have a look at the Arc if it came up really soft. He seems to be improving with his racing - Owen Burrows, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred Derby (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: Deira Mile ran very well. He probably wants a bit further. He was a bit slow early on and got further back than ideal - Jim Crowley, rider.

runners.name: Shin Emperor
runners.comment: Narrowly beaten in the Japan Cup and warmed up for this when winning in Saudi; player
runners.spotlight: Fine third to Economics in the Irish Champion and narrowly beaten (dead-heated with Durezza for second place) in steadily run Japan Cup; warmed up for this when beating Calif in the Neom Cup in Saudi Arabia and should give another good account back up in distance.

quotes.race: Howden Neom Turf Cup (Group 2) (4yo+) (Inner Track) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Shin Emperor was definitely the best horse in the field. As long as he jumped well, the plan was to take the lead to avoid any disadvantages or interference. We'll go to the Dubai Sheema Classic next, but as for future plans we'll have to discuss with the owner. In my mind, I'd like to go to Ascot and York - Yoshito Yahagi, trainer.

runners.name: Cervinia
runners.comment: Dual Grade 1 winner but disappointing on reappearance and has a bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Dual Grade 1 winner in Japan, including of the Japanese Oaks over this trip and likely would have been suited by more of a stamina test when fourth in the Japan Cup; disappointed in prep run for this and bit to prove.

6:30.race_name: Dubai World Cup Sponsored By Emirates Airline (Group 1) (Dirt)

runners.name: Forever Young
runners.comment: UAE Derby winner who turned in best effort to win the Saudi Cup last time; the one to beat
runners.spotlight: 2024 UAE Derby winner; suffered his only defeats when placed in the Kentucky Derby and Breeders' Cup Classic; looked better than ever in the Saudi Cup when showing a fine attitude to run down Romantic Warrior (runs in the Dubai Turf) with a few of these rivals behind; trainer feels this fine physical specimen has improved since and he's the one to beat.

quotes.race: Saudi Cup (Group 1) (4yo+) (Outer Track) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: This is my second win in the Saudi Cup, but no matter how many wins you have in this race, it is still a great feeling. I believed in Forever Young. When he came here to run in the Saudi Derby, he was not in the best condition and yet he still won. Since that time, he has improved a lot and was in better condition today. We will go to the Dubai World Cup - Yoshito Yahagi, trainer.

quotes.race: UAE Derby (Group 2) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Of course it will be very difficult to manage Forever Young's condition from Dubai to Kentucky but I really believe my team will be able to get him in good order. He did not travel well from Japan to Saudi Arabia so he was not in great condition but he still performed very well. After travelling from Riyadh to Dubai he improved and he has so much potential, I always have a lot of confidence in him - Yoshito Yahagi, trainer.

runners.name: Hit Show
runners.comment: Multiple Grade 2/3 winner in the US but yet to make it at the highest level; more needed
runners.spotlight: Multiple Grade 2/3 dirt winner in the US but below best in Grade 1 Santa Anita Handicap last time; it's hard to envisage him winning this time.

runners.name: Il Miracolo
runners.comment: Dual Grade 3 dirt winner in the US; will need a big step forward to figure on UAE debut
runners.spotlight: Dual Grade 3 dirt winner in the US but well beaten on four of five starts in Grade 1 company and he'll need a big step forward if he's to figure on UAE debut.

runners.name: Imperial Emperor
runners.comment: Has thrived on dirt for this yard but looks more a place prospect than a win-only one
runners.spotlight: Has developed into a quality performer on dirt, his only defeat in four starts for the yard coming when second to stablemate Walk Of Stars in Group 1 Al Maktoum Challenge in January; bolted up in the Al Maktoum Classic on Super Saturday but looks more a place prospect than a win-only one.

quotes.race: Al Maktoum Classic Sponsored By Emirates Airline (Group 2) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Imperial Emperor is on the up. I've only thrown my leg over him three times and I've won all three. That was probably a career best for him. It was a true run race and there was no hiding place out there. He's very, very genuine - Tadhg O'Shea, jockey.

quotes.race: Palm Jebel Ali (Handicap) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Imperial Emperor trains like a smart horse and he broke on terms tonight. He settles and he's easy, and like the majority of these Dubawis, he's very good on dirt. We'll have to go back to the drawing board and see if we stretch out beyond a mile and aim for the Maktoum Challenge or something like that. As a horse he'll give himself every chance to stretch out. The dream is alive - Tadhg O'Shea, jockey.

quotes.race: Emirates Airline (Handicap) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: It's great to be back at Meydan and great to get a win on the board. I think Imperial Emperor is a smart horse. It was a bit of a tricky pick for me, as Sheikh Hissa's [Al Maktoum] retained rider isn't in town yet and that horse [Laasudood] has good form. But this horse had been working extremely well. I was a bit concerned, as I had to get him to jump and get him up there. He'd only run on turf before, and dirt and turf racing - there's no comparison - but I had a willing partner. I should congratulate the second jockey, Richie Mullen, as he actually suggested this horse to the owners at the Racing in Dubai Sale. I don't like to set targets for horses but he could make a Godolphin Mile horse one day - Tadhg O'Shea, jockey.

quotes.race: Winners Wear House Of Cavani British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I would think that Charlie will have a look at a 1m2f race for Imperial Emperor after that comeback. He's a lovely horse and as a relative of Ghaiyyath we'll give him plenty of time - Alex Merriam, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Prestige Vehicles British EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Imperial Emperor is nice horse with a lovely pedigree. He's a proper mile and a half horse for next year. We came up here with the confidence that he was going to run a nice race and he has duly obliged. I would say we'll probably leave it at that for this year and put him away until next year - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

runners.name: Katonah
runners.comment: Grade 2 US dirt winner in January; beaten a long way back in a Grade 1 last time
runners.spotlight: 5-18 on dirt in the US, his best effort when winning a Grade 2 over 1m1f in January; beaten a long way over this trip back in a Grade 1 last time and makes little appeal on UAE debut.

runners.name: Mixto
runners.comment: Grade 1 winner at Del Mar last summer but well beaten both runs at the top level since
runners.spotlight: Improved to win Grade 1 Pacific Classic over this trip at Del Mar last summer but has come up short on both subsequent runs at the highest level; needs a return to his best if he is to have any chance of providing Dettori with a fifth win in the race.

runners.name: Ramjet
runners.comment: Good strike-rate in Japan but behind Forever Young on last three starts; tough task
runners.spotlight: 5-9 in Japan but has finished behind Forever Young on each of last three starts, including when a well-beaten sixth in Saudi Cup on most recent outing; doesn't appeal as a likely winner.

runners.name: Rattle N Roll
runners.owner: Sharaf Mohamad Alhariri & Lucky Seven Stable
runners.comment: Grade 2 dirt winner at Churchill Downs in November; below best last time in Saudi Cup
runners.spotlight: Won Grade 2 at Churchill Downs in November but below that level in Saudi Arabia both starts since and 13 lengths behind Forever Young last time; return to 1m2f should suit but plenty more is needed from him.

quotes.race: Saudi Cup (Group 1) (4yo+) (Outer Track) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: My trip was good and Rattle N Roll ran like he normally does in the back and he came with a run, but he just couldn't get to those horses. This is a little different group than last time, but he ran his race. He was coming at the end, but he ran like he needs a mile and a quarter - Joel Rosario, jockey.

runners.name: Ushba Tesoro
runners.comment: Won this two years ago but behind Forever Young the last twice and needs to raise his game
runners.spotlight: Benefited from strong gallop when winning this race two years ago and showed he retains all his ability last year; has finished behind Forever Young the last twice, though, and, unless the gallop is a fierce one, he is unlikely reverse those placings.

quotes.race: Dubai World Cup Sponsored by Emirates Airline (Group 1) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Ushba Tesoro was in good form and he ran his race. It was a good run. We managed to beat Senor Buscador today but the winner was too fast and stayed really well in front. We will be prepared for the Breeders' Cup and I believe Del Mar will suit him better than Santa Anita - Yuga Kawada, jockey.

quotes.race: Dubai World Cup sponsored by Emirates Airline (Group 1) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: We will go back to Japan as Ushba Tesoro is a bit vulnerable in hot weather and heat. We'll see how he is over the summer and come up with a plan for him - Noboru Takagi, trainer.

runners.name: Walk Of Stars
runners.comment: Took his form to a new level on dirt this season but disappointed in the Saudi Cup
runners.spotlight: Improved on dirt this season, making all in Listed event in December and beating stablemate Imperial Emperor to take a Group 1 the following month; disappointing behind Forever Young in the Saudi Cup, though, and O'Shea gets off to ride Imperial Emperor this time.

quotes.race: Al Maktoum Challenge Presented By Longines (Group 1) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Walk Of Stars is a big, powerful galloper. He's a front runner but he's not a runaway - he's always parking a little bit up in front. It was a great performance on the night and it's great to get a Group 1 under his belt - Tadhg O'Shea, jockey.

quotes.race: The Entisar Sponsored By Emaar (Listed Race) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Walk Of Stars always been one of those horses that takes a lead and stops. But since his last race we've always worked him from the front. We had to change something, because always runs second - he'd probably run second to Frankel! He's a very talented horse and it's great to see that finally come out of him. This gives us a lot more options. I think a mile and a quarter [2000 metres] is probably his best distance. Hopefully this will do his confidence the world of good and from here on in he can be a really good horse - Bhupat Seemar, trainer.

quotes.race: Godolphin Mile Sponsored by EMAAR (Group 2) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Walk Of Stars is one of those horses that once he passes another horse, he always stops.
