So he has to be produced last minute but it just so happened that we were drawn inside and Isolate was right on top of us and we couldn't get him a breather. If he has something to come and aim at, he goes and beats them, but once he's in front he stops - Bhupat Seemar, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Golf World Cup British EBF Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Charlie (Appleby) mentioned if the ground was sensible we'd go for the Dante with the pair of them and see where we go from there. They're both in the Derby and it wasn't ideal not having a proper race. Walk Of Stars has only had two runs and more racing should bring him on again - Alex Merriam, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Wilson Tesoro
runners.comment: Beaten a nose in a Grade 1 in Japan in December but long way behind Forever Young in Saudi
runners.spotlight: Well-beaten fourth in last year's Dubai World Cup, though showed himself capable of running well at the highest level in Japan in December; long way below that level in the Saudi Cup last time and he'll do well to win this.

2:10.race_name: Dubai Gold Cup Sponsored By Al Tayer Motors (Group 2) (Turf)

runners.name: Al Nayyir
runners.comment: Took form to a new level when 66-1 2nd in this in 2024; Listed winner since but needs more
runners.spotlight: Took his form to a new level when 66-1 runner-up in this last year and highly promising start for yard when narrowly denied in Group 2 Lonsdale Cup (2m, good) at York in August; gained compensation with wide-margin win in a Listed race at Newmarket (2m, soft) but was no match for Kyprios in the Long Distance Cup at Ascot in October; below form on return at Riyadh and while he's entitled to come on for that, this probably demands a clear career best.

quotes.race: Jockey Club Rose Bowl Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: "He's a very exciting stayer and I couldn't have been more thrilled with the way Al Nayyir did it. We've got him in on Champions Day and that would be the logical next step but I'd love to avoid Kyprios if we could. We love to have these Stakes horses and that's the direction we want to go. I'm thrilled to have the owner's support and to train a horse of this calibre" - Tom Clover, trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Hamilton Lonsdale Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: It was a really good run. Al Nayyir is a new horse to us but he'd shaped up well in his home work. I couldn't quite believe the price he was. He had some very good form and he has a very high rating. Hopefully he can go one better very soon. We've got him in in France and on Champions day, we'll have to discuss it with the owners - Tom Clover, trainer.

runners.name: Continuous
runners.owner: D Smith, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, Westerberg
runners.comment: 2023 Leger winner/Arc 5th; not same level since; needs to come on from Riyadh return 3rd
runners.spotlight: St Leger winner in 2023 before finishing fifth in the Arc that year; hasn't been at the same level since and was a beaten favourite when third at Riyadh in February, 2l behind runner-up Epic Poet (who received 5lb); suspicion he'll need to come on from that to land this, even with the swing at the weights.

quotes.race: Longines Red Sea Turf Handicap (Group 2) (3yo+) (Inner Track) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Continuous ran very well. It was his first run back, so happy with him - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Shoda Market Cafe Royal Whip Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Continuous has loads of options. He could go to the Irish Champion Stakes or the Irish St Leger. He could run in the Irish Champion with a view to going to the Arc. He could go to the Japan Cup He is a very versatile horse and a great one to have. Dropping him back to this trip was not a worry. We decided we would take a lead today if we could. He could have popped out in front and done it all himself. He's a classy horse and an unusual type of horse and a very genuine horse. He can do it from 1m2f and possibly up to 2m - Aidan O'Brien, trainer

quotes.race: Qatar Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe (Group 1) (3yo+ No Geldings) (Grande) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I was very happy. We made the decision to take our time and relax, and Continuous dropped in lovely. The pace was very slow so they sprinted in the last two or three furlongs. He was coming through, but obviously the winner quickened up on the outside. He's probably best over a strongly run mile and a half. He could go to Japan, Hong Kong, America or Dubai. All those things are open to him. He's a ready-made four-year-old and we think the best is yet to come - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: You would say looking at him at York, he was nailed on for this race and he had form on soft ground. Continuous didn't have any problem with the trip. He's got a lot of class, you could see it in his work every day. We're over the moon. The lads will think about the Arc, I'd say, he handles soft ground and gets a mile and a half very well and has class. He has all the things that could work in an Arc. It's just whether the two-week turnback is too tight or not. He has a great constitution as well - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Great Voltigeur Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Continuous came here in the Dante and he needed the run badly and ran a massive race. I said to Ryan before the race would any of the other horses have run as well in Dante as he did and he said they wouldn't. A little bit of class usually outs, especially if the pace is even. We thought he handles an ease very well because he has a little bit of a round action but that was fast ground today and he didn't seem to have any problem with it. He bends his knee but obviously that's his best performance so you have to say he's very comfortable on it. I asked Ryan and he said he doesn't need a mile and six but you wouldn't rule him out - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV For Just 12 Euro A Month At racingtv.com Now Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Continuous is still a baby. He seems to stay well and he quickened up quite well. He's in the Beresford Stakes and that's a possibility for him - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: The plan all along was for his first target to be the Hardwicke and we've stuck to that plan. He's been away from home a few times and he's coming along nicely. We feel there is more to come from him this season.  11-06-24

runners.name: Double Major
runners.comment: Group 1 Royal-Oak winner last 2 years; good prep run on AW at Chantilly; major claims
runners.spotlight: Has won the Group 1 Prix Royal-Oak in each of the last two seasons and mopped up a couple of substandard Group 2s in France last year too; satisfactory return on the AW at Chantilly over an inadequate trip last month and wasn't given a hard time once his chance had gone; potential pace angle in this contest and he's versatile ground-wise; one for the shortlist.

quotes.race: Prix Royal - Oak (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Obviously, there was a slight worry that the Cadran might have left its mark, but I talked a lot with Maxime and he wasn't hard on Double Major when he felt his chance was gone that day. Kyprios is obviously a very good horse. He gallops his rivals into the ground and breaks their hearts. We'll probably run across him at one stage or another next year, but over 3,000 metres [one mile seven furlongs] it might be a slightly different proposition than in a Gold Cup or a Cadran, neither of which will be on Double Major's schedule for next year. Now he's in top form, we'll keep him around in the yard and he can lead the babies and his little brother, and we'll prepare for Dubai I think - Christophe Ferland, trainer.

quotes.race: Prix Maurice de Nieuil presente par Radio FG (Group 2) (4yo+) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Double Major had a long break over the winter and he took a while to come to himself. He hasn't been running badly but it wasn't his best. Now everything is right with him and the rain an hour before the race only helped his cause. He enjoyed himself out front and was able to beat them with that long finishing kick of his. He'll be back for the autumn but Goodwood isn't ruled out, we'll give it some thought and keep an eye on the weather - Christophe Ferland, trainer.

quotes.race: Prix Royal-Oak (Group 1) (3yo+) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It's always something to win a Group 1 at any stage of the year. What Double Major has done there is just mad. He had the perfect trip, having his own way up front and by the time they got to the false straight, he already had the others on the stretch, while Maxime hadn't yet moved. I wondered what he'd find but he accelerated regardless of the ground and he's just a crack, a very, very good horse. We'll have to think about what we want to do. He's entitled to a holiday now and he'll need some downtime after that effort and the others during the season. We'll make a decision about where we want to go, whether we want to have a crack at Dubai or not - Christophe Ferland, trainer.

runners.name: Dubai Future
runners.comment: Bolted up in 1m6f Group 3 here in February; form knocked but can't rule out
runners.spotlight: Group-class middle-distance performer in his pomp but showed his future could be at staying trips when bolting up in the Nad Al Sheba Trophy (1m6f, good) without coming off the bridle; nothing has been done for that form in the interim but he's an intriguing runner, particularly with the likelihood of De Sousa resuming front-running tactics in a race without much pace.

quotes.race: Nad Al Sheba Trophy Presented By DP World (Group 3) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Dubai Future had a little bit of a setback last year which is why he didn't run. I didn't want to lead with him today as it was his first time back after a break, so I told him [de Sousa] to go in behind. He'll now go straight to the Dubai Gold Cup - Saeed bin Suroor, trainer.

quotes.race: Bahrain International Trophy (Group 3) (3yo+) (Outer Track) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We've tried to win this race in the last few years with no luck, but this year we had two runners and had first and second. Dubai Future has improved a lot this year and he won at Royal Ascot. Physically and mentally, he was better than last year and we thought he was the right horse again for this race - Saeed bin Suroor, trainer.

quotes.race: Wolferton Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Dubai Future did well. Danny's given him a very good ride. He's a jockey I like a lot, he gives the horse a chance and we've had some good luck with him. I said to keep a hold of him and keep him relaxed in the race, which he did. He tried and he finished the race well, and he'll go for the Princess of Wales's Stakes at Newmarket next. I love it here, I love being in the winner's enclosure - but it's so hard to get winners here. It means a lot for the family to get winners and to do so with Fazza and Hissa here too - Saeed Bin Suroor, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Racing Club Classic Presented By The View at the Palm (Listed Rated Conditions) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Everything went pretty smoothly although Dubai Future was a bit keen early on. I had a lovely spin around and when the gap opened he shot through it and we probably ended up in front a bit sooner than ideal. That said he galloped all the way to the line and I would like to think he can build on this up in class - Pat Cosgrave, jockey.

quotes.race: Matchbook Best Value Exchange Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Dubai Future has done that really, really well, couldn't have been any easier. I would have liked to have waited a little longer turning for home but as soon as the gap came he was very willing and he just took me straight through it. He's a proper horse. I'm not sure about the plan now. I suppose there's a chance he could go to Dubai, he's proven himself quite capable now but that's not my decision to make - Callum Shepherd, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He provided our first carnival winner this season in the Listed Dubai Racing Club Classic last week - a race he finished second in last year - and thrives here in the winter. After the impressive manner in which he won last week, there are possible races for him over 1m6f in the Listed Al Khail Trophy on Friday or the Group 3 Nad Al Sheba Trophy on February 17, before going back to 1m4f for the Group 2 Dubai City of Gold on Super Saturday. 26-01-22

runners.name: Epic Poet
runners.comment: Course winner; back to his best when 2nd at Riyadh latest but this demands more
runners.spotlight: Course winner who was back to his best when runner-up at Riyadh (1m7f, good to firm) in February, finishing 2l ahead of Continuous; may struggle to reverse placings now 5lb worse off at the weights though and he needs a strong pace to aim at.

quotes.race: Longines Red Sea Turf Handicap (Group 2) (3yo+) (Inner Track) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Little bit hard luck but delighted with him. Epic Poet got locked in for a little bit up the straight but finished off really strongly. He's been invited to the World Cup meeting in Dubai so we'll look at that - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: Zoho (Conditions) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Epic Poet was a bit fresh tonight which isn't him. But the race panned out nicely and he got the job done. The plan will probably be to go to Saudi for the two-mile race [Red Sea Turf Handicap] - Daniel Tudhope, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfair Exchange Old Borough Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Epic Poet has been a good horse this year, he ran a cracker at Royal Ascot and obviously in the Ebor as well - he had a bad draw that day. He doesn't really help you - he's just so slow. The owners and David said try and get handy on him, but that's as handy as you can get because he takes a long time to warm up. He travels good, that's the main thing. We followed the right horse and he picked up well - Danny Tudhope, rider.

runners.name: Passion And Glory
runners.comment: No show in last 2 renewals; 2nd on Super Saturday was encouraging but others preferred
runners.spotlight: Fifth in 2022 version but he hasn't shown up in the last two renewals of this race; while it was one of his better recent efforts when runner-up over 1m4f on Super Saturday, he would need to be right back to his best to figure.

quotes.race: Davies Insurance Services Gala Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Passion And Glory was down in trip and Saeed thought the ground might be a bit quick, but he handled it fine. It's maybe on the quick side of good and he jumped well and travelled well, so I let him use himself with this being his minimum trip. I didn't know where he was fitness-wise, but he hit the line well enough and had a good blow after. I did think something could tap him for toe, so that's why I took him on early enough before I got headed. I was a bit worried I committed too soon, not knowing his fitness levels, but he got away with it today - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: l'Ormarins Queen's Plate Glorious Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: That's the best sort of ground for Passion And Glory and he handled it really well. I'm now thinking of taking him to Germany for the Group 1 at Baden-Baden. I've always liked the horse but tiny problems have kept stopping him - Saeed Bin Suroor, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a very good season in Britain last year, winning three consecutive races before finishing third in Group 1 company in Germany behind subsequent Arc winner Torquator Tasso. He had his first start of this year on January 14 in the Listed Dubai Racing Club Classic over 1m4f, will have improved for the race and will have various entries from 1m1f to 1m4f in Dubai. A trip to Saudi could also be a possibility for the Red Sea Turf Handicap, for which he's received an invitation. 26-01-22

runners.name: Straight
runners.comment: German middle-distance raider; 5th over 1m2f at Riyadh last time but 2m is a shot in dark
runners.spotlight: German middle-distance raider who landed a soft-ground Italian Group 2 last year; encouraging fifth over the extended 1m2f at Riyadh but 2m is a shot in the dark; percentage call is to look elsewhere.

runners.name: Trawlerman
runners.comment: 3rd in this last year before 2 good runs behind Kyprios; big player if fully tuned up
runners.spotlight: Well held in this in 2023 but he's a high-class stayer who beat Kyprios to land the Group 2 Long Distance Cup at Ascot later that year; third in this last season before a 1l defeat to Kyprios in the Ascot Gold Cup and behind that rival again back at Ascot when last seen in October; would have a major chance if fully tuned up but there's a suspicion this is a stepping stone back to Group 1 company; off 168 days.

quotes.race: Gold Cup (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Trawlerman was foot-perfect the whole way and when I turned in I thought I had plenty of horse. He kept finding all the way to the line and even when the winner headed me, he came back. It was a huge run and he stayed the trip. I'm sure that [Goodwood] will be his next target. The winner's been there and done it before so you've got to respect him but Trawlerman's run a mighty race - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Qipco British Champions Long Distance Cup (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: When he [Kyprios] passed me comfortably, I thought he was going to win by a few lengths but when he couldn't get away from me, I thought that maybe there's a little bit left here. In fairness, Trawlerman was a professional today and a great battler - Frankie Dettori, rider.

quotes.race: Jockey Club Rose Bowl Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: The Rose Bowl is a nice race to win and we'll have another go at the Ascot race. Trawlerman has to go down early as he takes such a strong grip - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Ebor Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: We did that with Trawlerman's sire Golden Horn in the Arc, we did it with Muntahaa in this race and we've done it again here. Once you get that draw you should just stay out there. It works. It was very much a team decision. As soon as we got that draw we knew what we were going to do. So long as you mind your own business, you're fine. You just don't want the horse to turn right and go into the stables. You had to fancy him to run a big race after his run at Goodwood. I felt very strongly that he was the right horse for the day - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Summer Handicap
quotes.quote: Trawlerman ran last time at Newmarket and he is over generous. He leans on the rider a bit and doesn't give them much of a chance usually. Obviously he had the hood on today, which helped him a lot, but Benoit gave him a great ride and every time he felt a horse coming to him at the end, he pulled out a little bit more. We were trying to run him in a race that had a big enough field to try and get him settled. He is such a genuine horse, he gives you everything when you ask for it. Hopefully the hood relaxes him a bit and lets him enjoy the quality he has - Thady Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF "High-Rise" Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Trawlerman has obviously learned from his first two runs and he was pretty push-button round there, it was a nice step forward - James Doyle, jockey.

runners.name: Term Of Endearment
runners.comment: Consistent mare who won at Gr 2/3 level last term against her own sex; new trainer
runners.spotlight: Consistent mare who picked up a Group 3 at York and a Group 2 at Glorious Goodwood last season for Henry de Bromhead before sold for 1,300,000gns in the off-season; needs to step up on what she's achieved against her own sex so far but it's certainly possible that William Haggas can get some improvement out of her.

quotes.race: Qatar Lillie Langtry Stakes (Group 2) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: I was a little bit concerned about the ground today but Term Of Endearment handled it and I think she'll stay further as well. The owners might take a bit of convincing but I'd love to go for the Melbourne Cup. It's been a great ambition of mine to have a runner - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Give Thanks Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: Term Of Endearment is a tough and game filly. She seems to get better with racing, she relaxes and gives herself a chance. On better ground she might even go further - Colin Keane, rider

quotes.race: Gowran Park Median Auction Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Term Of Endearment put up a nice performance. She had a good draw and I got a lovely position. She was still a little green but she hit the line well - Wayne Lordan, rider.

runners.name: Trafalgar Square

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Hugo & Pierre Pilarski & Gousserie Racing

runners.comment: Has talent but was almost unrideable when refusing to settle at Riyadh on yard debut
runners.spotlight: Has talent but was almost unrideable when refusing to settle at Riyadh on yard debut and hard to fancy on the back of that.

4:20.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Maiden

runners.name: Blue Bangor
runners.comment: Big price and never involved on debut in a 6f maiden at the Curragh in October
runners.spotlight: Big price and never involved on debut in a 6f maiden at the Curragh in October; stick a line through him.

runners.name: Chester Nimitz
runners.comment: Good run in defeat when fourth at the Curragh on return; bred to get a mile; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: All three starts over 6f; just denied on debut at Navan (good to yielding) before third on AW next time; good run in defeat when fourth at the Curragh on return; bred to get a mile; shortlisted.

runners.name: Dahoma
runners.comment: 80,000euros purchase; sixth at Dundalk over 7f in November; entitled to progress
runners.spotlight: 80,000euros purchase is a half-brother to French Listed winner; stable's second string when creditable sixth of 13 on debut at Dundalk over 7f in November; entitled to progress for leading yard.

runners.name: Fantazy Man
runners.owner: Mcpeake Investments(Ni) Ltd & Jp Murtagh Racing
runners.comment: Midfield in 1m Curragh maiden on return last month; probably one for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Went off 7-2 when well beaten in 1m Dundalk maiden on debut; much bigger price when midfield in 1m Curragh maiden on return last month; probably one for handicaps.

runners.name: Jorge Alvares
runners.comment: Failed to see out 7f at Ayr but intriguing contender on first start for Ger Lyons
runners.spotlight: Beaten just over 1l into fourth of 20 in the big sales race at York in August, with subsequent Breeders' Cup Juvenile Turf Sprint runner-up Arizona Blaze just in front; failed to see out 7f at Ayr but intriguing contender on first start for Ger Lyons.

runners.name: Mischief Man
runners.owner: Mcpeake Investments(Ni) Ltd & Jp Murtagh Racing
runners.comment: Half-brother to a couple of winners but will need to step up massively on his debut effort
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to a couple of good winners but will need to step up massively on his debut effort at Dundalk 15 days ago to get involved.

runners.name: Atsila
runners.comment: 50,000euros yearling is a half-sister to Layfayette; leading yard can ready one for debut
runners.spotlight: 50,000euros yearling is a half-sister to Layfayette (5.7f-12.5f inc 2yo/Group 2; RPR 114); dam 1m winner; leading yard can ready one first time out; market noted.

runners.name: Brosna Green
runners.comment: Good fourth of 14 over 7f at Dundalk in November; each-way possibilities; hooded
runners.spotlight: Seventh of 14 in 7f fillies' maiden at Down Royal in September; improved effort when fourth of 14 over that trip at Dundalk eight days later; each-way possibilities; hooded.

runners.name: Lady Lilac
runners.breeder: Robert Ryan, Brendan Quinn & Joan Quinn
runners.comment: Third behind a good type at Dundalk on latest; the second has boosted the form; contender
runners.spotlight: Made a promising debut when fourth of 14 at 100-1 over 1m at Dundalk in January; backed that up with a third behind a good type over that C&D on latest; the second has boosted the form; contender.

runners.name: Steel Magnolia
runners.comment: Speedily bred filly was always in rear in 6f Dundalk maiden on debut in November
runners.spotlight: Speedily bred filly was always in rear in 6f Dundalk fillies' maiden on debut in November; difficult to fancy.

runners.name: Uluwatu
runners.comment: Sent off 50-1 when completely tailed off over 7f at the Curragh last month; blinkers
runners.spotlight: Sent off 50-1 when completely tailed off over 7f at the Curragh last month; impossible to recommend judged on that run; blinkers tried now.

runners.name: Captain Ciano
runners.comment: Prominent racer might struggle to get across from high draw on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Much more promising efforts at Dundalk since being gelded; disappointed when sent off favourite for 7f claimer at Dundalk on latest; prominent racer might struggle to get across from high draw on handicap debut; first start for new yard.

runners.name: Aherla Rock
runners.breeder: Lynch Bages, Camas Park & Summerhill B/S
runners.comment: Sixth in an AW trial and beaten around 37l in her three races under rules but can improve
runners.spotlight: Sixth in an AW trial and beaten around 37l in her three races under rules; entitled to improve on her handicap debut but she will need to.

runners.name: Refreshment
runners.comment: Mild promise in 3 maidens; backed after being gelded when midfield in 7f Galway handicap
runners.spotlight: Mild promise in three maidens in the first half of last year with his best effort coming over 6f; wasn't without support after being gelded when midfield in 7f Galway handicap in October; the jury is out.

runners.name: Marianne North
runners.comment: Last on yard debut at Navan in October; stable target this track so monitor the betting
runners.spotlight: Creditable fourth behind Arizona Blaze on debut at the Curragh last year; raw when promising third over 6f at the same venue next time; last of 19 on first start for this yard at Navan in October; stable target this track so monitor the betting on handicap debut.

runners.name: The Mizen Queen
runners.comment: Rail draw on handicap debut and Colin Keane is booked for the first time; on the shortlist
runners.spotlight: Much improved on second start when fourth at Tipperary (7.5f, good); regressed in two subsequent starts but she has the rail draw on handicap debut and Colin Keane is booked for the first time; on the shortlist.

runners.name: Faithlegg Lodge
runners.comment: Struggled to go the pace at Dundalk latest; might need to come further down the weights
runners.spotlight: Some promise over this trip at Dundalk, but struggled to go the pace on handicap debut there on latest; probably needs to come further down the weights to be of interest.

runners.name: Edergoles Angel
runners.comment: Second at the Curragh (7f, good) on handicap debut off this mark in August; poor since
runners.spotlight: Only beaten 1.25l when coming from rear to finish second at the Curragh (7f, good) on handicap debut off this mark in August; poor when sent off favourite at Naas next time; last of 14 at Dundalk in October; chance if she can reproduce Curragh effort.

runners.name: Tam Lin
runners.comment: Narrowly got off the mark over 7f at Dundalk in February; two fine efforts there since
runners.spotlight: Narrowly got off the mark over 7f at Dundalk in February; two fine efforts there since; should be up with the pace throughout and looks one of the more likely contenders if he can translate that form to turf.

runners.name: Weegeebear
runners.owner: Mark Devlin & Nigel Ohare & Philip Smith
runners.comment: Surprise 40-1 Dundalk win latest; can be slowly away which can't be afforded around here
runners.spotlight: Left Ger Lyons after third in Naas nursery off this mark; had been regressing prior to surprise 40-1 Dundalk win in 7f claimer last time for Cormac Farrell; respected on first start for Ado McGuinness; can be slowly away which can't be afforded around here.

runners.name: In The Minus
runners.comment: Beaten 2l into fifth over 1m at Dundalk last month; could pinch a handy lead here
runners.spotlight: Maiden went closest when beaten 2l into fifth over 1m at Dundalk last month (well-backed); strong in the market again when last of 11 in a visor (discarded) there over 7f last time; 1lb lower on turf; front-runner could pinch a handy lead from inside draw.

runners.name: Roaming Eyes
runners.comment: Looks well treated off this mark judged on Naas run in September but she is risky
runners.spotlight: Was gradually improving since switching to handicaps but was beaten out of sight on her latest two starts on the AW; looks well treated off this mark judged on Naas run in September but she is risky.

runners.name: Chriselli
runners.comment: Eyecatching fourth at Dundalk on handicap debut; big player but may need luck in running
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in three maidens but improved for switch to handicaps when running on strongly to finish fourth of 11 over 7f at Dundalk 15 days ago; step up in trip will suit; big player but she will need luck in running around here.

runners.name: Letters Of Love
runners.comment: Three poor efforts to date on the AW, including when over 6l behind Weegeebear at Dundalk
runners.spotlight: Three poor efforts to date on the AW, including when over 6l behind Weegeebear in Dundalk claimer last time; leading yard but plenty to find on handicap debut.

runners.name: Kilgharrahs Love
runners.comment: Two good handicap efforts last year in the mud; respected but the ground is a worry
runners.spotlight: Beaten 3l at Gowran (7f, soft to heavy) on handicap debut in October; ran well a week later at Galway (7f, heavy) when fourth of 16; respected but the ground is a concern.

runners.name: Endless Dawn
runners.breeder: Mrs S Field, Miss S Field & Mr A Turbitt

prev_owners.owner: N W T Dalzell & Gary Devlin

runners.comment: Consistent in defeat in AW handicaps from 6f-1m since the turn of the year; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Consistent in defeat in AW handicaps from 6f-1m since the turn of the year; closely matched with Chriselli and Tam Lin on latest; turf mark is fair; on the shortlist.

runners.name: Handmedownmybible
runners.comment: Best effort yet when third in a Dundalk claimer but overall profile isn't great; reserve
runners.spotlight: Reserve; best effort yet when third in a Dundalk claimer last time but overall profile leaves much to be desired.

runners.name: Dynamic Force
runners.comment: Fair chance judged on pair of runner-up finishes at Naas and the Curragh off 72 in August
runners.spotlight: Fair chance judged on pair of runner-up finishes at Naas and the Curragh off 72 last August; stays this trip and had excuses on soft at the Curragh last month; contender back on quicker ground for local yard.

quotes.race: EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Dynamic Force did it nicely. He was a bit laid-back so he took time to learn and adjust as the race progressed, but he's got a lovely big stride and is a horse who has a future. I'll have to talk to the Middleham Park team about plans and we might just feel our way gradually and have a bigger target towards the end of the year or we could pitch him in somewhere nicer next time, but we'll see how he is. He's an exciting horse, but he's still got a bit to learn and is a bit raw. He'd shown enough at home, plenty to be honest, but he's so laid-back, which was a little concern of mine and that's maybe why he was a longer price than he should have been. I think he's more 6f than 5f and he may get further next year; his stride is quite eyecatching and he seems to do everything effortlessly as you could see with Danny, who didn't have to give him any urgings. He's a Kodiac with a good, strong, powerful action and I think he'd get through easier ground as well; extremes of either ground would not be right - Robert Cowell, trainer.

runners.name: Pandion Power
runners.comment: Given too forceful a ride when weakening at the Curragh on return; best form in the mud
runners.spotlight: Hit form with two wins and a third last October at around this trip; given too forceful a ride when weakening at the Curragh on return last month (sent off favourite); best form is on soft or heavy.

quotes.race: Racing Club Membership Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Pandion Power has a big engine and a big stride, and Rory rides him out very day. He's not an easy ride but he's reaping the benefits from him now - Johnny Murtagh, trainer

runners.name: Prince Of Eyeries
runners.comment: Dundalk maiden winner should stay this far but others look better treated on this occasion
runners.spotlight: Denied narrowly in a Dundalk maiden in December; went one better in a weak affair in January; below best in AW handicap last time; should stay this far but others look better treated.

runners.name: Vierson
runners.comment: Dundalk maiden winner over this trip below that last time; unplaced all six tries on turf
runners.spotlight: Improved nicely to justify market support when landing 1m Dundalk maiden on return in January, plugging on gamely to the line; not as effective up in trip last time; unplaced all six tries on turf.

runners.name: Free Solo
runners.comment: Seldom runs a bad race but looks exposed and his sole turf victory came way back in 2019
runners.spotlight: Won at Dundalk early last year and went close twice in January; seldom runs a bad race but he looks exposed and his sole turf victory came way back in 2019.

quotes.race: Frank Conroy Irish EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Finally we got a colt to win. Free Solo learned a lot at Naas and he was just a baby there. He jumped out and stopped rather than jumping and going. He was a different horse today. He'll improve with racing - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has had only six runs in his life but has shown plenty of ability. A winner over a mile, he finished runner-up in successive Listed races last season. I think he'll progress this year and is definitely capable of winning at that level. I feel he's probably best over seven furlongs. 17-03-21

runners.name: Mount Ruapehu
runners.comment: His 1-28 record on turf is a concern; first try at this trip but a contender if he stays
runners.spotlight: His 1-28 record on turf is a concern; several good runs last year, the best of those a runner-up finish over 7f at Fairyhouse off 73 in July; handles good ground; first try at this trip but a contender if he sees it out.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Mount Ruapehu took full advantage of a good opportunity. He's had a good few runs but he is still plenty raw and still learning. He's not fully there mentally but he'll get there - Andy Slattery, rider.

runners.name: Nezeeh
runners.comment: Sole victory came over 6f at Thirsk (good) on debut for Saeed Bin Suroor; regressive since
runners.spotlight: Sole victory came over 6f at Thirsk (good) on debut for Saeed Bin Suroor; regressive since with five moderate efforts for this yard on the AW; would need to see market support to be of interest; others preferred.

runners.name: Rockbury Lad
runners.owner: P E Ryan & J G Shanahan
runners.comment: Should give his running again but hold-up tactics not suitable at this venue; ground fine
runners.spotlight: Stayed on from rear to win at Punchestown (1m1f, good) in September off 60; went close in defeat last three attempts on the AW; should give his running again but hold-up tactics not suitable at this venue.

quotes.race: William Hill Proper Betting Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Rockbury Lad is a very frustrating horse. He's had a couple of fractures and he needs to be smuggled into races. We'll see what the handicapper does - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

runners.name: The Bog Bank
runners.owner: Hugh J Obrien & Loughlin Flynn & J B Tolan

prev_owners.owner: Hugh J O'Brien & Mrs Pauline McCourt & Loughlin Flynn
Hugh J O'Brien & Mrs Pauline McCourt

runners.comment: Four-time C&D winner off marks ranging from 48-60; might need to come down the weights
runners.spotlight: One of pair for local yard; four-time C&D winner off marks ranging from 48-60; always entitled to consideration around here but she might need to come down the weights a bit.

quotes.race: View Restaurant At Dundalk Stadium Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: The Bog Bank is tough as nails. She just loves the game. She ran crackers at Bellewstown and just ran into one the first day. She tries every time and is always thereabouts - James Ryan, rider

runners.name: Relevant Range
runners.comment: Shock 50-1 win at Listowel last September but has struggled badly three times since
runners.spotlight: Got his head back in front with shock 50-1 win at Listowel last September but has struggled badly three times since; plenty to prove at present.

quotes.race: Clieveragh Handicap
quotes.quote: Relevant Range was flat out the whole way but Darragh got him travelling and enthusiastic. It was a fantastic ride because the hors isn't the most genuine - Gillian Scott, trainer.

runners.name: Takeachancejimmy
runners.comment: Out of form since Ballinrobe win off 77 in 2022; now 18lb lower but hard to make a case
runners.spotlight: Record of 6-46 on turf; veteran knows where the winning line is but he's been out of form since scoring at Ballinrobe (9.5f, good) off 77 in July 2022; now 18lb lower but hard to make a case for him on his return.

quotes.race: KPMG Handicap
quotes.quote: Takeachancejimmy is a solid horse. He turns up every year and wins one or two, so its great to have him. He probably won't go to Galway - Nigel Slevin, trainer.

quotes.race: extra.ie Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: A mile on soft ground seems to suit him. We took him to Tipperary and the ground went against him and Dundalk didn't work. He did it well today. He's a bit hit and miss but when he gets it right he's good. We'll probably keep going until the grass season ends - Nigel Slevin, trainer

quotes.race: Blackcastle Handicap
quotes.quote: He was quite unlucky first time out this year when he clipped heels and should have won. We don't know what happened to him the last day. He's a consistent sort and he's not winning out of turn. We fancied him today but these are tricky handicaps - Rory Slevin, assistant trainer

quotes.race: Come Racing Saturday 8th June Handicap
quotes.quote: He won a shade cosy in the end. He bumped into one the last day. He's won over five and seven now so he's versatile and we'll tip away with him. We've nothing really in the pipeline and we'll just see what comes up. He's consistent and Robbie gets a good old tune out of him. He's hot and Robbie just sits cold on him - Nigel Slevin, trainer

quotes.race: Awards And Gifts Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: He surprised me a bit at the Curragh as we always thought he was a 6f horse. The programme will dictate where we go next - Nigel Slevin, trainer

runners.name: Higher Kingdom
runners.comment: Eyecatcher 3 days ago; well treated on pick of turf form and handles good ground
runners.spotlight: All six wins have come on the AW; 0-23 on turf; eyecatching effort at Gowran three days ago when never-nearer fourth after being slowly away; well treated on pick of turf form and handles good ground; shortlisted.

quotes.race: Floodlit Friday Nights At Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Higher Kingdom is a talented horse. He travelled like a dream and he just did enough - John McConnell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has really progressed this winter as having won off 62 in December at Dundalk, he has since added two more wins at the track and is up to a rating of 86 now. The plan is to send him over to Lingfield on Good Friday for either the 1m or 1m2f race. Even though he's now at a career-high mark, I think there could be a little more to come. He's a very talented horse who was highly thought of as a juvenile, but like so many Kingmans he has a mind of his own and has taken a while to get back on track. He was disappointing last time out, but he seems grand at the moment and we'll almost certainly be claiming off him at Lingfield. I'm not entirely sure who'll get the ride but Siobhan Rutledge has won twice on him. 06-04-23

runners.name: Blue Wood
runners.comment: Tried to make all when midfield at Dundalk 8 days ago; engaged 7.15pm Dundalk on Friday
runners.spotlight: Winner on turf and AW; narrowly denied at Cork off 54 last September; tried to make all when midfield at Dundalk eight days ago; 4lb wrong; engaged 7.15pm Dundalk on Friday.

runners.name: Aurora Nova
runners.comment: Didn't recover from big hike for Fairyhouse win last summer; back down to a fair mark
runners.spotlight: Sole win came over 6f at Fairyhouse last summer for which she got a huge hike which anchored her in four starts afterwards; now dropped to 5lb above that winning mark and squeezes into this grade on first run since August.

runners.name: Shes Smart

prev_owners.owner: John Abbey, Jimmy Fairhurst & Emma Evans
John Abbey, Jimmy Fairhurst & Emma Evans

runners.comment: Good run when last seen in August; fair mark and player if handling the track
runners.spotlight: Down Royal win last summer came off 4lb higher and ran well in competitive Curragh contest when last seen in August; ground to suit and could go well if handling the track.

runners.name: My Girl Sioux
runners.comment: Only fifth at Dundalk yesterday but second here last October so respected on overall form
runners.spotlight: Busy time of it of late at Dundalk, winning once and placed four times until below-par run yesterday (fifth); good second here last October so handles the track and considered if turning out again.

runners.name: Sams Xpress
runners.comment: Placed C&D form in recent years, needs to improve on recent AW form though
runners.spotlight: Placed C&D form in recent years and last of three AW wins came in November; not at best of late so more needed but handicapper giving him a chance; draw not ideal.

quotes.race: Happy St Patrick's Weekend Handicap
quotes.quote: Sam's Xpress has loads of boot, piles of boot. He showed a nice bit last year but had a bit of trouble with sore shins and that. He could turn out next week in a three-year-old only handicap at Naas - Kieran Cotter, trainer.

runners.name: Lakota Lady
runners.comment: Unexposed 5yo tongue-tied here on handicap debut and back to minimum trip
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 5yo; promise on sole start at two for David O'Meara; never involved on both recent Dundalk runs following a huge absence; tongue-tied here on handicap debut and back to minimum trip.

runners.name: Livingston Range
runners.breeder: Newtown Stud And T J Pabst
runners.comment: C&D winning 2yo but on a long losing run and others appear more likely
runners.spotlight: C&D winner as a 2yo and both wins since have been at 6f; long losing run however and doesn't appear an obvious contender although senior rider now takes over.

quotes.race: Foran Equine Irish EBF Auction Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Livingston Range came on for his run and his first run worked out very well. He's an improving horse and still quite green, so there's a lot of improvement in him. We've taken our time with him. He doesn't really want that heavy ground and he will step up in trip - Tracey Collins, trainer.

runners.name: Whatswrongnow
runners.comment: Little to take from four Dundalk runs to offer encouragement here on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Showed promise without threatening in a trio of Dundalk runs last winter for Kieran Cotter; similar scenario on return from over a year off at same track last month; turf debut.

runners.name: Shoebox King
runners.comment: Much reduced mark and yard had a winner during the week so not one to rule out
runners.spotlight: Both wins have been on soft; couple of okay runs last summer, below best in Dundalk claimer in November when last seen; much reduced mark and yard had a winner during the week so not one to rule out.

quotes.race: Cusack Hotel Group Handicap
quotes.quote: It's hard in Ireland in those lower grades as there are a lot of horses with not much between them. I think he's genuine enough. We'll probably put Shoebox King in the August Sale now. I think he's done his job here and he'd be a good horse for England - Kevin Coleman, trainer.

runners.name: Eric Lock
runners.comment: Second at Naas and yesterday at Dundalk under 10lb claimer; Keane takes over now
runners.spotlight: Best turf run yet came in Naas 3yo handicap 11 days ago when second, despite racing freely under inexperienced 10lb claimer; also second at Dundalk yesterday under same rider; Colin Keane takes over here.

runners.name: Lismacbryan Hill
runners.comment: Far from disgraced from out of handicap at Naas latest; back to 5f here
runners.spotlight: Precious little to recommend although did show a bit more at Naas last time from out of handicap, despite racing keenly; back to 5f here.

runners.name: Sturlasson
runners.comment: Well-backed on return at the Curragh last week but missed the break; not discounted
runners.spotlight: Sole victory came when making all in Navan maiden last May (5f, good); went close in valuable Epsom sprint in June but has regressed since; interestingly, was well-backed on return at the Curragh last week but missed the break completely; not discounted.

quotes.race: Betfred 3YO "Dash" Handicap
quotes.quote: It was Sturlasson's first time in a handicap, and normally they'd say they need a run in a handicap because it is a different type of sprinting, but he did fantastically well. He won his maiden in Navan, and the thing we were happy with it that the first few furlongs there are a bit undulating and downhill, so he might have had a bit of experience there for this. Oisin [Murphy, jockey] said the three-year-old handicap sprint at Royal Ascot is made for him - that's where he said he'd do, so all things being well, we will. When he first ran in a maiden he was second to Bucanero Fuerte, who is favourite for the Commonwealth Cup, so we knew he was pretty useful - Kieran Cotter, trainer.

quotes.race: Navan Racecourse Maiden
quotes.quote: Sturlasson's work during the week was spectacular. He skipped along there and he loved it. It was a real professional performance and I'm delighted. The lads are saying they might go for the Palace of Holyroodhouse Handicap at Royal Ascot on the Friday - Kieran Cotter, trainer.

runners.name: The Poacher Daly
runners.comment: Won weak C&D maiden (yielding to soft) for Joseph O'Brien; high enough in the weights here
runners.spotlight: Made all to win weak C&D maiden (yielding to soft) for Joseph O'Brien in October but he was disappointing for the yard overall; first start for new yard; looks high enough in the weights.

runners.name: Emerald Harmony
runners.breeder: B Kennedy & Mrs Ann Marie Kennedy
runners.comment: Excuses over 6f on soft at the Curragh; prominent racer 2lb lower than Cork 2nd in August
runners.spotlight: Only 1-12 but mostly consistent; her best form has been over this distance on good or faster ground; excuses over 6f on soft on return at the Curragh; prominent racer is 2lb lower than Cork second in August; contender.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Emerald Harmony is improving and learning to sprint. The ground was probably as quick as she wanted it but she is going the right way - Ben Coen, rider

runners.name: Cuban Grey
runners.comment: Good winner from the front at Dundalk in January; major player despite career-high mark
runners.spotlight: Dual winner in Britain got off the mark for this yard at Tipperary (5f, soft) last May; just denied at Down Royal on good in June; came back from 220-day break when an impressive winner from the front at Dundalk in January; major player despite career-high mark.

runners.name: Rathbranchurch
runners.comment: C&D winner off 74 last July on good; course form figures of 32103; ground will suit
runners.spotlight: C&D winner off 74 last July on good; 6lb lower now; course form figures of 32103; tough sort was a beaten favourite at the Curragh on return and was again strong in the betting when poor at Naas a week later; should improve on quicker ground.

quotes.race: Book Your Discounted Tickets On NavanRacecourse.ie Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: We made a mistake as I thought Rathbranchurch might get the seven in Fairyhouse, as it's a handy seven, but he doesn't seem to get that trip. This trip here is ideal for him. He's entered at the Curragh on Saturday and we might have to go again - Mick Mulvany, trainer

runners.name: Only Spoofing

prev_owners.owner: Mrs H Mannion, B Carter & F Durbin

runners.comment: Went close here a couple of times but last win was at Musselburgh in the summer of 2023
runners.spotlight: Veteran has won 13 of his 93 starts; has gone close here a couple of times but last win was at Musselburgh in the summer of 2023; others preferred.

quotes.race: Bellinter Handicap
quotes.quote: Only Spoofing loves this track and trip. He cut out at Naas last day and back to five today suited him - Kevin Coleman, trainer.

quotes.race: Neptune Investment Management Supports Child Bereavement UK Handicap
quotes.quote: Only Spoofing is improving and came here in good form. He was great today and I think he could win a big one before the end of the year - Kieran O'Neill, jockey.

quotes.race: Troytown Bar Handicap
quotes.quote: He can be very buzzy and went to the start early. Sean (Davis) had ridden him before and gave him a very brave ride. He's great value for his 7lb claim and you'd never think he was a claimer watching that ride. I'd imagine Only Spoofing will be coming back to Ireland before the end of the season - Tim Hogg, assistant to Jedd O'Keeffe, trainer of Only Spoofing.

runners.name: Distillate
runners.owner: Mark Devlin & Nigel Ohare & Philip Smith

prev_owners.owner: N O'Hare/G Devlin/J McCrory/Kabin Racing Syndicate
Nigel O'Hare/Gary Devlin/Joseph McCrory/Kabin Racing Synd

runners.comment: C&D winner but made no impression when well beaten at Naas on return 13 days ago
runners.spotlight: C&D winner but best at 7f; consistent on the AW in defeat at the end of last year; made no impression when well beaten at Naas on return 13 days ago; more needed.

quotes.race: Starman At Tally-Ho Handicap
quotes.quote: Distillate has improved all the time. Hopefully the handicapper won't be too hard on her and she should be a good fun filly. We'll probably go back to Dundalk for the winter - Ado McGuinness, trainer

runners.name: Hero Of The Hour
runners.comment: Should be finishing his race off well and will pick up the pieces if the pace collapses
runners.spotlight: Four AW wins over 5f-6f; not in the best form over the winter at Dundalk; finished third over C&D off 66 last August; should be finishing his race off well and will pick up the pieces if the pace collapses.

quotes.race: Join Us On Instagram @dundalk_stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: What could go wrong did go wrong but Hero Of The Hour still won - Chris Hayes, jockey, speaking on RTV.

runners.name: Devils Angel
runners.owner: One In A Million Syndicate/B Sheerin/G Obrien/K Coleman
runners.comment: Eight-time winner who has done a lot of racing since his last success in 2022; blinkered
runners.spotlight: Eight-time winner who has done a lot of racing since his last success in 2022; consistent enough for current trainer, making frame in six of nine visits to Dundalk since last October; can run well without threatening; blinkered.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Sprint Handicap
quotes.quote: We couldn't believe the price he was for a horse that won two starts ago. I know Devil's Angel is a bit hit and miss because of his minor issue with the stalls, but he was still a huge price. He loves Sandown (won both starts there) and we'll look at a choice of races at the Saturday and Sunday meeting there in two weeks' time - Jedd O'Keeffe, trainer.

quotes.race: Play 4 To Score At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a good bit of placing. There wasn't much pace on paper so I sat close and Devil's Angel gave me an easy ride. It was the right track to experiment going five and maybe he will stay at that trip now - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

quotes.race: Thank You Dr Jerry Hill Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Sprint Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Callum Shepherd has given Devil's Angel a lovely ride as he lugs left when he hits the front. He's the right colour, so the plan is come back for the grey horse handicap next month - Chris Vallice, syndicate spokesman.

runners.name: Moonhall Lass
runners.comment: Down Royal second over this trip in September off 72 offers hope but has a bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Finished runner-up twice at Dundalk in the winter; two moderate AW efforts so far this year; Down Royal second over this trip in September off 72 offers hope but she has a bit to prove at present; 2lb wrong.

runners.name: Tillys Company
runners.comment: 4th behind subsequent Breeders' Cup winner Magnum Force at Cork last August; poor since
runners.spotlight: Definite promise when fourth behind subsequent Breeders' Cup winner Magnum Force at Cork (5f, good to firm) last August; has regressed since, including when tailed off last at Naas on return 13 days ago; risky proposition; 2lb wrong.

6:55.race_name: Good Enuf To Eat Catering Handicap

runners.name: Rauzan
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Better hurdler; has his ground but may be best watched after winter break
runners.spotlight: Completed hurdling four-timer last summer on decent ground, below best when ground eased afterwards; 0-10 on the Flat, running only once last year; probably best watched on return from winter break.

quotes.race: Waterford FC Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rauzan was behind the bridle the whole way, just struggling to hold his position. The trip was too short. Hugh said once he pulled him out wide he just locked onto it and once he met the rising ground he just went away from them - Eoin Doyle, trainer.

quotes.race: Dunlop Homes Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rauzan was in good nick, but the only problem was the drop back in trip. Slower ground out there helped and he handles it no problem - Hugh Morgan, rider.

quotes.race: Dunmore East Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rauzan wasn't really suited by Winter ground. His jumping has come together and I think there is a bit of improvement in him. He could do a job on the Flat over a trip - Eoin Doyle, rider

runners.name: Doctor Grace
runners.breeder: Dundalk Racing Club& Mrs Barbara McCourt
runners.comment: Has been hanging right at Dundalk of late; contender if on her game
runners.spotlight: All three wins have been over shorter, including 1m2f Navan success last summer off 62; hasn't looked the most straightforward of late at Dundalk (hanging right, slow starts) but could go close if fully on her game.

quotes.race: Navan Racing Festival November 16th & 17th Handicap
quotes.quote: Doctor Grace wasn't winning out of turn. She is rock-solid in that grade and always runs her race for you when she gets conditions right - Michael Halford, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Eastern Wind
runners.comment: Best form is at 1m, winning here last October; this trip an unknown though
runners.spotlight: Runs well here, winning over 1m last October off 61 and comes here on the back of a solid recent Leopardstown effort over same trip; this trip very much a step into the unknown however.

quotes.race: Sign Up For The Coast To Curragh Charity Cycle August 27th Handicap
quotes.quote: Eastern Wind was very gutsy. James gave her a good ride. She has to be in front and she will battle away if she is - Tom McCourt, trainer.

runners.name: Mogwli
runners.comment: 1m winner here last October; never run over anything remotely like this trip before
runners.spotlight: Last two wins came here at 1m, including narrow defeat of Eastern Wind last October; entitled to come on for recent comeback run but ideally wants it softer and has never run over anything remotely like this trip before.

quotes.race: Barney Curley Charity Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Mogwli took me there once I was able to take my time on him. Once I got past the horse in front he was able to pick up - Wesley Joyce, rider

quotes.race: NavanRacecourse.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: Mogwli broke well, there is lovely fresh ground on that rail and Jack just kept him happy. The horse fought them off well too - Willie McCreery, trainer.

quotes.race: TRM Hoofmaker Handicap
quotes.quote: Mogwli doesn't like the wind and having it behind him was the best thing for him. He rode a grand race and I loved the way he fought back at the finish - Willie McCreery, trainer.

quotes.race: Fairyhouse.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: Mogwli was bred by my wife. He's a tough and hardy little fellow and he loves racing. He'll be kept on the go for the apprentices to ride - Willie McCreery, trainer

runners.name: Waystar
runners.comment: Recent Dundalk winner at this trip rates a big player off 5lb higher mark
runners.spotlight: Off the mark when causing 20-1 upset at Dundalk last month over this trip in beating a warm favourite; 5lb higher here but big chance of a follow-up with stamina concerns surrounding some of main rivals.

runners.name: Kartayaz
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Best form at 1m2f; first run for new yard and may need this
runners.spotlight: Four wins for John McConnell were at 1m2f; hasn't convinced over C&D in the past; first run for new yard and may need this.

runners.name: Uberrima Fides
runners.comment: Didn't appear to see out the 2m trip at Dundalk last week; don't rule out though
runners.spotlight: 0-14 on the level, didn't appear to see out the 2m trip at Dundalk last week; wouldn't be out of it here on narrow Dundalk defeat over this trip in the past.

runners.name: Zentopia
runners.comment: Rated a meagre 36 and hard to see where the required improvement will come from
runners.spotlight: Rated a meagre 36 and hard to see where the required improvement will come from.

runners.name: Black Heather
runners.comment: Likes a sound surface, running away with Naas maiden hurdle on Thursday; interesting
runners.spotlight: Won Ballinrobe bumper last summer on good to yielding and showed his liking for a sound surface when readily landing Naas maiden hurdle on Thursday; interesting if turned out quickly.

quotes.race: Pat O'Hare Bookmakers Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Black Heather is a smart horse. I've liked him for a long time. He doesn't handle that real winter ground. We have him in on Saturday in a Flat maiden [at Bellewstown] and I don't think he got overextended today so all roads might lead there. He's a lovely dual purpose horse. He's for sale, like a lot of mine, and could be one for Galway - Harry Kelly, trainer.

runners.name: Irish Boyo
runners.comment: Tailed off last of 18 on last month's bumper debut at Thurles
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-brother to a minor Flat winner; dam won at a modest level on the Flat; tailed off last of 18 on last month's bumper debut at Thurles.

runners.name: Lukers Tipple
runners.comment: Useful juvenile hurdler; fair form in two Flat maidens last autumn on better ground
runners.spotlight: Useful juvenile hurdler, second at both Punchestown and Cork, most recently midfield in the Fred Winter at Cheltenham; fair form in two Flat maidens last autumn on better ground.

runners.name: Mick Collins
runners.comment: Bled last time over hurdles but major chance on his best Flat form
runners.spotlight: Useful maiden, pick of form being 1m2f Leopardstown second last summer on good ground; absent since calamitous hurdles debut at Cork in October (keen, mistakes, slipped badly and burst blood vessel); new headgear combination tried and major chance on his best form.

runners.name: So Scottish
runners.breeder: Nicolas Madamet, Ian Kellitt, Mmm Ann Thomlinson
runners.comment: Very useful NH performer at this best, especially on a decent surface; respected
runners.spotlight: Very useful National Hunt performer at this best, especially on a decent surface; not at his best in Grand Annual at Cheltenham last month but has to be respected.

quotes.race: Introducing Racing TV Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I missed the second-last and wasn't sure I was going to get the second horse. Going off ratings, So Scottish will nearly have to be dropped. I was lucky to get there. Early in the race he was travelling very well, he missed the second last but apart from that he was fairly good - Richie McLernon, rider.

quotes.race: Schooling At Tipperary Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Jumping has always been his forte. So Scottish is an exciting horse and that opens up more avenues for him. He is an intelligent horse and hopefully we will mix it between hurdles and fences for the rest of the season. With the weather we've been having for the past few years I'd prefer if he handled that ground than heavy - Emmet Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a good run at Galway the last day and is in at Fairyhouse this weekend in the two-mile handicap hurdle, albeit two miles might be a touch sharp for him. He had a break after Galway and the new two-and-a-half-mile handicap hurdle at Leopardstown on St Stephen's Day looks a good fit for him. He was a bit unlucky to bump into The Wallpark at Galway, so hopefully he can get his day in the sun this season. 25-11-24

runners.name: Toto Too
runners.comment: Dundalk third may not need to improve a whole lot to feature here
runners.spotlight: Bumper and dual hurdle winner burst blood vessels in consecutive starts last summer; promising yard debut when third in Dundalk maiden over this trip in February and may not need to improve a whole lot to feature here.

quotes.race: Treo Eile Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Toto Too coped with the ground and got through it well. He jumped well apart from the second-last and that will improve him. He will need more experience but he could potentially be a Galway Hurdle horse - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Guaranteed Multiples All Shops Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Toto Too is a lovely horse. He schooled well at home and I was keen to get him out on nice ground, but he can mix on softer ground heading into the winter. He could develop into a nice novice hurdler - Peter Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Eponine Etoile
runners.comment: Well held both maidens, will be of more interest when tackling handicaps; blinkers tried
runners.spotlight: Well held both maidens, will be of more interest when tackling handicaps; blinkers tried.

runners.name: Theflyingbee
runners.comment: 116-rated hurdler likes this sort of ground; don't rule out on Flat debut
runners.spotlight: Won 2m4f maiden hurdle here a year ago on good to yielding and ran well in much better-class contest at Punchestown festival afterwards; second in 2m4f Navan handicap on soft when last seen in December; don't rule out on Flat debut.

runners.name: Journalism
runners.owner: Bridlewood Farm, Don Alberto Stable Et Al
runners.comment: Likely to be a threat; won Santa Anita Grade 2 35 days ago.
runners.spotlight: Narrow scorer in the San Felipe Stakes five weeks ago; completed his hat-trick last time; should be on the premises.

runners.name: Citizen Bull
runners.owner: Sf Racing Llc, Starlight Racing Et Al
runners.comment: In with a shout; winner of four of his five career runs.
runners.spotlight: Winner of four of his five runs to date and completed hat-trick last time out; got the job done by just under 4l over 1m here (Grade 3, bobbled at the start) in January; looks likely to be involved.

quotes.race: FanDuel Breeders' Cup Juvenile - Thoroughbred Aftercare Alliance (Grade 1) (2yo C&G) (Main) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Citizen Bull was just running easy early and the other horse (Gaming) was just cruising in second. And when it was time to go the horse just took off - Martin Garcia, jockey.

runners.name: Westwood
runners.comment: Not beaten far last month; wins-runs record of 0-3.
runners.spotlight: Nicely bred (by Authentic) and related to Stakes winner Tarabi; good effort when close up three weeks ago in a maiden special weight.

runners.name: Barnes
runners.comment: Clear chance; placed in the San Felipe Stakes five weeks ago.
runners.spotlight: This son of Into Mischief looks the part on breeding and won a Grade 2 in January here; behind Journalism when beaten just under 2l to finish second in the San Felipe Stakes five weeks ago; should be involved.

runners.name: Baeza
runners.owner: C R K Stable Llc & Grandview Equine
runners.comment: Having his first crack at a big race and others more appealing.
runners.spotlight: Related to Grade 1 winner Mage; got the job done by just under 5l when opening his account at the third time of asking 50 days ago in a maiden special weight; having his first crack at a big race and can be taken on.

2:10.race_name: Catanach's Jewellers Redoute's Choice Stakes (Listed Race) (2yo) (Turf)

runners.name: Latin Boss
runners.owner: Lindsay Park Bloodstock Pty Ltd, P B Devitt Et Al

runners.name: Punic War
runners.owner: R I Williams, M H Dalgleish Et Al

runners.name: Boa Vista
runners.owner: Sheamus Mills Bloodstock Ladies & Newton Ladies

runners.name: Skjaldmo
runners.owner: R D Griffiths, Yabby Dam Farms Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.name: North England
runners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.name: King Of Pop
runners.owner: Wilrace Pty Ltd, Werrett Bloodstock Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.name: Missile Magnate
runners.owner: Double C Syndicate, B F Townsend Et Al

runners.name: Stormland
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.owner: S G Darby, F J Biviano Et Al

runners.name: Fortissimo
runners.owner: Arrowfield Pastoral Pty Ltd & K Yoshida

runners.name: Hay Street
runners.owner: Triple Crown Syndications, F Cetraro Et Al

runners.name: Strada Varenna
runners.owner: Ladbrokes Racing Club Synd, Newgate Synd & Newgate S F Synd

runners.name: Alabama Magic
runners.owner: Ms A M Mchardy & J R Tyrrell

runners.name: Sylph
runners.owner: Yarraman Park Stud Syn, Horseshoe Investments Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.name: Desert Hero
runners.owner: Hm The King & Hm The Queen

quotes.race: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: The Melbourne Cup is on the table. A decision will have to be made soon. It hasn't been discussed until after this race. Physically Desert Hero is really thriving. Tom blamed the early pace, which was a bit gentle for him. He'd be better with a faster pace. He ran a good race and he beat Chesspiece a fair way so it was probably a career best so I can't complain. He's had a race and given his all, he was very brave. I'm thrilled his owners were here to see it. It's been brilliant that the King and Queen have come and the crowd have embraced them. They've been very excited and it's been terrific - William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: John Pearce Racing Gordon Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Today was a testament to how tough Desert Hero really is. While he had to be brave to find gaps at Royal Ascot, he had to be brave again today on ground that is extremely tough work. He filled me with confidence because of what he did at Royal Ascot, and while it was always going to be tougher on this ground he's got a kick over a mile and a half - Tom Marquand, jockey, speaking on ITV.

quotes.race: King George V Stakes (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: It's fantastic, a great honour for all of us, and I'm thrilled they [The King and Queen] were here to witness it. We discussed it [the race beforehand] and I thought Desert Hero was going to be more forward, but he [Tom Marquand, rider], obviously thought they were going too fast and they were going too fast. He stayed on really well - it was his first time at a mile and a half. He's done well since Newbury, and whilst this is a surprise, you always hope things like this can happen - William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: Tuffx Glass EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was really impressive. Desert Hero was really learning on the way down and on the way round and the penny really dropped two (furlongs) out when he had the top two in the betting to chase down and he surprised me how quickly and well he did it. There's plenty to work with for the future - Tom Marquand, jockey, speaking on RTV.

runners.name: Athabascan
runners.owner: Oti Racing, F W Cook Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Oti Racing, M Hay Et Al
OTI Management Pty Ltd, Haras D'Etreham Et Al

runners.name: Alalcance
runners.owner: N Yammine, L M Nestadt Et Al

quotes.race: Tote Now Online At Tote.ie Fillies & Mares Maiden
quotes.quote: Alalcance deserved that. This galloping track suited her much better. She is a lovely big filly and will be a lovely four-year-old. She found a lot and quickened up well on that ground - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

runners.name: Lastotchka
runners.owner: Australian Bloodstock, S Tsalikidis Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Noel Forgeard, P Bonnier Et Al
Ecurie Noel Forgeard, Earl Touchstone & P Bonnier

runners.name: Francesco Guardi
runners.owner: Ballylinch Stud Syndicate, Grand Parkview Stud Synd Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Ballylinch Stud, N Greenhalgh Et Al

runners.name: True Marvel
runners.owner: C J Dunn, P G Davis Et Al

prev_owners.owner: M D Holland, P G Davis Et Al
M D Holland, D Healey Et Al

runners.name: Waltham
runners.owner: Mcs Racing, M J Burns Et Al

prev_owners.owner: MCS Racing Syndicate, M J Burns Et Al

quotes.race: Hipodromo De La Zarzuela Rated Race
quotes.quote: Waltham is just a nice horse. I thought he had to be a stakes horse to do that and I'd say he's a stakes horse on that ground. You're not going to see the best of him until this time next year when he grows up - Ger Lyons, trainer.

quotes.race: Vintage Voyager Maiden
quotes.quote: Waltham is a horse we have always loved. We knew he would be green and we also knew he was only 70 to 80% cooked. We'll take baby steps. We would have been very disappointed today if he didn't do that - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

runners.name: El Jasor
runners.owner: Australian Bloodstock, J G Singh Et Al

stable_tour.quote: He is a fine, big strapping son of Le Havre who had one run in a maiden at Kempton in December. His first run of the year at Windsor in April gave us plenty of encouragement when he was second to Clever Relation over 1m2f. I thought he would be a big player at Chester this month, but he didn't do a tap. I don't know whether or not it was a health issue, or he just hated the track, but we are checking everything over. I like to think he will get further and if he is, as expected, effective over 1m4f then he is a nice prospect for the coming months off an opening mark of 75. 28-05-23

runners.name: Kinesiology
runners.owner: A Kheir, N A Greenhalgh Et Al

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Vinnie Roe Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Kinesiology had a good look in front and as far as I'm concerned he was definitely the best horse on the day. The stewards made their decision and they are in charge. There was a bump close to the line, but I felt my horse had the race in safe keeping at that stage. He quickened up past Declan's mount and was just dossing in front. The best horse won but it was taken away from him - Shane Foley, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He progressed nicely to finish second at Leopardstown and has done very well since. He won't be appearing until the ground dries out. I'd say he could definitely stretch out to a mile and a quarter. 24-04-24

runners.name: Valiant King
runners.owner: A Kheir, Qatar Bloodstock Ltd Et Al

runners.name: Birdman
runners.owner: A Kheir, N Greenhalgh Et Al

quotes.race: Queen's Vase (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Birdman is very green still. Thought he was going to pick up, maybe the ground was a little bit quick for him. It was a big step forward. He got stuck wide - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Yeats Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I would say Birdman\o will go for the Queen's Vase at Ascot now, that's the plan. We thought he would take the jump in class in his stride and that's what he's done. He goes on good ground and would go on quicker ground too. He's a great big baby and he's only a frame of a horse. He's still a work in progress - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Cork Maiden
quotes.quote: Birdman is a lovely horse and was very green. Shane couldn't even hit him as he didn't know what way he could go. Even at the stalls he didn't want to go near them because there was somebody in them. That will crown him and he is a nice horse - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

runners.name: Manzoice
runners.owner: B Flannery, Mrs P A Flannery Et Al

runners.name: Hopeful
runners.owner: On Track Hopeful No 1 Syndicate, P Hope Et Al

prev_owners.owner: P T Hope, M L Borger Et Al
Ontrack Thoroughbreds No 1, Ontrack Hopeful No 2 Et Al

runners.name: Mr Waterville
runners.owner: C J Waller, D H T Devine Et Al

quotes.race: Friends Of The Curragh Irish Cesarewitch (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Waterville is a massive horse and next year he's going to be something different. Over the winter he's going to turn into a different animal and he will be very much at home over Cup trips next year - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been working like a very good horse, so I must admit I was disappointed when he was beaten at the Curragh. He just seemed babyish and green. You should never be too surprised when these things happen, and it's still early days, but we'll have to revise plans. You wouldn't be rushing to run him into one of the trials now, but you never know what could happen if he wins a maiden next time. We've always thought a mile and a half will be ideal for him. 19-04-22

runners.name: Age Of Sail
runners.owner: L Petagna, M P Brown Et Al

runners.name: Bacio Del Mist
runners.owner: Mrs C E Curtis, A R Davison Et Al

runners.name: Fulfilled
runners.owner: Australian Bloodstock, J W Woodbridge Et Al

runners.name: Laspirit Deeler

quotes.race: Juddmonte Royal Lodge Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Jason (Hart) said Royal Patronage was a bit free early on and he was trying to settle him and no sooner was he getting him under control than the race was on again. He said when he hit the rising ground he found another gear. He has got a lot of speed. We almost supplemented him for the Champagne Stakes. He is out of a Dalakhani mare so there is lots of stamina on the dam's side. It is great that you have a horse you think will stay a mile and a half that has so much speed early on - Mark Johnston, trainer.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Acomb Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Royal Patronage was the most exposed horse in the race but we brought him here to the Dante meeting, which shows we thought very, very highly of him at that stage. He was beaten over six furlongs first time out, ran well second time at Sandown and then showed us what we always thought of him at Epsom. We'll go home and think about targets. On pedigree the horse will clearly stay further. I was asked whether he's a Guineas horse, it may be he's more a Dante horse but time will tell - Mark Johnston, trainer.

quotes.race: Maker's Mark Breeders' Cup Filly & Mare Turf (Grade 1) (3yo+ Fillies & Mares) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Moira broke well and I was able to get myself close to the rail going into the first turn. It felt like the pace was slow, and on the backside I didn't want anyone to get the move on me. I decided to get out and get myself closer and try to get the jump on everybody and it worked out - Flavien Prat, jockey.

quotes.race: Ranvet Stakes (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Al Mubhir just did too much on the way around. He just never let go - Tom Marquand, jockey.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Everything went really smoothly and the soft ground was always going to help coming back to a mile. Al Mubhir\ relaxed well and surprised me how well he did it in the end. He's clearly a talented horse and if we keep getting things right, he's got a big future - Tom Marquand, jockey.

quotes.race: MansionBet Beaten By A Head Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Al Mubhir did that nicely. The jockey liked him but said he knew nothing so we might have to run him again but he was a bit spicy after the race so we'll have to see - William Haggas, trainer.
